review_body: There's no place like the OCEANFRONT rooms (1404 & 1305) of this awesome hotel! The panoramic view of the Kuhio and Waikiki beaches combined is a picture so perfect! This is the main reason why we kept on coming back to this hotel. It's like a home away from home. Thanks to all the staffs, you all made our vacation complete. Keep up the good work God bless you all. Aloha!

nice place to stay very well located and easy to get to. parking was a lil iffy if not onsite but not that bad. rooms were nice and clean. balcony had very nice view of beach and nice place to stay. I would stay here again.

This is a basic, no frills budget hotel. I usually stay at the larger resorts when in HNL, but since this was a short 3 night trip we decided to stay here to save some money. I probably wouldn’t stay here again because it lacked amenities, but overall it was a nice stay for the price. What I liked: - Great location (right across the street from the Duke’s statue).- Staff was very friendly and accommodating when we asked for a late checkout. - Beds were comfortable- Balcony with ocean front view was amazing!- Concierge service (although they didn’t help very much)What I didn’t like:- Bathroom and shower were REALLY small! - lots of outside noise - garbage trucks, leaf blowers in the morning (sliding glass door is old and not double paned). We were in the 5th floor- No real lobby area

We booked an ocean view room for three nights - we had a great view, and our room was quieter than the room we stayed in last time (which was close to the service elevator) but it is still noisy, from the traffic outside to the air conditioner in the room (which did affect my sleep, even with ear plugs). Rooms are small but that is okay. Very clean, especially considering all the sand that must get tracked in to every room, very friendly staff, great location. For some reason, there is always a huge line up at Eggs 'n Things, so even though being a guest at the hotel entitles you to a 10% discount, we just never took advantage of it because we didn't want to spend all that time in line.Beds were very comfortable, shower was small but adequate. It was nice to have a newspaper every morning. The location is phenomenal - right across the street from the beach! I would stay here again, I think it is the best value in Waikiki.

Stayed at this accommodation for 3 nights, regretted that I didnt stay longer. Very basic but very clean rooms. The staff are excellent and pleasant...ALL OF THEM, special mention to Shawn at reception who is very helpful and great to deal with. We stayed at 1205 which had a fantastic view of Waikiki. We arrived early (8am) and Shawn did his very best to get us a room so we can rest - we were in our room by 9am!The bed was clean and comfy, and though room was outdated, it was very clean and had everything you need. Bathroom was small, but expected given the size of the bldg.The also offer a free shuttle and their driver, Earl, was wonderful!Would definitely stay here again!

The most impressive thing about this hotel is how friendly the staff were. They'd say hello in a happy and friendly way every time we saw them in the hallways.Otherwise, this hotel isn't particularly impressive. The beds were comfortable, but the rooms small. Our room (partial ocean) overlooked a parking lot and a very nice looking hot tub and pool of the place next store. This is across from the beach, in a super loud and busy area. We could hear street noises even with the doors closed. The elevators are open to the outside but require a key to use. It was the lower cost and convenient option for what we were in town for -- a friend's wedding.
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
letsgoseestuff
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

review_body: I am originally from Hawaii, so when I do come "home" I usually stay at Ashton Waikiki Beach. However, I got a descent package deal by staying at Ashton Waikiki Circle.The hotel is small and one of the older ones in Waikiki, which it definitely shows in the hall ways, etc. The rooms are small and the bathroom even smaller. It's good enough for up to two adults, but anything more you will be bumping hips. Every room has a refrigerator but no microwave. There are no iron or ironing boards in the room. You can request one and they will bring it to your room.The plus side, every room has a beach view. Even a partial view is nice, as seen in my pic.Yes, the rooms are small, but the location is great! Waikiki beach is directly across the street, Mcdonalds is next door, famous eggs and things is downstairs. So many shopping and eating options all within walking distance.On a side note, if you plan on renting a car, the hotel only has 22 parking spaces available which is on a first come first serve basis. They assign you a remote that lets you in their garage. If you are lucky to get one of the 22 remotes, then you hold it during your whole stay, which means you have a parking stop your whole visit.Parking is $29 a day which they charge you upon check out.However, if you are not lucky enough to claim one of those 22 spots on your visit, they told me that they have an overflow parking lot 3 blocks away, and the price each day is $10 less.The hotel also charges a resort fee each night. I think it is $25 a night. This fee is ridiculous. The hotel has no exercise room, no pool, no free breakfast,no laundry service, no valet, etc.They will talk it up, that the resort fee includes wi fi, towels to use for the beach, and free dvd movie rentals.Oh, it can be very noisy. I stayed at the top floor (level 14 which is the highest)and the noise level can be high from the street noise. Cars, emergency vehicles, people talking, yelling.There are other bigger hotels as your neighbors, so depending on what side you are on hotel, you can literally yell out to them or see in their rooms. Visa versa.The hotel really doesnt have a lobby either.You kind of walk up to a person behind glass windows to check in/out.Overall it is not bad. Can't beat the location and convenience of everything.Yes, rooms are small, but you're in Hawaii...you should only be in your room to sleep. Enjoy Hawaii!

This was my fortieth stay at the Waikiki Circle Hotel. The property is directly across the street from the ocean. You can experience the surf directly breaking on the sandy beach or relax in a part of the beach protected from the surf. The hotel is a colorful facility with friendly and helpful staff. Rooms can have an ocean front view or a city view depending on where in the circular structure you are located. The hotel is within easy walking distance of restaurants of all types of cuisines and attractions such as the zoo and aquarium. Definitely a walking friendly environment. Highly recommended.
user_name:
Fred B
Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: This hotel was a little run down and the rooms were pretty small. But it was an excellent location and the staff was nice. It is across the street from a swimming beach. It is definitely not a luxury hotel.

Over 20 years we have been visiting Hawai’i and try to stay at The Circle for part of our holiday. All about position position right on the beach , easy walking distance to all main parts of town. Friendly staff, clean , safe, affordable, we love the little circle on the beach .

Small, but clean hotel right across the street from Waikiki beach. It has no pool, but who needs a pool when you’re that close to the beach! Be sure to get an ocean front room, it is worth it!The location is within walking distance of many shops and sites.

Our family of 4 stayed in this hotel and have loved it. We upgraded to a full beach view and it was worth it. Its an older hotel with no pool or bar etc but has been great. Amazing views and is perfect location. . It's a small hotel with car park underneath. The rooms are small however very clean and tidy. The beds are fantastic all 4 of us have slept very well. TV is only basic chanels but you can hure movies or playstation.. We love that you just walk across the road and swim in the most beautiful water. No noise comes from the street despite the fact you are on the main drag.Definitely value for money. We would stay again.

Arrived in Waikiki around 10am and thought I'd just drop my bags off until 2pm check in - Jay at reception offered me an upgrade to Oceanfront for $25 per night - of course I took it! Very fast check in, very friendly AND I got to check into my room straight away! The views are to die for, one of the best value for money hotels on Kalakaua Ave (imo). Kamaki is just awesome too!The room was clean, beds super comfy and the bathroom supplies were Hawaiian Tropic so I'm happy as!Lifts run better than other hotels I've stayed in, Eggs n Things is directly downstairs, you can order your food and they'll deliver to your room (rather than waiting ages in line as it's so popular).Beach towels are provided, beach is right across the road. McDonalds is a one minute walk away as is an ABC store.The noise from the streets aren't too bad (I was on the 13th floor) and the aircon is great too.All in all, I had a great experience at Aston Circle Waikiki and would recommend it to anyone!

Even the word Terrible can’t fully describe my experience with this hotel. It was a nightmare.I stayed at this hotel for one night and I woke with red spots of my legs, obviously they were bug bites. I complained and here are some highlights on what the GM said to me:“Flea is everywhere.”( He said it more than twice.)“Those marks (bug bites) on your legs don’t seem serious, they all should be gone by the end of today.”He asked a few times if I had been to the beach and I answered him a few times “NO!”More important, He had never said sorry to me, no apology at all!!!!May be Flea is everywhere to him as a general manager in this hotel. I have been to many hotels and this is the first time I had bug bites from a hotel. I only stayed in this hotel for one night and all those bug bites scars leave on my leg forever!!. Flea is everywhere? Probably it is true to this hotel. Furthermore, He said my one night stay cost will be covered by the hotel, but until now ( almost two weeks already) I am still charged for the cost!!!I am so upset and angry !!

Quaint hotel, outstanding for the budget! A Tad dated but the history, location and the uniqueness makes it great. Rooms are small.... so prepare but you are only in your room to sleep! SERVICE and CLEANLINESS are OVER THE TOP!!!! RECOMMEND THIS PROPERTY.

The Aston Waikiki Circle is at a good price in fantastic spot virtually across from the Dukes statue and the swimming areas. Has Eggs and Things at your doorstep.It is slightly dated but that adds to the apeal.The staff are friendly and always looking after whatever you need.
user_name:
Colin W
New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We stayed for a week and from the moment we arrived to the lovely welcome from the lady on front desk until the day we left we've enjoyed every moment of staying here. The rooms are not big but they are comfortable and clean. I give housekeeping a 10/10 (and I work in the industry). We had an Ocean View room and we spent most nights during our stay out on the balcony enjoying the experience. It's a busy place but we had no trouble sleeping. The staff are all very hospitable and very friendly. It's in such a great location and so handy for shops and restaurants. We would definitely stay here again when we revisit Waikiki.

We have stayed here before (5 years ago), but I felt it deserves another review as it never disappoints. Our stay was 14 days this time. Upon arrival we were given our room with a partial ocean view on the 7th floor. The gentleman who checked us in, said to check back tomorrow morning as there would be some upgrades available. We came back at noon, and boy they did not disappoint, they had an Ocean Front room on the 14th floor available. Room #1405. He took us to see it and the second he opened the door and we saw that view, we were sold!! It was amazing. Our room had two double beds and they were very comfy, you always get lots of pillows. The bathroom has a shower only. It has an area with a desk, coffee pot and mini fridge. We noticed that a lot of the staff were the same from 5 years ago. Our favorites are "The Goddess" and "Baby Bear", and of course John. I'm sorry I can't remember them all, but everyone is so lovely to deal with. We will always stay at this hotel when we come to Waikiki as it's right across the street from the beach, and there are countless options for restaurants everywhere you look.

This is a small hotel located in the best part of Waikiki, just across the beach ,Torch Lighting and Duke Kahanamoku Statue. Location is its biggest adventure.There are lots of shops and restaurants around and a bus stop is across the street. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and ok, but they need some upgrade. I recommend to book ocean view or partial ocean view room. You can watch a beautiful sunsets and surfers at the morning. This hotel is really worth money you pay for it. And sorry, but I took one orange fish from the bathroom. Now she decorate my bathroom reminds me of my vacation.

We have just stayed for 5 nights in a Partial Ocean view room on the 12th floor. The view was amazing from 1202. The room is small but has everything you need and the beds are super comfy. Rooms have bathroom, balcony, coffee maker, small fridge and in room safe. Check is was very easy and staff are very friendly. Located right in the heart of Waikiki, the Aston Waikiki Circle is straight across the road from the beach, super close to the Hop on Hop off bus (use the public buses at $5.50 US for a full day pass and easy walk to the bus stop) and Duke Paoa Kahanamoku Statue. Eggs N Things downstairs and ABC store for bits and pieces right next door. Nothing is too far away and you have an easy walk to most restaurants, including Cheesecake Factory, Teddy's, Denny's, and Kirin for great Chinese food (plus many more). If we ever return to Waikiki again, we will stay here again.

13 night Hawaii vacation with only 1 night in Waikiki. I wanted an oceanfront room but didn’t want to pay the price. I “settled” on the best room in this little gem among the giants! We loved it! Walking distance to everything, a great view, and swimming directly in front. Yes, the bathroom is very small, as well as the room, but if you are spending your vacation in your room, you are doing it wrong.

It is a completely circular building with a balcony to each room , offering views of the city or Waikiki Beach priced accordingly. A word of warning if you want a specific view it should be clearly identified or you will end up with only half the view you want or none at all. The rooms are well maintained and comfortable. It's a little pricey, as is the resort fee for probably the oldest hotel on the beach front. It has a restaurant onsite but be prepared for a long queues/wait for service. There are other restaurants nearby but a little difficult to locate as there is some major renovations, revamping and town planning going on in the area. There is parking at the hotel however its an extra charge, extremely limited and very tight parking spots especially for large cars. .

We stayed in Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel for 8 nights. The hotel provides a small safe. We were careful to put our valuables such as smartphones, laptops and headphones in there. Since we rented a car and we had a chance to buy our groceries from the groceries stores such as Walmart and we kept the food, beers in the fridge and the other stuff such as bread and sweets on the desk at plain sight. One day we bought two six pack of beers, bread and ham to make some sandwiches. That same night we drank 10 beers. Next day, September 18th, we all went to hang out and travel around Oahu, when we got back we noticed that the two remaining beers, a bottle of water and a bread were missing.We didn't want to report because we were afraid that if the same person knew that we had reported her she would steal us even more. Then next day, September 19th, more things were stolen. For example, one women underwear which was a surprising for us, we never imagined someone would want to steal something like that also since we brought first aid box with some medicines one box of medicine for flu was also stolen.This bad experience had never happened to us before. We weren't expecting this to happen in a place that is considered safe as Oahu.People like this shouldn't be working as a room service because people cannot store all their belongings in a small safe. We don't put food and drinks in the fridge so that room service can get whatever they want. This needs to be investigated because there is a thief in there that has key to access all the rooms.

We recently stayed here for our second trip to Waikiki and sought out a beachfront hotel with a balcony. As far as room prices go this would have to be just about the best value for money you will find for that combination. We had an ocean front room and the view from the balcony was amazing. So relaxing every day just watching the sunset, before going to dinner at one of the many eating places nearby. The room was small but not tiny and certainly manageable for two people. I think they all have two double beds and perhaps one queen size might be better but it didn't bother us. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful when we arrived and were very accomodating in getting us to our room as soon as they could, which was much earlier than the check in time of 3pm. The hotel is on the street, not on the beach, so there is quite a lot of noise and if you are a light sleeper this might be a problem for you. We were on the 10th floor and it was still quite noticeable, however the air. conditioner was a good 'white noise' provider and we didn't have any issues. We loved our stay here and would be very happy to stay here again.

My wife and I arrived very early (12:30) to our checkin which was supposed to be at 3:00. Luckily Kamaki at the front desk was able to get us in the room and upgraded us for an extra $40 from standard 2nd floor no view to ocean view 9th floor. It was SO worth it! We didn’t even realize when we reserved initially that this hotel was right on the beach, arguably the best location on the island! The room was nice, modern, and clean, with our own private balcony. We absolutely loved it and we highly recommend trying to get an ocean view a few floors above ground level! Thank you Kamaki for your service!

Very unique metro hotel experience literally 500 feet from Waikiki Beach. Gorgeous views, great location within walking distance of some of the best restaurants and shopping in Honolulu/Waikiki. Room was comfy, a bit small and very slightly worn, but all in all a very good value.

A very unique hotel as it is a circle. The check in and concierge area are open air. The rooms were very nice and clean. The beach is just across the street. All rooms have a patio and the view is awesome. Mahalo!

This hotel’s staff are very friendly and helpful! We were in Room 1202 which is an ocean view room and the view was beautiful! No pool but with ocean few feet away, who needs a pool! The hotel is located in a very pretty area with restaurants nearby. I would suggest getting a 8th floor or higher room due to traffic sounds etc.

This place took us by surprise, I have to admit. We’d reserved a “partial” ocean view room, but when we arrived, we were immediately asked if we’d like to upgrade to a “full” ocean view room! Of course we accepted, and the next 3 nights were spent in great comfort. The balconies are great, but watch your trunks! One dude’s pair flew off and wound up on the roof of the adjoining restaurant. My only complaint is that the doors slamming tend to echo throughout the entire floor. If you’re a light sleeper such as I, this might be a problem, but even I’ll admit it wasn’t THAT bad, and it only happened one night....at 3am. Next door is a GREAT restaurant called Eggs ‘n Things that gives a 10% (15%?) discount to hotel patrons who show their key card.

Being one of the first hotels on Waikiki Beach it is showing its age, but still a nice place to stay, you are only in there for a short time, to sleep.Very handy , right on Waikiki Beach, walk across the street and there is the famous beach.

Pleasantly surprised with this resort. The location is literally just opposite the beach. It’s not a huge resort. It has no pool but you don’t need one with the ocean being so close. Beach toys and mats are help yourself. The rooms are compact but well positioned, may be a bit squishy for a family of four. Had a nice modern feel. We arrived at 10.30 in the morning and was given a room straight away. Which was really nice of them considering check in was at 3pm. Very, very clean and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Restaurants and abc stores are abundant. Eggs n things is right at the bottom of the resort. We didn’t eat here but the lines for it were constantly long. Very popular. Lovely place to stay.

I had the room at the top on the 14th floor. The view was mesmerizing. My girlfriend and I sat on the lanai for what seemed like hours enjoying the view. For what you pay and the value you get at this beachfront hotel, it was well worth it. The rooms were clean with a cool beach boutique vibe. There's no pool or fitness center but who needs it when you have the beach across the street. There's also Eggs N Things downstairs if you get hungry. The location of this property is a winner.

Stayed for a few days here on a journey to the US. Clean, convenient to the beach. Shops nearby. Staff are helpful. Easy to walk from the room to the beach, which was lovely to swim in. There are airport coaches who pick up from the hotel.

Great location, across from the beautiful beach. And there is a balcony where I spent a great deal of my time just looking at the ocean and the sunrise, enjoying my morning coffee. Friendly, helpful staff, and price is reasonable. Give them a prize!

I asked for a mid to high floor looking north and we got exactly that. Looking out onto the perfect water of Waikiki beach.Room was clean and very comfortable beds.Our room was available before check in time which was great. Beach towels are available also.Hotel is in a great spot close to everything. Naomi looked after us at check in and she was very friendly and helpful.Would highly recommend this hotel.

This was the cutest hotel ever and the location was incredible. The beach is right across the street with restaurants up and down the street, which is the main street. Loved the beach theme in the hotel room, which was very clean. I loved the complimentary essentials in the bathroom, including the little orange fish, too cute! We had a partial ocean view which was breathtaking. The staff including the wonderful ladies who cleaned our rooms always had a smile for us and an "Aloha" everyday, thank you very much. I will definitely come back to this hotel and definitely tell friends and family who plan on traveling to Oahu to stay at this wonderful hotel. Mahalo!!!

Great location opposite the beach. Small rooms, beds were doubles not queens. We had 3 adults in our room and it was a bit squashy. Small bathroom. OK for short stay. Everything on your doorstep, cafes, restaurants, beach, ABC shops. Clean and comfortable beds. No pool.

Perfect Location to Waikiki Beach. Right across the street from Waikiki Beach. We had an ocean front room and loved sitting on the balcony watching people go by or listening to the nightly music/entertainment on the beach. Room was nice and clean. Vert friendly staff. Perfect location to beach, shops and restaurants.

We stayed here for our 44th wedding anniversary, and came back for our 50th. We will not stay away as long next time. We had an ocean view room both times, with a balcony that we used to eat take out or just sit out and enjoy the beautiful view and sunsets. We will be back!

I know that we were a stones throw away from the sea but having no pool was a pain and should I go again I would always get a pool. The hotel room was lovely, clean cool and a good size.The reception is outdoors.The hotel is right next door to the McDonald’s.If I went to Oahu Hawaii again I would stay somewhere more remote as the road is constantly busy. It is nothing like I thought it would be.Lots of high end shops.The Hilton is not too far away do you can go and watch the fireworks on the Friday evening for free. Using google maps was brilliant as buses stopped on the road behind the hotel and some right on the road outside the hotel. I would definitely recommend getting day passes which are about $5. We went to pearl harbour using the bus and when we got there it was free to go in, you only had to pay to go in museum part or if you wanted to go in a submarine. We went to the botanical gardens, I wasn’t that impressed in comparison the the botanical gardens in San Francisco we went to a few days earlier which were lovely.Get the bus to the bottom of diamonds head, we walked from the hotel there, up to diamond head, down diamond head and back to hotel on the first day. There was no shade so I would recommend getting the bus. Leonard’s bakery and rainbow drive inn is s short bus ride away also from the road behind the hotel. It’s worth a trip and you could also go the Safeway to pick up some food / drinks while there.

If you want to be right beside the ocean on Waikiki then this is it. It might be a little bit of an older building but you cannot go wrong. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The front of the building on a high floor is just amazing. You open the curtains and you can see from Diamond Head to the Hilton Hotel. Cannot recommend this highly enough.

We really enjoyed staying here, right across the road to the beach and close to everything. Our room was very clean and comfortable. We didn't need the aircon on all night & slept well with the balcony door open. The amenities charge covers things like beach towels, wifi, tea & coffee making facilities and a small fridge. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. Highly recommended.

My family of 6 visited there and fell in love. The location is right on the beach. The left side of the breaker wall is a place for toddlers up to an adult. The water is calm and has a sandy bottom. The right side is great for surfing so it can suit all ages. Not to mention McDonalds and ABC stores right next store makes breakfast simple as well as getting waters and basically has anything you can think of. The hotel has a trust policy with its visitors and has inflatables for kids and adults as well as boogie boards, sand toys, and snorkeling equipment and they have a surfboard locker. Beach towels are handed out at the front desk, as many as you need, just drop them off next to the elevator when you're done and that's it. If you watch tv on vacation they do have plenty of channels and movies you can borrow free of charge.Each room has a bucket and shovel for your kids and the AC works great. My 2 yr old son left his favorite blanket there and we realized it when we got home. With one phone call they mailed it back to us for free.All in all, this place was amazing right on the beach, excellent staff, rooms, kid friendly. I recommend this to any family we will be coming here everytime!

Absolutely wonderful place to stayVery welcoming and friendly Great viewExcellent location Near beach and shops and transportation Had a wonderful relaxing time making the most of the view and especially the balcony
user_name:
Patricia W
East Los Angeles, California

review_body: My air bnb fell thru last min and I was able to easily book a few days here! The room was very clean with cute amenities. Great location right across from the beach, restaurants, and the always helpful ABC stores. Front desk was extremely helpful, held my bags for a few hours after checkout which was beyond helpful! Highly recommended!

This is our second time staying at this hotel, we previously stayed two years ago. The views from this hotel (pay extra for ocean front it's worth it) are sensational. The location is central Waikiki close to everything. The staff this time were a 10/10. We love staying here and will be staying here next time we visit Waikiki.

old hotel but well maintained. hot water anytime you need it. A/C is great. bed is comfortable. location is awesome....beach is right on the front with few feet walk. there is a restaurant on the hotel premises. mcdonald's on the corner and a convinient store a few steps away. the hotel location is near everything.

We stayed two nights at the Waikiki Circle. The room and bathrooms are small but the beds were really comfortable and it was very clean. You cant beat the location being right across the road from Waikiki beach.

Located along the strip, across is the beach. Very accessible to the beach. The only thing is when we checked in, we weren't informed of the amenities we can borrow from the hotel such as beach chair, boards, etc. for free. Hotel has no microwave, coffee machine is old and takes forever to brew. Our hotel room isn't facing the beach side. Our balcony view is the parking lot from the next building and the big exhaust is also outside our balcony so its wind is making this loud noise off our balcony door. Try to get a room higher than 4th floor. Overall, this is a clean hotel at its price considering its location.

Great customer service – the rooms are very clean – across the street from Waikiki Beach, had towels, and floats you could use on the beach - This is an older hotel and my not have all the bells & whistles – but Wow what a view

Stayed there in May 2018. Clean room, great location, great deal. Nothing bad to say about the hotel. Very much enjoyed my stay here and would stay here again. The desks to book tours where very helpful. Reception staff very friendly and helpful as well.

Stayed here for 1 week, it is a simple hotel with balcony we paid extra for sea view (best is ocen front sea view). Its a great location near the duke, waikiki beach and a great surf hire shop 1 block back under copacabana (US$7 per hour for surf board). Dissapointing american idea of amenity (or resort) fee on all hotels was US$25 per night! (for WiFi & coffee apparently) on top of what we already paid through booking website. So aussies beware, friends paid US $40 at Hilton on top of daily rate. If you air bnb which we did for 2 nights there is no amenity fee. So budget for tips and amenity fees and pathetic Aussie dollar.

After doing our research and reading many reviews, we stayed at the Waikīkī Circle Hotel this month. We booked an Ocean Front room (Not an Ocean VIEW room, know your categories people!) The Ocean Front view is FABULOUS. If you want to be in the heart of Waikiki this place is it. But you should bear in mind that when you are in the middle of all the action, then it will come with NOISE. It gets pretty noisy in your hotel room, between sirens, general traffic, and leaf blowers, so you may want ear plugs, as some guests have previously reviewed. But overall we very much enjoyed our stay. Yes the hotel is in the shape of a circle so your rooms will be uniquely shaped. And YES the bathroom is pretty small BUT is totally doable. Our room was kept very clean. The housekeeping staff are fabulous ladies, and John at the front desk really did all he could to make our stay wonderful, helping us switch to a higher floor once a room became available. The hotel also gives you access to beach towels, beach toys, floaties, and body boards (when available) which we really appreciated. They had two elevators which were very fast. And do your research to know that most every hotel in Waikīkī adds an amenity fee, so no need to get upset at the front desk. All in all we wouldn’t hesitate to return!!

This is our second stay at this hotel. We were here in 2017. We love it. The staff is great, the rooms are clean and the location is great! The beach is right across the street. We did not rent a car because everything is within walking distance of the hotel. The park is within walking distance and a great place to relax. Thanks again for a wonderful stay!

This hotel is just across from Waikiki Beach which is ideal in location. We were only staying here for 1 night enroute to Maui. The hotel is shaped as a circle which means that each room is pie shaped. It is small and awkward for 1 adult and 2 teens. Otherwise if is clean and there were beach towels available at the concierge. Good for a short stay but too tight for a longer stay. Microwave and bar fridge available.

The room has a very clean and comfortable environment. Location is superb, right near the beach with various surfing stores nearby. Their elevators are by room key only, so safety is greatly ensured for female travelers. Staffs are also very friendly: offered us discounts relate to the hotel, advised us on traveling, and helped us call a taxi to the airport at midnight. Price is extremely reasonable compared to the service we got, so I greatly recommended!

Right across the street from Kuhio Beach which is perfect for little kids. We had a beautiful oceanfront room, the beds were really comfortable, and the staff was very friendly. The shower was snug along with the limited parking spaces available, but with all the other positive experiences, I still give it 5 stars. Happy with my stay and will be back!

We were a little skeptical of this hotel because it was so well-priced, but the room was excellent and the hotel is in a great location. It is across the street from the beach, without any hotel in the way on the beach side, like some of the places further west on Kalakaua St. It is centrally located so you're in easy walking distance of Queen Kapiolani park (where the zoo and aquarium are) and also the shopping at the west end of Kalakaua if that's your thing. Also, if you take tours or go to the Polynesian Cultural Center, a lot of the tour busses pick up behind the Hyatt Regency, which is only a block away. The hotel is older but the rooms are clean and were fine for me and my wife. We were offered an upgrade to a full beach view for cheap, which we recommend - it's nice to be able to see the ocean from your balcony. The AC works well, as does the wifi - we've been to many hotels where the wifi is terrible, not here. We had several phones, laptops, and tablets connected and never had an issue. There are a lot of electrical outlets on the walls and electrical outlets on the lamps, so we were able to keep everything charged. Complementary coffee (and tea) is nice and plentiful, including half-and-half. We used the refrigerator and hotel safe, no issues. Also, the restaurant at the bottom of the hotel, Eggs N' Things, is pretty good for breakfast, and is nice and close. They seem to have a line every morning, so get there early. The only minor issues we had at the hotel is that the TV seemed a little unstable - it seemed like we would often get a "No Signal" indication after watching a channel for a bit. The good wifi made the TV issue less important, and we weren't looking to watch a lot of TV while on vacation. Also, the water pressure in the shower isn't great, but good enough to get the job done. The showers are quite small, and I suspect the water pressure is purposely kept lower so that you don't flood the bathroom. We told the front desk about the water pressure and they sent someone, but it didn't change. A little higher water pressure and better TV would have made this room about perfect, for us at least. But other than those 2 things, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again. The staff is very friendly and the value for the location is excellent.

What everyone says about this place is true - the staff is amazing - we had a problem with our first room and were switched the next day, no problem! It was refreshing to have people actually take care of blips without passing it on - nothing big - a remote didn't work, extra towels that sort of thing. Parking was well done and the bar/restaurant was pretty good.

Great location right across from Waikiki beach and walking distance to lots of great shops and restaurants. Rooms are clean but very small however all rooms seem to have at least a partial ocean view.

I recently stayed for 4 nights in mid-January. Though this hotel is smaller and may not have as many bells and whistles as some of the big resorts around it, the location and cost made this the perfect choice for me. The beach is literally steps away across the street and it's smack dab between the zoo/park/Diamond Head and high-end shopping and dining around the Royal Hawaiiian, Hilton, and Westin resorts. There was construction going on at a hotel next door, but who goes to Hawaii to hang out in a hotel room? It was very easy to get Ubers, and catch tours at the Hyatt Regency next door. There is a popular restaurant at the ground level - Eggs N Things that offers takeout if you prefer to grab and go. I didn't need much attention, but the front desk was always staffed if guests needed towels or help. In addition to lower prices, the resort fee was half of that charged by the surrounding resorts and included WiFi and DVD rentals. For less than what I would have paid for a base room at another nearby resort, I was able to get an oceanfront room with great view. Very satisfied customer!

This hotel deserves 5 stars for the locaton and staff but that's not what 5 stars represents. I would absolutely choose this hotel again, but if you are one who wants polished marble floors, butlers, free breakfast and room service, don't stay here. If you want an excellent location and a room that might show wear and tear (what looked like drywall along my window was broken from floor to ceiling) this place is for you. What you need to know: front desk and check-in is outside...a window facing the parking lot. The resort fee is charged at checkout and covers wifi, beach towels, beach inflatables and boogie boards. They charge for parking (everywhere in Waikiki does) and the lot is below the hotel and tiny. If it's full and they can't accommodate your car, they give options of parking somewhere else.I had an oceanfront room on the 9th floor. Glorious view. The rooms all seem to have balconies, although having a bite to eat on your balcony is not advised. You will be attacked by birds who are not afraid of humans. They don't care about your coffee or cocktails though :) NOISE...being oceanfront also means facing the main street. It's noisy. If you need a quiet place to fall asleep, this is not it. The old window style-air conditioner kind of masks the noise on the street, but it's loud and goes on and off at random times. Just as the white noise lulls you to sleep, it shuts down and you hear horns honking or people being people on the street below. Hotel noise: The hotel is circular, so the hallways are circular and there is no carpet. When someone closes the dooor to their room, it slams and echoes. Rooms are not sound proof. Final notes: This hotel is sandwiched between an ABC Store (the best convenience store in Hawaii) and McDonald's. A breakfast restaurant that serves all day is on the property. Starbucks is 2 blocks away. The room had a mini fridge that was actually cold. Keurig coffee maker to get your day going.In Hawaii, I want a view of the ocean from my room and a clean place to shower and rest my head after playing in the sun all day. This hotel fits the bill.

Dont stay here they advertise parking first come first serve because they only have 20 spots you have to walk 7 blocks to park at the Ashton sunset they have no rooms with king beds on 2 standard their employees are sub par as far as we're concerned they parking lot attendant tried to charge us $71.00 for overnight I had to get desk clerk to fix it there are no managers to talk to and parking attendants manager refused to come over and when I called they wouldn't answer then just picked up and hung up before I said anything stay away from this dump well never stay in an Ashton property again this was our honeymoon the rooms are shabby to say the least

This was the first stop of a family trip to the West coast of the US. We have a family of 6 - Mum, Dad, 16, 14, 11 and 8. Due to room sizes and restrictions, we booked two rooms billed as family rooms - 2 adults, 2 children. As the photos show, both rooms had only double beds - no singles or fold outs. Mum and daughters (16, 11) shared one room, Dad and sons (14, 8) shared the other. Due to the ages of our kids, this worked okay for us. Room had a fridge and coffee machine, as well as a PS3 connected to the television to act as a DVD player. We had rooms on the left side, 3rd floor where construction work was underway on a neighbouring building. Not the fault of the hotel - we weren’t really disturbed by any noise and we just closed the curtains from the workmen. Additionally, we didn’t really have a lot of traffic noise around our side of the building nor were there any noises from the hallway.Very central in Waikiki, walked to all locations, including Honolulu (a full day out walking) and around Diamond Head (Another full day out walking). The MacDonalds at the base of the hotel was good for breakfasts and quick meals. We didn’t go to the other breakfast store on the other side. Would suggest getting groceries from the Food Pantry about 10 minutes walk away, the ABC stores were a little more expensive. All in all we felt very secure at the hotel, the keycard system controlled access to the lifts as well as the rooms which was a good feature.The hotel itself felt a little dated and the rooms were fairly compact - the bathroom also was a tight fit for two people, but it was certainly adequate for our needs to have a base from which to explore the surrounds. We had some problems with the PS3, but a trip down to the reception booth and they were very happy to assist by sending someone up to help out. We found the staff to be helpful and obliging throughout our stay.

I can't rave enough about this hotel after staying here. Our Uber driver wasn't familiar with the hotel and mapping to it showed a different name so there was some confusion if we were at the right place. We knew enough to look for a circular building. The front desk staff- HELPFUL and SOOO Nice. They were able to accommodate us for an early check in and managed to get us 2 rooms side by side. The rooms are arrayed in a circle on each floor and thus each room is almost like a slice of pie. They were decorated in bright colors and kept very clean. As a result of the shape of the room- there are some idiosyncrasies that must be managed. The room is small but used every square inch available. Bathroom was small. But this is Hawaii - you shouldn't pay high prices for a room that you should only sleep in is my thought. Where this hotel shines is it's fabulous location and proximity to Waikiki beach- literally- walk across the street. You can't get any better than that at the rate we snagged for our room. Without a doubt we would consider staying there again.

Awesome location, across from Waikiki beach. We booked a partial ocean view and were above the garbage dumpster. After talking with front desk staff and paying increase we were moved to a great ocean front room. Rooms are small, we spent most time on the beach or exploring Waikiki. Having refrigerator and coffee maker in the room was a great addition. Rooms were clean.

This place was centrally located in the heart of Waikiki and had the most gorgeous beach front. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The only downside is that parking is very limited, so If you’re thinking of renting a car don’t be surprised if their lot is full, as only a few cars can be in the parking garage. (About 20 spots, all on a first come, first served basis) Luckily I never struggled for parking, but I went in December so it might not be as bad as the summer months.

Perfect location. Directly across from Waikiki Beach. Everything is within walking distance. Underground parking only for guests. You can't find a better lodging buy in Hawaii. Car rentals and tours available in the lobby.

I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel earlier this month for four nights. From the moment I checked in to my reluctant departure, this hotel really was perfect for my short trip.I was welcomed by "The Goddess," Naomi, who got me settled in my room, 1403. The hotel is in a round building just across Kalakaua Avenue from the beach. The rooms are uniquely shaped. Mine had two double beds. There is a small desk area, a safe, a refrigerator and a coffee maker. The TV is plenty big. There is also a playstation 3 and you can use this to watch movies and games available for free rental downstairs. (I didn't use this...) The bathroom is smaller and there is a amaller shower without a bath. Toiletries are Hawaiian Tropic and the shampoo smells like coconut!And then there is the balcony. This is where I spent a great deal of my "in room" time just staring at the ocean and the sunset, enjoying my coffee. It's just wonderful. (See pictures.) On site parking under the hotel with "in-and-out" privileges was just under thirty dollars nightly. There is a resort fee (but every hotel has a resort fee). Wi-Fi (fast and reliable) is included in the resort fee. A key is required for the elevator so I felt secure and hotel staff is present 24-7. I had a late flight and, for an extra charge, after normal check-out I moved to a room (208) with a 10PM check out. Very convenient for a shower and a nap before my red-eye to the mainland. 10% discount at "Eggs-N-Things" which is right downstairs. Great views and service. Okay food. Review to follow.The hotel staff is so welcoming and kind. I can't say enough positive about them. They can answer any question you may have.This was among the cleanest hotel rooms I have stayed.With respect to location, this hotel is in the Center of Waikiki at Kuhio Beach and walking distance to everything. Bottom line: I'll return to the Aston Waikiki Circle!Pro Tips: 1. Spring for the oceanfront room. 2. The free Kuhio Beach Hula Show is right across the street at the big banyan tree stage on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays. Google it!3. Waikiki is a city beach. It's beautiful but it's not a quiet tropical getaway; there are other destinations for that.4. Enjoy this wonderful and unique place and respect its rich history, tradition and culture. You will feel right at home.

Love the beach location! It's situated right across the beach and near many shops. It's about 25mins drive from the airport and it cost about USD45 for a cab ride from the airport. Friendly reception and it was great that we could check in early as we arrived at about 11am. Went for the upgrade to ocean front room at USD15 per day for the view. Higher floors would get the sun but definitely lesser traffic noise. The room was small with two double beds. Bathroom was small too. The hotel is a nonsmoking hotel even at the balcony, so you need to go down and smoke at the designated area.Didn't opt for breakfast but Eggs N Things is just beside the hotel reception. Expect a long queue in the morning though. There's a big ABC store just beside the hotel so you can buy snacks and drinks there. There's a resort fee so be sure to get yourself a beach mat, floats, surfboards, and beach towels to make it worth when you go down to the beach for your swim. Though price is a lil high for a small room, I would consider staying here again for the awesome location!

Was at the circle for 2 days as a stay over before we left, rooms are on the smaller side but we had 2 adults and 2 kids and were fine. There is ac in the rooms but not in the hall way. Older hotel but nice especially if you want the old Hawaiian feel. Great location.Ask for the ocean front rooms which are a little extra but the view is worth it.

Great little place that's been outgrown by the newer fancier places. I'll take this place any day. Clean comfortable. Close to everything. Very nostalgic place. Friendly, helpful staff, and priced reasonably for the are.

If you want to be right on the beach front with sea views over Waikiki at a reasonable price then this hotel maybe for you? But, it is cheap and cheerful and does have a downside. The hotel is an oddly designed concrete structure that is in need of refurbishment and can be quite noisy. Doors to the rooms do not fit properly and there is a good 10mm gap under the door and a 3-4mm gap around, (at night you will readily see light from the corridor penetrate around the door frame), this means that any noise from the corridor, which is not carpeted, comes straight through the door. Also the sliding doors to the balcony in both my room and my friend’s room could not be closed properly which meant that the noise from the street outside was also a problem. My friend had a standard room at the rear of the hotel. However, the hotel that is just to the rear of the Aston Waikiki Circle has a large 4th floor sundeck with pool, there also bars and BBQ areas; this generated a lot of noise in the evening.We both slept as best as we could with earplugs.As other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms are smaller than they appear in the photos. Although they are getting old they are clean and well serviced daily by the friendly staff. The hotel lobby will provide beach towels and the beach is literally 50m away across the road.There is limited parking in the hotel basement at $28/day (2018 price) and when we parked the car there were always spaces available.

We loved this hotel. Right across the street from Waikiki Beach and the perfect central location to everything else in Waikiki. Fantastic architecture, this hotel was built in the round to resemble a Chinese lantern (the story of the founder is the lobby), so the rooms have a pie shape to them. It makes the shower stall a tad tight, but it was really no big deal. Front desk staff while we were there "Kamaki" and "John" were just wonderful. Newspaper delivered to your door each day was a real nice touch. No pool, if that's important for you - it wasn't for us. We highly recommend this hotel!

Second stay in 3 years and it did not disappoint us. We love the location on Waikiki. Parking is conveniently located in the garage below. Staff are friendly and the room was clean. Love the Hawaiian tropic toiletries. I cannot get enough of the coconut lotion. Smells like the beach. This hotel is located within walking distance to all of the most popular areas of Waikiki. We enjoy the intimate feel of the hotel. It is nice to just get on the elevator and up to your room quickly without having to navigate through the lobby like other hotels. We didn't mind the few amenities offered. This is what we like about the Aston Circle. I only wish they had king size beds available. The daily paper was a nice touch.

This modest hotel is centrally located and just across the street from the beach.Parking is below the hotel. There are ABC Stores on the left and right side of the hotel as well as a McDonalds just next door. The prices are more reasonable than anything close by.

Loved staying at this hotel, the staff are friendly and very helpful.The rooms with a sea view were wonderful and it was well worth paying a little extra to upgrade to one if they are available. The rooms with a partial sea view are also good.The hotel is in a good position opposite the beach. There is a McDonalds next door for families with small children. I would certainly stay there again.

Fantastic location across from the beach,walking distance to everything. fantastic, friendly staff and clean rooms. would have stayed here longer only had more family arrive and would've been to small, was great for a few nights with 3 adults in one room, would stay here again

Love the location right across the road from the beach. No pool and that is why we like it, just skip across the road. ABC next door. Couple of minutes to Duke's statue or a cocktail at the Westin Moana Surfrider. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Great location clean, friendly people and straight across from the beach, will be back no doubt walking distance to shops and eateries, their little fish pillows were so comfortable wish I could have brought one Maholo

The hotel is very tired and needs refreshing, our room had a fantastic beach front view, the beds were comfy, the room was very tiny and smelt strongly of cleaning chemicals, and the shower was the smallest shower I’ve ever seen, I think on our next visit I will pay a little more and go elsewhere. There’s also an extra charge for Wi-Fi $30 for one night

My family and I stayed for three weeks at the Aston Waikiki Circle.The hotel is directly opposite Waikiki beach.It is a three star hotel,but is great value for money and of course a great location as well.There is a restaurant at the ground level, but not part of the hotel.All restaurans and shops are easy walking distance.The bus routes for Honolulu and the island are easy to find and are frequent.There is free wi-fi, toiletry service, and chamber maid service daily.The hotel also provides a newspaper to each room , each day.There are front desk staff on duty 24/7 also.Plus TV in each room. All rooms are very well air conditioned, with showers.The staff are very friendly and helpful.Oh, there is an underground car park.Staff will also supply you with a beach towel whenever you want.As the name suggests, the hotel is circular in shape.The rooms are slightly more expensive if you face the beach, than if you do not.I highly recommend this hotel to stay at in Waikiki.

This is a great place. This is our third time here. If you want ocean view that is right at you Lanai door, you got it. You make a request of staff you got it. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean, you got coffee, and a fridge. The rooms are plenty big enough and so is the lobby (your in Waikiki I'm going to sit in my room?????) The staff are helpful, and friendly. With an ABC store right down stairs, you got everything from snacks to light meals, soda beer, spirits, Hawaiian attire, etc. Mcy D is right around the corner also.

My husband and I love Hawaii and have travelled there many, many times, but as we get older it is not as easy. However staying at the Waikiki Circle on Oahu makes it much easier for us old folks. Located in the heart of Waikiki, and just across the street from the ocean afford us the ability to utilize public transportation if we choose, thus eliminating the need for a car.A McDonald's is on the property(or right next door perhaps), and they have their own restaurant there, too, and directly next door is also an A B.C. store that sells nearly anything you need or want!All of the personnel are courteous and helpful and full of Aloha! Oh, Did I mention the price?(You probably can't do better.)
user_name:
Janice B
Bainbridge Ross County, Ohio

review_body: nice rooms and the view was great. Was clean and the view of the ocean was awesome. There is a McDonalds right next door and ABC store... was a great place to stay. The staff at the front desk was not as friendly as I would like, but you never know what they were dealing with that day. All said It was a great little hotel with old world charm

You get what you pay for is what I said when I checked in. The hotel had no lobby. There was a "ticket booth" and and elevator. I didn't know which line I was standing in because there was a line wrapped around for the restaurant next door that blocked the check in booth. I booked one Partial ocean view and one city view. The city view was the view of the pool from the hotel next door. So I waved to everyone there. I felt like I can extend my hand and touched them. The partial ocean view was hardly a partial ocean view but I understood thats how these hotels make their money. We were moved from a lower floor to a higher floor but not much better. The rooms were extremely tight along with the bathrooms. It was clean. It would not fit 4 people comfortably, so glad I opted for 2 rooms. I couldn't ever connect to the wifi that was offered so I don't even know why we had to pay a resort fee. This was more of a motel than a resort. I always smelled this stench of urine. I still can't figure out if it was the hotel or Waikiki itself. The parking was ridiculous. $28/night and it was the bottom floor with barely any parking. I've always found a parking spot when I got back in from my day out but I cannot imagine if all the tenants had a car. Where would everyone park? There is an ABC Store right downstairs and on everyone block. I did not eat at the Eggs and Things on this visit because I've had it before on other visits and I wouldn't stand in that line for it. Aside from the staff and maybe the location that was all that was good about this hotel. You can definitely find something better in the area for about the same amount of money.

So we booked this hotel based on a recommendation from my in-laws. We thought we would go with a cheaper option than our previous stay at the Hyatt Regency. Going the cheaper option, we got the cheaper service. The hotel itself was good enough for us to sleep...however, the room it self was a bit small, the bathroom was very small...barely enough room to sit on the toilet and the parking....was actually quite disappointing considering they are charging $28 per night plus tax. The spaces were limited and small. And when it appeared there was no parking, I was told I wasn’t looking hard enough, and pointed me to a spot where the lines were barely visible, and it was right in front of a door way so you would assume you cannot park there. All in all....you get what you pay for....

The ONLY good things about this hotel is that it's location is great, and the view is remarkable! All down hill after that I'm afraid. The hotel is just steps away from the famous Waikiki beach, but our experience here has been a nightmare... Cockroaches, spoiled coffee creamer, the manager keeps bankers hours and the room I had smelled horrible (and progressively worsened over time, smelled like a dead mouse or something)...We booked through a third party website and since the manager is gone for the day all they could do is offer to give us another room (?)... THIS HOTEL HAS GIANT ROACHES!!! NO, I WANT A REFUND!!!

This little hotel is surrounded by giants, but holds its own. Its retro decor matches the quirky circular building. The place is well maintained. The location is ideal. Directly across the street is the main Waikiki beach access with family friendly areas and loads of surfers. There is a McD’s and ABC convenience store on either side so you can grab something quick without crossing a street. Other restaurants and shops are a short walk away. The zoo is a few blocks down. No need for a rental car with this location. The amenities are a little sparse, but with the beach, restaurants, and shopping so close by, why do you need a pool? Compared to other hotels nearby, this is more affordable.

The Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel is a good place to stay while in Hawaii. The circle hotel is not like the other hotels, it does not have a pool, but who needs a pool when the beach is across the street.Great location! Walk out the front to the corner and cross the street and you are on the beach! It is with in Walking distance to other Restaurants and sites. Diamond Head is a short 10 to 15 min ride by taxi or Uber.

We stayed for 10 days at Waikiki Circle recently and found it to be the most charming place. It may not have all the bells & whistles but it was clean and in the most central location in south Waikiki. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff especially John & Kevin at the front desk. We arrived after a long flight and were greeted with the wonderful news that we could have an early check-in, this being 9.30am. If we return to Hawaii we would have no hesitation in staying there again.

Stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights in early May. The booking had been made through my travel agent so i had no preconceived ideas or general info apart that is next to the beach and has great views. Both of these points are very true.I had arranged transfers from the airport and they will drop you at the kerb in front of the hotel so you will need to haul your luggage up the inclined driveway to the front of the hotel.Once at the top you will see a window opening on the left that is where you check in. John was very helpful in pointing out that my booking was for a standard room but for an extra $30 per night i could have a beach view room. I paid the the extra and was very happy with the 10th floor view. The room was on the small side but was air conditioned and had an ensuite. There was also a coffee maker, TV and DVD player that were included under your daily service charge. All hotels in Hawaii charge a daily service charge in addition to your room charge. The room was clean and tidy. The road between the hotel and the beach has a lot of one way traffic. You can get the occasional late night motorcycle, drag car or police siren going past. The cafe at the front of the hotel is called Eggs and More. It is very popular and hotel guests get a discount.I would stay here again. It is well located next to Waikiki beach and has great views.

I stayed at the hotel from 20th to 30th July 2018. The hotel was in a prime location in Waikiki but more of a tower of rooms rather than a hotel really! The reception is a hut in the lobby area (between Eggs and Things and the lift to the bedrooms). The staff here do the job but are not particularly friendly or welcoming. Having said that, one member of staff did sort out a car parking place for me at the hotel, after the first day we had to leave our hire car four blocks away in another hotel, but other than him, they were all fairly surly! Our room (I stayed with one of my daughters) was comfortable (we each had a small double bed), with a good shower in the non-bath room! The housekeeping staff kept our room in good order, with clean towels daily and beds made (although not changed during our stay, as far as I was aware). There is a resort charge of $26 a day, which covered our use of Wifi, a coffee machine in the room, a paper, use of a room safe, use of DVDs (which we used extensively) etc. However, given this is the rate for most hotels, it seemed excessive for the services we actually received at this budget hotel (and added $260 to our final bill!). There were some minor issues, for example, the refrigerator in our room was extremely smelly. We did try and keep a few things in this but they ended up smelling too - so we couldn't store the products in this, we would have liked too i.e. we would have liked to have had some breakfast items (my daughter is vegan, so found it really difficult to cater for her needs, with few restaurants having vegan options) but the state of the fridge made this impossible. If we had had a baby with us and needed to store their food/milk, this fridge would have needed to have been changed - it was awful! The is also construction work going on next door i.e. it appears either another budget style hotel is being built OR apartments, and this commences at 6am in the morning. Not good if you want a lie in!

Stayed here in November last year, price was really reasonable compared to other hotels in the area. The location of this hotel is amazing, right on Waikiki beach, literally come out of the hotel lift, cross the road and you're right there in the perfect spot!Rooms were cleaned daily, had a coffee machine, small safe, tv had a ps3 with it and reception gave us a card which we could use to rent movies from a machine for free, great choices too, had all the latest releases so this was a pleasant surprise. Views from the rooms at the front of the hotel are incredible so would recommend spending a little extra for these rooms.Had a very enjoyable stay in Hawaii, this is a great base for anyone looking to stay in the Waikiki area on a budget.

This is the place I will stay in Waikiki. The location cannot be beat. The beach is at your door with many restaurants and everything else you need. The front desk staff are great. They are professional, take their jobs seriously and do it all with a smile. It is a small boutique hotel with rooms to match. The bathrooms are modest and rooms on the smaller side but perfect for your visit. You won’t find better value, a better location on cleaner spot. The balcony with the beach view was a nice treat for my morning coffee.

We were in Waikiki for 1 night on way home after visiting other islands. Stayed in top floor ocean front room which had an awesome view - for our family of 4 this was perfect for one night as I already knew in advance the room would be tiny and we would have to share two small double beds. If you can accept the small room - it is worth it for the great location and views

This hotel gets a solid 3.5 stars. Were it not for the fact that the Circle Hotel is in DESPERATE need of updating, as in a complete overhaul, they would’ve received 5 stars! The hotel is quaint, small (by comparison), has unbeatable views from any room, good customer service, and is directly across the street from the beach... which in and of itself is INCREDIBLE! There is even an equally small but VERY popular restaurant on the premises (10% discount), and an ABC convenience store next door (you will pay for the convenience). The bathroom, and rooms them-self are very small, with 2 beds, with an OLD looking carpet and bathroom fixtures, not to mention a dingy/slightly grimy tiled shower floor that needs a good scrubbing/cleaning/tile restoration. It’s as if the ENTIRE hotel is stuck in a time warp from the 70s! Meanwhile... a complete renovation of a same sized hotel is going on right next door (get with the program Aston Circle!!!). It’s s good thing that one doesn’t really go to beautiful Hawaii to spend all that much time in the room. YOLO... true... and it is Hawaii, so remember to bring LOADS of money for excursions, to eat, and to buy such little things that we take for granted on the mainland (e.g., water $5 for a 6-pack; $2.50 for a chocolate bar; and inflated prices for what we’d consider cheap staple foods... McD’s, Subway, BK, and Kentucky to name a few. If you find the staple restaurant prices to be expensive, then you’ll really get sticker shock when it comes to restaurants you’d typically visit to eat dinner at... PF Chang’s, Hardrock Cafe, Tony Romas)! Take your own favorite snacks and pack water in your checked luggage if you have space/weight limits available. Flip flops, a good pair of sneakers, shorts, t-shirts, and sundresses are the only attire that one needs (and perhaps a poncho...pick one up from Dollar Tree or Family Dollar before you go, because you’ll not find those stores there!)!

We arrived at 1030 local time after approx 15 hours travelling and they were kind enough to check us in to a room then. Friendly and helpful staff at the front desk. Clean and comfortable with twin double beds. Right across the road from the beach, we could sit on the balcony and get a great view. Ideal location. Nothing fancy about it but secure and comfortable with the basics.

The Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel is nothing fancy. It’s on the older side and has a very basic front office, BUT the staff are super friendly and it’s a comfortable, relaxing and casual atmosphere. The rooms are small, very clean and comfortable enough. The view from the rooms on the front of the hotel is simply spectacular. There’s a TV, PlayStation and a bar fridge in the room. There’s even a small office nook/kitchenette. Air conditioning unit is a tad noisy but not annoying. Room servicing is regular and they do a great job. Oh, and you get a newspaper daily!The hotel is located above the famous Eggs n Things. McDonald is next door on one side, and an ABC store on the other. It’s located opposite Dukes statue across from Waikiki beach.

My family of three stayed here a week, and had an enjoyable stay. The location is amazing! We stayed in room 906, which is a double bed, ocean front room. The view was spectacular! It was nice to be able to walk right across the street and be on the beach. Great restaurants and shopping in walking distance! The staff is friendly and helpful! I only have two complaints...the size of the room and bathroom, and the fees they tack on at the end of your stay. The bathroom really doesn’t have anywhere to hang wet towels or swimsuits. Fees totaled almost $200 for one week, and the parking lot was full when we checked in, so we had to park a couple blocks away at the Banyan hotel ($80 cash for a week, which was much cheaper than parking at the hotel lot any way). Would probably not stay here again, only because I would prefer a condo with a washer and dryer, and a kitchen so we didn’t have to eat every meal out. All in all, an enjoyable stay though!

I've been aware of Aston Circle Waikiki since my first visit to Oahu in 1982. I visit twice a year and stay in a variety of mid-price to expensive hotels. However, this time I was going to be in Waikiki for 18 days, prompting a slightly more economical approach to choosing my hotel. Aston Circle Waikiki- the Chinese Lantern Hotel- offered everything I was looking for in a room, parking, and location for an extended stay, so I chose a "partial ocean view" and booked it for the entire 18 days. I have to say, I enjoyed this cosy retro-hotel more than the larger ones I've stayed in over the past several years. The room was spotless, the staff were extremely helpful, parking was available in the underground lot (You get an dedicated garage access key remote you keep for your entire stay). The room is on the more compact size, but not tiny. It worked very well for my spouse and I, though I'd seriously not consider more than a couple with one small child for the room. Toiletries were provided daily, along with beach towels, free local calls, a daily newspaper

I stayed in Aston Waikiki circle hotel for 3 nights . It’s very central just behind the famous Waikiki beach, very close to the restaurants and bars. Rooms are just okay shower could be bigger. There’s is an egg and things restaurant just at the entrance. There’s an activity center at the lobby. As a conclusion the hotel has a great location but is little bit aged.

Room itself was clean tidy and good. Great room service. Admin staff were uninformative deceitful with fees and lied about payments and holding fees. Also charged $21 for a local 70c call. Very poor admin service and extremely disssppiinted about check in information which was totally wrong and different to check out. Watch out for these people as they are not trained and tell you the wrong things. Very bad service.

Thoroughly recommend this hotel, friendly front office staff, special mention to John who remembered us when we checked back into the hotel 3 weeks after our first visit. Excellent location right in front of Waikiki beach, beach towels available. Hotel is kept very clean.

Upgraded to an ocean view room overlooking Waikiki beach and it was perfect! Small room, tiny bathroom, but right within walking distance of tons of fun. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean, comfortable room. Would stay here again!

I debated for so long and read review after review on almost every hotel in Waikiki for over a year , yes I'm a compulsive planner . It drives my kids crazy . They say just once they'd like to go to a gas station I haven't yelped or studied on TripAdvisor . And they are not exaggerating . My debate was this : did I want to stay in one of the nice resorts with a nice pool and settle for a city view room because I didn't want to pay the big price for the ocean view or did I want to stay at this Aston Waikiki circle and give up having a pool and a fancy resort to have an ocean front view . I chose the circle , and although I have a couple complaints , I am happy with my decision . To be able to wake up and walk on to your balcony and watch surfers under the rainbows , that's why you stay here . Now , one of my complaints is a big one that you should know if you are booking this hotel for the ocean front view . CONSTRUCTION ! NOISY ALL DAY , CRANE LIFTING BRICKS , JACK HAMMERING ALL DAY ! we stayed in an ocean front room on the 13 th floor which was directly across from the construction . At first I was upset and tried moving rooms but they didn't have anything else . I was a little upset that there was no warning by the hotel letting us know this would be going on . The construction is not on this hotel and not their fault but there should have been a warning or a discount . If you can get one of the ocean front rooms that is straight facing the ocean or facing towards diamond head that would be much better . It's not directly across from the construction so I imagine a little less noise . You want a room that ends in 4 or 5 if in an ocean front room . Ours was 1306. Although the construction was an annoyance it did not ruin our time and I would choose this hotel again . It is that worth it to have that view and the proximity to the ocean and to many food places . There is an abc store to your left and to your right . These stores are literally on every corner . They have everything from toiletries to souvenirs . We are at eggs and things downstairs twice . Don't let the long line scare you away , you get a menu while in line , order when you get to front of line so when seated your food is on it's way in a few minutes and worth it . You get 10% off if staying at the circle . We walked to dukes steakhouse and Cheesecake Factory a couple of times , about 5-7 minute walk. We even walked to ala Mona center one night to eat at bubba gump shrimp . It took us about 25 minutes to walk it and we took the pink trolley back . There is no fancy lobby . When the elevator door opens you are looking st the beach which we thought was a cool feeling . The front desk gives you beach towels and there are floaties , chairs and boogie boards for your use . You just grab what you want but get it early because they get taken up . The room was small . It was just me and my daughter so it was fine. The shower would be another minor complaint . It's small which I could deal with but to not get the water to go all over the floor took some skill. The shower head faces you as your trying to turn it on and you have to open the curtain to turn it on so ..... make sure you put a towel on the floor when starting it . The beds were not the best but not the worst . The pillows were flatter than I prefer but you get 3 per bed . Don't rent a car the whole time you are there , why pay over $20 a night to park when there is a hertz rental car next door at the Hyatt open from I believe 8 a.m and doesn't close until 9 p.m. We rented from there twice for one day rentals it takes three minutes to walk over there . If I ever go back to Waikiki I will stay here again hoping for no construction . I suggest calling the hotel and asking for a room facing away from construction .

Got an upgrade to Ocean Front view but only on second floor. We paid extra but would have been nicer to be higher. Gave a credit card for final payment but said to reception we would be back to pay balance in cash. instead of processing credit card. The reception staff seemed to be ok with this. When we went back to pay we were informed he had processed credit card and it couldn't be changed. His reason, there are just so many tourists he forgot. Also now I am home they have taken a further $20 after check out with no explanation. I have emailed them but no reply as yet.

We had a 8th floor ocean view apartment, it was perfect for us. It’s centrally located to everything. Eggs and Things restaurant below. No pool but we swim at the beach anyway so that didn’t worry us. It was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Couldn’t ask for more!

Yes walk out of the lift and see Waikiki in all its all it’s glory. The motels decor and facilities may be a bit dated but perhaps that is the character of this motel. All rooms have a balcony (only small) view of the beach and ocean with only a short stroll to all that Waikiki offers.

So happy we booked the Aston Waikiki Circle. The hotel is older but clean and well kept (and it’s in the shape of a circle so if you have young kids they will certainly love that fact!). The location is the selling feature as it is right across the street in the midst of Waikiki beachfront, many shops and restaurants nearby. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful - we took a $30 upgrade to an “ocean view” which gave us a partial view (don’t be confused with “ocean front”) but we were even able to take a look inside the three rooms available to pick our favourite view. The beds were firm but comfortable and the room was roomy. The bathroom was quite small and could have used a few more hooks or a shower clothesline to hang up our wet beach stuff everyday but otherwise we were very happy with our stay.

This hotel was very convenient, close to restaurants and fast food outlets and within walking distance to shops. Best of all it is straight across the road from Waikiki beach, we would definitely stay there again, there is a tour booking area at the entry which means you can book a tour without having to leave the hotel complex.

We recently visited the Aston Circle in Waikiki located directly opposite the beach. Although a little tired compared to the high rise accommodation surrounding us we found this quaint hotel clean, compact but all we needed. The price was a lot cheaper as well. A coffee machine was provided as well as beach towels, and free DVD,s. Staff were friendly and very helpful. The attached tour desk helped out with transfers, tours and local recommendations. Highly recommend for people looking for a cost effective stay in Waikiki.Susan and MarkAustralia

It was my first visit to Hawaii and definitely not my last all because of this gem. The hotel's in the heart district of Waikiki with rooms that are directly facing towards the ocean within affordable price range compared to the other hotels in the area. I stayed in an oceanfront room on the upper floor and the view was absolutely gorgeous especially to watch how the sun rises & sets daily. The staff was a top-notch, reflects on their manager Mr. Kevin Wong. I love John & Jane and the housekeepers, they were very hospitable! I work in the hospitality industry and I can say it was truly an excellent 5* service. Do not forget to swing by at Eggs n' Things which was on-site to have a delicious breakfast! Couldn't wait to go baaack!!! :)

This was my 4th stay at this hotel and I really don’t want to stay anywhere else when I visit Waikiki, I just love it! The location is superb and the rooms are bright and clean. Yes they are a little on the small side but who cares when you have the amazing views from the ocean front rooms! The staff on the front desk are always super friendly and nothing is too much ch trouble. Big shoutout to ‘the goddess’ who changed our room to a better location and a higher floor , that was much appreciated. And also to John who remembered me from my last visit 2 and a half years ago. Such lovely people and nothing was too much trouble. Can’t wait to come back and stay here again!
