Love this hotel. Great location. Nice ocean view. Cute decorations. Boutique style. Clean with friendly helpful staff. Do not expect frills and thrills. It is not a high end fancy hotel. Rooms are small with only showers. Parking is limited. Enjoy it for what it is. Don’t hate it for what it isn’t

The location of this hotel is perfect, across from beach and on the main street. Rooms are very clean and serviced daily. The staff are very friendly and if booking any tours, Tina down stairs is amazing. Also you can get free DVD rentals for those quiet nights in. This hotel is perfect if you are after a simple place to stay, with no extras which means cheaper resort fee.

This place has been around for quite some time and is now part of the Aston chain. The hotel has an unusual design. It is basically a cylinder with the rooms situated on the outside part like wedges of pie. All the rooms have a lanai or balcony but unless you really want the full on ocean view, not partial view, (which costs more), just go with the city view. Bathrooms are clean and functional. AC unit is built into the wall. I think mine needs to have the filter cleaned or something. I was waking up in the middle of the night with a sore throat. Tried higher temp setting, still the same thing. When I turned it off completely at night, I felt much better. Rooms have a safe and a TV.. you can rent movies from the front desk for free. Actually, it’s not free. It’s part of the so called resort fee or amenities fee which almost all hotels charge in Waikiki. It’s 25 dollars a day and a total ripoff, but it’s a mandatory fee. To call this a resort fee is a joke. No swimming pool but Waikiki beach is right across the street. WiFi is included in rate. There is a highly popular breakfast place attached to the hotel which provides a 10 percent discount for hotel guests. However, lines are very long to get in there. The hotel also offers parking underneath the building for a fee. However, parking is limited. I think they have 22 spots so if you plan to rent a car and use their parking, I would call ahead and see if you can reserve in advance. Several times while I was there, it was listed as full at the lobby. Staff is friendly and helpful and I think it’s generally good value for money but keep in mind it is an aging property.

Friendly people, great location right across the street from Waikiki Beach. The rooms are cute-they remind me of being on a cruise ship. Worth it to pay a little more money for a partial ocean view, at least. Clean and comfortable.

The photos on line show this to be a very inviting place, however the reality is less so. The place is old and definitely needs a make over. This is not a hotel in my opinion, just serviced rooms. There is no reception, only a window "hatch" behind which someone sits.The rooms are very small and fitting in two beds makes this worse (especially if you only need the one, however each bed is anyway only a small double). The bathroom is minute. Water is very hot (beware) but only one person can fit in the bathroom at any one time. Full frontal room is a lovely position and with excellent views over the ocean (and the unfortunate homeless people camped outside). The Circle has a popular restaurant at the front (Eggs n' Things). Unfortunately the cooking smell comes up into the rooms. When you sit on the balcony, the air conditioning unit spits water over you if switched on!The few staff we saw (in the hatch) were pleasant enough but you do not feel that you are in the sort of hotel you would expect for the price they are charging.Parking is $22 per day (a bit cheaper than others) BUT you can only book it the morning of your first day before 7.00am. Not very helpful if you arrive in the evening!No swimming pool for kids, but beach is across the road.The most outrageous thing is the $25 Resort Fee! For this you "receive" free WiFi, free DVD hire and an (old) coffee machine in your room. (Coffee was ghastly and tea undrinkable). I understand that the Hawaii Tourist Board are hoping to persuade the Hawaii Government to pass a law banning such "rip off" practices. Until then I would suggest you look at the Tourist Board's list of hotels that do not make such charges. It has quite put us off going back again to Hawaii. It is an expensive place to visit at the best of times but the hoteliers in Hawaii are destroying the Aloha and we certainly won't return again until the Hoteliers make me feel that they really want me to come there, not just my wallet and they start providing better value for money.

Beachfront hotel that sits overlooking waikiki beach close to many eateries at doorstep beach across road,no pool or room service but excellent value for money.Oceanfront room had 2 doubles and would suit a family.Clean room with a free dvd machine downstairs.Would stay again

Stayed here recently for 8 nights with 3 friends we had 2 rooms. Oceanfront room is just lovely the view is spectacular even with the beautiful fig tree blocking some of the view we were on the 6th floor. Our friends were on level 9 and could see over the tree. The rooms aren't huge but for 2 people is perfect you could stretch to 3. Two double beds which I must say were very comfortable and pillows were good and they gave you 3 each bed. Bathroom is fine toiletries were lovely the shower not huge but not a problem. There was a wardrobe and plenty of drawers for storage and a little safe and a small fridge. Aircon worked well a little noisy but didn't keep me awake. There was a coffee pod machine and teabags and coffee supplied? Reception staff always helpful and friendly. Great location and 2 minutes To the beach. Would stay here again ABC shop downstairs and McDonalds right next door

This is a solid cute place. Clean, Friendly, and well kept despite age. This place, though small offers a comfortable stay with nicely appointed rooms. There is no pool but who needs pool when you are across from the best natural pool - the ocean !!Luxury comfy beds and linens, and a large balcony - especially nice if you upgrade to Ocean Front. Staff are very accommodating and helpful. This is great location close to a variety of shopping and eateries. This place offers an appealing retro feel good stay leaving you wanting to come back for more.

We were in Waikiki for 2 nights only and wanted Ocean front room without spending $$$$. This fit the bill, we were 4 adults and the room and bathroom were pretty small, but the view gorgeous and location perfect. They also give free movies and ps3 games-the 2nd night was pouring so badly we just wanted to dry out in room and watched a current movie we wanted to see at the theatre. Only double beds but very comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful, would definitely stay again.

Well, if I was able to choose, I would have chosen somewhere else. The only positive is the location, walking distance to everything, and the beach is directly a cross the street. The shower: no pressure at all, and barley enough room to turn around, I'm 6'3", and ya, it sucked. Now I understand that the hotel is round, so the design isn't all that great but, it is what it is. The staff, lol, ya ok.... let's leave it at that.... no microwaves in the rooms, a/c units are regular window units mounted in the wall, so guess what, the part outside is flat, and when it rains, it's LOUD in the room, they need to put slanted covers over them. With the age of the hotel, we were afraid to use the balcony, 12th floor.... so, like I said, location is all this place has going for it....

Perfect location. You step out of the elevator cross the street and you are on the wakiki beach. Located in the centre of beach. Flanked by the convenience store, the ABC store and Macdonalds. And famous egg place in front. Even the partial ocean view room had a good ocean view. Rooms are small but well equipped and daily cleaned. Provide beach stuff like chairs, umbrella etc

Stayed there for our Honeymoon not happy. We're offered a free upgrade with agent got there and no free upgrade had to pay further for better view. That was the only upside. Shower small not happy. 2 double beds no king. No foyer. No pool. Not what i thought my Honeymoon room would look like. Only stayed under duress for location and view.

Last January 17th I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights.The room was certainly very small. The view, which they call euphemistically city view is to see blocks of apartments that prevent you from seeing anything more pleasant.During those days there were really strong gusts of wind but the sensation was that the wind literally entered the room. The noise from the bay window that overlooks the terrace was chilling.The coffee maker did not work since all the water went out.All in all, what really happened when I went to do the checkout was the most impressive.They, despite Booking.com proudly proclaim that it pays to checkout, the reality is that they retain the money from the first time you make the reservation .. However, when I went to pay I found that the Invoice that should have been 400 USD amounted to 687.97 USD.In addition to the fees, it is true that in small print and far from where they advertise the total amount to be charged is announced and that I could not see because it is set with the intention of going unnoticed, or worse is that they charge 25 USD more fees for the use of Wi-Fi, something absolutely unusual in these times.To make matters worse, the stay of the last night, without further notice, they raised it up to 233.11 USD that same, with taxes includedThe answer was before a crazy size that the price was fluctuating in function of the occupation that they have. I had never heard such a barbarity in any of the 120 countries previously visited.It must be said that they charge USD23.04 with the uncluded rates for parking the car in the parking lot. That is to say 256.15 USD the total amount of that night.Those prices for a hotel built in the 60s and without any apparent major renovation is outrageous and in no way corresponds to the quality offered.The employee who took care of me on the day of the checkout, that is to say on January 20 in the morning, around 10:00 o'clock the voice continually went up to explain what obviously has no explanation.From here I want to express outright my refusal to the performance of that hotel and the behavior of the employee who used a tone of voice more like a police station than a reception of a hotel where they charge 256.15 USD for sleeping one night. .Of course, they do not include breakfast. They offer a discount in an adjoining cafeteria where breakfast is not available for less than 30 USD.When I finally told the employee that I was going to make a comment on Tripadvsor, she invited me jokingly and with laughter to do so.I mean, he did not care at all

My husband and I stayed here for a week. The location is great and so were the staff. Naomi, Kamaki,Steve and Jan at the front desk were very friendly and always helpful. This hotel is small but very easy to navigate and right across from the beach and great for the price. We upgraded to oceanfront, partialocean would have been okay too and we were not sorry. Great view. The hotel is built as a circle so the rooms are small too but they were very clean. Great job cleaning staff. I'm not there to spend time in a hotel room. It had two double beds and a shower only. It also had a fridge, safe and coffee maker, wifi and beach towels. Next time we would ask for a room with just one bed. It's great location made it easy to use theBus for getting around. One neat thing this hotel has is an area where guests could leave any beach gear they bought for the other guests to use when they checked out. Very aloha spirit. Definitely would choose this hotel again.

I have stayed at this hotel twice now and would stay there again. It is in an excellent location just across the road from Waikiki beach. The hotel is wonderfully clean and the staff are great. A popular restaurant is right downstairs and there are plenty more within easy walking distance. Also reasonable prices when compared with other properties in the same area

Warning. Major construction next to this hotel. Expect to first hear the prep work at 5am which includes clean up and the trucks going backwards with that safety beeping sound. We requested a quiet location so they put us in full view of the construction side. Partial cleanup starts 5am with garbage trucks with beeping backup sounds and some banging. Full construction starts 7am. The sliding glass door no longer has any insulation and rattles with the wind. I had to use newspapers to act as insulation when the sliding glass door does not fully close. On windy days the corridor of inside of hotel sounds like ur in a tent. The hotel is drafted to the outside like a motel. People rated this hotel high since is right on the beach. However the hotel has poor sound insulation. Forget sleeping in here. I hope you are an early riser. No resting at all form 5am to 7pm daily. In addition the doors are all metal. If someone closes there door it's like a slam. Shame on Aston for not telling quests about the construction. For the price of one day of the 25 amenity fee they could insulate one room.In addition the shower needs anti scalding. If you turn the handle to get hotter it just gets a bit warmer. Then it gets super scalding hot. The trick is to turn it all the way hot then lower it. Try not to burn your hand doing this. The valve needs to be replaced. This is a factual review with full videos I will be submitting to Aston.

This small hotel amongst Waikiki's high rises is in a great locstion and more affordable than neighboring hotels. splurge for an oceanfront room. It is worth it as Waikiki beach is what it is all bout and you can watch it all go on from your room. There is no pool or lobby, just a round building with bright airy rooms. Nice staff. hotel next door is double the price and set back further from the beach. would stay here again! Safe for single travelers.

This was one of the worst hotels we ever stayed at. The only good things I can say about this hotel is the location and the very helpful staff only on Saturday Dec. 16, the rest of the staff was not very helpful or friendly. The rooms are very small, the beds are uncomfortable, they don't have ice machines on each floor you have to go down to the front desk to get ice. There was not enough parking, so we had to park at different hotel a few blocks away, that only took cash. Their is a $25 a night resort fee, I am not sure what for? Also don't go to the "activities desk" to book any trips or transportation the staff their does not have your best interest at heart, they are selling overpriced trips and if you tell them no they will literally become hostile with you.

Stayed here one night after staying on the North Shore for two weeks. The hotel has an amazing view of the beach. We were on 9th floor. The room was quite good for cost and position. The staff were very nice and parking was right next to check in. There was a lot of noise from traffic as Kalakaua Ave is the main street on beach front. There was also a lot of noise from the park across the road. There was one homeless guy who whistled constantly and the rest of the squatters kept telling him to be quite. The hotel next door has renos going on so builders were there a 7am to start. Also there was inconsiderate people returning late at night banging doors and talking quite loud. I think if the hotel upgraded their windows/doors to double glazing it would help with the noise.d

We just arrived home from a week at the Circle!!! We loved it!!You are 2 minutes from your room to the very beautiful sandy beach with clean warm wonderful water....what more can you ask for!!!Yes the rooms are a little small but they are clean, comfortable and the views are absolutely amazing!!!!The hotel is small, friendly, has a great vibe and the customer service is second to nobody...You can grab a coffee at the McDonald’s right next door and be back in your room watching the sunrise and all the early morning surfers within 5 minutes.You are right in the middle of all the excitement in Waikiki surrounded by stores and places to eat...All I can say is that if you are looking for great great value in a simple, fun, clean, friendly hotel you could not look for a more wonderful place to spend a week in Waikiki than the Circle!!!Also a big thank you to the Goddess.....ask fir a room with an ocean view!!We miss you already!!!

When we go to Oahu, we always stay at the Circle Hotel. The prices are always low/reasonable, the staff is always nice/personable, and the rooms are always clean/modern. I remember one year we stayed there over christmas and they gifted each guest's room with beautiful Hawaiian scene painted on a porcelain round xmas tree ornament, which they put in a blue organza pouch and hung on our door to find xmas morning. It was so special and I still cherish it. Yes, the rooms are on the smaller side, but thats okay if you are just traveling with one other person or alone. The main reason we love this place is because of the lightening fast proximity to the beach and Kalakaua Ave. Get on the elevator and BOOM you're there...Love that there is ZERO drama going from our room to Waikiki beach in less than 5 mins. They have a small underground parking garage, so if you do rent a car, its super easy access to get in and out with ease.

Second Time staying here for New Years Celebration and the hotel is in a great spot for people watching, taking in the beautiful views of the beach with all the action of surfers trying to catch a wave, paddleboarders, colorful beach umbrellas, the beach waves, bright colored innertube swimmers and hearing the sounds of the waves. The room itself is small, but it is well equipped with 2 comfortable doubles with 3 pillows, coffee maker, refrigerator, fresh daily towels and room service, Tropic Sun shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and soaps. Balcony overlooks the street, which can get noisy, but it was New Years Eve. Although not directly on the beach, your view is not blocked by any buildings in front of you, just beautiful beach views with palm trees waving in the breeze; the beach awaits right across the street, 100 feet away. Our room came with parking place at the hotel, if there isn’t room for your car, you can park at their sister hotel Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel 2 blocks away. There is a restaurant at the ground level called Eggs & Things that always has a line of people waiting to eat there. This place can’t be beat if you want to soak up the sun Waikiki Style. $22/day parking fee and $20/day amenities fee, which includes WiFi, beach towels, movie rentals and gaming console for the kids.

Have stayed here several times over the years - have also rented houses on the island, stayed very upmarket, but keep coming back to the Circle. Had been on Maui and just had a couple of nights here before returning home. Had a partial ocean view - was on the side with construction work going on, noise was not a problem as we were out all day and still a beautiful view and always a sunset to remember. Has been updated since our last visit and hopefully the next lot of work will include the noisy air con. Only downer was the girl came to service the room at 8am, I was on holiday and still in bed, not a sleep but hello, not up either. She said she'd be back but wasn't serviced that day. I can live with that. Reception always happy with towels, ice etc. Value for money if your not needing the resort/pool type accommodation. I'm sure it wont be the last visit.

We have always loved this small hotel located directly across from Duke Kahanamoku statue a central area of Waikiki. The views are fantastic and unobstructed. The rooms are small but fit two queen size beds comfortably and met our needs. We spent most of the time there on the deck watching the surfers and the sunsets. You exit the elevators get your towels from the front desk and cross the street to the beach. If you want a mega resort this is not the hotel for you. If you like things simple but functional with helpful staff and ambiance plus this hotel is great. By the way those innertubes and boogie boards that are in slots by the driveway are left for new guests from the leaving guests. Just a fun place to be.

I have stayed at the Waikiki circle 3 times and loved it each tim. The location is great, we had a ocean front and request a higher level. Value for money, the hotel is a bit of an odd shape for bedroom/space if you have more than 2 pieces of large luggage but plenty of drawers and hangar space to unpack

Booked an oceanfront view room and was initially put in one on the side which was still an oceanfront room but also had views of the neighbouring buildings. Requested to be put in a center oceanfront room but unfortunately only on my last night and the view was amazing. It had just enough space for us, staff were nice and bed was comfortable. Close to everything and also had a balcony. Im definitely coming back

Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: For many years we've stayed at this older hotel and once again had a perfect 3 week vacation - the secret is to stay above the 4th floor (street is noisy) and in one of the 3 Front facing rooms. The view is unbeatable. The staff have been there for years - and feel like old friends and are one of the reasons we keep going back.

We just got home from our 9 night stay at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel and could not be happier with our choice of hotels. Unless you are staying at the Royal Hawaiian or the Moana Surfrider (at 2 to 3 times the cost of the Circle) you cannot get a better location. Out the door across the street and you are on the beach in less than a minute. The staff were very friendly and helpful always smiling and cheery. We found we had plenty of space in the room, which was clean, comfortable and colorful. The room we had did not have a tub, which is of no concern to us but it may be to someone else. As well, there is no pool on site, but no need for one with the ocean so close!!. I would recommend getting a room with the full ocean view on a floor as high up as possible as Waikiki is noisy all night long, no matter what hotel you stay in. Spring for the full ocean view if you can afford it, there is nothing better than waking up to the waves hitting the beach.

I liked the convenience, the view and the staff so much... I came back again! A perfect stay from start to finish, this lovely little boutique hotel is the best. It reminds me of little Italian coastal hotels. Yes, it's busy by there. Yes, if you have a balcony too low to the street it's somewhat noisy. If you want to walk through a 200' lobby and be treated like you are a celebrity, this is not for you. If you are higher up, you can't beat the beach and ocean view. Very clean and cute still, so convenient to just drop out of the elevator onto the "strip" Kalakaua Ave. which is center to everything. The parking is right there, small, private and easily accessible. The staff was always smiling and joking with us, down to the room service personnel, they are happy and genuine. Special shout out to my fun and sweet "Goddess" at the front desk, she rocks!

We stayed two days in Honolulu as part of a round the world trip. Choosing a hotel on Waikiki Beach from afar isn't easy, but dwarfed by all Lego brick like hotels towering over a relatively overcrowded small beach, we found a quaint round hotel, "The Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel," overlooking the beach.We booked a room with "Ocean View," and well, there was a view of the beach and ocean, but the noisy construction of a neighbouring high rise building had certainly limited the view, meaning that it ought to be re-classified as a room with a partial ocean view. A suggestion that wasn't well received.To be sure of having an unobstructed view, book an ocean front view room.Apart from that the room was actually quite nice with a pleasant colour scheme.At the entrance one finds "Eggs 'n Things." Each morning with a long line of people outside waiting to be seated, but only a short walk away we found a "Cheeseburgers in Paradise" which can be recommended for breakfast. Looking at massive buildings surrounding "The Waikiki Circle" one wonders when it will be replaced by a new Lego brick hotel.

I chose this hotel because it was a great location and when I booked it, it was $170/night. This does NOT include the $20/day amenity fee and $22 for parking. Checking in: If you have a car, pull up onto the left ramp to check in first. Then they will give you a ticket to put on your dash and a remote for the underground parking. There is limited parking and if you don't get one, there is a sister hotel you can park at down the street.During my stay here, there was a filming production at Eggs N Things so we couldn't use our 10% off coupon. They hand out beach towels for free and you're welcome to use the inner tubes and boogie boards free of charge.Room: We had the partial ocean view room. The view was beautiful however the room is a bit dated. We were placed in a handicap room. Upon entering, there was a strong smell of cleaning products. I had to leave the sliding glass door wide open for a couple hours to air out the room. It's a bit dark - I feel they could use some brighter lights in the room There's a safe, mini fridge and shampoo and lotion.Bed was a little to soft for our liking. Air conditioning is a little old so it's loud but it does the job. Overall, this is an okay hotel. I would think with the price and the added $20 amenity fee, there would be a hot tub or swimming pool.

My husband & I stayed at this small hotel for 3 nights. We were very happy with it. We were not looking for a resort with a pool and fancy lobby, as we planned to sight see in Honolulu mostly. This was a great fit for us, directly across from Waikiki Beach. We spent an extra few dollars when we checked in and got a balcony with ocean views. The higher floors are the best. The room was small as well as the bathroom, but all very nice, comfortable bed, and wonderful views. The location was perfect for walking across to the beach, and only a few blocks to the downtown area, historic hotels, shops and restaurants.We scheduled a tour of the island just off the lobby, and picked us up around the corner. We would stay here again as a very nice , convenient small hotel with a great location in Honolulu.

Gorgeous views of Wakiki beach (from an ocean front room). Upper floors have less street noise. Beautiful views of the morning surfers, sailboats, evening sunset and the night lights along Wakiki. Just step across the road and you are right on Wakiki beach. It doesn't get any easier or more convienent than this. An ABC store next door with very reasonable prices, almost as reasonable as Walmart, for food, drinks, beer & wine, souvenirs, health and beauty items. A McDonalds is also next door for inexpensive coffee, light meal. They were filming a movie at the Eggs N Things restaurant at the base of the hotel, the week we were there. Evidently this restaurant is quite famous. About the hotel itself. It is probably one of the oldest, smallest hotels on Wakiki beach. But it has been renovated and is immaculately clean. This is a no frills hotel, but it is also the most reasonably priced hotel on Wakiki. The shower is tiny, but clean. Our room was small, but manageable and well worth the view every day! The mattresses were a bit too soft for my taste, but that is really my only complaint. There is no pool, cable tv or laundry. But you can use the smart flat screen tv to cast shows and they have a DVD rental by the elevator. Who spends much time watching tv on Wakiki beach anyway?We stayed seven nights. Our first day, we met a man on the elevator that told us that he and his wife have stayed every year at this hotel for their vacation - for 21 years. He said you can't be the price, the views and the location. That says a lot. This couple have been coming here for 21 years and are still satisfied customers.

Friendly, helpful staff. Really clean and well kept. Definately recommend! We didn't want to leave. And we will be back as soon as we can! Off home to Sweden and cold and snow. Aloha and mahalo nui loa!❤

Older hotel, small, but location location, location. Rooms quite clean and tasteful. Oceanfront rooms and balcony cannot beat the view. Staff very friendly and helpful. Right close to everything. Have stayed here before and will definitely come back again

its just a small hotel compared to everything around it, but the staff where fantastic, very helpful. when we arrived i was not happy with my room (position) so i asked to be moved if possible and they arranged it within the hour, no questions asked. we ended up with a room with a beautiful view overlooking the ocean, (cost us $20 per night extra but that was reduced from $30 because of the inconvenience but well worth it). there is coffee making facilities and a bar fridge and the rooms were quite clean and comfortable. it is situated in the heart of Waikiki beach so you can walk to everything including the zoo and places like the cheesecake factory and Ross's department store. there is a restaurant attached to it that does breakfast through to dinner, it must have been nice because it always had a line going down the road, we didn't eat there because of the wait. the desk staff where very helpful and friendly as was the lady that arranges the tours. she knows everything about everything and happy to to have a chat.... wifi was free and good.

Location Location! Normally when travelling to Hawaii we as a family stay at the Banyan which cater for a family of 5 superbly, as this was our first trip since my retirement and with no kids we decided to splurge and have an ocean front room. The reception desk staff were polite, helpful and very welcoming they also allowed us into our room a little earlierthan scheduled. The room was on the 13th level which we had a bit of a laugh about (no number 13 bad luck for us on the holiday) moving on, the room was an adequate size for a couple and maybe a young family the view was to die for all the rooms I believe have been refurbished which give the a nice fresh feel with a nice decor selection if I was to have any negativity it would shower size but in saying that I am 183 cm tall and 110 kg's so for the average size person they will be fine. The hotel doesn't have any laundry facility other than sending your washing out we found a coin operated laundry in Kuhio Ave adjacent to the food pantry. There is a tour desk down in the reception area and remember to show your room card at eggs & things for a small discount. Overall we would not hesitate to go back to the Aston Waikiki Circle it was a great memorable place to stay

We stayed for 4 nights at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel, as two couples with separate rooms, and we couldn't be happier with our experience, and especially for the price point.Right from check in - which, thankfully, was available nice and early for our morning international flight arrival time - the staff were warm and helpful.The location is perfect - next door to cheap, family friendly food options, and just across the road from beautiful Waikiki Beach only steps away. Although the hotel doesn't technically offer direct beach access, the beach is just as close as it is for other hotels in the area that boast that they are on the beach.The rooms aren't huge but they aren't tiny, either. There's enough room to sleep and store bags comfortably. Each room has two double beds, an in room safe, coffee machine, balcony, and bar fridge. Hopefully, you won't be spending a long time in the room anyway with so much to see and do.The only suggestions we can make for what was a very pleasant stay are for management to consider having microwaves in each room so guests can cut down prices in an expensive town and cook for themselves, and perhaps for a dimmer hallway light overnight as light streams through the cracks in the door at night.All things considered, we loved our stay and will definitely be back!

Agree with all the review. The location definately is the best. I got the ocean view room and the although not as great as oceanfront room but good enough. Room was nice. Parking was at USD22. McD was next door and ABC stores was everywhere. Waikiki beach was just infront of the hotel. I was happy with my choice.

We chose Waikiki Circle based on other reviews and on the great rate available for this outstanding location. We were very happy with our choice and strongly recommend this hotel. We arrived early and were offered an upgrade to a half view room. It was certainly worth the extra $10/night for a wonderful view of Waikiki. As well, the other room had only a partial view and lots of construction around the hotel detracted from what little view there was. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The resort fee of $20/night is typical of Waikiki and we were ok with that as the staff and service were very good. Internet was fast, beach towels always available and ice happily provby the front desk day and night. Many of the older hotels along Waikiki are disappearing and we hope the Waikiki Circle is still around for our next visit.

I don't care what others say - to me, this is one of my favorite hotels in the world. Yes, the room may be smaller, but THE VIEW THOUGH. There is absolutely NOTHING obstructing your view when you have the oceanfront room on a high floor. You can watch the sunrise and sunset and let the ocean therapy vibe take you in. And when you feel like taking a dip in the ocean at any time during the day, all you have to do is walk across the street. The location is very convenient, the ABC store is right next to the hotel where you can get water, food, snacks, all the necessities. To me this place beats any other place I've stayed at in Maui, especially for the low price- you can get the best oceanfront room that's at half of what it would cost on Maui Kaanapali area. You can pretty much walk anywhere from this location...it's right in the middle of the Waikiki strip so not far away from anything. I've stayed at other places on Waikiki and this place is still my favorite. I've found Hyatt Place to be too far from the action/beach access and Park Shore to be also too far from convenient food places. This place though, the small and beautiful Waikiki Circle hotel has EVERYTHING. I can't wait to go back!

If you are looking for a "resort experience" then this place is probably not the place for you. We loved it. Initially booked an ocean view we decided to upgrade to an ocean front once the lovely staff member took us up and showed us both rooms. We are glad we did. If you can - book ocean front. Views are stunning and whilst we were not in our room much it was so wonderful to relax and take in the view in the morning and evening before heading out again. Yes, bathroom small however we had been on the cruise of the islands so used to it and really you are just showering! Plenty of space to put things with the suitcases under the bed. Beds were comfy and whilst the air con was on the loud side it worked and also kept the street noise to a minimum for night sleeping - kinda like white noise so didn't bother us at all. All staff without exception were welcoming and helpful and room was always made up and nice to return to at the end of long hot days. Perfect position being across the road from lovely beaches and a short walk up the quieter end of town with zoo and parks and trees. We stayed for six nights. Our first two nights before the cruise was in a more spacious place but a ten minute walk to the beach - would take the circle over that in an instant. Yes - there is construction on both sides but as we were up and about most mornings except two it really didn't bother us. Having said that stay on the middle or left side facing the beach as it is the furthest from the work. Internet was fine for our purposes and worked well. My husband was able to conduct an online interview with no trouble. Value for money.

Nice place, but the smell/stench from the nabouring McDonald's is overvhvelming . We are on the 6th floor, Seaview, and the constant smell of oil-frying food - potatoes, garlic-shrimp etc. is not nice!Just saying ...

This hotel is very tired and dated. It's decor is still in the seventies and not in a good way. The bathroom was tiny, cramped and rusty. The balcony door was secured with a home made metal pin instead of the actual door lock. The air conditioner was ancient and loud. The housekeeping service was sporadic, either trying to come in at 8am or not making up the room at all! It is very noisy too, with not one but two construction sites, one on each side of the hotel. This was not disclosed at the time of booking and the construction was obviously well established. The actual hotel is located behind an Eggs and More Restaurant which always had a long line up, meaning not only did we never get to have a meal there but we had to walk up the steep driveway, pulling our heavy cases after 28 hours of travel, as the other entrance was filled with a queue for the restaurant. The check in area is actually outdoors, no smart hotel lobby here! There are no restaurant facilities, no pool, no bar, no kettle in the room (although there was a one cup coffee pod machine, but with paper cups!). On the positive side, the staff were polite and helpful, there is a reasonably informative tours desk, instead of a concierge, and it is right opposite the beach. (You do get beach towels) We paid nearly US$250 per night, so it is not really budget accommodation.

Great value hotel. Appreciably less expensive than others on the Waikiki strip. My young son and I were on a father and son surf trip and the location, directly across from the beach (Queens/Canoes), was great. For those renting surf boards KOA Boards (whom we rented from) and another couple of surf rental shops are all only 200 or so metres away in the street behind the main strip and so very convenient. We booked an Ocean Front room and the view was great. Spend the little extra to get the Ocean Front rooms if you can. You will appreciate the views. Your overall hotel cost savings by comparison to neighbouring hotels will still leave you in front. No swimming pool or conventional hotel amenities. Really basic hotel and in that regard you get what you pay for. It was, however, clean and convenient and the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. When my wife and youngest son joined us in the second week of the vacation, we had to upscale a little and so moved down to the Outrigger Reef Waikiki. We had always planned to do so and so no further reflection on the Aston Circle. WiFi is included with the room cost. Cannot comment on Eggs and Things (the restaurant at the bottom of the hotel albeit I glean not directly related to the hotel) as there was always 20-30 people in line to get in. Life is too short to line up for bacon and eggs. Prefer to spend that time in the surf. Aloha

Screaming view at the most affordable price. Built in the 1940’s it is dated with no perks other than location and the most amazing views! Special hope it never follows the trend in Waikiki and gets torn down for profit A true treasure!

This is a no frills place. No swimming pool, no fancy check in desk, no cookies. But, it is clean and just the place to be in Waikiki. The view from the room was great. It is right across the street from the beach.The room was adequate, bathroom had all the amenities needed. They had coffee cups or tea bags.The best was the free towels and beach toys. There are bogie boards, sand chairs and even tubes to float in outside just waiting to be used.It is walking distance to most restaurants and stores. They have a events person on site to plan for any outings.

We had to change our travel plans due to the hurricanes. This hotel was recommended by a friend. If you want someplace clean and don't care that you don't get breakfast. It is an older hotel but it was clean and the staff was friendly. It is right across the street from Waikiki beach and if you get a partial or ocean view room the view is great. They do charge like other hotels $20 a day for wifi and other things. Parking is very limited and they charge (again like all the other hotels.)

This was a 25th anniversary stay. The hotel was nice. The staff was friendly and helpful. If your looking for a clean place to stay and do not care if the room is lavish and large, this is your place. It is basically in the middle of Waikiki beach so you can walk ti about everything. We did nit have a car so I cannot speak about the parking.
user_name:
Harvey S
Kirksville, Missouri, United States

review_body: Got a very good deal on this hotel using Delta Vacations. Good size TV, fast internet, Cold A/C, but a little loud (had to use ear plugs to sleep). My room was partial ocean view, view from the balcony (not the room) was excellent. Room was rather small, particularly restroom and shower. Location was the best. Overall would recommend.

Good rooms with a view of Waikiki beach as well as diamond head. Wonderful location right accruals the street from the beach. Loved the proximity to the ocean as well as the convenience of being close to restaurants and shops. Good place to go if you have kids.

My daughter & I stayed there for 4 nights during our visit to Hawii. The rooms are nice but small. That was ok for just the 2 of us. Especially since we were there to do as much as we could & not spend time in the Hotel. We had a room on the side of the Hotel which has a view of a Hotel next to us and a parking garage. Again that was fine because we were there to do as much as we could and that wasn't spend time in the room. It was a great location on the main strip and right across from the beach. It was also very nicely located to the bus stops which we used to get around allot. There is a McDonald's right next to it. There a a restaurant that is connected to it you get a 10% discount if you eat there while staying at the Hotel. The Zoo is in walking distance from the Hotel. So those are all great things and were very helpful to our stay. But, the staff isn't very knowable. My first night there I brought my itinerary down to the desk and asked if the things I wanted to do i the next few days were within the bus root or would I have to call and Uber to go where I wanted to go. The gentleman didn't really know how far some of the things were from the Hotel. Nor did he know information about the buses or bus roots. I wound up having the cal the bus station & get all of my roots mapped out with them. He also informed me to come down in the morning and talk to their travel desk. So I did an the lady was very rude. I asked her if she could help me same question I asked the man at the desk the night before. She didn't want to help me or answer my questions. She was too interested in trying to sell me tours. I told her I had my 4 days mapped out and everything I was planning on doing was already pre purchased and after I said that she didn't want to help e anymore with anything. So though the Hotel was nice, conveniently located the staff was to be desired. If I visit Hawaii again I would stay there again, but defiantly wouldn't have much interaction with the staff there.

We are returning guests and the reason being that you can't beat value for money in the heart of Waikiki. The staff are super helpful and ensure that your stay is the best it can be. The rooms are super clean and comfortable. A special mention to Kamaki (Skittles) and Naomi ( Goddess) for your continued help and advice during our recent stay with you and for all the laughs. This hotel has the best views of Waikiki Beach and being in the heart of Waikiki everything is in walking distance. We do recommend you take a drive up to the North Shore where the coast meets the mountains. The views are spectacular.

This is a great hotel located in the hustle and bustle Kalakaua Avenue. Perfect for enjoying Waikiki Beach in the day and Waikiki nightlife in the evening. The staff are friendly and very accommodating. They provide you with beach towels, and there are straw mats, floats, beach chairs, and boogie boards that you can borrow for the day.The rooms are small but have a good closet space and little desk and fridge area that is a bit separated from the beds. They have a keurig in each room and provide you with as much complimentary coffee and tea as you want. One thing I wish had been different is there is no ice machine, so you have to ask the front desk each time you need an ice bucket. The rooms are very clean and the whole place has a bright ambiance. The hotel is good for people traveling with children. The restaurant at the base, Eggs N Things, gives a 10 percent discount to those staying at the hotel. There is a small parking lot, and if it is filled you can park your car in an alternate lot about two blocks away. The Aston Circle is a great hotel in a prime location that won't break the bank!

A great value very clean and the rooms are big enough for 4 people adults is across the street from the public beach at Waikiki near lots of restaurants and shops they also have parking for 20 a day on property there is a charge of 20 per night to use there beach equipment and towels a very nice experience a great value in Waikiki

This is our third visit to the Circle. It has such a fantastic outlook over Waikiki beach, the rooms are always immaculately cleaned. Staff are friendly and helpful. For the price and location I cannot fault this hotel.

Stayed two nights August 3-5, 2017 Hotel has parking underneath easy in & out access. Checking in at the hotel was great, I had booked on hotel.com after researching for the best deals. The ocean view room was breathtaking, I was super happy that it mirrored the picture on the website. The mini bar fridge worked great for us. The air conditioner did it's job just abit noisy which was no issue for our stay. Room is small but you don't even notice. The balcony, view, & location! Is Winning! We definitely enjoyed our stay. Our neighbors on the left Macdonald's & on the right abc store (my favorite). Across the road the beach & 150m walk down from the hotel is Duke Kahanamoku Statue. The staff from front office & house keeping were always friendly always greeting us which also contributed to our stay. Thank you Ashton Waikiki circle hotel, for making our trip amazing I will definitely recommend this place! Aloha

Restaurants, bars,shopping, beach, it's all steps away! The rooms are small but recently renovated. If you get oceanfront there is no better view in Waikiki. You will want to be above the fifth floor for best views. We have stayed there several times. Sometimes for a few days and for as long as a couple of weeks. Staff are friendly and helpful. Parking is limited, it's a small underground garage.

I chose Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel for its ideal location on Waikiki Beach, and it delivered as expected. Both my Mother and I loved its location, all you need to do is cross a two-lane street to be on the beach. You are also within close proximity of tons of shopping, restaurants, and other hotels on Waikiki Beach.The hotel does not have a conventional-type lobby, and check-in is on street level, literally. Our check-in was expeditious, and they even gifted us a box of chocolate-covered macadamias.Our room was pretty small, but functional. Both the room and bathroom were very clean. Our balcony provided views of the ocean and was a delight. The air-conditioning kept the room crisply cold. While this hotel is not the lap of luxury, it functionally delivers everything you need for comfort, even offering a free movie rental service, which we ended up not using. Our room had a safe, which is essential, especially when you are at a beach. There was also a coffee/tea maker in the room. Beach towels are easily available from the reception desk, we were also provided with complimentary beach chairs, which you have to carry to the beach yourself. Check-out was prompt, and they called a taxi to take us to the airport. You were able to get by without a rental car, given the hotel's central location in Honolulu. You might need to rent a car, though, if you intend on exploring Oahu beyond Honolulu.I was happy with this hotel selection, would stay here again, and am happy to recommend it to others.

We stayed for 10 days at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel. We loved the location of the hotel right across the road from "The Duke" and fabulous Waikiki Beach. The hotel provides all that you need for the beach including chairs, towels, boards and even blow up floaties. The hotel was clean and the staff were welcoming and efficient. The hotel itself however is totally retro and felt old and tired. It needs a major refurb and it would be absolutely perfect. At the front of the hotel is a restaurant called "Eggs and Things". We were offered a 10% discount as guests of the hotel however we never actually got to eat there as there was a constant line queuing for hours. We ate elsewhere.

I booked initially through AMOMA thinking that it was the cheapest of all. Only stupid mistake that I made was..... It was not Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel which was higher end class hotel. No wonder it was so cheap.Well Circle Hotel was very very old, small, no gym, no pool, no etc. I do not have any complain about the staff. After all, it was my mistake.... However, with that price range, I would recommend Ohana East or Pacific Beach Hotel. Pacific Beach Hotel is in the middle of renovation that they may offer their rooms cheaper for now. they may increase after it's done.Hey, Location was the best thing. I did not go to the beach because it was more of a biz trip than vacation. So, if you want the Beach and cheap hotel here it is!!!!
user_name:
hajibroke
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for three nights. The location of the hotel could not be better, it is directly on Waikiki beach. We had an ocean view room and the view from the balcony was really spectacular. In the morning we went to Starbucks or the ABC shop nearby, bought coffee and breakfast end enjoyed it on the balcony, watching the surfers, the beach, the ocean - just great!Staff at reception were friendly, checking in and checking out was fast, without any issues. There is a (small) parking garage underneath the hotel, which we used. You can pick up beach towels at reception. Many shops and restaurants are close by.The rooms were clean, friendly and well equipped, but relatively small and could use a bit of renovation. It is clear that this is one of the older hotels on Waikiki. It can be noisy on the road along the beach in the evening. I did not mind, but if you you are easily disturbed by noise, you might want to go for a room at the backside of the hotel - but then you would miss the view. The aircondition was rather noisy as well, by the way.In summary, we really enjoyed our stay here.

Location is great -very central, however the rooms are very small and the beds are only double bed size - NOT queen as stated and the bathroom is very tiny. We paid for a beach view and were on the side of the hotel so only had a one way beach view.

This hotel is not a 5 star and doesn't claim to be. It is, however, clean, comfortable, in a great location (the beach is across the road), friendly and helpful staff and has well appointed rooms. We didn't have a kitchen and didn't ask for one. We did have a fridge and tea/coffee facilities. We will stay here again. (I can't recall if the wifi was free or not but do remember that we didn't have any trouble with it).

We actually stayed in August 2015 so this is a late review. The Hotel is in the perfect location, directly across from the beach and on Kalakaua Ave. We stayed in a ocean view room and the view was just incredible, we could see Waikiki Beach for miles and loved sitting on the balcony having a snack and watching the ocean. The room itself has two double beds and is nicely decorated with a ocean theme, there is however no swimming pool. The hotel building itself is quite old and not super modern but it was nice enough and the staff were lovely. It is very pricey considering it is not a resort, however all accommodation in Hawaii is expensive so can't fault them on that. Would definitely stay here again!

From reading previous reviews, we knew the room were on the small side but the location was great and who spends a lot of time in a hotel when visiting a Hawaii. Across the street from Waikiki beach, near lots of restaurants, trollley, and beach activities.

The location is amazing, the rooms are very small - since the hotel is round (why named Circle) the rooms are triangle shaped. So not for a family with a lot of luggage as we had.Most of the staff were very help some. And if your kids like pancakes - Eggs'n Things were located in the same building. If you have a rental car - they do have a garage - but don't expect it to be available. We had to park in a public parking 4 blocks away for the first day.We ordered a room with partial ocean view - and looked right into a wall where were builders all day from around 8AM. So ocean view is to prefer. They had wifi and it came with the extra cost of 20 USD a day for a resort fee witch included morning paper, beach towel, wifi and they "filled up" you coffee quote in the evening (for us 3 pods a day)

Updated rooms, comfortable beds, clean, well maintained hotel. Across the street from the beach, but so close to the beach that it might as well be beachfront. Hotel offers beach towels, and a free DVD kiosk. I tested Wifi speeds to be 14 Mbps. Rooms have a small fridge, coffee makers, desk area, plenty of closet space, with shelving. Window air conditioner has plenty of capacity to keep room cool, even on the sunny side of building. Parking is limited; if overflow, they have a nearby hotel with more parking. Hotel is between a McDonald's, and an ABC store. Staff is very friendly and attentive.

Stayed 13 nights in June. The location of the hotel is great, beach food and shopping all at your doorstep. Not the biggest or flashiest hotel, but really cool retro vibe. The rooms are smallish but well layed out, everything you need is there. The view from our balcony, room 1404, was super impressive. Finally, the staff we dealt with were top notch. very friendly, helpful and happy.

This place was great! Friendly staff, amazing on site restaurant, and right across from the beach. Will make a point of using this hotel for our next vacation. Location is on the main street so it is very easy to catch the city bus or set a pick up for shuttles. Near shopping and sights.

We had a great stay in July 2017. The staff are super friendly and the rooms are very clean and has everything you need. The location is the best part. It is literally across the road from the beach and walking distance to shops, cafes and restaurants. Would stay again next time!

We only used the room for a few hours while waiting for our redeye flight back to Phoenix. Although the building seemed dated, it is near shopping, and right across the street from the beach. The room was small but clean and had it's own AC unit. There was a partial view of the ocean from our balcony. The parking garage was very strange in that it was small and circular. It also did not seem to have very many spaces, but we were fortunate enough to get one. All in all it was a great choice for our purpose.

Myself, husband, 7 year old boy and 9 month old daughter stayed here for 5 nights.Pros:- Location to the beach is second to none. Literally across the road.- The staff are Uber friendly- Cost wise it is pretty good bang for buck.- DVD now. This is a free DVD and ps3 game rental facility and is awesome if you just want to chill.- Free rental of boogie boards and blow up rings- ABC store located right outsideNow the cons: - The rooms are tiny. Maybe OK for a couple or a family of 3 (older child) but they are far too small for anymore than that.- I would not suggest staying here with baby's reliant on formula/ baby food. There are no in room facilities to warm these up (I had a bottle warmer but it was a pain)- Balconys seem a bit dodge and it is incredibly windy on them.- Walls are paper thin. You can hear your neighbors and they can hear you.- The building is very old. Apparently it is newly renovated....it doesn't appear to be the case.- Bathrooms are tiny.So there are many pros and cons to the Aston Circle. Overall I had a pleasant enough stay. If we were to return minus children I would stay again but would rather fork out the money to stay elsewhere with children.

No onsite pool for $190 a night is too much when there are nicer newer hotels in the same place! Room was nice, beds very short. Tiny bathroom 3' x 4' - maybe. Shower was gross the drain was rusted. And you could barely, barely turn around in it. Just too high priced for the quality compared to the neighboring properties.

I really liked this little hotel. While the rooms are small, the location is awesome -- you're right across the street from Waikiki Beach and there aren't other buildings to block the view. They provide beach towels and have a rack of beach toys (I think left by other guests) you can borrow. The room was clean, had a refrigerator and coffee maker (keurig type). They offer parking for a fee ($22/day) and you park yourself right under the hotel. The only downer was the elevator doesn't go down to the garage level. The staff was super helpful and the price was great!

We booked a room directly overlooking the beach. Great sunrises and sunsets. I must say it is a convenient location with Eggs n Things downstairs (guests enjoy a discount). Bathroom on the tiny side but we were not too bothered. Very attentive housekeeping staff, and a request for a tea kettle was immediately fulfilled by the front desk.

I stayed here with my boyfriend for my birthday. We had a beautiful view of Kalakaua and the ocean. We reserved a room with two full size bedrooms. The beds were really stiff and the front desk assigned us to the worst room possible. It was directly next to the elevator. So we could hear all the noisy loud tourists talking in the morning.

This is not an expensive hotel, and for the money it was pretty good. The view from our room over Waikaki was just beautiful. However, the daily amenities charge us US $20+ was a surprise to our prepaid deal and not particularly good value for money. Most of the services included in this charge were free in every other hotel we've stayed in on this trip and there wasn't any way to make a cup of tea. And, the shower was very squeezy.

We stayed only 2 nights in this hotel but i can recommend it. Its located just in front of the waikiki beach where u can find a lot of shops and restaurants. The beds was very comfortable the room was clean. You can see that the hotel is quite old but still it was very nice. the air condition is quite noisy and the bathroom is small but still recommend it.
user_name:
malgorzatar549
New York City, New York

review_body: At the recommendation of my Travel Agent we booked 10 days at the Aston WaikikiCircle Hotel.We arrived fairly late and though the shuttle dropped us off at the right address, we had trouble finding the entrance. We had been told that the hotel had a recent update and a beautiful lobby.The sign indicating that we were at the right spot was unlit, dirty with plant growth and the lobby was a small room attached to the hotel that looked like they were renting surf boards.When we arrived at our room we both were gain disappointed since for the price paid we had expected a whole lot more. The main room was odd shaped and so the bed were closer together at the head. The bathroom was very small with dirty grouting in the shower. The balcony door latch was broken and replaced by a common hook. I put my expensive dive gear into a safe that was in a clothe cupboard designed for one. The safe stopped worked after three openings and the Manager, the only one who could oder the opening of the safe, had gone home and would not be back until the next morning too late for me to get my dive gear out. The location was very nice, close to the beach and a variety of restaurants. But my son was very disappointed and so was I. I made the mistake of showing him another hotel for the same price which increased his disappointment very much..

The hotel is very old but with a nice view of Waikiki beach just in front of the hotel. The room is very small and also the shower. There is only one elevator and can only accommodate few people at a time. Parking fee is $22/day and resort fee $20/day.Extra $10 charge per day for partial ocean view.

We have just had 4 nights at this hotel. We were seeking value for money in a good, clean hotel in a great location. It ticked all our boxes. We got an upgrade for $20 per night from partial beach view to full beach view - glad we did - sitting on 11th floor balcony in cool of evening overlooking length of Waikiki Beach was fantastic experience.Good travel agent on ground floor who tee'd us up with all the activities we wanted to do.Eggs n Things restaurant looked good (regular queue outside), but didn't use it.No big hotel feel with lavish lobby etc, but who cares if you just want good clean room in great location?!. Reception was quick, efficient and friendly.Settling up the night before early departure was no problem.Room was small - but who cares with that view!. Room was clean and well made up each day.Shower was good.Room safe was part of daily charge for 'amenities' - safe, dvd's, wifi etc.I think car space can be had in hotel if needed.All round great value hotel option especially if visiting Waikiki for first time - beach in front and all shops & restaurants you could possibly want within 5 mins walk.We will definitely stay here again and have already recommended to friends ........

I'm sitting here dreaming of Hawaii as I write this review. My husband and I stayed in the Aston Circle Hotel for 4 nights in May. This is a perfect little affordable hotel for those that want to be right across the street from the beach. The location is perfect, right in the heart of Waikiki, with everything at your fingertips. The beach is literally across the street; in less than 5 mins you can be in the beautiful water. There are so many restaurants within walking distance. The very popular Eggs N Things is downstairs, be prepared to wait online even at 7am. McDonalds is right next door if you wanted to opt for a more economical brekkie. There is an ABC store right next to the hotel (I am now addicted to this store). The hotel itself is a fairly basic hotel, but has all that you need. The staff was extremely welcoming and friendly (John and Naomi aka The Goddess). There are no facilities such as a pool or restaurant but who needs a pool when the ocean is right there. You can avail of beach equipment such as boogie boards, snorkels and chairs. I would advise taking them when you see them and not wait as they go very quickly. We took 2 boogie boards the night before we drove up to the North Shore for the day. They said just make sure you bring them back. The hotel offers beach towels also, and you can just drop them in a basket at the end of the day and get clean ones the next day. I had initially booked an ocean view room as it was what my budget would allow, the view was beautiful facing Diamond Head. On the second day we asked if there were any ocean front rooms available, there was so we upgraded for the final 2 days for $30 a day. I think we could have gotten it for a little cheaper had we asked. Room 1105 was dead center with the most amazing view. While ocean view is quiet sufficient, if you can afford it I would pick oceanfront (all depends on how much it means to you though, for us it meant a lot). The rooms are basic but nice, has a coffee maker, fridge and a gaming system (cannot remember what it was). A lovely touch is getting a free newspaper at your door every morning. We rented a car for 2 days (which I would recommend to be able to explore the rest of the island). There is parking underneath the hotel which costs $22 a day, the parking lot has limited spaces so make sure you check with the hotel as soon as you get the car. You will be guaranteed a spot for as long as you need it (they give you a little key fob). There is literally no parking in Waikiki, so this is pretty much the best option. The hotel is circular which is really neat and different. I would recommend this hotel if you don't need all the frills a fancy hotel has to offer. I would definitely stay here again.

Thank you Aston Waikiki Circle for another great stay! Appreciate the new type coffee/tea maker in the room, and love getting the paper in the morning to read on the lanai during daybreak. Front desk and staff were friendly as usual. Rooms haven't grown any since our last stay but very cozy. Weather perfect this time of year, and water and waves made for a lot of fun beach time. Hope to return next year.

Quiet and very clean basic hotel No frills, very comfortable and convenient.Easy access.Free parking.Next to Aston Tower where family was booked.Highly recommended.Lend towels to use in the beach.Cool

We have returned after 8 years and still not disappointed. The hotel is small and friendly. Rooms are clean and beds very comfortable. It has the best location and views. We are very happy to be back.

I love that hotel!!!!! The view is spectacular, the staff is outstanding and the price is right! Love love love it❤️Say Aloha to John!, Chip, they are the best!!!!!!!!! Very centrally located in obstructive view of the ocean, great restaurants with in steps. Rooms are small but perfect. Bright and clean

This is an old looking hotel. Rooms are relatively small but we had 4 in one room. Not sure if any other rooms were bigger. The view was great, it was right opposite Waikiki beach. It was very clean and so close to everything. The staff were great and no complaints at all really and very reasonably priced. Walked to the zoo and walked to the shops many times a day. Free DVD hire. Well worth it and would recommend it :)

Just got here today! Weather 82, slight breeze, great sunny sky!  Ocean front room on the high floors is the way to go. This place is awesome. I'm over 6'5 and all thou on small side it's perfect! In every way, u can't beat the views just amazing and it's actually a little closer to the beach(because of the way the beach curves around) than others nearby.  Two queens which is fine we r using one as a 2nd closet and tv watching area, flat screen tv, PlayStation, free DVD rentals, 10% off egg n things downstairs. There is a small fridge, decent closet , neat and actually decent bathroom with shower I thought it would be smaller. Clean very clean and every1 here is super nice. We checked in at noon with no line and took all of 45 seconds.  Again this place by FAR is the best deal in town, they will beat any other advertised price online.  Seriously we stayed at the Marriott Waikiki two years ago, paid double and it wasn't half the coolness of this place.  I will attach some pics of the views, are u kidding me, now if u drive a Bentley u prob won't like this place, no pool(uhh the pacific is actually 20 yards across street) no bell hops or event coordinators. But for the other 98% of the world this rocks!!!!! No complaints and if there were I would tell ya!  Oh and plenty of sockets for charging everything, a in closet safe, AC, a nice patio with table and two chairs, obviously Cable and wifi, again very clean!  Look into it I will recommend it to every 1!

Firstly, this is an old hotel. This means that it does not have the grand foyers and some amenities that one associates with the modern offerings, such as included restaurants and bars and better sound proofing. Having said that, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.The location is brilliant - directly across from the beach with great views up and down the coast. It is walking distance to may local restaurants, the zoo and local shopping. The bus stop is directly across the road so access to most areas is easily obtained.The rooms were small, but extremely clean and the bed/pillows enabled a great sleep (something some more modern hotels still cannot provide).Breakfast is available just outside the front door at Eggs & Things and is good value (discount for hotel patrons).We also found the staff to be excellent. While our interaction was small their friendliness and ability to communicate but not impose was commendable - special mention to Sean and John.There was some street noise on the lower floors.Would we stay here again? - We certainly would - great location, good value, great views .... what more could we want?

cute & clean & convenient! we walked to the zoo. we borrowed 2 beach chairs & a floatie & simply walked across the road to a lovely beach. the underground parking was free with the kamaaina rate. we enjoyed all of our interactions with the staff & would stay there again

The hotel is unique in that it is round. That said, the rooms are pie shaped. Very small. There is only room to put the suitcase on the bed to use it. That said, the room was clean. Initially, I had a "partial ocean view". Upgraded to ocean view, thinking it would be direct. But the rooms at the front I later learned were classified, .ocean front".

We stayed here because we needed to be in close proximity to the beach, restaurants, etc. The rooms were very small but the views were fabulous if you had an ocean view. We went at Christmas time so the rooms were very expensive for what you get. The staff was extremely accommodating and we appreciated their helpfulness. We would stay again. We loved how close we were to everything! It was great for my parents.

We have stayed here before and loved it. It has very few amenities, but we didn't come to Hawaii to stay in the room! The rooms were clean, neat and roomy. The tvs were newer. The people working were so pleasant and eager to please. We had the privilege of meeting the manager and he was great. We were right across the street from the beach and could catch transportation if we wanted it. Liked the idea of a safe in the room and the key to operate the elevator. Would go back again in a heart beat!

Wow, have stayed here twice, the view is a million $. Great location, across from the beach, walking distance to restaurants and shops. Perfect location.......Staff are super friendly and helpful. No pool here, but you are right across the road from the beach, it is truly heaven. We got beachfront, and you can sit on balcony and watch everything. Yes the rooms are a little on the small side but extremely clean, always clean linen, serviced everyday. The hotel provides beach towels and most beach equipment to borrow. Will definitely be staying again. Thanks Aston.

This was a great, comfy hotel. Within walking distance to many cafes and restaurants. Staff were really helpful in guiding you to bus stops etc. The rooms were quite spacious despite being part of a circular building. No pool, but just walk across the street and you are on Waikiki beach. At night there was minimal noise disturbance.

We stayed for 11 nights in this super convenient location! It was great only having to cross the street to be at the beach! The hotel provides beach towels and there's some beach equipment (body boards, inflatable rings & buckets/spades) out the front to borrow also. Perfect location to walk to zoo, aquarium, restaurants and shops. Bus/trolley stop just across the road also.Yes the rooms are "smallish" but we found unpacking our suitcases into the drawers and cupboards and then popping suitcases under the beds left us with lots of room. We had an ocean front room and enjoyed sitting out on the balcony and watching the world go by. The DVD and PlayStation rentals were a great way to help fill in little bits of time for our 6 year old. My only suggestion would be to have a microwave in the room to heat up leftovers but this is only a minor issue.The staff we spoke with were friendly and helpful. Housekeeping did a great job and replenished supplies daily. Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel has a relaxed holiday vibe and was a wonderful place to soak up the sun. Aloha!

The view is incredible very nice but don't expect a pool. Clean and close to everything. The aviance is 70's but clean and nothing more. Across the street is ocean and people watching is what we did. Again clean and 70's, no pool and safe.

Older place but great for couple on a budget. A little outdated but that comes with the price. Helpful staff. Can't beat the views if you get an Oceanfront room. Rooms are small but you shouldn't be in your room that much anyway!! Nice balcony for a glass of wine.

My husband and I, plus our two children and five suitcases, managed to squeeze into our tiny room at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel. Fortunately we had been pre-warned that the rooms were small, so we weren't too shocked. The partial-ocean view from our balcony (which was on the side of the building) more than made up for the lack of space in the room, as did the fact that the hotel was across the road from Kuhio Beach – the perfect place for kids to swim. My kids enjoyed the 'free' PlayStation 3 in the room (not really free, as you have to pay a daily resort fee for the privilege), and the WiFi signal was very strong. If you don't mind a cosy room, then this is a great place to stay – it's within walking distance of the Royal Hawaiian Centre, the revamped International Market Place, Honolulu Zoo and many different restaurants.

Hotel is located acrosss Waikiki Beach, great location, friendly sraff.Rooms are old, air-conditioning is noisy, rooms need improvements.Our balcony had a great view, but the smell from neighbouring McDonald made it unpleasent to sit outside.

The hotel was great with everything you need. The rooms are on the smaller side but I didn't go to Hawaii to hang out in my room. The views are gorgeous and the location to the beach and everything around is great. Friendly staff, overall no complaints!

The staff was great, but the hotel is old and rundown. It has tiny bathrooms and rooms.The place does have a great view and a nice staff, it needs a serious renovation. The bathroom was scary and very old. The balcony looked dangerous, but it is in a great location.

Literally 15m from Waikiki beach and ua shirt walk up to the main shopping. Fantastic service and a great hotel especially since its one of the older and original hotels in Waikiki. I had a room facing the beach so my view was outstanding but if I had a great view room all I would see would be a larger hotel.

We had wonderful views of the beach. ... It was handy to transport... Lots of restaurants all around... plenty of souvenier shops ... Hotel room was small but neat & clean .... The staff were very friendly & helpful ..

Our first trip to Hawaii and this was a great hotel to stay. It is like a step back in time. The hotel has very friendly staff and great service, We were right across the street from Waikiki beach. The location was perfect. We had an ocean view room. We were close to everything! The hotel does not have a pool but you don't need it! You are in Hawaii on Waikiki beach!! That is what we came for! The hotel has the history and picture of the founder, Emma Kwock Chun. We had a wonderful stay! Thank you so much to all the staff for a wonderful stay!

An old but refurbished hotel overlooking Waikiki Beach. Good value for money.Great place to stay - make sure to get one of the beach side rooms. We had room 1205 and it had c. 180 degree views. Balconies are small (2 chairs and small drinks table) but great for watching the sunsets over the ocean.The room is on the small side due to shape of building and the shower also small like a cruise ship but hey that's a minor detail when you consider the location and price!

A simple but very clean hotel, but the location is unbeatable. Awesome views from our balcony of Waikiki beach while we drank our complimentary coffee..They had mats, boogie boards, rings, and beach towels for the guests to use, included with the room. Restaurants and shopping VERY close.Famous Eggs and Things is part of the hotel. Hula activities and fireworks right on beach across from hotel.Staff very friendly and helpful. Parking (Extra fee as do all the hotels) in underground garage under the hotel secured with gate pass.

We had our second visit to Aaron Waikiki circle in March this year it still shines . Do your self a favour and pay a little extra for the ocean front room the view is just amazing .The staff are full of Aloha and are always happy to help . Cannot recommend this place more highly and look out for the little fish lol

This Hotel was well suited for us. For couples especially.  Located in the heart of Waikiki, opposite the main beach - cross the road and you are there. Seven years ago we stayed just one door up, just opposite The Dukes statue. Unfortunately this one from last time was undergoing renovations.Our " partial ocean view "room needed no upgrade. From our balcony on the 7th floor, we were able to see right onto the street, with the beach as backdrop - watching the breakers roll in and surfers out there waiting for a wave in the stunning aqua blue waters of the Pacific Ocean.There were yachts, canoes and sail boats..and on consecutive mornings a cruise ship, making her slow and majestic journey to other shores. What an incredible view her passengers had.Our room, although small, had 2 double beds with aqua spreads and matching bolster cushions, fish prints on the wall and waves on the carpet. There was a little alcove with a coffee/pod machine, chair and wardrobe which contained a safe for valuables. The bathroom was clean and entirely adequate.The room was made up daily with daily newspaper at the door. We left a tip for the daily cleaning staff everyday. There was a little handwritten note one day with " Mahalo " on it. That was a nice touch. The reception desk is manned 24/7 ( with early morning security guard ). Very professional and friendly.I liked the sounds. The street noise, the air-con, visitors next door splashing in the pool,the traffic, even a construction site on the Hotel adjoining didn't bother. I guess it was noisy but non-threatening. We were out most of the day.With a McDonalds on one side, a large ABC store on the other and the very popular restaurant Eggs n Things in the Hotel entrance, we wanted for nothing!Paradise was right here. Highly recommended . Excellent location for a stay in Honolulu.

This is our second time we have stayed at 'The Circle' and again another fabulous stay. 12th floor ocean front view which was amazing. Myself, my daughter and my grandson were more than comfortable in our room and oh that amazing housekeeping staff where just super once again. How they worked on our room with all our belongings spread about and to leave it all fresh and clean on our return each day was magical. The front desk staff couldn't do enough for us and were so friendly and accommodating to our needs. This services is what helps us so much enjoy our time in Honolulu and keeps drawing us back. We will see you again before long.
user_name:
Christine C
Tirau, null, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel during spring break. It was more than what I expected it to be.
