We booked an ocean view room (ocean front is the prime room) but i took my chance with just an ocean view room, the view is priceless. It is picture perfect. Watch the sunrise and sunset almost every morning. Magical. We stayed in a hotel in Ala Wai Canal last year in a much roomier hotel for the same price as this, I would not trade the view to the hotel space. Our experience from check in to check out was seemless. Everyone at the front desk is amazing. Parking underground was great. I have zero complain. We travelled as a family of 4. Again - the room and the bathroom is pretty tight but the view is A+. Very convenient for family travelling with small kids as you just need to cross the street to Waikiki Beach. Please remember to lock the balcony hinge parents, the view is very nice from the balcony, but i cringe evertime my kids go near the balcony dppr without me. We always kepta it locked unless one of the aduls are on the balcony. Housekeeping are amazing. Our room is always spotless. They changed our sheets 2x in our 6 day stay -So wonderful. They give you ice chips and let you use their mocrowave at the front desk. The staff are all very accomodating. The room and furniture looks modern. Mahalo Aston Waikiki Circle Staff! We hope to be back soon :)

Friendly welcome, early checkin and a fantastic location made this a perfect two night stay. Paid extra for ocean view room and it was well worth it. Loved watching sunset from our balcony.Rooms clean and appear recently refurbished. Ammenities fee covers wifi and dvd rentals local calls etc. beach towels and other extras available free, on requestWould highly recommend for its God value a great location opposite Waikiki beach. Goes to show you don't have to pay a fortune for priceless memories

We have just got home from a 5 night stay. We loved the location, right across the road from the beach. We had an ocean front room on the 9th floor which has the most incredible views out to sea, you see all the surfers and stand up paddle boarders. Rooms are smallish and a bit tired, but as it was just myself and my husband the room size was fine. Rooms are serviced every day to a very high standard. We found the front desk people nice and friendly. Just one negative incident happened upon check out at 6.00 am in the morning. The person Jay was unfriendly and had a negative attitude. Apart from him we loved our stay. We would definitely stay next time we're in Waikiki! You pay a daily fee for wifi, movies, newspaper and free local calls.

Perfect location, great price. I don't think there is another hotel this close to Waikiki Beach for the price. It is right across Kalakaua Ave from the beach. We had a 5th floor ocean front room and really enjoyed the view. Hotel staff was very freindly and extremely helpful. Be sure to look for beach supplies on the rack next to the parking lot. We had free use of beach chairs every day which was great. The hotel is within easy walking distance of restaurants, shopping, the zoo and aquarium. We even walked to the top of Diamondhead! For anyplace too far to walk the hotel is right on the bus line with a stop right across the street.

We have stayed here before and love the location. Upon arrival this time after a 12 hour flight and being up for 24 hours as we checked in I realized I had requested the wrong room locatiion (wanted OCEANFRONT BUT had requested oceanview) realizing my mistake I asked if it was possible to get an oceanfront, thinking to myself there's no way this is going to happen! Th e next morning we were called and told they had one avaliable for a small upgrade--The staff is wonderful!!Bear in mind it is near the street so you will hear early morning deliverys---BUT the location,view and staff outweigo anything else

Room small but adequate, very clean , opt for an ocean view room at a higher level. Staff very friendly and helpful, on site restaurant always busy with long queues. We found the price of the hotel expensive as were most things on the island

The old saying is location location location...this hotel certainly has that. We have room with a full view and wow. The staff are very friendly the rooms are clean and modern not to mention comfortable. Yes they are small but there is no way I could criticise this. There is fantastic pancakes to be had downstairs the beach is across the road they loan out beach equipment (wow). I would definitely stay here again.

While the Aston Circle has a good beach front location, poor service and impolite staff take away from the location. We stayed at this hotel in March 2017 and found the front desk staff rude and lacking typical hotel professionalism. Any requests, such as late check outs, will not be accommodated. If you’re looking for a great location with the level of service that you would expect, I recommend the Hyatt Regency right next door, well worth the extra $$$.

Yes, the hotel was a bit retro and the room was smaller than I had expected but the view from the balcony (we paid extra for a view) offered spectacular sunsets. Right across the street from Waikiki, surrounded by shops and restaurants, easy access to public transportation (much cheaper than paying for tours), comfortable beds, good shower, beach chairs/umbrellas to borrow, etc. Our DVD player didn't work for 3 of our 4 nights so DVD rentals as park of amenities fee was disappointing. They refunded one of the 4 nights fee.
user_name:
Dianne S
White Bear Lake, Minnesota

review_body: Except the fact this hotel close to Waikiki Beach, there is nothing special about this hotel, their front desk is horrible, we made reservation 3 moth in advance , arrived Hotel around 11:30 pm , the night guy came to our car without checking system or reservations he said go away we don't have any reservations , the night shift guy is terrible, also day front desk the manager is very rude. The rooms are very small , we booked queen size bed , they give me double twin, it was originally ocean front the give me room you barely see the ocean. Also the rooms are smelly and old ! Never again and not recommended

This hotel is situated directly opposite Waikiki beach it the best location with "Eggs and Things" underneath. The rooms are very small room but are renovated nicely. The staff were excellent and very helpful.

Sure it's an old hotel with small rooms and even smaller bathrooms. On the other hand the location is outstanding with unbelievable views from lanai. The rooms are clean and the staff friendly and helpful. The beach right across the road is excellent offering both surf and a protected areas. Excellent eating and drinking spots surround. A gem.

We stayed in an ocean front room on one of the upper floors. Fantastic views of Waikiki Beach and out to sea. We loved to sit out on the balcony early in the morning enjoying the view. The room may be a bit small for some, but we knew that before we booked and it was good enough for us as we were out all day and each evening anyway. Our room had two double beds, a small bench table with coffee and tea and a bar fridge.There is not a kettle of iron and ironing board in the room so you have to request one at the reception area. Room was clean and the housekeeper does a great job. A complimentry newspaper was left outside our door each morning. The hotel is in a great location. At street level is Eggs and Things which is great for breakfast, but very popular so long lines. An ABC store is convenienty located next door to the hotel and the beach is just acoss the road. Beach towells are available from reception The staff were all very friendly and made us feel welcome. The hotel website offers a range of discounts and we got the Hawaii 50 discount for over 50's. We selected the discount when we booked online. We will stay here again.

Loved the location and loved the price! This was one of the cheaper options we found as we wanted to stay right on the beach and not pay a fortune. You will be at the beach in under a minute…and I’d say it’s the ‘heart’ of the beach. When we arrived to the lobby (which is outdoors and not a typical lobby…it’s just a desk) they offered us an ocean view upgrade for $20/night which is completely worth it. If you book partial ocean view, it’s literally a bit of the water and more buildings than anything! They even gave us the option to get a room with one King vs. 2 doubles (but not ocean view) - apparently they have those available in small amounts - They were very friendly and accommodating and let us pick whichever option we preferred.Rooms are tiny and bathrooms (especially the showers) are also tiny but didn’t bother us at all. You’re in Hawaii! You’re rarely in the room anyways. Restaurants in the area:- Eggs and things attached to the hotel (show your room card and get 10% discount) – lines start at 6:00am when they open so allow some time for that. We were lined up for about 25minutes but didn’t bother us - McDonald’s is right beside the hotel if you need a quick bite- Steak Shack – GO HERE! It’s about a 10minute walk down the beach near the Sheraton Waikiki I believe…so yummy! Wish we ate there more- Cheesecake Factory and PF Chang’s also a walking distance - Buho Concina Cantina – great rooftop Mexican restaurant walking distance as well. Tuesdays are $2 tacos – great foodOther things to do in the area if you have a car: - Pearl Harbour & Aloha Swap meet (local flea market - $1 per person)- Ko Olina beach which is where the Disney Resort is – calm water here in 4 different lagoons…we wanted a change from the business of Waikiki - free- Diamond Head Hike - $5 for parking or $1 per person if you get there by foot

It really doesn't look so bad in the photos online. But in person it's pretty dumpy. And the "partial ocean view" is a joke... you have to go onto the corner of your balcony, try to see past other balconies, and the ocean is over there somewhere. Don't bother unless you're getting the full ocean view on a high floor. For a small amount of additional $ just go somewhere else. The staff was really great, and the place was clean. So I'll give it that. But really, don't bother!
user_name:
WolfMother2000
New York City, New York

review_body: I was traveling alone with my daughter. I was happy with the security of the hotel. The elevator needs a key to access. The location was excellent. There was a restaurant on property as well as a Mcdonalds and ABC store next door. The rooms were renovated and pretty. The staff was very kind. There were beach toys that you could borrow. We booked a tour with the travel agency on property. She was very kind and recommended a delightful turtle snorkeling tour for us.

Stayed here 12 nights with my wife and 2 daughters 17yo & 10yo. We had 2 double beds. Daughters sharing a bed. Yes room small but we knew that from reading reviews. Wasn't much room left with our 4 bags left on floor. But didn't worry us as only time in our room was sleeping and usually an hour or so before sleep. We sat or laid on our beds watching the TV or on iPads/phones. Small fridge was handy. Bathroom was very good.Daughter complained about noise of Air con when start up and shut off. But I fixed that by changing from energy save to constant mode. We went for a budget room with out a view as we rather spend our money on trips. Especially considering how little time we spent in our room. We got a great deal. Location is the key with this hotel. It is over the road from the best part of Waikiki beach. You have a choice of the rock pool or the open beach. Surfboard and SUPs hire is over the road too. No pool at hotel but with the beach over the road is all you need. Downstairs in lobby is Eggs and Things a very popular place especially for breakfast. It's a great breakfast but can be a wait. Check reviews on it. Also handy on one side of hotel is a large ABC store great to grab a drink or a sandwich when leaving in a tour real early. Other side is Mcdonald's. Dukes statue is almost over the road which is where a Trolley and your pick up and location is which we used a few days. On some of our tours a pick up location was at Hyatt which was next block from us and we also hired a car from there too. Another great thing we loved was arriving on a red eye we got to the hotel about 8am without much sleep. Looking to leave our bags there before check in later the day. They were able to get us in a room straight away. We all had a great quick sleep and so thankful for that. Yes we would stay there again for sure. Great price and location.

This hotel is right across the street from Waikiki. It is very convenient to walk out of your hotel and do some window shopping. They have a restaurant but the line is always so long. You have to order your food before you are allowed to sit down. I really didnt care for it. I ended up going to McDonald's right next door to get my coffee. The room was very cramped. The shower was something else. I've never seen a shower head where it faces the shower curtain. It takes forever to get any hot water and if you are not careful the floor of the bathroom will get totally wet. Parking at this hotel is not good. If you are not one of the lucky ones to get a space then you have to park farther away and still have to pay for parking. I won't be staying at this hotel again.

Basic...but as I said above, location is pimp, great price, clean and excellent customer service! Our first time at this hotel so we only booked 1 night but decided to stay for 2 more, mainly because of the awesome customer service (Kamiki at the front desk when we checked in and a super nice woman that helped us when we extended our stay by tracking down our last minute reservation, keeping us in the same room and adding our Alaska Airlines frequent flyer number when she noticed it on our visa so that we could also accrue mikes for our stay). Wow. We will stay here again for sure. Only reason for the 4 and not 5 rating is no pool but the ocean is right across the street.

We had an ocean front room with the most incredible view of the beach right across the street & amazing sunsets from our large balcony.Hotel gives you free new movies & games plus playstation everyday, access to chairs boogie boards and beach toys thats other guests brought & left there. Kona coffee with a pod machine for great coffee every morning in your room, mini fridge , safe. Comfy beds, only 2 doubles in each room but my husband & I were ok with that for a week. The bathrooms very smallish but really plenty big, nice shower,good towels and linens. Plus a separate area where you can sit outside the bathroom to do your hair and makeup. The desk is staffed 24 hours and are there to helpyou with movies, ice, beach towels etc. plus they were super nice & friendly. We loved Jan up front! There is a delicious restaurant downstairs small but great waffles, Eggs & Things, plus 10% off for guests of the hotel. Also right across the street on theBeach with a sea wall, are chairs & umbrellas to rent. Jason there was great! So overall I would stay there again & again. Small quiet hotel right on the beach, with grocery store and lots of shops right next door. Walking distance to mall and restaurants like Dukes, cheeseburger in paradise, & cheesecake factory & Starbucks. Plus within walking distance of the aquarium which we went to and it was small but interesting, sea horses and jellyfish. We had an excellent time! Mahalo!

You can't beat the location. It's right in the middle of the strip across from Waikiki Beach. That being said, of course the sidewalks are crowded with people. The lobby isn't really a lobby, just a window to check into. The room itself was larger than we thought it would be. It was clean and has everything you could need. There is no tub just a stand up shower which worked for us because we had no kids to bathe. Eggs N Things is right downstairs and McDonalds is next door. This was a great stopover for us on our way to Kona the next day.

I loved this hotel. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Yes, rooms are small but really aren't you just sleeping there? The staff was great, room clean, and they have THE BEST BODY BAR SOAP. We had a beach front room top floor and the view was spectacular every night. Close to everything. Just cross the street with your beach towel and chair compliments of hotel and you're on the sand. Kudos to this hotel.

We booked our Waikki eight day vacation through Westjet Vacations from Jan 11-18th and found this amazing gem. Our priority was a family hotel, clean, affordable, comfortable and CLOSE TO THE BEACH. We checked first on its reviews, googled the images and videos and of course, google maps for its location. On all accounts this hotel meet all our needs and them some.Location: Our goal was beach time and had no plans on staying at the hotel for extended periods of time except to sleep. There is no other affordable hotel that can compare to the location and beach access than Aston Waikiki Circle. From the lobby elevator to the beach is about 50 Meters. We were there for a restful beach vacation and this was it.The hotel was walking distance to everything. * Major Shopping was five minutes away. * McDonalds, Egg and Things, and ABC store right beside hotel. There are ten ABC stores within five minutes of the hotel* a variety of local markets close by depending on day of the week. * we bought grocery staples from the Food Pantry which is a ten minutes walk. * We preferred the surf shop two rights from hotel and one block back. The shop was cheaper and staff much more knowledgable than the Beach rentals.* Dukes is less than a ten minute walk and amazing patio. Service: No matter our questions and needs, the front desk staff were always willing to help. From Beach towels to extra room cleaning to directions and suggestions on restaurants, the staff were always helpful. They also went the extra mile for we arrived late at night (10:00 PM) and the front desk staff person suggested to come back the next morning because they had rooms on higher floors. We lucked out and were moved from Second floor to the thirteenth floor! There is also a tour desk opposite side to the Front Desk Office. We booked our Hanauma Bay tour through the desk with ease.Across the parking lot from the front desk is a Surf Board storage area. The Hotel suggests guests who are leaving to donate their beach things. We used inflatables, beach chairs, boogies boards, beach mats during our stay and when we left, we added a couple of inflatables and beach umbrella to the pile. Rooms: We travel a great deal and appreciate a good affordable, clean and comfy room. Its the only way we can afford to travel so often. Every room in the Circle is the same with two double beds, bathroom (shower no bathtub), large closet, air conditioner, fridge, coffee and tea maker, and small office area and deck space. The only difference is the views. We had an partial ocean view room and loved waking up to the sunrise and seeing the sunset before we were off for a late dinner. We regularly posted photos to Facebook and our friendly regularly asked where we were staying. There are two double beds with bed spreads. The beds for our family of four were soft and comfortable. I did encounter a man checking out early complaining about bed size and room size but clearly he had not researched the hotel before booking. This is not the Hyatt or Outrigger with the duvets on the king beds. Part of the charm of the hotel is the history. It is an older hotel but that was certainly apart of the appeal. The rooms were definitely freshly painted and all furniture were up to date. My suggestion is to stay here before some large chain buys it and tears it down to build a mega hotel. Family: My wife and I traveled with our tall 11 year old son and 8 year old daughter. The hotel was perfect for our family of four. The area was safe especially with a Waikiki Police office two blocks away. We arrived late the first night and walked no problem to Dukes Statue to donate our Leis and shopped at a few stores before going to bed.

Ok this hotel is dated, that doesnt mean the staff isnt great or the rooms arent clean. I was surprised to see each day they actually life the beds to vacuum the entire room. The rooms were spotless. The hotel is centrally located in the middle of everything, perfect distance to the beach or shops. Eggs n things was a plus.

Older hotel but has been refurbished so not one if you are wanting luxury (no pool but with the beach right in front of you don't need one). Fabulous view and location. Staff very friendly and helpful. There were 20 of us staying there and all of us found the person on the tour desk to be less than helpful and not terribly interested so any business through that avenue was lost. Still an excellent place to stay in my view.

I love the Aston group, they are truly all friendly and customer service focused. I like the other locations better in that this location was just hit and humid no matter the a/c. However if that's ok, the views from this location were so awesome. Also the price is beyond reasonable for Waikiki. If you can overlook the humidity then def try here. We only stayed 3 days (staycation).

This is a gem. Great little hotel right on Waikiki beach. We were lucky to get a parking space in the hotel's garage which really made having a car easy. Great little restaurant on the street level "Egg n things", we hade a very nice breakfast. The room was not big but the balcony was of a decent size so that helped. Overall a clean hotel and a very efficient staff. Can really recommend this!

This hotel was the perfect location - it was close to everything. Close to buses and shops and right opposite Waikiki beach. Do everything or do nothing. Rooms were clean and great views from the lanai. Will be back

My new husband and I stayed here for 5 night of our honeymoon. We arrived in the middle of the night and had no problem getting our room. We reserved an ocean front which was THE BEST! I would highly recommend spending the extra money and doing this, so nice to sit on the balcony and watch the fireworks and the hustle and bustle of Waikiki beach. The only problem we had was solved right away. I had originally booked a queen size bed, but when we received our room it was 2 doubles. We advised the staff of this and were told there were none available for that night, but the next afternoon there would be one available. We said we would take it, but would not be at the hotel at the time we would have to switch rooms as we had a tour booked. They said no problem, pack up your things and leave them on the bed, we will switch it for you. We got back from our tour, got our new room keys, and all of our luggage was in our new rooms (of course we brought our valuables with us). I could not recommend this hotel more! Eggs and things was amazing and great prices, especially for Hawaii.

For the price, the place was great. It was our honeymoon, so we were out alot walking around, so we didn't need no 5 star top of the line hotel. The staff was extremely nice, and eat at "Eggs-n-Things"....Food is wonderful!

We were really impressed by the location of this hotel, whilst there were some construction works underway it never affected our stay here. The staff were all very friendly and I used the tours desk to book a few things and the lovely woman was very informative and helpful. The rooms are very basic, and rather small, but they are clean and have everything you need, we don't go on holidays to stay in our hotel room so the size never bothered us and we had an ocean view room with a balcony and it was perfect for relaxing. The location is great, a few steps across the road and you are at the beach. We moved from this hotel to a luxury hotel half way through our trip, as I always try and book different accommodation if staying for an extended period to mix it up a bit and we were just as impressed by this hotel, especially for the price. Very impressed and would stay here again.

Downstairs there's a restaurant so guest cannot cook their food they just go to the restaurant to eat, that's smart!! the location is so nice you can just walk to the beach or even walk to the stores to go shopping. the rooms are small but they have a nice ocean view and two beds. Even a small bathroom.

The location of this hotel is the selling point, a ride down on the lift puts you on the street and pedestrian crossing across to the beach . The room are small but clean and comfortable, with so much going in the area little time is spent in the room anyhow. We took a partial view room which gave a great view south along the beach to Diamond Head. The hotel was perfect for our needs, but the $ US 18 amenity fee was a bit rich on top of the taxes as we only used the TV, and ineffective Wi fi when in the room, it appears this fee is charged by most hotels. The base per night charges were reasonable compared to nearby hotels.

This hotel's location is the best thing about it. The rooms are basic and quite small. The staff are friendly and helpful. Be careful of extras on the bill taxes etc . It is great that you can just cross the street and be at the beach. The rooms are quite high up for the beautiful views and therefore when you are out on the balcony it is extremely windy. One of the good things is the free dvd rental.

This hotel was perfect for our trip. We stayed 7 nights here. It is in the heart of Waikiki opposite the beach and the lagoon, which was perfect for taking our baby for a swim too (did not miss not having a pool). It is walking distance to all shops and zoos. I recommend to buy a cheap snorkel from abc store and snorkel out at the beach opposite the zoo. The room is nice and new, it is clean and beds are comfortable. We had an oceAnfront room with amazing views across the water. Nothing wrong with the metal cot supplied. The room may be a bit small, but if they got rid of one of the two beds it would of been better for us, then our baby could of played more and it would of felt bigger. Wifi is excellent. The staff were friendly, my only complaint would be check in eg out cot wasnt in our room already and one of our requests wasnt met, but it didnt matter in the long run and our issue was offered to be resolved. Overall i had a very comfortable stay here, was aware of the added amenity fee, as most hotels in Hawaii have it, the hotel made it clear prior to booking. It is worth the 5 stars for a perfect 3 star hotel!!

Staying here for 7 nights and all the bad reviews on here wasn't sure what to expect it's amazing the view is breathtaking the room is not huge but plenty of space with a queen bed a desk separate area for your luggage shower a little small but nothing to cry about enough room to shower comfortable the lady at the front desk her name is the goddess is amazing and friendly there's always that one person that makes there company shine she is it and a great asset to the company the rooms are very clean and cleaned and bed made every day for you we had a ocean front room well worth it for the view you won't get any better I will definitely be coming back to this motel and won't be listening to the crap reviews people on here

Myself and my friend stayed here for 6 nights. The value is superior to anywhere in Waikiki. Great view and service is good. Don't expect a lavish hobby but the location is perfect. I would recommend!

Love this comfy little queen room with an ocean view. Hotel staff make you feel right at home. The room has a fun ocean motif and is well maintained by the housekeepers, Very clean and tidy. This place is a hidden Jewel I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a great room on a budget. You get the money shots as far as photos because you are right on the ocean steps from your door. You are in the mix of everything at this location. The staff are the best, we will be back

Visited in February 2007! Based on Location alone couldn't be any better. Can't comment on the standard of accommodation as it's been such a long time since we visited but it was good when we were there. It is literally across the road from Waikiki beach. The perfect location ❤

customer service here is great, so helpful and friendly. When we first walked into our room on the 5th floor our first thoughts were how tiny the room is. After 15 mins or so we fell in love with the room, we had oceanfront and its so worth the upgrade. The view is amazing maybe a floor or 2 higher would be better but we loved it, and such a great location. will definitely be staying here next year.

This is my go to place to stay in Waikiki as you can't beat the view for the price. They have limited parking so take that into consideration but the staff are always so helpful and smiling. I think this is my 6 or 7th time here and always have a great time!

What a treasure Jan is on reception,best advice ask the driver not the rider after we got off a bus at the wrong stop.The hotel is old but the rooms are quite roomy with two double beds room in the wardrobe for suitcases leaving plenty of room to move around.Of course the main points are the location and the views,walk across the road to the beach.half a block to the trolley stop,two blocks to the bus stops,abc next door,eggs and things are great,dont let the queue scare you,they move you in quickly,staff are super friendly.Views are incredible,we were on 13th.floor(I know)saw the motorbike toy run from our balcony and the highlight was the 75th.pearl harbour anniversary parade.Found the rooms very quiet probably due to the solid construction of an old building.Shower small but instant hot water good towels comfy beds.Would have liked a proper kettle instant coffee and china mugs,bought the last two at walmart and managed with the coffee machine for hot water.

I stayed here many years ago and found the hotel OK. The rooms were refurbished about two years ago and are now fantastic. Beds are very comfortable and the views cannot be beaten. The room is well appointed and although small, who stays in their room all day while on holiday in Hawaii. The only down side of the room is the small shower stall. In saying that, there is sufficient room for a decent shower without feeling clostraphobic. The staff at check in are also very friendly and offer any assistance you may require. Highly recommended. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

We have stayed here twice and it is always excellent. The view is amazing. Our stay this time coincided with Halloween and our balcony was the perfect vantage point to watch the parade of people in their costumes on Kalakaua Avenue. We will be staying there again next year.

We stayed here for two nights before embarking on a cruise around the Islands and then four nights on our return a week later. We had originally booked a partial ocean view but on arrival were able to be upgraded to an ocean front room which was definitely worth it!The room itself was spotless but small-ish, which was perfectly adequate for the two of us, and had a stunning view of the beach. Very easy to grab some ice from reception and enjoy a drink on the balcony watching those amazing sunsets. We also appreciated the drip filter coffee provided and the fast wifi.Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, from asking for a beach towel to getting directions and local knowledge. The Goddess in particular is a fantastic ambassador, not just for the hotel but for Honolulu.Shawn and Jan were also very friendly and helpful, making the check-in and check-out process a breeze.To summarise - a charming place to stay with its own history and the perfect location!

We ended up at this hotel after trying an airbnb for one night and let me tell you what a wonderful hotel this is.The location is amazing and the price is great!It is located right downtown Wakiki and within walking distance to everything!You cross the street and bam! you are at the beach!The staff is wonderful and the rooms are clean and beds are very comfortable!Next time I'm in Honolulu I am definitely staying at the little jewel of a hotel!Nice, nice place!!

This is our 3rd visit to Waikiki circle. The location is fantastic, the view is incredible, housekeeping is amazing! HOWEVER, it the facilities and amenities seem to be getting less and less every time we visit. No laundry, you HAVE to pay to use coffee and tea, wifi, videos, etc. shouldn't that be included in the room price??? The cot we requested to use for our 9 month old daughter during our stay is the smallest cot (she lays flat and her arms reach out the side and her feet and head hit the ends of the cot! Any longer and she'd have to sleep in the bed!) and it's the oldest scrap metal I've ever seen. Seems like they havnt upgraded these since the 70's! There is a building next door completely vacant and under construction which they start hammering and banging at 7am in the morning! So there goes your holiday sleep in and cue bub crying (she never cries!). We hired a car for 24hours but had to pay $22 to park it overnight at the underground hotel parking. I don't know if I would return to this hotel. It may be better value to pay the extra money per night and stay at a hotel that has all amenities included.

Although the location of this hotel was wonderful, there are several things you should be aware of before staying here. First, there is no pool or hot tub. There is NO fitness center. We were told if we wanted to use a gym, we could walk to the YMCA, several blocks away. There is NO laundry service. If we wanted laundry service, we were told to walk to a laundromat several blocks away. There is NOT a single ice machine on any of the 14 floors. If you want ice, you have to go to the desk and ask for a bucket and then carry the ice back to your room. The room is the smallest motel room I have ever stayed in. There is a single desk chair and that is the only place to sit in the room. There is not even a fan in the bathroom. To use the mirror after a shower, you have to "defog" it with the blow dryer. There is NO microwave in the room. If you want the use of a microwave, you take your food down to the reception desk and the clerk will lead you to the staff break room and offer you the use of their single microwave. (I really am not kidding.)There is no lobby, not even a single chair to sit in while you wait. We were on the 6th floor and the street noise was deafening at all hours of the day and night. Staff was friendly and the room was adequate, but we were shocked at the lack of common amenities. It should be made clear in their advertisements that these standard options are not available at this hotel.

Take the view from the ocean front rooms at one of the best value for money rooms going around. It also is in a great location just 50 mtrs away from the Dukes statue on the beach. Bus stops and shops all around you. Doesn't have any dinning options at the hotel but there are many places within minutes to eat at. Hotel rooms are clean and tidy, not overly large but big enough for two or small family. Two double beds in the main room with a bathroom and a small wardrobe area leads onto a great balcony.

Clean, with nice staff and a superb location next to the beach. Everything you need from a hotel room but you can tell it has been around for some time, the ac was really loud, our door to the balcony did not open, we had to change rooms once since the toilet did not work. Great with a fridge and beach towels available!

Our first stay in Hawaii and couldn't be happier with out accommodation, we paid for a partial ocean view room. The staff are very friendly at the front desk, housekeeping and the activities desk. We had a room with 2 double beds and while the rooms are smaller than usual we were only in there to sleep, the linen is very comfortable. We will definitely stay here again.

So much fun in Waikiki and the Circle Hotel was GREAT. This is a small hotel with amazing ocean views. The staff was so nice and helpful and friendly, rooms were small but very efficiently laid out and very comfortable. Just steps out the front door to the beautiful ocean and Banyan Tree.

The hotel is located across the street from the famous Waikiki beach. Our room on the 11th floor and it's small balcony had a incredible view of the beach, sunsets and mobs of tourists walking the Avenue The downside to the spectacular view is the ever present street noise, combined with the in wall AC unit it's little tough to sleep. The room is nice, clean and spacious. The staff is friendly and helpful. Overall, I would recommend this hotel it's location is fantastic.

We stayed in a front ocean view room on 6th floor and wow! View to die for. Room smallish but adequate and bathroom with shower very small. Staff really helpful on reception and this place is bang central to Waikiki opposite the Duke statue. Exceptional value for position. We walked out of hotel and across road to beach. Shopping malls also very near so ideal for Father who had limited mobility. All in all a perfect location makes up for lack of luxury.

We arrived very early in the morning and was offered a room and upgrade straight away which we promptly accepted. Our room was on the 6th floor overlooking the Banyan Tree across the road and with lovely ocean views. The hotel next door is currently being renovated so if you want to sleep in or you are a light sleeper, it's probably not going to happen, but the block out drapes are great.The hotel has been renovated since I last visited and the front desk renovation was completed during our stay. Staff very helpful and let us know what equipment was available to use i.e. chairs for the beach, body boards, DVD's. Tina was a great help with booking day trips and also offered other tips, very friendly and seems to enjoy her job with a smile on her face. Our room was comfortable for 2 people and so were the beds (double). Just remember the room size isn't large, but you don't spend a lot of time there. The bed size may be an issue if you are used to queen or king. On a previous trip 3 people comfortably managed the space, but we were out and about a lot.You can't beat the location and availability of shops and the beach. The balcony is the perfect location to sit and watch the crowd walk by. I'm looking forward to return in the near future.

The hotel is just that: everything you need. The room is fine, the bathroom small but enough and the services consist in a small reception (though very efficient), wifi, small parking and free DVD movies and beach apparel. But it is enough to enjoy a few days in Oahu and the price is better that at other hotels around.Rooms to the front let you see the beach but are quite noisy at the same time.

No problem checking in. 7th floor WITH ocean FRONT room. Total view of Waikiki Beach. The room is small but the balcony helps. Would definitely recommend this hotel. A lovely visit and NO problems. Staff were very pleasant. Check-in is actually outside by the elevator - quirky! Loved the VINTAGE feel. Totally round hotel with central elevator. Coffee pot/frig/safe. NO microwave but the staff will re-heat left-overs for you if you ask nicely!

Very handy location, we walked everywhere. On arrival we were told there were ocean front rooms available for $20 extra per night (our booking was an ocean view room) We paid the extra and did not regret our decision. Superb views for our afternoon drinks on the balcony. Tina at the tour desk was most helpful in advising and booking tours and transfers and the front desk staff were always friendly and helpful. Posting letters and supplying ice to name a few things that they helped us with. Our room was clean and tidy and must have been renovated quite recently. However the air con was old and very noisy.

Good room ,very good view of beach, ,very comfortable, aircon,facilitys to make tea or coffee, excellent service. I wanted for nothing .Will stay there again All staff very helpful,from frontdesk,,cleaners housekeepersVery good with security, and have a safe for valuables.,

Had a great experience here. Staff was helpful and friendly. The room was nice and clean. Everything worked. They had beach toys and chairs for our use. Loved that. Definitely exceeded my expectations.

Central location In Waikiki with beach right across the road. Can walk to everything. ABC stores and grocery store close by. Good tour desk very helpful. Rooms are not big and suit couples or two travellers, Beds are comfortable. Beach view rooms are worth the cost as the view is spectacular.

We arrived at Aston Waikiki Circle after a very early flight at approx. 7.30am. We were greeted by Naomi and were kindly allowed to check in and go to our room. Room was clean and comfortable, although a little on the small side. It had everything we needed and was in a fabulous position directly across the road from Waikiki beach. Naomi was on the front desk for our first three days and was so kind and helpful. She gladly shared tips and advice on things to see and do and is a credit to the company. I cannot speak highly enough of her. We will gladly use this hotel again if we are in Waikiki.

Best spot on Waikiki - the views are magnifient. Staff are lovely. Rooms recently renovated. Prices reasonable. Close to everything. Able to watch the Hula shows from our balcony. Hoping to go again next year and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

We stayed 2 nights before our 7 day Hawaii cruise on NCL Pride of America.Plus another 2 nights in a different room before Cruising back to Aust on HA Maasdam.This may be an old Hotel we found both rooms clean with comfortables beds and the air con worked.Requested extra pillows delivered to our room no problems.Next door was an ABC shop and the other side McDonald's.A short walk up the street was a Hop on Hop off Bus stop.Hotel Staff helpful We would stay there again.

First time in Hawaii , Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel was fabulous. Wouldn't hesitate to book again. Very clean roomy, staff very friendly. Make sure you try Eggs n Things at lest once.Great Mexican a block behind hotel, underneath Mexican you can hire great surf boards. Do a tour of the island, shopping is incredible !

Decent small hotel with small CURVED rooms ! 2 to 2.5 star hotel OK depending on price.... many better hotels in the $180 to $220 price rangeSheratons and Outriggers priced in the same range are much better and they have bigger rooms and full services plus swimming pools so shop accordingly

This was our 4th stay at "The Circle" and we still love it. Staff are lovely - even when they are dealing with difficult conditions in the open air while their office is being refurbished. The location is great and views from ocean front rooms are spectacular.

Fantastic view (Ocean View) floor 14 west side.Staff really nice and helpful, check in was easy and fast. Room cleaned 100% everyday however the room is quite small and shower tiny...if you are 6ft or taller prepare to squat. Beach across the road and you receive a towel from reception desk each time plus there are boogie boards and other beach equipment you can use that is left from other tourists near surfboard rack. Shopping and restaurants only 5 minute walk west and zoo/aquarium 5 mins the other way. only negative is Eggs & Things even though not part of the hotel there is a massive line up and the food not that good for the price - walk to Cheeseburger in Paradise 30m on the left for their $6.99 breaky!!
Staff very friendly and always there to help us. We had a wonderful view from 14th floor facing the beach.Bathroom was small but it didn't concern us very much as we had a great view from the balcony

stayed on the 12th Floor Room 1203. Amazing view of the Ocean and surrounds. Being over 50 we received a slightly cheaper rate. Rooms were cleaned daily to a very high standard. Staff very helpful on the front deskABC store next door for all your needs. We ate a couple of times at Lu Lu's down the road which was pretty good value. Got a two day ticket for the Waikiki Trolley bus which was very good value (90 USD for two persons).All in all really enjoyed our stay.

We stayed here for 3 days prior to our Hawaiian cruise. The hotel was well located and very clean, although it did feel a little dated. Rooms were much better than the public areas and corridors, which didn't really do the hotel justice. Great location right on Waikiki Beach and central to all local restaurants, bars etc. Not a resort style hotel, but great for a short stay.

Lovely place to stay. Friendly staff, clean but rather small rooms, great linen and thick abundant towels, right across from famous Waikiki Beach and the 'Duke' statue where the Waikiki Trolley stops. ABC store right next door, Eggs and Things at the front of the property. We were very comfortable and would stay again.

Stayed for 2 nights and found this hotel to be in a perfect location, just across the road from the main Waikiki beach. Hotel is a bit faded, but the rooms are large by UK standards, clean and have everything you need.....especially a balcony overlooking the sea! Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby, though we found that without a reservation the waiting times were horrendous in most places.

Great awesome place right in front of Waikiki Beach!Great hotel, superb staff and clean for a low cost!For breakfast and lunch you can get some really good food right beside the reception at Eggs n' Things and there are plenty of restaurants in the area when you will have a nice dinner in the evening!

My family and I just arrived back from our trip to Waikiki. We all stayed at this hotel. 6 adults, 3 rooms. 4 of us had partial ocean view rooms on the 9th floor and the other 2 had a partial ocean view room on the 13th floor. The Partial ocean view room was very nice - but next time I go, I am definitely going to get an ocean view room. One of the ladies cleaning a checked out room, let us take a look at the view from one of these rooms and the view is just amazing!The staff at the hotel were VERY friendly! The day we left, our flight wasnt until 1030PM at night and we didnt reserve a room for the next day so one of the guys at the front, I think his name started with a "K", looked into it and with a full hotel, managed to let us stay until our shuttle picked us up at 630PM at a cost of $85. We were so thankful because a bunch of us wanted to go swimming and without the room we wouldnt have been able to.The rooms for this hotel were small. I dont think ive ever stayed in such a small hotel room before but If you dont have more than 2 adults in a room, it works out fine. There is a balcony that you can sit out on with 2 chairs and a little table, there is a good sized closet where you can store your luggage, a safe in the closet and shelving. There is a desk and chair with a coffee maker on top. There is a fridge located under the desk. Two double beds - the beds were comfy but a little bit soft. I think it felt soft because it was only the mattress on top of the bed frame without the boxspring but this was minor - I had good sleeps every night I was there. There is air conditioning in the room and you can adjust it on your own. I did feel a bit cold so I asked for another blanket and they were more than happy to bring one up. The bathroom was small. Only one person could fit in there. The shower is a stand up one person tiled shower - good water pressure. The room was updated and it was very nice. Like an "aquarium" type theme. There was a flat screen tv on top of a desk (the TV had a TON of channels to choose from).The location of this hotel is PERFECT. It is literally right across the street from the beach. McDonalds is located on one side of the hotel and a ABC store on the other side. Totally convenient! There is also an "Eggs N Things" restaurant beside the ABC store, pretty much part of the hotel, and it is worth checking out. The spam and eggs with rice was delicious! There is usually a long line up in the morning - we waited about an hour to eat. If you feel like having breakfast for dinner, there usually isnt a line. We rented a car and paid the $22 per day. If you are renting a car, I do suggest that you reserve parking before you go because there is pretty much no parking anywhere else as this area is quite busy. On our last day at the hotel, the parking lot was full and no one else could reserve a spot so we are glad we reserved parking ahead of time. It is quite a small parking lot but there were maybe 12 cars that fit the lot when it was full.There is an activity center where you can reserve activities at the hotel but we didnt use this service. The hotel does offer free DVD rentals which was cool, because at the end of the day when you are extremely tired you can just pop in the dvd on the playstation and get comfy in bed. The DVD rental service they have is an automatic computer machine and they give you a room key type card and it takes less than a minute to rent it. They also have wifi (you pay an amenity fee for the week to have this) and the connection was perfect.The hotel is on the "Waikiki Strip" and there are tons of restaurants and shopping nearby.We will definielty stay at this hotel again! The location is super convenient. Rooms were always clean. Staff are nice and helpful and there are a lot of things to do. If you have one person that wants to go to the beach - its there. If you have another who wants to shop - its there.We had a great vacation at the Aston Waikiki Circle! We will totally would recommend this hotel to others.

Aston Waikiki circle Is located on Waikik beach ,fairly cheap ,clean and comfortable accomadation, staff were friendly. Room was comfortable and clean, probably dated ,but cheap and clean .Staff were friendly ,called them twice for assistance. We're approachable and the rooms were cleaned every day.

Just completed a 4 night stay at Waikiki Circle a couple of days ago. I didn't know what to expect after reading some of the reviews but I was pleasantly surprised. Shawn who checked me in was a delight, he even remembered my name when he saw me during my stay. He was very helpful answering my questions and explaining everything at check in. I kept reading tge rooms were small but I had an ocean view room and the only thing that was small in the room was the shower. The room was extremely clean, one of the cleanest I've ever stayed in. Beds were comfortable. Kudos to Housekeeping. Everyone there was very friendly and I felt safe. It was one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed in. You didn't hear people out in the hallway and only heard a door slam a couple of times. The elevators were very quick even though the hotel was sold out. The location and views were awesome, can't be beat. Only a couple things I wish were a little better, air conditioner was a little noisy, shower was small and would have liked the hot water to have been hotter and they needed more parking. I always found a space to work but think they could use more spaces. This hotel is truly a gem and I will be staying there again.

First of all, I will say that the rooms are quite small. If you are OK with this, then let me continue. The Hotel is a rather interesting cylinder shaped hotel that is dwarfed by the surrounding properties. That cylinder shape leads to some fantastic views out of your balcony. I reserved a partial ocean view room for my son and me. When we arrived, we were delighted to hear that they ran out of these rooms and upgraded us to a full ocean view on the 11th floor. We stayed in unit 1107 which faced the southwest of the ocean. What was so cool about this unit is that you could also see the homes on the hillside to the north! The room was clean as a pin. The beds were extremely comfortable. The bath featured a standup tile shower. There was a table with the TV and a desk near the back of the room next to a very large closet. The closet had ample space and little cubbys that were perfect for clothes or supplies for the week. There is a small refrigerator in the room, but no microwave. My son is only six, so we both had a lot of space between the two of us. This room would be perfect for a single adult and small child, or a couple with a small child. I would not recommend this for more than two adults due to the smaller size. The housekeeping staff was great, and the front desk was very accommodating. The location is hard to beat. You are on the eastern side of Waikiki directly across the street from a nice swimming area that is protected by waves due to a break wall. Next to that area is a surfboard rental and perfect Waikiki rollers for any level surfer. I managed to surf 3x while I hired a sitter to stay in the room with my son. There is an ABC convenience store very close. You will find yourself popping in there all week long for water, food, souvenirs, etc. What a cool place. There is also a beautiful park that you can walk or drive to. One word of caution; parking spaces are extremely limited at the hotel. I had a car rental for one night and parked in the parking garage (which I had reserved a space earlier that morning). Without that reservation, I would not have been able to park there. The parking is steep; $22 per day. I would say to hire an Uber or Lyft to get around short trips. And don't forget to eat at Eggs n Things downstairs. Awesome stay, I would definitely recommend The Circle Hotel.

right on the beach, just cross the road, and there is a safe swimming area with a rock barrier, and then next to that there is a fantastic surf beach. the water is warm, and clean!! we even saw a turtle swim under us!! the room was small but very clean, the daily staff really nice, the shower was clean, no mould, decent size fridge, comfy beds. there was two adults, we took a bed each. we had enough room. if you had little kids, probably ok, but if id had my 2 late teen kids, we would have been sardines!! desk staff are good, tour desk lady good, if a little bored!! right next door is a eggs and things, you get a 10% discount. its good, but I could not believe people queueing down the street! lots of better, cheaper options with a 100 metre stretch! and no queue. just down the side street next door there are some really great cheap food options, lots of big healthy salads, as well as local traditional food, for around $7-$10 a serve. even the maccas has some good food options, its not all junk, I really enjoyed their southwest salad $6 and the yogurt parfaits $1.89.the hotel is reasonably priced considering anything around it. for the location the price is really fantastic. very close to Lowes, Macys, and the market place. check out the farmers market that's on every second day ust 2 blocks up, and around the corner, (its near hungry jacks) there is also a little 60s diner that has amazing colectables. and the market food was cheap, filling, local, healthy, there is a smoothie place, $5 for 2 big cups, and really delicious! and they are happy to share their secrets. id stay here again.

I recently stayed here with a group of 5 friends (3 in one ocean view room and 2 in partial ocean view room with two double beds in each room). Amenities were perfect for what we needed, comfortable, basic, clean and tidy, great central location and friendly staff. Made our short stay great value for money. Partial Ocean View room was great, can't beat the view. Right across from the beach and walking distant to great shopping. Would gladly stay again for a short trip. Good wifi signal.

My husband and I ended up going to Honolulu for my sister's wedding in November - and having never been to Hawaii I wanted something as near to Waikiki beach as possible so we could both enjoy the sand (we are from Colorado, so the beach is something of a marvel to us). Waikiki Circle was perfect for our needs. Yes, it is very bare-bones simple (the lobby is literally outside and you talk to the desk service through a window similar to a movie theater's). We had a rental car, and since the on-site garage was full constantly, we were given directions to a parking lot a few blocks away in which we had to pay for on a daily basis. The parking problem seems to be normal for the area, so was not too big a deal for us. We were lucky to get a room almost to the top floor, so the view was spectacular! The beach is literally across the street, and the hotel is pretty much in the middle of Waikiki beach - how much more convenient can you get?The room was small, but clean, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. If you are budget-minded like we were, and care more for location than hotel perks, you cannot beat the Aston Waikiki Circle!

You just cannot beat the location of this Hotel! Center of everything and across the street from Waikiki Beach. Great Breakfast place right next to the Front desk, McDonalds and ABC store within a few feet of front of building. The rooms are on the smaller side, but really... What more do you need?

I needed a last minute hotel and the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel did not disappoint! The location and views are perfect - the beach is across the street, and if you're lucky, you'll get a beach view from your lanai. The staff were super nice and helpful, storing my bags for hours at a time. The room was small, but super cute, and just what I needed. Skip the egg place. It was fine, but nothing spectacular. Actually good breakfasts are hard to find on the strip.

I have stayed at the Waikiki Circle Hotel more than 40 times since 1973. Rates are very reasonable for Waikiki. The hotel has been updated in the last few years and the rooms are bright and comfortable with A/C, refrigerator and large screen TV with video games. The front desk and housekeeping staff are uniformly pleasant and helpful. The day manager, Chip, can answer any question you may have. The hotel is directly across the street from Waikiki Beach and close to the zoo, aquarium and the just re-opened International Market Place.
user_name:
Fred B
Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: We were staying in the Waikiki Circle from aug13 to aug16 having booked an ocean front room. We got room 1403 which had a lovely ocean view but as I can read now out of the comment of Manager Kevin this was NOT an ocean front but an ocean view room. So we got less than we had paid for. Sorry, we did not know this so far, as we did not know that there was any difference - we just found out reading the previous reviews. So take care - the hotel seems to try to give you a cheaper room than you have booked. Not good.

This clean and tidy hotel is a great option when you have to be next to Waikiki beach on a budget. It was literally a two minute walk across the road to have your toes in the water and all the action that is Waikiki. Staff was great on check in and we were able to store our bags and explore Waikiki till our rooms were ready. Our flights got in around lunch time, rooms ready around 3pm. The only drawback is that the rooms are small and a bit dated, but good for a couple for a day or two. May be a bit tight for a family or a longer stay.

We had been looking forward to this holiday for years as we had stayed in this hotel back in the 90's and looked forward to seeing the renovated new Aston Waikki Circle Hotel, so decided to splurge and get the Ocean Front Room. Booked and paid through the Flight Centre but unfortunately we were put in a Room with Ocean View.(Room 504). Now we loved this room and the quirky decoration is adorable, but I sort of feel we have been charged for something we didn't get and after travelling 10 hours from Australia for a once in a lifetime holiday, a bit disappointed. In saying all this we loved the Hotel and the staff are really lovely. Thank you to the lovely lady who serviced our room, you were amazing.The beach is straight across the road, McDonalds next doors and the ABC shop just downstairs where you can purchase, food, drinks,and just about anything else you can think of. Only 10 minutes walk to the Honolulu Zoo which I thought was an excellent experience. A great location close to all eating outlets and shopping.There really is a lot to like about this hotel and if I ever get to Honolulu again would stay here but would be a bit more aware about the difference in rooms.

Have stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle a couple of times now, just can't beat it for price, location & awesome staff!!I have stayed in both a standard and Ocean front room, both are the same inside but obviously the views in the ocean front are amazing. They have everything you need in a room, coffee / safe / small fridge / luggage area. Bathroom is small but totally fine & house keeping are great, always smiling & I always had clean towels when needed and a restocked room. Check-in & check-out is easy. Since flights coming in from Oz always seem to be in the early AM, when staff can't get you in early they take care of your bags while you enjoy some breakfast & the beach. Love the place & have already booked to be back there again in June 2017!!

There's a lot to like about this hotel. It's right across Kalakaua Ave from Kuhio Beach. It's a great spot with great ocean view rooms at a great price.The staff is friendly and helpful but you certainly don't get the aloha spirit at this hotel. You pretty much feel like your at a hotel on the mainland. No Aloha, no mahalo.Depending on the site you book from the pictures can be misrepresented. The ocean feel wit the fish murals definitely looked better on bookit.com then they actually do.You're also better off doing your own research on activities. They have a Pleasant Holidays desk in the hotel, so any questions are automatically referred to the Pleasant Holidays rep. so they can get their commissions. If being referred to a commissioned sales agent for advise on how to get to a place like the Aloha Flee Market or the lack of Aloha doesn't bother you, this is a great hotel. If you expect something more of your Waikiki stay, you may want to look elsewhere.

I really enjoyed my stay here. Arrived early in the morning and got my room right away. The staff at check-in very nice and helpful. Room are great and clean with nice amenities. Location is perfect, facing the beach. Resort fees are OK as you can borrow boards & waterbeds.

Picture showed a nice lobby but then when we showed up you checked in outside. They give you a elevator key to go up to your floor. Rooms are very small, shower was so small I couldn't turn around without hitting the wall. We were there during a tropical storm stayed on 5th floor and the hall way in the morning had towels next to the wall to soak up water.The only pro's was there was movies to rent and your across from the beach and two ABC stores.

We had a great time the view is amazing and we watched the surfing comp. WiFi was hard to get but no worries as McDonald's is really close and they have free WiFi. The zoo is very close aswell we loved waking up looking at the ocean

Great service, great location. The hotel is across the street from Waikiki beach. It was nice to be able to walk 50 feet and go swimming any time we wanted. The balcony are big enough to enjoy without feeling cramped. The on-site parking was a great. Having a rental car and not having to waste time looking for parking made a big difference in the trip. John worked the front desk and was always there with help, advice and a smile. I can't wait to go back.

We booked a full ocean view from the balcony and it was great. We had a third floor apartment which was adequate to see the beach. The hotel is right across the road from the beach. The room was very small. It had two double beds in it. Don't know why as there was no way you were going to fit 4 people in there. A queen or king bed would have been fine. There was only the two of us. The room was nothing flash but it was clean and the beds were comfortable. There was no where to put your suitcases so we left ours on the floor. We could have unpacked but were only there for 4 days so didn't bother.The air conditioner was very noisy but you could cope with that. Being on the sidewalk we found there was a lot of street noise floating up to the room which you could hear even if the air conditioner was on. The staff were friendly and the rate was not too bad for the middle of Waikiki Beach. I would stay here again if we go back. It is very central to everything.

Right across street from popular beach. We had room with semi view and that's exactly what it has--very partial view. Room is small and decor is dated but you pay for location. Wind zipped by windows and was difficult standing on balcony. No lobby. Front 'desk' was outside.

Booked a partial ocean view & was no trouble to upgrade to full ocean view at a very reasonable price. The view was stunning Room had everything needed, shower was a little on the small side but other than that it was clean & adequate. Would stay here again as it is so central

Awesome hotel for a Kamaaina staycation! Parking is great, room is small but adequate. Showers only, no tub. Eggs and Things is a bonus. Waikiki walls for boogie boarding right across the street. Right on Kalakaua avenue, close to the Honolulu zoo.

We really enjoyed staying at the Aston Waikiki Circle hotel for 8 nights.The room we had was on the 10th floor and it was extremely clean, and beds comfortable . The hotel offers 2 free movies to rent at a time which was great when we were up really late at night. The location is perfect, right across from the beach, and beside Mcdonalds and a ABC store. It is also close to the restaurant that serves the garlic shrimp truck food , you will not be able to miss it because it smells delicious. If you love garlic you will love the shrimp truck restaurant with the garlic shrimp, garlic rice, salad, and "freshly squeezed lemonade" and dessert . Those garlic shrimp were so delicious we had to return again.Another plus about the hotel is that they have items you can use at the beach for example life vest, boogie boards, beach mats, etc. The room is small but it is very adequate for the two of us, but who stays in there rooms all day in Hawaii. We would definitely stay again if given the opportunity. Until next time Aloha.......

Stayed here with a friend for 9 nights from 30 June. We had an ocean view room on 13th floor and the view was absolutely stunning. We often sat watching the world go by with a coffee or in the evening, a glass of wine. Room was a bit on the small side but perfectly adequate. Beds were really comfortable and there was always lots of hot water on hand for showers. It is in such a great location, close to everything. Even had our own ABC Store next door which was very convenient. Staff were really friendly (with 2 exceptions) and helpful. The room maid on our floor was such a happy friendly lady and nothing was too much trouble for her. We also used the services of the travel advisor tucked away near the check in area. Would definitely stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others.

Good basic hotel with ideal location just across the road from the family friendly beach .Rooms comfortable - our room with 2 double beds was adequate . As we were only in rooms to sleep this hotel suited us. Service at window at the end of path/drive - always on duty and helpful. Booked ocean view and loved our view.Great breakfast in front of the hotel - long lines tell it all.My daughter booked another room and that reservation was put on my card. Was later reversed but no explanation and no reimbursement of charges from hotel management .

My boyfriend and I stayed here for a few days in an Oceanfront Room which worked well for us! I would definitely recommend paying more for an oceanfront room over an ordinary room which faces the city. Although the room is small and would probably be somewhat tight for a large family, it worked well for the two of us and the sunset views made it all the more worthwhile. The location was great as well and if you have never been to Waikiki before, I recommend staying at a hotel on Kalakaua Avenue over a hotel near Kuhio Street. Hotels on Kalakaua are closer to the beach and Kuhio Street can be a little seedy around night time.

This hotel was excellent value for the money and we had a sea view as well. It is very well located in the centre of the activity. It is very handy to good breakfast places as well as other restaurants.

Very small room but what more do you need! It had 2 double beds & very clean but old. The one thing that I thought they could improve on is to have proper coffee cups. Having paper cups didn't do it for us. We had to go & buy 2 cups so we could enjoy our coffee in the morning. The view was fantastic!! We had a side view & it was great. It's a small hotel with 14 storeys. We had the top floor which gave us a magnificent view of the beach. Overall, it was great!

Stayed here for five nights on our return journey from four weeks in the States. Great location on Waikiki Beach. Rooms were fresh and had plenty of space for two. We had room 506 with ocean views and Waikiki beach opposite. Great! Old A/c's are noisy and can interrupt sleep. Noise off the street is also loud but that is to be expected with the location. Front desk were very helpful, especially Chip. Would recommend the hotel due to location, clean and comfortable.

This hotel is a hard one to score. If there had been two of us instead of four, I would have rated it higher, simply because of value-for-money in this location. It was located in probably the best part of Waikiki Beach - with a great swimming spot just across the road (a lagoon safe for children), and nearer one of the ends of the beach (so, perhaps, a little quieter). The hotel does not have a pool, but we did not miss it with the lagoon area just downstairs. We stayed here twice and had an ocean front room for one of the stays. This was definitely worthwhile as we had a fantastic view from the balcony of the ocean and the street (we spent an evening watching buskers). The room without a view was a bit claustrophobic.On the negative side - the room was very small to accommodate a family of 4. The beds (2 per room) are very small doubles but comfortable enough for 2 people. The problem was that the room itself was small. It would have been OK for 2 people but was a bit crammed for 4. If you are out all day it isn't an issue, but it isn't such a great room to spend much time.The staff were friendly and helpful, but I didn't like the hotel policy of charging my credit card for the amenity fee and deposit, and then having to wait (which took 2 weeks) for this to be reversed after I paid cash on check-out. Many other hotels hold the credit card details but do not place a charge through (although I do not know the policy of other Honolulu Hotels). Also, I object to the hefty amenity fee that apparently covers a couple of cups of coffee, a newspaper and free DVD rental (in other areas the first things are inclusive with the room price and hardly cost the hotel much, and the latter could be charged for individually). I guess this is standard in Hawaii, but I feel it is wrong to add on these charges when the actual amenities provided are so limited.

What a great find! We arrived late in the evening, room key was already coded and waiting for us at the front desk. Walked into the cutest room on the 14th floor, threw open the sliding glass doors to see the most amazing sunset, live Hawaiian music and dancing on the beach! Breakfast downstairs is great - pancakes and coconut syrup are a great treat! Very clean room, nice staff, and the best location imaginable! When we go back, we will definitely stay at the Waikiki Circle Hotel again!

The staff was very friendly and accommodated my request to have a directly ocean-facing room for my wife and 1-year old (there is one strip of rooms that squarely face the ocean from your balcony, our room was 1004). The higher the room the better the view bviously! Everything about the hotel was great, located right on Waikiki beach. There is an ABC store next door for any knick knacks, water/alcohol etc. Great restaurant downstairs called Eggs n Things (there is usually a long line but don't worry - it goes quickly). We had a rental car and there was easy parking directly next to/below the front desk. The cleaning staff was on top of things, our room was spotlessly clean every time we'd return from the day's activities. The only tough thing for us, with a 1-year old, was the fact that there was no bathtub to bathe him in, which made for some interesting showers trying to hold him in the air while washing him. I thought it was hilarious, wife not as much so. Haha. Overall, on a budget this is a great place to stay for your vacation!

Older motel but great location, rooms very clean and practical,friendly staff, right across the road from beach, everything in walking distance and easy access to transportjust go downstairs grab a towel and walk across the road to clean sand and swim in the rock wall area or open beachgreat value for money

Quick & easy check-in by the friendly Steve at the open air reception desk.Room furnished with 2 beds, large screen TV, fridge, tea & coffee machine, an in-room safe, ample hanging & drawer space & a hair-dryer. Decent Wifi available.Bathroom equipped with soap dispensers.We had a partial sea-view room which was fine.An amenity fee of $18.85 per night is applied to your stay to cover wifi, safe, newspaper, in-room coffee, beach towels etc!!10% discount available for Eggs ‘N Things on producing your hotel key, definitely worth queuing up for.Located across the road from the beach. Restaurants & shops found left & right from the hotel. $37 airport taxi to hotel$29 from hotel to airport with Charley’s Taxi

Speedy and friendly checkin. Rooms have been refurbished and although small are clean and functional. Had a full ocean view and loved sitting out on the lanai. Comfortable beds and wifi provided. Housekeepers did a great job cleaning our room and the front desk staff friendly and helpful. The location is close to beach, shops, restaurants and the bus/trolleys. Great value & highly recommended.

Depending on the priorities that you set for your trip, this hotel may be useful. It is in fact centrally located in Waikiki and thus close to everything (beach, shops and restaurants). However, the rooms are really small (there are two twin beds, but -in my opinion- there is not enough space for 4 people in a single room), the bathroom is tiny and only has a shower (no bathtub). At times, it may be noisy as well.
user_name:
marcolmn
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed 2 nights at Aston Waikiki Circle back in May before heading to Kauai, and whenever I will be back in Honolulu this will be again my hotel of choice. It's certainly an old building and it shows, but also has the historic charm and character of a 1960s Honolulu hotel tower and gives you a hint of how this location looked like back in the days, I thought that was quite cool. I stayed on the second highest floor in a ocean front room, and enjoyed views out of this world. I had to actually force myself to leave the room at times, so awesome to sit on that balcony looking over Waikiki beach and the endless ocean, there's really nothing that could top this view! I watched the first surfers paddling out at 5.30am right from my bed, and the sunset from my balcony, stunning. Apart from the views I experienced a lot of other positives about: nicely done up hotel room, everything in a good condition, no major wear or tear, tasteful ocean colors, enough space, really good bed, VERY clean, excellent housekeeping, very friendly check in and check out procedure, luggage storage, I felt very well looked after. Excellent location just across the road from the beach and in the midst of shopping etc. Yes this is a noisy location but remember it's Honolulu! This hotel is great value for money - in my opinion top scores.

The location and price are the real perks of this hotel. With Waikiki Beach just outside the front door, and located smack in the middle of great shopping and restaurants, this hotel is well placed. The rooms are small, but we didn't spend much time there. Good wireless internet was provided. The hotel is well taken care of and upgrades for security were underway while we were there. The front desk staff, especially John, were always present and helpful.If there is one complaint it's the very noisy air conditioning-and the fact that our room, 207, overlooked the garbage dumpsters.

We booked this hotel while through an agent in Canada, unfortunately it was on Memorial day weekend and there was not a lot on offer. We were happy we found this little gem. While the rooms are smaller than most hotels and a bit dated this hotel had plenty to offer. It is very central to Waikiki Beach, Our room 1004 had 180 degree views of Waikiki Beach absolutely beautiful. Room was clean and comfortable, serviced daily. The complimentary DVD hire system and beach towel set up was great, staff were friendly and very helpful. Tina from the tour desk helped heaps in booking tours and shows. Overall a great little hotel giving excellent value for money. I have no problems recommending this hotel

Stayed for 14 nights at this great hotel! They have no meals, but thats ok your not there for the hotels food! It's close to everything you need to do in Waikiki, 100 steps to the beach and 300 steps to the Trolley stop thata takes you around Waikiki and Honolulu! Great views to the beach and the sea!

Great location, great view. An older building with smaller rooms but but we'll worth the money you pay. Nice waking up each morning to the sound of waves crashing in on the lagoon wall and on the beach.

My wife and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle hotel whilst visiting Hawaii for my daughter's destination wedding. The wedding was on the north shore near Sunset Beach but we chose to stay in Waikiki.Our hotel was conveniently located directly across the road from Waikiki Beach and within easy walking distance of a multitude of places for food and shopping. We were on the 8th Floor with a full ocean view and it was an amazing view each morning. Whilst the hotel is a bit dated, it was always clean and functional. We never had long to wait for lifts. The staff were all very helpful and obliging. Downstairs near reception was a tour guide who helped us book cars and activities.If we visited Waikiki again we would stay there again.

This hotel was what we were looking for.Excellent location Waikki Beach right across the road and the views were awesome and walking distance to most restaurants and shopping.The famous Eggs n Things is located at the front of the Hotel we got a 10% discount off our food because we were staying there.The Hotel is older the rooms are small but very comfortable with two double beds and very clean.The price was excellent for the location compared to the other Hotels.The staff were friendly and helpful and we would stay there again so if on a budget this is the Hotel.

Wow you couldn't get a better location-in the heart of Waikiki across the road from the beach. We booked 3 rooms as I was celebrating my 50th and our adult children also came with us. We booked one ocean view room and we could see and hear the hula performances that they had on the beachfront celebrating Mele Mei. The other two rooms were the standard rooms, but when we arrived they upgraded both rooms for partial views - so a big thank you to Kev :). The rooms were comfortable and cleaned daily with two double beds in each room - but when your in the thick of things we didn't spend a lot of time in the rooms.
