All the staff were so friendly and accommodating. I just want to mention Tina from the activities desk, friendly and helpful-even when our bus to Pearl Harbour didn't show. It was a memorable experience - Mahalo Hawaii.

The location of this hotel will leave nothing desired! Right on the waikiki beach, on the shopping strip, close to Hanauma bay and a short car ride to Pearl Harbour. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The hotel itself could use a little updating, but for the purpose of somewhere to sleep and to store our belongings, it was great!

We were upgraded from partial to full ocean view. fantastic views. Rooms are small but efficient, how much time do you spend there except for sleeping. Very Clean, staff were friendly and helpful. Right across the road from Waikiki beach. Can't get any better than that.If we go back, would stay again. Loved it.

Waikiki is my favourite destination for years. A second long stay at Aston Waikiki Circle was I expected for: a perfect location, a good service, a friendly staff. Amazing view, right across the beach.
user_name:
Cristian R
Vina del Mar, Chile

review_body: This hotel is so central for the price you pay, it is unbelievable value. We were fortunate to be on the 13th floor with partial ocean views. In the afternoon there was nothing better than having a few drinks on the balcony as there was no afternoon sun on us. I would highly recommend this hotel. Some people may comment that they are small rooms. The room size suits a couple even though there are two queen size beds. I recommend only putting in one couple per room. Front desk is very helpful as well.

Stayed here prior to a cruise and found it to be a budget type hotel - no real amenities to speak of, however the position is fantastic - right on the beach. The reception or open air lobby is slightly off putting but the room was very clean, smallish in size with a balcony from which we could partially view the sea. Free wifi was a real bonus - the only downsides were a rather compact ensuite and an extremely noisy wall air conditioner, so bring your earplugs!

May 04th - 09th. Our recent stay at the Waikiki Circle was exactly what we wanted. Convenient location directly across from the best beach area, lots of convenient shops and awesome view.We were on the top floor in1406, and although this is one of the smallest hotels on the strip we wouldn't have wanted any other hotel. quick and easy to exit elevator and your almost on the street - then go stock up at the ABC store right next door and head to the beach. Rooms were small but clean, and WIFI was great. We would definitely return..

Our 5th floor room was not spacious but more than enough for 2 people. Great beach and ocean views from our balcony. Only real drawback was the noise from the in-wall air conditioner, significant street noise even in the early hours of the morning and the fact that our room faced the doors to some fairly old elevators. Reception staff were friendly and efficient but could not provide us with 2 wine glasses for the room.

When you arrive in paradise, you don't care where you sleep!! lol What I loved most about this hotel was the history. There is a large framed picture/tribute to the original woman who started the hotel. Cool story. I felt honored to be staying there, if only for 2 nights. This is an older establishment, built in the 1950's. It has been well taken care of and refurbished several times. Our room was small with 2 full size beds but had been updated with new carpet, tile, etc. Clean and so very close to the beach. Just walked across the road! Beach towels were provided for you. Kinda noisy at night with the street right outside your window. We had a front ocean view balcony. Definitely used my earplugs. But I was just so pleased to be so close to the beach and so tired from previous travel..... I didn't care!!! Very close to all the shopping and restaurants along the Waikiki strip. There is an $18 amenity fee that we felt was unnecessary. Staff was great. Sometimes our key card wouldn't work, took 3 tries sometimes. There is a restaurant right next to it. Didn't eat there, but it was always very busy.

This hotel completely surprised me. I had no expectations whatsoever booking this place. Generally speaking I would stay at a Hyatt or Westin but I was with family who is on a budget. The place is smack dab in the middle of the hustle and bustle and across from the beach. The rooms are simple but clean. Yes the bathroom was on the smaller side and the shower was tiny but not in s sense that I was shocked. You have a fridge in the room and a coffee maker as well as a safe, hairdryer and wifi. You get the newspaper and free beach towels. We also had a parking spot and during our 5 day stay never had a parking problem. Spaces are small...but really, so is my garage in the city of SF...no biggie. There is a restaurant called Eggs n things which is always busy! But the line moves fast: you order, pay, get seated, served and leave. Food is pretty good! The service: wonderful. Everyone on the staff was extremely friendly and helpful with any of our requests. We rarely heard the other guests, but if you are on a floor with kids, I can see the round shape would be an issue with noise traveling. Don't forget: you are on Waikiki beach...it will be noisy and you will see some unsavory things...it's not a quaint tiny beach town but a big city with beach access. All together, if you are on a budget this is the place to be. Splurge on the ocean front room, it's worth it!

Beautifully situated across the street from the beach. Rooms are on the smaller side but immaculately clean and fairly newly decorated in a 50's retro beach theme. My friend and I were delighted with the quaint decor! Our room was 'ocean view' rather than 'ocean front' and so we enjoyed not only a lovely ocean view but also a lovely mountain view through the taller hotels behind this one. The staff were very friendly and most helpful. The price was better than most hotels with free parking and an optional daily amenities fee for use of WiFi, a Gameboy/DVD player, and free DVD rental of even recently released movies. There is also a restaurant on the property. We didn't use it but read good reviews. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again!

We had never been to Oahu, or indeed Hawaii, and as my nephew was getting married on the island we jumped at the chance of a lifetime. The Aston Waikiki Circle was a real find. Central to every thing and reasonably priced and we were very pleasantly surprised. We booked an ocean view room and what a great view we had, Palm trees, sun, sea, sand and surfing. We expected nothing less.The room we had was adequate in size but nicely decorated and furnished. We had tea/coffee making facilities and a fridge to keep water/drinks in. The wardrobe, as well as having a good quantity of hangers, also had a free safe. We only had a shower room but that suits us anyway.Although the hotel was reasonably priced the room had a high end feel about it, it was kept clean every day, with friendly staff. The bathroom had guests toiletries and hair drier, and in the bedroom there was a good sized TV and programmes - other than just news - to watch, we really did not need much more, it was a shame that we were not staying longer than 6 nights.we would definitely stay there again.

My wife and I stayed on our honeymoon two out of eight nights (we wound up arriving earlier than expected). The hotel and staff were absolutely perfect. I booked with a third party which I don't typically like doing, however we got such an incredible rate that it was worth it. Kevin Wong went above and beyond for our stay. He upgraded us to an ocean view room and ensured that the roses I ordered were in the room prior to our arrival. My wife and I were ecstatic after a long day of traveling to have a smooth, easy check in, clean room, and breathtaking view. If you are looking for a hotel that is clean, kind, and discounted I would definitely stay here. The beach is also right across the street...extra win!

Wanted to stay at a reasonably priced hotel on Kalakaua Ave. and this hotel was as perfect as one could ask. Right smack in the middle with everything within walking distance. The beach was literally across the street while the bus stop was a minute's walk. Most restaurants and shopping areas were within 5-10min walk as well. Will definitely stay again!

This hotel is a bargain! For its location, it's customer service. It's not fancy by any means but who spends their days in a hotel room while in Hawaii! Aston Waikiki circle does the job. You can't beat the convenience of this location. We also loved, loved all the sweet hotel staff. Especially Tina! We will definitely be back!

I really enjoyed my stay here,not only you get the most amazing view possible but you have many perks as well. Starting with the location of course, you are across the street from the beach and in center location either to go shopping or go exploring to the other side. We also got 10% off from the Eggs n Things that is just below and the best part is that we never had to wait as we would order a takeout and eat at balcony with our own amazing view, they also have a movie rental machine in which you can rent as many movies as you like included in your price. They give you beach towels at the front desk when you want to go to the beach as well. If you are looking for something nice at a reasonable price, this is your place.
user_name:
carolinasF4781HI
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for 7 nights and chose it for its location in Waikiki. It's right in the middle of the action so it was perfect for us travelling with our 5 month old son. You could walk out the elevators and be in the ABC store in 2 mins. The hotel staff were all super lovely! We had arrived at 8am and they were able to check us in early (THANK GOODNESS as we had not slept on the flight at all) so we were able to have a nap and freshen up before heading out to explore Waikiki.It is a basic hotel, however the location and the amazing staff made it great value for what we were after. We had an 8th floor ocean view room which was spectacular. Bed was ok, pillows were terrible and flat. Shower is fine. Small fridge was helpful (buy fresh pineapple, yoghurt from ABC store and have it for a cheap brekkie - yum!). We requested a kettle (to have boiled water for baby formula) which was no problem. And they let us use their staff microwave to sterilise stuff. No pool, but the beach across the road was perfect for the little guy. It's enclosed so lovely gentle waves. The wi fi was great!!TIP: The aircon is really noisy (it seems to turn itselfs on to cool the room everytime it goes below a certain temperature), just switch the function to FAN and it will just hum along all night and keep you cool at the same time. This is more for parents travelling with a bub who might be a light sleeper. A HUGE thank you to the lovely Jan and "The Goddess" Naomi on the front desk who made us feel so welcome and were always helpful and lovely. I was a bit sceptical of booking this hotel as it looked a little too budget, but after staying here I highly recommend this hotel if you are after a great location.

Excellent hotel. Clean, small rooms but all you need for Honolulu. Everything's walkable from this location. Front desk staff were knowledgable and attentive to all requests. Resort fee was a bit of a joke... if you're in Hawaii, I pray you're not renting DVD's or playing PlayStation in the room but rather out exploring the city. But the included beach towels came in very handy. Recommend not parking... take taxis, Uber and busses (excellent, safe, cheap transit system across Oahu) as I heard the parking rate is high at this place. Would recommend this hotel, but even other cheaper options a block or two from the beach would be okay too.

If you're looking for fancy and upscale, you're looking in the wrong place. But if you're looking for a spectacular view, along with a friendly and courteous staff, then you've come to the right place. The staff was invaluable in directing my wife and me to buses, restaurants, tours, shopping, and whatever else Oahu had to offer. The spectacular views of early morning activity was surpassed only by the indescribable beauty of the sunsets. The rooms, while a little small by most standards, were clean and comfortable. The room size wasn't a factor because we weren't in the room that much, anyway. Even without an oceanfront view this hotel is a bargain by Waikiki standards, and being situated directly above one of the most popular breakfast diners at the beach makes it all the more special.

The Aston Waikiki Circle has a perfect location right opposite the beach, near the Duke statue.Whilst the room is on the smaller side, it offers two double beds, bathroom and a desk area with wardrobe and mini fridge. In room wifi, papers daily, free DVD hire, serviced daily are other features. Resort fee was only $18 per day.The rooms are clean and tidy. We had an ocean view room on the 14th floor. It was an amaising view from the balcony and was safe enough to leave the sliding door opened at night to let fresh air in rather than using the air con.We didn't have a car, so the location was perfect and central to all resturaunts, trolley bus and beach right across the road.You can often score some floating lilo, ring, beach mats, umbrellas and chairs that visitors have purchased and donated to the hotel. Just help yourself and return when finished for the day.Front desk staff were friendly and nothing seemed a problem.Tour desk can help with organising tours and Tina was so lovely and helpful. She would wave and say hello and ask how your day was.Overall it is a great place if you don't need fancy or pretentious staff and visitors. No pool but didn't need as the beach is steps away.

Compact room, made good use of space. Comfortable bed, efficient shower, small fridge in room. Our room was at the top, on the side of building so great view of the beach to the south though couldn't see the sunset. Fast wifi but no security on network.

While the location is very good, but the facility is inadequate and I question the honesty of the room service staff. I left my cell phone on the bad within three hours, despite repeated requests to look for my cell, I did not get much help from the staff. The front desk is indifferent and the roof service crew is not helpful at all. Management should educate their staff with better attitude and service.

We were on a late flight (arrived at 9:30 pm) and were headed to the North Shore the following day. But we wanted to maximize our time and experience in Waikiki. The Aston Circle was perfect, with a Oceanview. The staff was super friendly and let us check out late so we could enjoy the beach in the morning. The rooms are smallish *but unique). The history of the hotel is also quite interesting.

This hotel was booked through an agent so we didn't know when booking about the free DVD rental, towels, ice, newspapers etc that you get whilst staying at Aston Waikiki circle, these were nice touches.Car parking is charged at $23 per night plus tax which is reasonableIn comparison to other places. Our room was great: they said it had a partial sea view: from the balcony we could see right down Waikiki beach, a fab view.We were on the 8th floor, the hotel was really quiet noise wise considering its location.We got 10% off at the eggs n things below by showing our room key.There was a fridge in our room to store water etc and there was maid service everyday.Nothing fancy but clean rooms, friendly staff and just over the road from the beach: a great place to stay in Waikiki.

We didn't find this to be great value. We had stayed at the Aston Waikiki on the way from Oz to the US mainland, and stayed here on the way home. Not the winner!. The location was fine (though we prefer the swimming area at the Diamond Head end of the beach). The view from the room (Ocean View Room) was lovely as long as you looked towards the sea but our room was above the skip bins on the neighbouring building (not picturesque but hard to ignore because of the smell)Check in was ... was ... was ... well, I can't say much about it ... not friendly, not rude ... just not interested, total absence of "aloha" or any sort of cheery welcome. The lift was a struggle with the luggage. There didn't appear to be any luggage trolleys and my husband is disabled so it is all up to me and there was no help forthcoming. The room was fine. From reading other reviews I was expecting it to be small, and it was. But the lanai and the view balanced that out (but we had an equally good view at the Aston Waikiki Beach and it was a much more pleasant experience)

As many other guests have commented, the rooms are very small... but does that really matter when you are right across the street from Waikiki Beach? We were upgraded to an ocean view room on an upper level. Beautiful views. The bed was comfortable. The shower was small and did not have good pressure, but as I said, we were on an upper level. The staff was friendly. You get a discount at the breakfast restaurant that shares the open air lobby. Great location for the price!

Flew out for a short stay and booked a stay based on previous reviews. Had a great stay, very convenient to all of Waikiki as well as much of Honolulu and the Diamond Head area if you like to walk or take the bus. I rented a car but didn't use it at all for 3 days-beware parking here is very limited and expensive. Lots of places to shop and eat nearby so there is always something to do if you tire of the beach right across the street. I booked the lowest rate but received an oceanfront upgrade and it was the best view I've ever had at an oceanfront hotel. The rooms are recently redone, not super plush, but great for the price and unique architecture of the rooms. Overall a great choice for a quick stay in the area or if you are in the area on business.

I was debating whether to give this 2 or 3 stars, but I just can't say this property was average. 2.5 would probably be more fair in my opinion. My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights before having to move to another hotel because of availability issues (not hotel's fault, we decided to book that way). We opted to pay a bit extra for the ocean view room. Now, the view and location are excellent, but there are a lot of hotels in Waikiki that are nicer and offer a better value. When we checked in the woman at the desk was very friendly, but the man there at the time was not - he just seemed bored and disinterested even when we tried talking to him. We were having problems with our parking remote during our stay, and he just wasn't that nice when we told him about the problem. The rooms themselves are small and all have two twin beds. I knew this going in, but decided to stay here anyway since the hotel had ocean views. My wife and I were typically gone around the island during the day, and we just didn't feel we were coming back to a comfortable room afterwards. Also, if you're going to be gone most of the day think about whether the ocean views are really worth it for just a little bit of time in the morning and afternoon. The hotel tacks on an $18 dollar resort fee, which allows you to rent DVDs, but it's really a rip off. We stayed at another hotel not on the beach, about a 5-10 minute walk away during our last 2 nights and the staff and room were just at a much higher level than this place AND the room was cheaper with no resort fee. Despite being right across the beach, I'll skip this place on my next visit to Oahu.

We booked a room with sea views at this hotel and were given a room which was no bigger than a cupboard and if you had a neck like a giraffe you might just have managed to glimpse the sea.. We asked for and got an upgrade, at extra cost, to a room at the front overlooking Waikiki beach which was much bigger with terrific views over the bay

We stayed at this hotel in 2013 and enjoyed it's great location just across the road from the beach, the balcony view of Waikiki's glorious sunsets, and the friendly staff. We stayed again, this time in room 805, an ocean front room. If you're going to stay on Waikiki Beach, you really should pay the extra for an ocean front room...great views and ocean breezes. The downside is that the hotel is right on the busy Kalakaua Ave. so road noise can be a problem, especially early in the morning when delivery trucks and street cleaning vehicles start their days. If a light sleeper we suggest you stay as high as you can. If you don't think you will be bothered we suggest something a bit lower, around the 8th to 10th floors. Higher and the "people watching" from your balcony won't be as good. We also feel that the ocean front rooms ending in a "4" (i.e. 804) have the best angles or views. The hotel is an older property but has been newly remodeled. It looks fresh, the room was clean the shower good and the beds were comfortable. Our room rate was discounted for adults 50 or older. There is a $23.04 self-park fee (parking is limited) and a daily $18.85 mandatory amenity fee. The amenity fee covers WiFi, in-room safe, daily newspaper, refrigerator, DVDNOW, Local/1-800 calls and in-room coffee/tea. There is a laundry on site but we did not use it. The restaurant Eggs 'N Things is located next to the lobby. At sunset on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday there is a free hula program across the street in the park. You can watch it from the balcony but it is too good not to go to the park to watch the fun.When we made our reservation we reserved at the rate shown on line. When checking the hotel's web site several weeks later it showed a significant rate reduction. A simple call to the hotel secured the new reduced rate. We really appreciated that.We will likely stay here again on a future trip and can easily recommend this hotel.

We had an ocean view room... 904!It really was fabulous!Parking was a breeze!Full on wakiki beach energy so it was a fun intro to Hawaii ! We did road trips every other day and enjoyed wakiki in between !Great service! Wow so friendly I felt so welcome !It was inexpensive for the area but I suggest pay the extra for the ocean view it was sublime!TY to the staff, you were beautiful!

We stayed two nights, and from the start we were told we had only booked for one night, although I had confirmation we had paid for two. Not a great start. The 'reception' is a man in a booth you can't hear with the plexiglass safety stuff up, and doesn't inspire confidence of a quality hotel. I was really surprised that it's so low-key, I was expecting a lobby and an actual check in. We booked a king bed; had two of the shortest 'doubles' known to man - our calves were hanging off the end. Not exactly romantic, feeling like you're in a dorm when you expect a king sized bed.We had a partial ocean view, very very small and can sit on the toilet with your feet in the shower. It's clean, neat and does the job, but was expecting more due to rates being what we've paid (and more) for far better quality hotels on the strip. My husband and I both have substantial bruising from hitting the door knobs on the bathroom door as the access area is so small, and actually ripped a hole in our shirt from the unfinished balcony balustrade. Sounds silly, but would hate for a child to be injured by something like that at eye/head level. Would we stay again? Probably not. Have seen better rates for more customer friendly hotels with the same, if not better view, and far superior service.

Had a partial ocean view and it was very acceptable. Rooms are small but nice and clean and the best thing is the price was resonable for Hawaii and a super location. You can't get any closer to the beach and right in the middle of Wakiki stores and restaurants. All the tours pick up right next door and there was never a need to rent a car. I would stay here again.

Ok visited Oahu for the first time in July 2009. Had no idea what to expect. After an 8 hour flight I landed at the HNL airport. We walked through the airport and could immediately smell the sweet floral smell in the air. We made our way to our rental car and began the congested drive to Waikiki Beach. After about a 30 min drive we arrived at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel which isn't much to look at from the outside. We had to drive across the sidewalk and down under the hotel to park. Got out and drug our bags up to the open check in area. I will never forget the wonderful Hawaiian breeze blowing through. The very courteous staff quickly had us checked into our small little corner in paradise. The only draw back was they told us their parking was full and we had to drive 2 blocks down and one block off the beach to the Waikiki Banyon Hotel to park in their garage. At 60$ for a week. I went and parked and my wife stayed back and unpacked. After I walked back to the hotel we walked out onto the partial ocean view balcony and was 100% wowed at the sight before us. Looked down onto the street right dead in the middle of the Waikiki Beach Strip. My wife was exhausted as was I. We flew out of Houston Texas at 8am and landed in HNL at 1:45 PM which was 6:45 PM back home in Texas. She decided that it was time to eat so we walked down to the strip and 2 blocks down to the Cheeseburgers in Paradise and had a couple of very good burgers. After seeing the beach she suggested we go get into our swimming clothes and hit the beach. We had a very relaxing evening on Waikiki Beach. The Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel is right in the middle of the Waikiki Strip. If you do not get a rental this is a great hotel to stay in its in walking distance of everything it seems. The hotel is literally steps away from Waikiki beach just across Kalakaua Avenue. Here are my points for this hotel...The good...,.1. Its one of the best locations on Waikiki beach.2. Its a cheaper option than most of the other hotels.3. The staff is very friendly.4. The most beautiful part of Waikiki Beach is right across the street.5. The activities in the area are numerous. Surfing lessons, paddle boarding, canoeing in the waves, and many other options.6. Rental car isn't needed if you plan on just lounging on Waikiki Beach. The Bad....1. The rooms are small. ( did not affect me much as I was not in my room much).2. You are in a hotel. No bells and whistles. 3. Internet costs a small fortune. ( most places I Hawaii do as well).4. This is not for someone who is used to staying a 4 star establishment.The ugly......I only have 1 ugly1. PARKING<<<<<<<< This hotel does not have enough parking for its guests. Its 1st come 1st serve supposedly. I was there 12 days and checked everyday and was told it was full everyday. I did grow to like the walk to the Banyon but its still a 10 minute walk to my car. Was good exercise though.My final thoughts. If you are a budget conscience minded person this is a great locacation for 4 people or less. I would 100% recommend this hotel for you. If you are a Hilton Rewards Member then its probably not the place for you. There is no on site food or amenities like that. Its got one hug thing in its favor....Location location location. I have stayed here twice and will return for a third trip in July 2017. This will be my 4th trip to Hawaii with 3 times staying in the Circle Hotel right on beautiful Waikiki Beach!!!

Hotel with great location. Although some reviews complained about hotel shape and room’s size, we were very satisfied as we intended to use the hotel just to sleep. We had a two queen beds room which attended us very well. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Its Beach front is also at the best location. Be prepared to pay for parking (USD22 per day, if available) and USD18 fee, also per day. There is no breakfast and the cafeteria at the lobby offers mainly eggs and has always very long waiting lines. Our room was fitted with an empty minibar and coffee machine which was very handy.

These guys totally screwed up my reservation and overbooked the hotel. After waiting around all day, they finally put me up in another property much further from the beach than I wanted. I was never offered a discount or anything else to make up for the error.

It's hard to beat the location - the Waikiki beach is just across the Kalakaua Avenue, a lot of shops and a restaurants within a walking distance. The facility is quite basic and outdated but if you are not going to stay in the room all the time - it doesn't matter and the hotel is very convenient. Beautiful view over the ocean at least from my (1303) and adjacent rooms. Garlic smell on the balcony acceptable. No swimming pool, no lobby, no luggage service - again this in not a luxury hotel but I did enjoyed the stay. With regard to the (lacking) amenities the price seems to be a little bit too high.

I chose this hotel because it's located right in front of Waikiki Beach. We arrived really early and were able to check in straight away and also offered ocean front room for small fees and what a wonderful view of Waikiki Beach. The room is typical Hawaiian hotels' room very compact but that doesn't bother us because we're hardly in the room. I will definitely stay in this hotel again when I'm back to Waikiki Beach. Mahalo!

This was my first time in Honolulu and I wasn't sure what to expect and wanted a basic introduction to Honolulu. I knew I wanted a room with an ocean view, steps from the beach and a great location. This met all my prerequisites. Also considering the prices in Honolulu plus add taxes and resort fees with an Ocean View room and they get very expensive fast. But the Aston Circle was very reasonably priced considering and a very nice hotel. The rooms was recently updated in the last couple years and very clean. The hall ways and elevators were a little outdated. But that would be my only complaint. Objectively this would probably be a 3 to 3 1/2 star hotel but because of the views, value, central location and closeness to the beach I would definitely rate it higher. Especially for someone's first time in Honolulu. The picture is from my room #403.

is so not worth going here there's nothing nice about this hotel it is tiny view is terrible and it smells awful party zone and everybody around here are big-time partiers loud it's obnoxious and it is not in anyway romantic

Took the family on a short trip to Waikiki. Booked an ocean front room and requested the 12th floor. Upon arrival, we got the 14th floor. The room was small, but enough for me my wife and our 8 month old. The view of the beach was amazing. Even better was Naomi at the front desk, who made our stay super welcoming. Thank you Naomi!!

If you're looking for an amazing ocean view and on a budget, this is the hotel for you. I Recommend getting either an ocean front or ocean view room(where we stayed). The hotel is also located right off the beach, perfect if you have no transportation and want to be at the beach for the rest of your stay. However, if you have a car rental, you would need to pay 20/night and park at the underground parking just beside the hotel. Their lot is always full and the first night we stayed we had to park at a structure two blocks away. We also stayed on the 3rd floor on our first night, which didn't have the 'ocean view' that we booked. It's more of the parking lot and entrance view. We requested a room on a higher floor, and the staff gave us options the next morning,we left our luggage in the room and when we came back at night we had the best view ever on the 12th floor and our luggage was also taken care of. The rooms are small, two double beds were okay, pillows were soft. Shower is really small. There's a fridge, ps3 for movies or games, closet,office area. There's no fancy hotel lobby, elevator is outside the hotel, check-in is in a 'booth' right next to restaurant. That's where you also ask for ice and beach towels. This is a basic hotel, but worked for us since we were out all day. My rating goes to the amazing view and location!!

I just laughed when I first saw it against its neighbors; tiny and dated. built in 1962 an anomaly on the beach. The reception desk is behind bulletproof glass. They offered me an upgrade from a partial ocean view to an ocean view for $10/night that while not full on was perfectly fine. The woman behind the "activities" desk was worthless, offering no real advice only wanting to sign you up for some tour or another. There's an Eggs and Things restaurant which was always inexplicably crowded. The rooms might be small if you aren't a veteran traveller, but they were perfectly serviceable and the lanai was great. Close to the Zoo. Of course you pay a resort fee on top of the advertised price which only gets you WiFi and DVD's to watch?Only 14 floors 80 rooms I think, which gives it a sense of intimacy as compared to the corporate megaliths around it. As for Waikiki itself, there is a certain benefit in knowing that you never want to go back to a place again. Crowded, small beach, not much variety or choice in eating establishments, almost none at street level. Its a city of hotels and once you are several blocks off the beach, there is no charm at all.

We stayed at the Aston for 10 nights and loved it we didn't spend much time in the hotel but when we did the staff and room staff were lovely and very helpful. Definately would go back and stay again. The view was amazing definately centre ocean view it almost looked fake!

If you're looking for a hotel in a great location, then this hotel is for you. We had an ocean front room with million dollar views. Rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. Location is fantastic, across the road from Waikiki beach and close to all the restaurants. Staff were friendly and accomodating.

We have stayed here 3 times so far and am looking at a 4th, great location, staff, view and comfy rooms. We pay the xtra for oceanview because the sunsets are great. Can't wait to return to the best part of Waikiki beach

The rooms were very small and needed updating. Having said that, we choose this hotel for the view and position.and that's exactly what we got. It was right across from the beach in the heart of Waikiki. Great for our teens. The staff were so friendly and helpful. The view was breathtaking and we were so happy we chose to stay here

We had a pleasant stay in this hotel. The rooms are very unique. Small but very comfortable with everything you really need. The most amazing feature is the view over Waikiki beach. The sunrise and sunset views are simply amazing. The room service is spot on and the personnel very friendly and forthcoming. We really enjoyed our days in the Aston Waikiki Circle hotel!

If you get the ocean view then for the price, this is fab. Slightly quirky and a little old-fashioned but clean and comfortable with very very helpful staff. A good place to stay to be in the hubbub of Waikiki.

If you're looking for a beachfront Waikiki hotel without breaking the bank, look no further! Our family stayed there for almost two weeks in an ocean front view room on one of the higher floors. We had to upgrade a $10 per night for an ocean front view but it was honestly really really worth it! The view from our room was amazing, directly overlooking the beach so we could see people surfing and had breath taking sunsets without fail everyday. The hotel is situated right in the heart of Waikiki with convenient ABC stores and bus stops near-by within a stone's throw. It is also within walking distance from the aquarium, zoo etc. which makes it very very convenient. Rooms are really reasonably priced considering its location. However, don't expect a fancy hotel lobby with hotel shops, pool and gym. (But Waikiki beach is directly across the street) The rooms are smaller compared to other hotel rooms but really clean and comfortable. Housekeeping services are super fast and accommodating.The staff are extremely friendly and helpful too! John in particular was very attentive and welcoming. He never failed to give you that eye contact to assure you that he would be with you the next minute. Lave as well was kind enough to lend us his personal adapter when we didn't have one as the front desk didn't have one either. Really pleasant and great experience and would definitely be back there! Not forgetting, the personalized Christmas card and Christmas ornament ball that was placed in our room on Christmas day.. that was a very nice touch :)

This boutique hotel couldn't be better situated in Waikiki- right across the street from the beach and in the middle of-everything! The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating- you call the front desk for an extra blanket or whatever and it's at your door in five minutes.Good wifi and million dollar ocean views.

Great place to stay in the heart of Waikiki - walk across the road to the beach, surfboard rentals around the corner, strong wifi, tidy rooms, DVD/PS3 in every room :)The day we arrived there were strong winds and our sliding door onto the deck rattled through the night - spoke to the front desk about it and they immediately upgraded us to a beachfront room - superb. No problem returning to stay there again. Walking distance to Aquarium, zoo, bus stops, etc.

Satyed there for 4 days. The room is comfortable, has a small fridge , AC , internet is reliaible and included. Ther building is a bit old and its half moon shape is reminiscent of Art Deco hotels in Miami Beach, because on its shape, most rooms (more on this in tip section) have a nice view of Waikiki bay where you are treated to a daily spectucal sunset on your balcony. The hotel provides beach towels and you can store your beach gear in a specific area. There is parking (we did not use it), they were charging $20 per night I think. if you don't mind waiting (line ups start at 6h30am), Egg's and things is steps away and serves very good breakfast (recommend pancakes and French toast) and you get 10% off as guest of the the hotel. You also can rent the first 2 DVD free if you care to spend time in the room.Would gladly go back as you can walk pretty much anywhere in waikiki from hotel. Staff is friendly and rooms are well kept.

If you are looking for a Waikiki hotel with incredible views without breaking the bank, look no further. The sliding glass doors here extend the length of the room. We were very happy with our partial ocean-view room where we stayed five nights. Then after a trip to Maui, we stayed here again a few nights before our flight back to cold Minnesota on a higher floor, ocean-front room. Incredible! We left the drapes and sliding door open all night. It was wonderful to hear the waves and see the moon reflect off the water. Husband liked to people watch in the morning while I ran on the beach. Lots of restaurants in the area and the underground parking worked great. There is another parking garage not far away if this one is full. Naomi and Steve made us feel like family when we checked in and upgraded our room. The only thing that could make it better is if the road wasn't there right in front of the hotel. Sometimes the noise woke me up. But since we had the door open, I can't complain. I would definitely stay here again!

Can't say enough how amazing this hotel is. Firstly, this is a great hotel for what the setting of Waikiki Beach is. With the open air lobby, it makes holiday life that easy to walk straight off the street into the elevator and straight to your room. Highly reccommend upgrading your rooms to Ocean Front as to have that luxury of having a break on the balcony whilst the sun sets. As a travel agent for 3 years and having stayed at numerous hotels in Waikiki Beach - This steals the cake. Looking forward to going back there this time next year! OH and the reception staff are really nice and helpful, John is amazing and so is 'The Goddess' !

We stayed at the Aston Circle for 10 nights- the location was absolutely perfect (directly across from Waikiki Beach unlike others whom claim to be) The rooms were well looked after, clean, comfortable and all in working order. I would highly recommend this property to anyone whom wants a central location and comfortable accommodation at an affordable price.

Yes we are here again for another week and we have loved every minute. You can't beat the location and we had a full ocean front room on the 13th floor and the view was magnificent! The staff are very friendly and always happy to help. The rooms are a little on the small side but have everything you need and are very clean and modern. The wifi is easy to connect to and is very fast. We can't wait to come back to Waikiki again and don't want to stay anywhere else

The selling point for this Hotel is its excellent location, right across the road from Waikiki Beach, the views from the Ocean View rooms cannot be beat. If you are offered an upgrade (@$20 per night) it is well worth the extra money as the rooms are very small and having the view from the balcony makes everything better. This is a smaller hotel than most around it, and probably getting a little dated, but the rooms are clean and well maintained. Fronting the Main Street the rooms can be quite noisy, so the higher you are, the less noise. They charge a resort fee (@$18 per night, total rip off, but what can you do) and that gives you internet and a newspaper. Centrally located to everything, pick up locations, bus stops, shops and food, and right across from the beach. Would happily return.

We did a partial ocean view, it had a nice view of the ocean, rooms clean and pie shaped. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend going up on higher floor if possible for less street noise. They did let us do a 1:00 check out since we had a later flight.

During my recent trip to Oahu, i stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel, the location is awesome you are just a crosswalk away from fun on the beach.I spent my first two days with a "Partial Ocean View" room, which had a great view when you were on the deck, then while setting up to use the underground parking I was offered for a small fee to upgrade to a full ocean view. It was well worth it waking up to the beach and watching stunning sunsets from the chairs on the deck.This hotel is also located beside Eggs and things a small restaurant which has a line(worth it) all the time (yes even at 5:30am) as well as many place to do shopping.

This is a budget hotel located just across the road from Waikiki beach. The view from the (see facing) rooms is just great. Our room was at the top floor and was a sea facing room. The budget price tag makes it all the more worth it.ProsAmazing viewsGood pricesGreat locationConsRooms are fairly small and compactThey don't seem to have a restaurant (or it was closed while we were here)The hotel is right on Kalakaua Avenue, so lots of options to shop and eat. Pickup points for the attractions like the Luaus and sunset cruise are also just walking distance.Overall, fantastic value for money.

We have stayed at and reviewed this hotel before and I am writing yet again. This hotel has remained perfect in every way since we first visited in 2006. Since that time the hotel's decore has been updated but some staff, in particular Jan and John on reception and Larry in maintenance, have been at this hotel since our first visit. Jan and John are always friendly, efficient and go out of their way to make us feel welcome and accommdate us with our preferred room choices. Even though we do not know some staff by name, every staff member we have dealings with are always friendly and helpful, our room and the hotel surroundings are always clean and welcoming. The bonuses of this hotel are that it is small enough to not be intimidating by long waits at reception or elevators. Location is right across from the beach and most rooms have magnifient views of the ocean and in particular, the wonderful sunsets. You may have read that the rooms and bathrooms are small and this is true but the positives far outweight this minor issue.

This hotel is probably a 3.5 star but it is clean, has all the amenities you could want and the location is ideal, being, literally, a stone's throw from Waikiki Beach. It is on the Waikiki strip of restaurants, bars and shops. Next door is an ABC store for everything from beer, wine and sushi to souvenirs, sunscreen and basics such as bread, milk etc.The view of the beach is excellent and the staff are very friendly and helpful. It ain't the Ritz but I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Great Hotel-we stayed on the 11th floor with an Ocean front view, just spectacular! The room was very nice and very comfortable, enough room for my friend and I, although bathroom is small its fine- and lets face it how much time do you spend in your room. Great swimming right in front of the Hotel. Outstanding front desk, very helpful, lovely people. I would definately come back and stay :-)

My best friend and I really really liked this hotel. The staff was helpful at every corner and seemed more than happy to make sure we were enjoying ourselves.The hotel has a DVD rental kiosk and you are able to rent unlimited DVDs, up to two at a time, to use with the PS3 the room has (awesome!). And they have current and up to date titles as well.The hotel is also connected to "Eggs N' Things Eggspess" restaurant - this is the best breakfast I think I've ever had. My Uncle recommend this place and it did not disappoint!! WELL worth it.The room was small-ish. Two queen size beds and a large nightstand nearly took up the width of the room and the bathroom was kind of small, compact rather. But it was perfect for what we wanted as we didn't want to spend the day(s) in the hotel room.We got a partial ocean view and once you stepped onto the deck...it was perfect. Also the sliding door opens so half the room is exposed - *that* was nice. The black out curtains were nice and the sun came through on the sides and top - but I'm not complaining as that helped in the waking us up. Also - the A/C was amazing.The beds (and linens) were comfortable, not the best but certainly not the worse - the pillows were awesome though. However - the towels had an odd smell. Almost like too much bleach and too hot of a dryer smell - and they were rough.The room didn't smell, which was really nice. Sometimes you get that "hotel stench" or "we just cleaned" smell. Nothing like that here - and I think it is because when they clean they have the sliding door open to air it out.Overall if I ever come back to Oahu/Waikiki I would stay here again. Directly across from the beach, a smaller hotel (only 14 floors) and towards the end of the Waikiki strip. It's a really nice hotel and I do highly recommend it.

Me and my wife stayed here for a week for our holiday, on arrival the staff were very polite and helpful. When we got into our rooms they were clean and well presented, the bathroom was very clean too and all the rooms had balconies that you could sit on and relax, the views from the balcony were ok from the room as you could look over the beach and watch some beautiful sunsets. There were two large small beds in the room that would not sleep two people in each so me and the wife had to have a bed each, this was ok though as the rooms were stuffy but when you have the air con unit on made the room like a freeze that was really nice after you have been on the beach all day.The hotel was 50 yards from the beach, and this beach was very clean. The hotel also give you towels to go over to the beach and these are collected from the front desk and they were clean and very helpful, as I don't like to have sand all over my room which this stopped.The hotel room cleaning service was great and they were very helpful and took pride in the job they did, one day we didn't want the room cleaned but they came to our door with clean towels anyways which was very nice of them and they took the one's we had. The hotel it's self is in a great location as it is very close to some really nice restaurant's and bars if this is what you are looking for and if you are looking for shopping then there are loads of very good shops for miles as well.The room had a key safe in the walldrobe that was very helpful, you also get a coffee machine as well. The TV had a great selection of channels for when you were chilling in your room. The only thing that I believe was missing from this hotel was there was no bar there, however this is trivial as there are loads near by that we went to.

A1, I love this place and am already planning my return next year! This place is clean, friendly and just so close to everything. The room is on the smaller side but who cares your in Waikiki! The bathroom is modern and really clean...I love it, we had an ocean front room on the top floor and to wake up the night after arriving and seeing that view was just spectacular. The Saturday night had the markets on smack bang in front of the hotel which was fantastic too. The Circle supplies beach gear like inflatable lilos and rings plus noodles (big shame that some of the #@*ole guests don't look after the stuff & ruin it for others) they also supply the beach towels. We aren't so petty to worry about what the foyer looks like I think it's fabulous being open air, the desl for rentals and tours is very friendly and worth visiting. Highly recommended...:)

Just spent 3 nights at this hotel, a few things that brought this place down. When my wife and I first arrived the front desk man seemed uninterested in providing much in the way of help. The security guard was sitting on a beach chair playing on his phone. I was sent to another location to park my car since their lot was full and I had to make two trips since the desk man did not provide me with enough information about what payment was needed. The room was clean with a good view but it was so noisy we could not get a good sleep. We could hear everything from the outside and inside of the hotel, no sound proofing at all. $20 per day to park the car, make sure you get there early to park at the hotel or you will be parking 3 blocks away. The car park smells like a garbage dump and you have to drive over a sidewalk through pedestrians to get onto the street.The only upsides were the location (very central), clean room (with good view) and the beach was right across the road.

The Aston Circle provides reasonably-priced rooms (for Waikiki) in an ideal location. The rooms and bathrooms are small and the beds are just full size, but the room is clean and contains the essentials. The front desk staff are helpful. When travelling from the airport or to sites within Honolulu, use shuttles or the bus rather than teh outrageously priced taxis.

Many of the reviews are focused on the view at this hotel. Yes, it has a great view IF YOU SCORE A ROOM WITH A VIEW. My room was looking at the hotel next to us and at the parking lot. I was surprised to see so many high ratings for this hotel based on that criterion alone.If you have a rental car be aware that you may not be able to park at the hotel. At check in we were informed that the 22 parking garage spaces were filled and we needed to park at the garage approximately 1/2 a mile away ($20 per day, cash only). To access the hotel with your car you have to cross one of the busiest sidewalks in Waikiki and then pull off a 5 point turn to exit the hotel (not fun). My next clue that this was a sub-par hotel was that the check in window has a glass front between you and the staff (there must be a reason for that and it's weird).After exiting the elevator you'll feel like you are in a cheap Mexican spring break hotel and there is no key card access required to access the floors of the hotel. In a previous review, the management of this hotel reported that key card access is required to use the elevator, THIS IS NOT TRUE. That means that any Yahoo off the street can gain access to your floor and be at your door. The lock on the sliding glass door had been previously tampered with which indicated to me that there is a problem with break-ins (further confirmed with them recommending the use of the in-room safe). Due to those signs, I barricaded my door to the hallway at night.The wind noise howled through the room all night. My co-worker reported that his deck furniture shifted back and forth throughout the night. The in-wall AC unit never turned off all night (annoying).The rooms themselves are tiny. You can almost take a shower and sit on the toilet at the same time. Beds are tiny too.I have stayed at 4 different hotels in Waikiki (on government per diem rates) and this one is the worst thus far. The only positive things that I have to say about this hotel is that the staff was friendly and the room itself was very clean. All 5 of my co-workers and I checked out after one night and they agree with this assessment.

Although the rooms aren't big, they have every amenity including AC, bar fridge, tv with facility to play music and dvd, hair dryer and the best of all......a balcony large enough for chairs and a small table to enjoy a wine and nibbles (courtesy of the ABC store next door) while taking in the wonderful view along the beach and beyond. We had paid for a beach view room but friends were next door in a 'partial sea view' room and still had a really good outlook to the water. The $18+ per room/per day added 'amenity' fee gave us a daily newspaper, free video hire, use of beach towels and wifi. The staff were courteous and helpful and the rooms cleaned to a very good standard each day but the main attraction of this hotel was its proximity to the beach and the strip. We would stay here again.

We stayed here from 6th - 17th Sept. On arrival we were given the opportunity to upgrade from our partial ocean view to a ocean front unit for a reasonable cost. We did this and don't regret it, the views were amazing. We could lie in bed and watch the ocean, the sunsets were awesome every night. The hotel is in a great location, is clean and tidy and you can walk everywhere or catch The bus or shuttle to nearby shops and food outlets. We did not book any tours through the hotel but we did access brochures and information. The reception staff were always friendly and helpful and provided beach towels on request. We ran out of tea bags in room and were given more. The room comes with a coffee percolator but we asked for a kettle and this was also provided free of charge. Check in and out was quick. We stayed in room 1105 and can highly recommend. We had 3 adults sharing a room and we had plenty of space. In other reviews people say room and bathroom very small but we found this room adequate with a built in wardrobe and drawer and shelf space and the balcony was a decent size too. You cross the street and you are at the beach, the location is the best. Thanks for a wonderful stay and your friendly hospitality.

This hotel has few amenities, standard size room, clean, location in the middle of everything and request an oceanview balcony room, floor 5 or higher. Enjoy morning coffee on your balcony and watch the scores of surfers out to catch those first waves.

The room was small but the view made up for this! This hotel does not have its own restaurant or bar but is located right in the action of Waikiki Beach so Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner and no problem to find!

This may be a slightly older and smaller hotel compared to some of the newer hotels in the area but it is still very clean, tidy and sheets and towels changed every day - it is right on the beach front and centrally located to all the shops, restaurants and night life so you dont have to go far to find something to do etc - it isn't a fancy hotel but you do get two double beds which is great if you can't sleep due to heat etc, big balcony so enough room to sit out and enjoy the scenery - best to ask for a room with a sea view - no facilities for eating within the hotel itself and no pool but you are right above a breakfast place and right on the beach so no big deal for us - Hotel will give you a beach towel to take out with you and you just drop it back off when you return - we did a couple of trips when we were there - Pearl Harbor (including Punchbowl cemetery) I found this disappointing due to the fact that we didnt get to spend a lot of time at Pearl Harbor and i think if you organised a taxi and bought a ticket for Pearl Harbor direct you would be able to spend more time looking at the museum, exhibits, it is a sombering experience and a definite must if you come here - we also did a island tour including swimming with turtles, dole pineapple factory, and some of the other sights this was a good day out and we just booked this from a vendor on the street - got a great bargain including lunch - all in all hotel was great base for our holiday, no point spending lots more money when this did everything that was needed and was clean tidy and well located

After spending hours sorting through all the various hotel options and reviews for Waikiki, we decided on this retro-boutique hotel to fit our needs (and budget) for our recent honeymoon! The location is perfect!! Located right across the street from the beach and the lanai is a wonderful location to people watch and surf watch! The rooms are quaint with all the necessary ammenities- including refrigerator- very important for those late night cocktails on the lanai!The bathroom was a bit small but very functional. Overall, a great buy for the money and the location! Also, every trip we booked picked up right around the corner so really easy to get to those too. Fabulous piece of Waikiki history without the big pricetag!

Right across from the beach at Waikiki, the location couldn't have been better. Rooms were adequate, but not fancy. Clean with necessary amenities, and a beach theme. Although there was no pool, being so near the beach, it certainly wasn't missed.

Loved staying at this hotel.We had a beachfront room on the 11th floor overlooking Waikiki beach.The service was excellent and although the hotel is getting a bit dated, it was still very good with excellent service from the staff.I would have rated the hotel higher if it had its own restaurant and pool, but the beach was right over the road and there are plenty of places to eat nearby.

This is a slightly older hotel that is still very clean, neat & tidy with lovely white towels and clean sheets and rooms that are serviced daily. It is perfectly located right across the road from the beach with a lagoon, which is great as there is no pool. There is a beautiful view if you take the upgrade offer and get a front facing room as they are not built out. It is also a great location for people watching whilst sitting on the balcony. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful. The daily charge is also very reasonable in comparison to some of the big hotels. I'd have no problem staying here again.

Just spent 4 days here at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel wasn't really impressed at first but it got better in time it is very central and easy to get around from.But the staff were not all that friendly.But if you want a central hotel this is the one.

The room and space was rather small however the location as our son pointed out was AWESOME! Not many amenities, check in off the street, then take a tight elevator to your room. If you don't plan on spending much time in the room, it's a great place to be but if you're looking for comfort and spacious accommodations - you might want to find something else.

Spent 6 nights here and loved it! The ocean views are amazing. Small room with a tiny bathroom and poor water pressure which was a bit of a downer. The staff were lovely and helpful and the rooms were kept spotlessly clean. The two double beds could be replaced by a single queen which would provide so much more room! Breakfast normally consisted of a fresh fruit salad purchased from the ABC shop downstairs and consumed on the balcony overlooking Waikiki beach with a cup of tea - heaven!

Great location. We were upgraded to a full ocean view room on arrival which was great. Room was a little outdated but as most hotels in Hawaii are. Only negative - we had to source our own power plugs to charge our phones etc & staff not too friendly. Otherwise we weren't in the hotel too much to notice anything bad anyway as we were out and about all night and day.

One of the original places built on the water front in Waikiki, small rooms, but if you get up above the 7th floor and water front view, you will enjoy the view.Little things missing that make the difference, they have little room in the rooms due to the fact they have two double size beds in each, I would suggest they put in one queens size bed, and then arrange the rest of the room to add space.Air con is very noisy, this is a upgrade that the hotel should do, as it was so hot at nights you needed to run it all night to cool the rooms to sleep. Location to the beach is excellent, We were given a room on the fourth floor to start with, but John at the front desk upgraded us to the 13th after two night, which was excellent, thank you John, 1305 gives you amazing views, and worth asking for, as a budget place this room gave you a view many hotels would charge you significantly more money,All round happy to have stayed, our next place we stayed in Maui was totally different, The Whaler, recommend this place.Hired Scooters to get around the island, had a great time, Went to Pearl Harbour, lots of comments about timing and tickets, just get there either by car or scooter, and go to ticket place, we got some of the free tickets given out each day, 1300 of them free to get out to the memorial each day, on first in first served, you pay to see the other areas, about $35.00 per person for basic package, so don't be sucked in to pay a high tour fee, not needed.The Aston Waikiki is right across from the beach, so this is a real plus, just needs a few upgrades to bring it up to todays expected standard.

Regular visitors to Hawaii, first time at the Aston Circle Waikiki - impressed and we would not hesitate returning.We requested a high floor (given 13 in a 14 floor hotel) and an ocean view. We were delighted with the view, location, service and value for money. It's a smaller hotel, right across the road from Waikiki Beach. Our room had 2 double beds, a desk and chair, free wifi and high speed internet, free beach towels, beach chairs and water toys like air beds, tubes and boogie boards. Bathroom is small but functional. There is no restaurant or pool, but hey, you are in the middle of Waikiki and you don't come here to swim in a pool.Rooms are very clean and well maintained, we loved sitting on the balcony and watching the sun slowly sink into the ocean. Photos are actual view from our balcony.

This hotel is great depending on what you are looking for. The rooms are small, the hotel is old and doesn't offer very much. Limited parking and with the recent rains the carpet in the room was wet. No ventilation in the bathroom so it was muggy in there. But, the room is nice. Remodelled and clean. Great price, great staff and a killer view of Waikiki. I would have rather stay here and have the amazing view I have than at the Hilton in a nicer room with a view of another building. As a single mom traveling with two kids this hotel was perfect. Located right at Kuhio beach on Waikiki all we have to do is cross the street and we are swimming. I'd come here again with my kids. If I was coming for a romantic vacation then I probably wouldn't stay here.

Two of us stayed from 7th - 15th Aug 2015, we asked for ocean front on high floor, when we checked in the guy on the desk smiled and said "I think you will like your room" he wasn't kidding. We had unit 4 on the 14th floor, absolutely perfect. Comfortable beds and pillows, plenty of wardrobe space behind mirrored door. Spotlessly clean with nice bathroom and balcony overlooking the ocean, the shower head is fixed and a little awkward for a tall man but I got used to it. An electric jug would be an asset for us tea drinkers but other than that we loved it. The small amenity fee includes wifi and beach towels and the staff were lovely and helpful. We loved it, we wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.
user_name:
BarryK297
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: I cannot tell you how perfect this little hotel is and how much I love it! I stayed at the Aston Circle for a full week back in 2011 and loved it then - and that was before their recent renovations! This time I just needed one overnight stay, travelling back from Anchorage, Alaska to Sydney, Australia. I was thrilled when I rang them the day before and they had availability at an affordable rate! It was like coming home! From making the reservation with Alicia (hope I got her name right) to remembering Steven at the front desk when I arrived, to spending the night there - the whole experience was full of aloha and I left Hawaii the following morning happy :) It is a gorgeous hotel in the heart of Waikiki and perfect for anyone who doesn't want the expensive high-rise hotel or resort experience, and is happy with simple but beautiful, clean and comfortable accommodation in the best location Waikiki has to offer. I'll be back! :)

We love this hotel. We have stayed there there any times and always go back there. It is straight across from Waikiki Beach. The rooms are spacious with 2 double beds, large bath room, fridge, kettle for tea and coffee making. There is a safe a beautiful verandah to sit on, what more could you ask for.

I went with family that had stayed here before. Convenient location as it is in walking distance of everything you will need. Beach is just across the street with beautiful views from your balcony. Rooms are small but nice. Staff is very accommodating and friendly.

This hotel was exactly what I was wanting. I came to Oahu on a business trip and needed a clean and reasonably-priced place to stay. The Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel was very clean without a lot of frills. Basically, you get a room right on the Waikiki strip with a great view and accessibility to everything. As you may see in other reviews, the hotel is quite physically a circle. So, all of the rooms are wedged-shaped. They are a updated and clean with two double beds, a very small bathroom and a small work space for your laptop. There is also a small closet. This room is not intended for hanging out in for an extended period of time. It is intended for 2 to maybe 4 people to sleep in. Hey! You're in Oahu! What are you doing just hanging out in your room for anyway?There is a balcony with each room that holds two connected seats with a table in between. This was perfect for sitting out on after working each day, watching the ocean, drinking a local micro brew and eating some local snack mix that I bought at one of the many ABC souvenir stores that are around. This hotel is right on the main drag with a lot of people walking up and down the street. So, if you like to people watch, then there is a lot of entertainment to be had just sitting on the balcony.

We stayed there in March 2012. Now I am going to HNL again and found these reviews. The only positive thing was the location. Anyone from the street could walk in and do stupid things as security wasn't there. Once Fire Alarm was triggered by someone and lifts stopped and we had to walk 11 lvl down. It was late, so we had to wait for someone to clear Fire alarm before anyone could get back. It wasn't real alarm, just someone broke alarm panel in the corridor. The rooms were small, and weird shape of the room make them even less attractive as hotel is round in shape.

I had a very enjoyable stay with fourteen year old granddaughter. The rooms have been updated sense my last visit to this hotel. We stayed on the eighth floor with an amazing ocean view. The staff was very friendly. Great stay for teenagers as they have a playstation in room and free movie rentals to keep them occupied when you are getting ready or relaxing after the beach or before dinner. We enjoyed the free use of beach mats , chairs , rubber rafts and tubes to float on as well as boogie boards used on the north shore. We left a couple of boogie boards for others to enjoy when our stay was over. They also had a couple of serf boards that could save someone some serious cash on rentals. This hotel has an eighteen dollar resort fee that covers all of the above mentioned. It will cost you an additional twenty dollars a day to park your rental car. What I liked most about this hotel is that it is located directly across the street from the beach, walking distance to many good restaurants and shopping, amazing views from lanai. Lastly we arrived on a very early flight and were at the hotel by about 10:00 a.m. They were able to get us our room right away . I really thought this was so nice of them. Thank you so much Waikiki Circle for making our stay comfortable and fun!

July, the busiest time in Hawaii with180,000 people in Waikiki.Great weather with temperatures of 30 degrees.Very friendly people everywhere.Plenty of things to do and see.Beautiful beaches with clear,warm water.Hotel is one of the old original hotels on Waikiki.Great location and great views.Very clean with extremely friendly staff.Great information desk.The rooms are very small(not too bad for a couple but probably to small for a family) with a tiny bathroom.We stayed on the 14th floor and had great views with a lovely sunset most nights,but...very noisy with aircons from other hotels.A little overpriced.

Great location in Waikiki. This is the place to stay if you plan on going out and exploring Oahu and not just hanging out at your hotel. Rooms are clean. Great customer service. Walking distance to bars, restaurants and the beach. Car rental is near by. I will definitely be back.

I stayed at Aston Waikiki Circle for four days with family. It was a great stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had an ocean front view like we asked. The hotel is close to macdonalds and stores like the ABC store. It is walking distance to the beach. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who plans on visiting Hawaii:)

When I arrived with my 3 year old son it was 10 pm in Hawaii but on our time it was 1 am... so we were tired and my son was hungry... My mom had originally made the reservation through a package on Orbitz so she had her plane tickets and the hotel set up. We added my name on the reservation since I was going to arrive before them, agreed to pay the extra 30 per night and I myself was going to be in charge of paying that, I figured I also wanted an upgrade so I was going to pay that myself as well. Upon my arrival the guy at the front desk seemed pretty bored and I arrived towards the end of his shift it seemed like, he barely cared to help me out said my reservation had been canceled it was absurd because my mom was on her way, an then he changed the story saying it was changed to a later day, I was so confused and outraged and there was no way this could have happened... I asked him to figure this out because there was obviously something wrong, he didn't care I asked him if he could hold my luggage while i went to grab my son something to eat and he rudely answered No you are not a guest here! I almost cried and he still didnt help me out. I had to walk to the restaurant with my son luggage bags and everything. Came back and still had to call Orbitz myself. Orbitz said on there end nothing had been changed nor canceled it was the hotels fault. So they didnt do nothing to make me happy which was me who went through all this hassle not my mom. It was a disaster! I am never staying here ever again!

Upon entering the room we were first struck by how small the room was. There were two double beds which didnt help. 1 queen bed would give the room more space.  The next thing we noticed was the view it was lovely! We had an ocean view room and while it wasn't directly at the front of the hotel it still had a great view. With no restrictions.  The balcony was great to sit and watch all the people walk by on Waikiki beach. The bathroom was tiny, but we showered ok . I liked the smallness of the hotel after the other huge waikiki hotel we stayed in.  There was a mcdonalds just at the bottom of the hotel and an egg restaurant which seemed awfully popular.  It is right on waikiki beach and there is an ABC store just next door. So the lack of room service wasnt an issue. And although the early morning rubbish truck seemed to spend an eon with his reversing beacon on I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

I must have stayed at this hotel 10 times and seen some changes over the years.Staff are the same - great - which means the hotel must be doing something right. Always friendly / helpful.Wifi is pretty good (included in the amenity fee)Great location - walk straight out onto the beach - free towels for the beach.Always hot water available for the shower, never had a problem.The only criticism is the AC in the rooms, which although is effective and goes to a nice low temperature, it is noise which is a problem during the night.They are happy to store your luggage for you if you arrive early / depart late.

I have only good things to say about this hotel. I cannot wait to stay here again when we return to Waikiki.The check in process was quick and John at the front desk even offered us a room upgrade (at a discounted rate) He even showed us the rooms to allow us to chose (we stayed with our original room however as we preferred the view looking towards Diamond Head)The view from the balcony made our stay even better. It was amazing coming back from a big day exploring and enjoying a Kona Longboard Lager watching the sunset.The room was clean and suited our needs. It came with 2 double beds however we didn't mind.The staff were amazing. So friendly when we ran into them in the lift or in the corridors. The lady at the front desk (whose name sadly escapes me) was so incredibly helpful and went our of her way to offer us help and suggestions on things around and about our stay. She was awesome :)The parking under the building was a big help when we hired a car. When it's full they offer alternative parking locations at their sister hotels which is a plus.The only thing I can criticise is that the air-con can be a bit noisy however it worked so it was fine.It's located right across from waikiki beach with the tidal pools straight across the road. Perfect to walk everywhere or the shuttle bus is half a block down.Another plus is that every room will get some ocean view.I totally recommend this hotel, thank you so much for an unforgettable stay

We stayed here for a few nights to get to Pearl Harbor and see Oahu a bit before jetting off to the big island. The location is fine, the rooms are tiny. Make sure you get an oceanfront room and on a high floor, or you will be looking at nothing. Desk staff was fine, the lady who works at the travel/reservations/activities desk to the right of the elevator was awesome. She helped us get a rental car over 4th of July week when we couldn't find one on our own. For a night or two this hotel is fine.

This hotel is right across the road from waikiki beach. It is a perfectly sized hotel which is small enough that you feel like the front desk staff know you. Spare lilos and chairs have been left in the surfboard rack for use which is great if you don't want to spend $3.49 on one at the ABC store! Rooms are nicely appointed with a small but well laid out bathroom.

We loved this hotel and would definitely stay again. A family of 6 including 4 teens/adult children we had 2 rooms which worked perfectly. Being right across the road from an amazing beach meant we could all be a group or independent. Location is perfect for families like ours that love the beach, surfing etc...So close to shops and restaurants too. A great walk to Diamond Head. We never needed to wait at reception for service which was especially important when checking in following a long flight. We knew the rooms were compact so this was not an issue, they are clean and very pleasant. The views are truly amazing. I don't want to say too much more as this treasure may become too popular!

My wife an I loved this place. We stayed in room 1303 for a week and it was great. I can't speak enough about how wonderful it was. The free movies rentals that came with the room was great. My wife and I aren't really bar people so it was great to be able to catch up on some missed movies after long days out on the sandy beach.

This hotel is all about value for money and location. The location is fantastic - you are literally steps from the beach. And at the price I paid - that's phenomenal.You might be tempted to stay at one of the brand name hotels a little further back from the ocean front. Don't. I can't recommend the ocean front view experience enough.The rooms at the Circle are pretty basic but clean, comfortable and spacious. The balcony is fantastic for relaxing and enjoying the sunset from. See the attached picture - but a picture really can't do it justice.Don't bother booking one of the upgraded 'ocean view' rooms in advance. They'll sell you an upgrade at the front desk - haggle. I think I ended up getting it for like $10 extra/night after extending my stay a bit.Yeah - this isn't a resort hotel with a pool etc etc. But you can always buy a day pass at one of the larger resorts/spas if you want it. And frankly - there's so much to see that you should be getting out of the hotel instead of not making it past the sun lounger at the pool every morning!Just writing this review makes me want to go back. And I'd certainly stay at the Aston Waikiki Circle again.

Just checked in today, absolutely thrilled with our room. The room itself is small and basic. Tiny shower and smallest "Queen" size bed we've ever had... But the view... Omg incredible!!! 100% worth upgrading for ocean view. You'd pay at least twice the price for this view any other hotel. Great value for the price. Recommend for location and reasonable price.

I'm writing this review sat on the balcony of room 1402 with a glass of Longboard beer watching the sun go down on another day. What can I say? I absolutely love this hotel! The location is fantastic just across the road from the beach. The view from the balcony takes my breath away. The rooms although smaller by American standards are perfect and spotlessly clean. I love the quirky decor. There is a fridge and coffeemaker. The coffee provided is very good. There is also a safe provided free of charge. The beds are very comfortable and the hotel is quiet at night. I had excellent nights sleep throughout the stay. The maidservice was excellent and the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. No need to bring beach towels they provide them free of charge. There is a brilliant breakfast venue Eggs n'things at the hotel entrance with massive pancakes. Get there early to avoid the queues. 10% off for hotel guests. Also takeaway service. What more can I say.... I don't want to leave. One day I hope to return despite the 17 hour flight time from Wales! Aloha ☺

This hotel was right across from Waikiki beach rooms where clean great location to everything. ocean view was great to wake up to every morning. Restaurants close by ABC shop next door & they sell everything.

Checkin was quick and courteous. Front desk was always helpful with information. Rooms...yes they are small but well laid out and enough room for us 3.
