Beds are cozy especially when use to king. ;) the balcony is wonderful! Great views and ample space. Yes there is a amenity fee whether you use them or not but that is how every hotel is! (so quit complaining and giving this hotel less stars!) This one was by far the cheapest out there! Love love how the beach is right across the street and shopping and restaurants are all around you! This hotel is great for the price!!

If you are looking for a fancy lobby, pool and bellboy theAston Circle Hotel is not the place for you. Also, parking is an extra fee and every day had a sign saying it was full (we only rented a car for one day and didn't park there.) Also there is an additional "resort fee" that is very common in Oahu. I thought of it as the charge for wifi. So, with all that out of the way, here's what I enjoyed about the ACH. First read about the women who opened the hotel. She was quite extraordinary. The rooms are not huge but perfect for 2 adults or a family of 4 (with smaller kids.) There is a microwave and a desk and a safe. The rooms are clean despite its age. It smells fresh and is cheery. The best features are the view and the balcony. The higher the better! There's nothing like waking up to that view!Also, on the first floor is "eggs and Things". It is a great place for breakfast but get there early or call it in and take it across the street to enjoy it right on Waikiki! Their juices are fresh squeezed and the pancakes are so good we went there twice! Finally, the location is wonderful! Most things in Waikiki are walkable. The Duke statue is right across the street as well as a free hula show on Wednesdays (although there are better free hula shows at the Halekulani on the weekends and my favorite was at the Ilikai on Friday & Sunday Nights. On Fridays you can see the fireworks from the Hawaiian Hilton). There is shopping down the street a McDonalds next door for you fast food fans. Oh, I also found the rooms to be very quiet. I'm not sure if it was the rooms or the clientele but unlike some hotel experiences where you hear doors slamming and voices echoing in the halls there was none of that. While nothing is cheap in Honolulu, I felt this hotel was a good value for my money. Other tips:If you want to get out of Waikiki the bus system is great! We took the bus to Pearl Harbor, downtown to see Iolani Palace (take the tour and go on Friday for the free concert on the lawn. It's quite charming!) and to Kailua. In Kailua we rented bikes to get to the beach and biked to Lanakai beach as well. Lanakai beach would be better described as a bunch of paths between houses with various sized amounts of beach area in between peoples back yard. It was breathtaking and totally worth the hunt. Taking the bus in Honolulu was so much easier than fighting traffic and trying to find parking. We had a tour guide-- Vince take us to Hanauma Bay since the bus ride was long and it's best to get there early. It was very reasonable. He set us up with the snorkeling gear but you still have to stand in line and watch the movie. I rented a car for one day to drive around the island and go to the North Shore. I found a car rental place that was about 6 blocks from the hotel (if you are a member at Costco you can get good prices.). There is an Enterprise and maybe a Herz both at that location. Anyway, I walked to pick up the car and returned it that evening. Some highlights of my drive around the island were: seeing whales breach on my hike on the Makapu trail to the lighthouse, having shrimp from Giovanni's food truck, enjoying the different views and pace and enjoying a shave ice with ice cream at Matsumoto in Halewia. I kept hearing about this and thought what's the big deal about a snow cone? No comparison... You've gotta try them! I stopped at the Dole Plantation and I would have been happy with just a picture. I walked in & was bombarded with a super sweet smell and Pineapple items everywhere. I wasn't impressed. I ended my day by driving to

The Circle is a simple hotel and very retro. What a surprise to walk up to the entrance and find no real lobby; only an open area with a reception desk behind a wall.We had a 10th floor room, partial ocean view and were very happy with it. In spite of the location right on busy Kalakaua, we were not bothered by noise. Also, by choosing part ocean Diamond Head side, we had shade on our lanai in the late afternoon.Room was very nice, ample size. Bathroom is small but well equipped.We thought the location was the very best part of Waikiki beach. This beach is beautifully landscaped, there are multiple benches, water fountains, foot wash fountains, restaurants and only about 3 blocks to Kapiolani Park. Although our lanai looked out to other buildings, when we turned our chairs we had an outstanding view of the ocean. The best part....when you go down on the elevator, the doors open and VOILA !There is the beach right in front of you.Much nicer than walking long hallways to get outside !

Just returned from a fantastic trip to hawaii.Stayed at the aston waikiki circle in ocean front room overlooking waikiki beach,.All rooms have a balcony and the views both morning and night are to die for.Its not a 5 star hotel by any means ,but rooms are tastefully furnished with very comfy beads and light and airy.A big thank you to John at reception who couldn,t do enough to make our stay any more comfortable answered all our questions ,gave us helpful hints in finding our way around ,and always with a smile. We are already planning our next trip to waikiki and will most certainly be staying at the aston circle .To all who are planning a trip to waikiki please check out the ASTON WAIKIKI CIRCLE as you will not be dissapointed.Once again thank you John for making our stay sooo memorable ,and will miss your lovely smile.xx Doris and Dotty

very good, no frills hotel. great location. very clean! room was good size. staff friendly. the beach and all the shops and restaurants are very close by. stayed with me sister and we loved the area. definitely would come back!

The Aston Circle we found by searching the internet and booked via expedia. It is only 13 floors and we had an ocean view room. The accommodation was excellent. A very comfortable bed, the bathroom was small but sufficient. The views were amazing and to die for. Right across the road from the main Waikiki beach it was a short 2 minute stroll to the beach. The ramp leading to the hotel had a number of beach equipment for guest use, and we used a couple of beach chairs, which we put back after use, as every body does.In the centre of the action and close to everything.Cannot fault this hotel and will certainly return to this one when we are next in Hawaii. Forget the 5 star jobs this one takes the cake.

I have stayed in Waikiki Circle for a couple of times. My last stay was in Feb 2015, after 6 years gap from the previous stay.It seems they have renovated the room to the better. Check-in is smooth with friendly lady at the front desk. Parking is a bit expensive, but pretty much around the ballpark price in the area.The best parts of the hotel are the location and view. I booked ocean view, which is basically on the side of the building, but still come with the non-blocking view of the ocean and kalakauau street. The location is the best out there. Literally, just take the elevator down and it is the main street already and just a road cross away to the beach. It is not a beachfront property, since we still have to cross the street.Will come back every time they offer good deals!

Rooms are small, but just what you need when staying in Waikiki! They do fill up fast, so reserve early. There is parking on site, just below the hotel as well. The views are stunning, even on lower floors. This hotel has everything you need. There is a great little breakfast place attached to the hotel (always busy) or grab some bread and fresh fruit at the nearby ABC store and have breakfast on the beach....it's so nice. Prefect location on the strip ans great walking to all the shops. This hotel is directly on the beach. The first time we stayed there was a parade, so we had front row viewing!

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle hotel for our 20th anniversary. This was our first trip to Hawaii, and we were very happy with the Aston Waikiki Circle. The location is very convenient to the beach (right across the street) as well as convenient to all the shops in Waikiki. One of the best-rated breakfast spots (Eggs and Things) shares the same building, and you get a discount through the hotel. McDonalds is right next door. The hotel staff was very pleasant, and our rooms were clean and well-maintained. The hotel provides as many fresh beach towels as you need (my wife asked for 6 for two of us!). You won't be disappointed with this hotel. Other reviews state the rooms are small, but we only used our room to sleep and shower so we were fine with the size. The shower and bathroom were perfectly fine (I'm 5'8" 250lbs). The room may be on the small side for American standards, but it's very comparable to European rooms in which we've stayed. We also rented a car for the week and kept in the hotel's garage for an extra $20 per day. The garage is directly below the hotel, and incredibly easy to get in and out of with the remote provided. Here's a tip, if you want chairs, and you will spend more than 8 hours on the beach during your stay, go to KMart or Walmart and buy the foldable beach chairs for $30 each. What's nice is you can then take them to any other beach on the island that you want (Kailua Beach Park is nicer than Waikiki in my opinion).When I researched the hotel, I was unsure of the location because of the view of the water from Google Earth. The water has a lot of discoloration which we found out later are rocks on the bottom. The rocks are fairly smooth, and can be walked on with bare feet. The water is beautiful and the beach was perfect!Everything about this hotel is convenient, and we will definitely be back on future trips.

At the circle now.It's great. We've been here twice before but it's been renovated!!!The rooms are still small but so lovely with the new furniture and renovation.All very clean and comfortable.My hair dryer was broken and they promptly removed it and replace it .The staff are so nice and pleasant.Ice is available from the reception staff... And towels for the beach. They have a honesty system for the beach chairs and boogie boards. Which is great. Other hotels hire them out but the circle is happy to give them out free. I love it here!! Good job Waikiki Circle! And free wifi on the rooms too.Location is fab..opposite the beach at the duke statue area.

The view was oceanfront and awesome, but the room was too small. The smallest shower I ever saw. I'm 6 ft tall and had to duck under the showerhead. We only had 2 luggage bags and could not open both bags on the floor without them being in the way. We cancelled our second nights stay.

Location is great, right opposite the beach and right in the main Street. The rates are very reasonable. restaurants are close by so very easy to walk everywhere. Plenty of public transport to jump on buses for shopping.

The Aston Circle was superbly placed immediately across the road from the beach, and we selected a sea view room which was magic. The hotel is situated within close walk to all the shops and restaurants and is an easy trolley bus ride to Ala Moana shopping mall, or Diamond Head in the other direction. We already knew about the daily fee charged for 'services' prior to arriving and just factored that into our budget. This was still a third of the price of some of the other beachfront hotels along the strip. Would stay again. The "Eggs n Things" restaurant just out the front doors always had a queue and provides some very good value meals (although the American's obsession with obscene piles of cream is evident here). The hotel activity centre was helpful in organising a Pearl Harbour tour and hiring a soft top Jeep to explore. You must go to the Bubba Gump Factory restaurant while in Maui. We loved it. Everything Forrest Gump. Got the T-Shirt (several actually) :-)

this is an older hotel in an excellent location. it was clean and convienent, and the employees were all nice. the price was ok, but the resort fee is a joke; you really get nothing for it. the ocean front view was excellent and the water was cystal clear. if you're nostalgic, stay here soon 'cause it probably won't be around much longer.

Very convenient to all the action and it is very clean. There is no bathtub but I would rather take a shower any way. I left a package on the bench in the check out area. They sent back to my home address. Paid extra for a better view and for amenities.

I gave the man at reception my credit card when checking in on the understanding it would be used if there was any damage to the room on our part. When checking out I was told $113USD had been taken from my account without my pin, signature or knowledge for an 'amenity fee'Amenities we did NOT use.When confronting the same man and his manager, both men were exceptionally rude towards my mother, grandmother and myself.I would NOT return!

When planning past visits to Honolulu, I never considered this hotel; it looked old, sad, forlorn. Last visit I tried the Eggs 'n Things Eggspress located in the hotel and took a closer look. For this trip, trying to reduce lodging costs since I knew shopping expenses would be high (did you know Louis Vuitton is slightly cheaper in HI vs. the mainland?), we decided to give the Circle a try, and we were pleasantly surprised! Its location and budget-friendly rates are main selling points.The hotel was opened in 1962 by Emma Kwok Chung, the first Asian woman to own a hotel in Waikiki. Its circular design is meant to look like a Chinese lantern. It's situated on the eastern part of Waikiki's main street, Kalakaua Ave., just past the Duke Kahanamoku statue, where there are no building on the ocean side of the street. Thus, the hotel as direct views of the beach and ocean.There are 14 stories, with 8 rooms per floor. The "lobby" is open-air, behind Eggs 'n Things, the front desk is situated behind glass, like a theatre ticket window. There are 1-2 staff members at the window. There are 2 key-accessed elevators, also used by the staff, and a tour desk. Beach equipment and towels are available. The front desk folks were efficient, some were friendly. I don't know if they do concierge-type duties. I found the Waikiki Ambassadors, who wear fluorescent green tops and are found all over, more helpful. We booked an oceanfront room online. After booking, the rate decreased twice before our visit. There are 3 oceanfront rooms per floor, and of course these are the costliest, relatively speaking. The other room categories, going towards the rear of the hotel, are Ocean View (2/floor), Partial Ocean View (2/floor), and Standard (1/floor--faces a garage). We were on the 13th floor, and had almost 180 degree views of the sea from the balcony. Note the balconies have railings on 3 sides, so are rather unprotected and subject to wind. You cannot see Diamond Head from any room. The rooms are indeed compact, but well-designed, making maximum use of the space. There are 2 full beds--fine for 1-2 people, tight for 3-4. The flat screen TV and Playstation sit on a dresser/desk with a few drawers and a stool. There's another desk by the closet, which has nicely designed shelving. There's a mini-fridge and a safe that has a key, not coded entry. The wall-mounted A/C worked well, and I didn't mind the noise--it helps block out noise from the street. The bathroom is also small, room enough only for one. The stall shower is particularly tight. I was surprised the glasses were real glass. Niggles: there was only one set of drapes (only block-out, no semi-sheer), the sliding door did not slide easily. Ice must be requested at the front desk.The rooms and entire hotel are whimsically themed with aquatic features and colours--the carpet, photos in the room and elevators, the headboard, bathroom door, tiled wall in the lobby. There's a beach bucket and shovel and plastic goldfish in the bathroom.There's a mandatory amenity fee ($18.85 per night) that includes WiFi, newspaper (USA Today), in-room coffee/tea, the safe, local calls, DVD's available from a machine in the lobby.Eggs 'n Things offers a 10% discount to hotel guests. Note that this branch is not a full-service restaurant. You order before entering, pay the cashier, then wait for a table. Everything's disposable (plates and cutlery). Lines can get very long for breakfast, but it's served all day. The place is open 6am-2pm, and reopens 4pm-10pm, when there are additional dinner offerings. The famous pancakes are quite good (they sell the mix). There's a McDonald's next door, and also one of the larger ABC Stores.If you have a car, parking at the hotel is TIGHT. Overflow parking is at the Aston Waikiki Banyan a few blocks away. This is where we parked--access is easier despite the walk to the hotel. If you just plan to stick around Waikiki, a car isn't needed; there are oodles of shops and restaurants within walking distance, including the high-end shops towards the west. Amusingly, when staff at Bottega Veneta and Louis Vuitton asked where we were staying, they did not know of the Circle.In the end, this turned out to be a fine stay--great location, relatively inexpensive, charming. We would definitely consider the Circle again should we choose to stay in Waikiki. However, I still would like to try the Kahala someday, and there will be a new Four Seasons at Ko Olina in the future.

We were really really happy with this hotel . First off, the location . What can I say , you're right on the beach . All you need to do is cross the street. You're on the main Street ,you can come and go as you please. Lots of restaurants all around . The rooms are clean and you have everything you need. My only regret is we took a room with no view . It would have been wonderful to sit out on the patio in the evenings and watch the sun set . This hotel has been around for some time . We saw it in one of Elvis s movie. The price is right and location is the best . We were a group of 12 , and I don t believe anyone had any complaints. We stayed here from the 15 to the 18 April 2015. Yes I would stay again !

Hotel right in the middle of Waikiki. Cross the road and you are on the beach. No pool or restaurant but this means a lower resort/amenities fee. Rooms are not huge but big enough. Facilities are good, comfy bed and views from ocean front room are awesome. Staff are friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

We stayed here for 4 nights.... Amazing location only a few leaps across the road and your on Waikiki beach, the views from the balcony and room were spectacular!!! The hotel room itself was great lots of room but small bathrooms but we didn't find it an issue at all, it was very clean and was was made up daily. The staff were amazing and very helpful and we also booked all our tours through the tours desk they were excellent and so helpful would highly recommend staying at this hotel.... Amazing location for an amazing price!!!!!

I have stayed at the Waikiki Circle Hotel more than 30 times since 1971. It is located directly across the street from Waikiki beach, has clean, up to date rooms, helpful, friendly staff and is reasonably priced. You can walk across the street and swim in a protected lagoon or jump into the surf, rent a surfboard, ride a catamaran or outrigger canoe. Waikiki is an urban environment that has the advantages of restaurants, shopping and attractions. Tourist activities of all kinds will pick you up and drop you off directly at the hotel doing away with the need for a rental car.The Waikiki Circle Hotel is the perfect property from which to enjoy all aspects of Waikiki Beach.
user_name:
Fred B
Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: This hotel is right across the street from Waikiki Beach. It is close to lots of restaurants. Parking is very limited and can sometimes be awkward as it is a circular hotel and the garage goes in a circle as well. It only fits about 15 vehicles.Our room was very clean but not very big. There is no pool but the beach is right across the street. it is close to a lot of shops as well. If you are on a budget, it would be fine. We had a city view and it is very congested with hotels and condos . Although this area was nice, we didn't really feel like we were in Hawaii. Very commercial and busy. They offer free movies. There is no real lobby, you walk up the ramp and there is a window where you check in. It's different but it was ok. The beach is awesome. You can rent chairs and umbrellas.

Stayed in the 13th floor with ocean front room. Affordable price with a spectacular view. Only downfall is just the bathroom, it is way too small but still enjoyed our stay.Beach is just across the street, Restaurants both pricey and affordable are all walking distance. Will definitely stay again!

This Hotel is great if you don't plan on staying in your room too much.Rooms are small but comfortable and the hotel is opposite the beach and close to everything.Staff are very friendly and helpfull.Not really suitable for young families in my opinion because of the room size and there is no pool.There is a compulsory Resort Fee of $18 per day to cover for WiFi, tea and coffee and movie rental. Cheaper than other resorts that can charge $30 per day.Best to stay above 6th floor because of traffic noise and a full view room as it gets very windy on balcony of other rooms.

We stayed for 6 nights in this hotel. The reason why I chose this hotel was because of the excellent reviews. There were 4 of us travelling, 2 adults and 2 teen boys. We have an ocean front room on the 13th floor. My first impression when we first checked in was, what is this place? It looks cheap. There is no proper lobby. My first impression of the room was it was so small. We have 3 big suitcases and 1 medium suitcase and the room looks like it will be too cramped for the four of us.The cabinet have plenty of shelves where to store clothes so we used them and store 3 suitcases inside the closet. The room got more bigger after I organized all our things. The bathroom is super tiny but this really didn't bother us. They have double sized beds and it was the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept in. The room is super clean including the bathroom. The aircon was sometimes noisy. The room has a safety box which I've used. Their parking lot can only park less than 20 cars so if you are planning to rent a car, I suggest to get parking permit immediately as this gets full right away.The location is premium plus. It's one of the best location along Kalakaua Avenue. The beach is just across the street. There is an ABC store next door and there is a Eggs N' Things restaurant right at the hotel building which always have a line-up. Their wifi signal is strong, but they don't have computers/printers for guest use. They will direct you to the Marriott business center two blocks away which charges per minute and per page printed.Their customer service is excellent. They give beach towels withought checking them, you just return them in the big bucket in front of reception.We will return to this hotel again.

Waikiki Circle is a great weekend or layover hotel. The hotel doesn't have a bar/lounge, a swimming pool, or a restaurant (Eggs & Things right in front of the hotel). The rooms are a little small; but very clean and comfortable. The view from the oceanfront rooms are incredible. Without all the resort amenities, you are not paying the resort price. A nice room with the incredible view is $100+ cheaper per night than the resort hotels. This hotel is what it is, a great place for weekend trip to Waikiki and why pay for the resort amenities that you probably will not use anyways. A great deal in Waikiki.

We had made a reservation for an oceanfront room. This was so much, what we got. We had Waikiki Beach right in front of us and from the twelfth floor the only sound we could hear was the ocean.The parking is very limited but if you are quick, you can get a parking lot in the basement. It doesn’t get any easier than that.We stayed for 8 days and enjoyed the place big time; just seeing the sun go down over Honolulu from the terrace is worth every penny.We will for sure come back to Waikiki and for sure use Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel again.Mahalo

I have just spent 4 nights here with my 17 year old daughter and we loved every minute. We arrived exhausted at 830 in the morning after a 10 hour flight and couldn't believe we were lucky enough to get access to our room straight away! We had an ocean front room and it was just fantastic. The rooms are decorated nicely and we had a great balcony and the view was breathtaking. I was in heaven being just across the road from the beach and my teenager was in heaven with a large ABC store right next door on one side and McDonalds on the other. Beach towels are available from reception and we also had access to a DVD rental machine with 2 free rentals per day! I just loved laying on my bed with the most amazing view right in front of me. I have been coming to Waikiki for years and have always wanted to stay here and now I can't wait to return and stay there again!

This hotel was one of the best prices for a halfway decent hotel near the beach in Waikiki. The hotel is a little older but the rooms, although small (which was expected), aren't too bad. The beds are comfortable and each room has a nice sized balcony. There is a mini fridge tucked under the desk but no microwave which was not convenient for us. The laundry was also very overpriced (also somewhat expected) so we took all our clothes to a laundromat near the hotel. The front desk staff are not overly helpful but housekeeping was always very friendly and left our room exceptionally clean when we asked for service. Good enough that I would stay again if the price was right.

Aston Waikiki Circle has a great location, right across the street from Waikiki Beach! We had the city view room (what we got on sale for our vacation package), but the ocean view would have been much better if you want to pay for the upgrade. The sunsets are breathtaking!The rooms are quite small, perfect for two adults. You can fit 3 adults, but any more would be pushing it. The bathroom is very small, especially the shower. But for the price and location, we made it work. The rooms are clean and well kept. On a few days, the wind was quite strong. We were on the 12th floor and it was almost impossible to sit outside. A lady below us had her bag of beer and it flew off her balcony!The resort fee includes safe-use, movie rental, Playstation 3 use, and WiFi. We didn't go to Hawaii to stay in the room and watch movies or play games. But I'm sure if you have children and need to keep them busy while you get ready, its a nice bonus. The WiFi works fairly well, but it did cut out a few times and it only works from the room (not even outside the door in the hallway).They provide beach towels for everyone and they're friendly and helpful with any room concerns and tour information.If you're planning on renting a car and parking at the hotel ($20 charge/day), do call before hand and confirm a spot in the lot. We were planning on getting a rental, but the lot was full every day we were there so we saw no point in spending that extra money (especially when TheBus and Trolley's go almost everywhere).

I landed at Aston Circle because of reviews on Trip Advisor. I'm so glad I did! I traveled solo, but had friends staying at a hotel right across the side street because they wanted to save $50/day. Their view was blocked by a banya tree, their room was old and it needed love. I was so happy to have the views of the beach, the quiet upper floor room, and the updated room. You don't need a lot of amenities when the beach is right across the street. There are ABC Stores filled with everything you could ever need a few steps from the elevator. I had the best view of the fireworks from the Hawaii culture parade. It was such a sight.

I've been to Oahu 3 times, and have stayed at this hotel each time. You won't find a hotel anywhere that's more accommodating, comfortable or friendly. The rooms are super clean with comfortable beds, the front desk staff are friendly and knowledgeable, and their housekeeping staff go out of their way to please you. The location is right across from Waikiki Beach with fantastic views from the ocean view rooms. Even the partial ocean view rooms offer breathtaking views. Better yet - it's an affordable place to stay in Honolulu!!!

Great hotel if you want to be as close to the beach as possible and don't need anything luxurious. If it's 10 seconds from the beach, it's 5 minutes from the heart of all the Waikiki shopping - was great for us who didn't plan to spend too much time indoors. The room had all the necessities: comfortable beds, good shower, free wifi, tv/fridge, etc - and a balcony with a partial beach view (although we paid a bit extra for this). The staff was lovely and helpful at check-in (we arrived late at night); they had towels at no cost to take to the beach each day; cleaning staff - two thumbs up. The thing to keep in mind here in Honolulu (or other parts of Hawaii) in general is that unless you have a car or the only thing you want to do is lay at the beach or shop, you really need to plan ahead. From Pearl Harbor to Luau's to snorkeling outings - you have to sign up with tour groups so they pick you up from the hotel, etc. The concierge can help you with this but do make sure you don't miss them (we did as we'd be out before they opened and returned after close). PS, here's a tip: while getting ready in the room, have the 'Hawaii' channel on and you get some good ideas about sightseeing (we learned for example that if you buy the Pearl Harbor passport tour on the site, you get a free mug - they sure don't offer it themselves but once we asked, we got them; and the touring companies charge you for things that are actually free!...)

Just got home today after spending a week at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel. Absolutely wonderful front desk staff and our room cleaning lady was so sweet. Naomi checked us in, and she made us feel like regulars. We felt so relaxed and at home. So friendly and accommodating. Westjet Vacations had us booked in an Oceanview room, but Naomi moved us up to 905, an Oceanfront room, for just $ 20.00 USD more per night. John took care of the details the next day, had our luggage moved up and new keys ready. We saw John all week, always there to help and took care of us. A lot of people have already commented on the rooms. We can add we thought it was really unique being a circle shaped hotel. It's very different to step out of an elevator and see the walls curving away in each direction. The rooms are clean and feel new. Carpets appear brand new. Furniture is contemporary and quite nicely fit in the room. Our dresser had a stone top. Our room had a queen size bed. Nice mattress, we slept better there than at home. With that bed, the room was spacious and perfect for two people. A lot of nice touches like an ottoman that splits open to give you a tray to carry drinks or food in. The in-room safe was a great convenience. The deck is a nice size with two outdoor chairs and a table. Looking down on the giant banyan tree and the waves breaking onto the beach was so relaxing. The drapes slide all the way over to the side to give you two monstrous windows, one a door that slides all the way open ( room for three people to walk out side by side ) and it lets that beautiful Pacific - Hawaiian sweet air blow into the room. Air conditioner was great, some people complain about the hum from it but I liked it because I need white noise to sleep and it drowned out the street noise at night.I have no problem with that $ 18.00 fee. We enjoyed the amenities, the Wifi worked great and we were posting pictures like mad on Facebook every night, and one day after a real nasty sunburn I stayed in the room all day and surfed the web. The towels, movies, newspaper, coffee - all good. The free floaties were also a cool addition.Yes, we could have opted for a room in one of those massive hotels. But, I live in hotels for work half the year, and I selected this one for location, amenities, access to the beach, access to shopping, the whimsical flavor and the price was right. I recommend that you get an ocean front, and definitely you want to be high up as you can get for the view, and to get away from the smells from Egg's N Things and the sound of delivery vehicles. Thanks John and Naomi, this was our very first vacation after 24 years of marriage and of course our first trip to Hawaii. You two made us feel like family. We LOVE your hotel. Already planning our return.

My husband and our 3 adult daughters stayed here for 7 days. We had 2 rooms.We had booked partial ocean view rooms but chose to upgrade to full ocean view rooms for an extra $20 per night. The view was spectacular! Directly opposite Waikiki Beach on the main shopping street, the hotel is in a top location. All shopping and restaurants nearby were within easy walking distance. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. My husband and I were moved to a higher floor after our first night - better view and the new room had one queen bed instead of two doubles so more space in the room.Good value for money. Only downside was no pool, but the beach was across the street.

I REALLY DO...It is a simple yet lovely little find. Opposite Waikiki beach and central to just about everything...The staff are lovely and so helpful... the ocean view is breath-taking... absolutely out of this world...what makes the entire place amazing is the price - amazingly cheap in comparison... Ok so it doesn't have its own pool - who needs it you have the ocean a stone throw away...The ONLY thing I will say is that hiring a parasol and sun loungers on Waikiki beach adds up $50 a day for 1 parasol and 2 sun loungers... so if you can see if you can buy your own and give it to the hotel after you leave... they have tons of stuff you can borrow to take to the beach such as body boards and inflatables...The room has a decent size fridge which allowed us to have bread, butter, cheese, deli meats etc so we can make our own sandwiches for the beach as Waikiki is quite expensive and eating out three times a day adds up...The room is ok in size, bathroom quite small but enough room for one person... two double beds in the room which is ok and a decent sized dressing area with a wardrobe and desk...There is a concierge desk in the foyer which is nice to have and they are more than helpful...A local newspaper is left outside your room every morning and there is a DVD rental machine in the foyer with free rentals... Playstation in your room too - but we never used it because HAVE YOU SEEN THE VIEW...

I just returned from 5 days in Honolulu where I stayed at 'the Circle' which I chose due to it's beach front location, and room with direct ocean views.I had booked a beach view room but on check in I was offered an upgrade at $20 USD a night to a ocean front room,which I took (room 803), and the extra $20 a night was worth it, waking up and having coffee every day looking out over Waikiki was a trip highlight for me.The rooms are recently renovated and had a calming ocean blue décor, and furnished nicely,hallways have some sort of island feel, although you would only get away with this décor in a tropical environment! My room had two double beds, smallish shower and bathroom, separate study area with safe, and desk. The hotel has no lobby as such and far more popular than the hotel itself is the ionic 'Eggs and things' restaurant which is adjoining the front desk area and has been around as long as the hotel, 1960's I think. Expect a long line virtually all day.So the pros? The hotel has absolute beach front access, across the road from Dukes statue and the trolley stop (to Ala Moana), it's surrounded by cafes, restaurants and ABC stores, not to mention the views and that everyone knows the hotel by name. The cons? The ridiculous $18 a night 'resort' fee for sub par wifi access, safe, coffee/tea, newspapers, beach towels, free DVD's (which are commonly out of the most popular recent releases). Most hotels give you these as part of the price. If you can get a good rate I would recommend, however at the $300 AUD a night I ended paying perhaps I would class this property as overpriced for the current Aussie traveller.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Aston waikiki circle! The rooms were a little small, but we were rarely in our room. Tina the activities lady was so sweet and helpful. Also, I left my watch in my room and they found it and sent it back to my house. So wonderful. I recommend this hotel, especially for the oceanfront views. This hotel really took care of us and seemed to genuinely care about our stay. Thank you!

I was there 7 days and it sucked! Great location to waikiki beach but they charge a resort fee of 18 dollars aday on top of your booking fee! I did not use their amenaties and was still charged! The staff was rude and unconcerned! Found a much better place to stay this october 2015! Save your money and find different location!

We enjoyed our stay here-only beachfront hotel for about $100. Clean, friendly and helpful staff. Simple and small rooms but the beach is directly in front of the hotel. They also have free rafts and floaties to take to the beach

This hotel is very central rooms not huge but very adequate , every room has a balcony, my stay was 2 nights on return from Australia . Location is optimal across from Waikiki beach.The color of the rooms were relaxing and The pictures of tropical fish appropriate for Hawaii. The fact that you had to put your card into elevator to get it to move was a good security measure.I was comfortable there. Air conditioner a little old and loud but works well.

I booked this hotel as it said it would accomodate 4 people in one room and was right on "Waikiki Beach". I thought I just can't go wrong, staying on Waikiki Beach is a once in a lifetime opportunity!Check in procedure was very smooth and the receptionist was very helpful. When we got to room #504 with our 4 medium sized suitcases, in all honestly it was a "squeeze" to get into the room.We had 2 double beds and next to not alot of walking space or unpacking space. The bathroom too was compact. One other downside I have to mention is that our room was right above the "eggs n things" restaurant and as soon as you opened the patio, all you could smell was food being cooked all day/night, and the generator humming away from the adjacent hotel.This was really disappointing after having paid a lot of money for one nights stay. This room is certainly not big enough to accomodate 4 adults and medium sized suitcases. As the hotel's own car park was full, (you would think with an advanced booking there would be a space reserved) we had to go to the sister hotel and pay an extra $20 so that we could park our car for the night.Overall disappointed, nice small room if there's 2 of you.

Its a 3 star property with 4 star rates, no frills. The location is one of the best and between Hyatt and Marriott. Right at the beachfront and steps away from the high street. A nice mile long walk to Hard Rock cafe has Cheesecake Factory on its way and all the hotels and shops of Waikiki. The free week long DVD rental and Wifi was all charged in the hotel amenity fee of ~$18.

We chose this Hotel for position and price, was great to step out the front and have the beach right there, easy walking along the beach front and could view the Dukes statue from our balcony. There is no pool or bar but we did not miss this as we were too busy on an adventure, unusual shape Hotel based on a Chinese lantern, we stayed in a side view apartment for a couple of days then went to a front ocean view apartment, both have views of the ocean, but it was a lovely view from the ocean front, bathrooms are very small but did not faze us, just a great position to be.

Such a great place but make sure you get a better upgraded room as its all about the balcony on a round building. If you are low and in back, you can not see the ocean, the people, you stare into a parking garage (and they stare back) and their is endless HVAC noise. A mid to best room will give you the balcony of your dreams and you can see the tide hit the sand, and hear it at night if you leave the door open and the ac off. There breakfast restaurant 'Eggs and Things' is terrific and makes it so convenient. This hotel has a lot of history long before Waikiki was massively developed and its in such a great spot for easy access to Waikiki Beach, right across the street.

This may be an unfair comparison. We came from a very nice and quiet resort on Maui in Makena. We stayed one night so we could go to Pearl Harbor first thing in the morning.They gave us an upgrade to an ocean front room, which was very nice. Second floor, in the front of the building. We found the room to be on the small side, and of course, pie shaped as the hotel is indeed a circle.Beds were kind of hard, and the air conditioner was noisy. As I mentioned earlier, we came from a luxury, quiet resort. Here we were front and center on the main boulevard. Lots of foot traffic and car traffic.They agreed to give us a late check out of 1:00 as were part of a tour for Pearl Harbor. Our tour bus was a bit late and we got back to the hotel at 1:20. The front desk guy looked very angry as we were late. (20 minutes). We told him we'd be out in 5 minutes. All in all, good location as it is directly across from the beach. Close to shopping (ABC store on each side of the hotel!!!)We would do things different had we known.

was treated to a stay in this hotel in March, must say it was a very pleasant stay. Staff was more then helpful and obliging, going out of their way to be helpful and friendly, assisting us in all we needed, giving useful advice. Met people who was staying there for the 7th time (that says a lot). View was awesome from balcony, and was reasonably priced, highly recommend.

Location: Perfect - right on the beach in Waikiki (well, you have to cross the main road, but it's just the other side of the road and there's a crossing point nearby). Near to shops and restaurants.Price: Very reasonable. They added an $18 resort fee at check out. Not entirely sure what resort facilities they offered for this (apart from wifi) but you had to pay. Seems pretty standard for Hawaii hotels (although usually you're paying for a pool etc.).Room: Average, bit dated, but did the job. We only needed somewhere to sleep and didn't spend much time at the hotel apart from for this.Negatives: Room was quite noisy at night time. Add to this the racket the air con unit in the room makes and conditions aren't great for a good night's sleep. But we managed OK for 1 night. Might get a bit annoying if you were staying longer.We stayed at this hotel for just 1 night in March '15. We were after a good location due to our short stay and this was perfect. Hotel rooms are a little dated but have all you need (TV, Playstation, Fridge, Safe, Coffee machine, Aircon, 2 double beds). We were only passing through and had to leave the hotel at 4 am to get to the airport for our flight, so were just looking for something cheap and cheerful. This hotel was ideal.My only complaint would be that it was quite noisy in the room at night - that may have been our particular room (407) being close to something noisy outside (like the next hotel's air con unit or something - nothing I could see in the dark when I looked).If you're staying here definitely check out Eggs'n'things which is a restaurant/diner located on the street next to the hotel. It's very busy (which shows how good it is) and does cheap meals such as omelettes and pancakes.

Our stay at this hotel was great. The staff was friendly & helpful. Have to give recognition to Ms. Jan & the 2 guys who worked with her at the reception desk (sorry guys couldn't remember your names) but they were just as helpful as Ms. Jan. Also want to give recognition to Ms Tina & Mr Angel, who by the way was a back up singer for Don Ho! He even sang a lil tune for us!! Can't beat that! They made the reservations for our outings. Very knowledgeable & helpful. This hotel also provides free movies & games just in case you take a rest day or in our case it rained one day so we took advantage of the movies. The location was great & we had a balcony with chairs & a table. We were in walking distance of shops & resturaunts & not to mention the beach is right across the street! The room was a bit smaller than others i have stayed in but this is the way i look at it...not planning on spending much time in there anyway. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable. Had everything we needed..bed, night table with clock, desk, t.v. closet, bathroom...a microwave would have nice.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel from February 6th, 2015 for four nights. This was our second stay and everything was perfect. We booked an Oceanfront Room and this was so worth it. We were on the 9th floor in room 904. I believe the higher the room the better as it was not as noisy as when we stayed on a lower floor previously.Housekeeping were very friendly and accommodating. The rooms a little tight but the location is just perfect. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

We just spent one week and had a full ocean view. All of the good comments written by others apply to our experience. Nice staff, clean rooms, and very central location. But oh my goodness were we disappointed with Waikiki due to crowds and noise. We had the gorgeous view of the beach, but the non stop tour buses and traffic noise totally spoiled the effect of hearing and seeing the beautiful surf. We could open our lanai doors from about midnight until 4 AM to listen to the surf, but had to close them again as the traffic started up again early. The streets were filled primarily with tour groups from Japan with lots of teenagers. Albeit they were polite and not rowdy, but just the masses of people was overwhelming to us. It turned out not to be much of a holiday for us due to the crowds and noise. We didn't really find a problem with mentally ill people, but Waikiki has lots of aggressive nasty panhandlers. Very different than the obviously mentally ill people who were quietly hallucinating and not bothering anyone. I think the nasty panhandlers spoiled the visit for us too. They would nice ask for money and we didn't give it they cursed us with foul language. Lots of very expensive designer stores like Rolex, Tiffany, Coach etc.but we had no interest in those stores or enough money to patronize those stores. Waikiki is not the place to go if you are thinking about peacefully lying on a sandy beach and reading a book. Food very expensive with mediocre quality. But thank goodness the Aston Circle staff were so nice as it would have been a totally write off of a holiday if they weren't so pleasant.

We only stayed for one night, room was clean but small. it's a trendy hotel right across from the Waikiki beach. Great location in center of all the action. There is a restaurant in front of the property that always has a long line...so we did not eat there. Golden Arches MC Donald's and Burger King is very close for cheep meal. There is Express Wolf Gang puck for late night pick up or eat-in place.

While the hotel is located at the center of Waikiki, the hotel is dated and looked nothing like the photos. There are also additional "resort" fees for a hotel that is anything but a resort. No pool and no bar - just a Playstation, mini-fridge, and spotty wi-fi. Another thing that was irksome was the sound of the garbage truck every morning waking us up. This is because the hotel is adjacent to an Eggs 'n Things restaurant that generates a ton of trash that needs to be picked up daily. Also, the older lady checking us in was not very nice and left a very bad first impression. If we had to return and were to stay at an Aston, we would definitely stay at the Aston Waikiki Beach down the street which is where the wife and I hung out a lot because they have a bar called Tiki's.

Our family of 3 ~ two adults & 13 yr old. We had 12 day stay iat the end of Feb 2015. We had booked ocean view but upgraded to ocean front on 2nd day. We enjoy sitting on lanai for breakie & watching sunset every night so the upgrade was worth it. Rooms are on smaller size, 4 adults would be cozy. Bathroom is tiny, only small shower & only 1 person can get ready at once. We do carry on and pack on the lighter side & found storage was adequate. Suit cases can fit under bed. Mini fridge & coffeemaker in room. We did NOT miss having a pool, the ocean is across street & so warm and best pool ever. Beach umbrellas and lounge chairs are available to rent on beach for $20 each for the day. We bought beach chairs at a tourist store by hotel so that was better than beach mat and better deal. Hotel provides daily towels to use. Some boogie boards & floaties if you snag them early. Beds are double size only. Recent Reno so pillows, bedding, towels, decorating & carpet is new and fresh. Location is the best, we walked to zoo, aquarium and took bus to Diamond Head & the mall. All kinds of restaurants & shopping, all in walking distance. Hertz rental is around block for car rental pick up & drop off., very convenient. We rented car a couple of different days and dropped back to Hertz at the end of the day so we avoided the $20 daily parking charge and sometimes the lot is full and so if you can avoid parking that is the better, and way less hassle. Pleasant tour desk right in hotel and had best price for car rental and they are most helpful and can book any tour you want. ABC stores right beside hotel and good place for snacks and sushi, pasta and salads for room and beach. You will hear traffic and noise but that is expected given it is the heart of WAIKIKI strip but we slept fine. For the price, the ASTON WAIKIKI Circle is good value. You could pay double or triple for same location at he other nearby hotels. If we go back we would book to stay again. Aloha!

I've been to Waikiki Beach before and have stayed at a few other hotels in the area, but I found this place to be the most bang for your buck considering its central location and view. My boyfriend, sister, and I stayed for 4 days/3 nights late last year. What we loved the most was the ocean front view that accompanied our room. Waking up to the sea's vast horizon and witnessing the beautiful sunset from our balcony was most memorable...and we didn't even have to break our budgets for it. The room itself was a bit tiny with double beds, but it was pleasingly decorated and evoked a comfortable and inviting atmosphere. Consequently, the bathroom was also small and cramped, but still functional. Who really stays cooped up in their rooms for long anyway when on a beach vacation? We mainly used it to sleep and shower before our planned activities for each day.The building itself is dated - there's really no lobby. There's check-in walk-up windows and the elevators to the hotel are right outside. Eggs 'N Things is on the same level, but anticipate long lines if you plan to try their famous breakfast. Everything was walking distance, from our quests to indulge in Mai Tais to acai bowls to udon to whatever else, it was done. Even the car rental place we booked for our farther Lanikai/Kualoa Ranch trip was just a block over. Overall, it was a great stay.

As the title says, perfect location, small and quaint. Stayed November 2014, would recommend getting a sea view room. Just across steet from beach and close to shopping and just short drive to nightlife, but lots of bars close. This little circle hotel is one of the smallest hotels I've ever stayed in and air con noisy but, in saying that can't really complain. Receptionist's always smiling and happy to help fill our cooler with ice evey morning. Handy beach chairs surf boards to take to beach. Didn't eat at eggs and stuff but queues every day. No bar and reception outside beside lift quaint to say the least , all in all good stay.

I liked the hotel and location but did not appreciate the daily $15 fee that was added at end of payment process on your website for this hotel. This info. needs to be listed on initial screen so the consumer sees the full price when comparing other hotels ......very misleading and WRONG!

I chose this hotel purely for its combination of location and price. It delivered on both beyond my expectations. The location is excellent and directly across the street from the beach. On the next corner is the Hyatt Regency and two blocks away is the Marriott. I could not help but chuckle at the fact they were paying three or four times as much as my $149 per night..Yes, the room is small and yes, it is dated. But location trumps all. From my balcony, (room 806, a partial ocean view) I had an excellent panorama of the beautiful sunsets. It was also great for breakfast.As to convenience, there is a McDonalds to the left and an ABC Store to the right. All the restaurants and shops are an easy stroll away. Eggs and Things is downstairs and always has a line, so I presume it is good. You can even use the money you save on the room to buy overpriced things that you don't need at all the high end shops.There is an $18 "Amenity Fee" which has become common anywhere you can so much as smell the ocean. Not too bad in this case since it includes internet (pretty good too), beach towels and DVD/Game rentals.There is no reason that I would not stay here again and recommend it to my friends.

Impecable hotel! Great location for your money. Will definitely stay here again! Right in the middle of everything hotel directly across from the beach worth the upgrade fee for ocean view!Room was small but was nice and clean. Beds were comfortable, had a great view from my bed stayed on floor 7 room 703. Only thing I'd suggest is a microwave. Everything was perfect!

Perfect location across from the duke statue. Views and sunsets are perfect from the balcony. Rooms are tiny but perfect other than they could use microwaves. Service was great, they upgraded us to a full oceanfront versus a partial the minute a room became available. Parking is small and very tight for a rental mustang but the parking at the zoo is not that far away. There is a nice little breakfast restaurant out front that is lined up every day. If there is anything I could say bad about the place it would be the noise, we had difficult sleeps the entire week we were there (shake hands with the devil I guess). The walls are paper thin and arranged in a circle like the rooms are you could hear the elevator every time it rang, and you could hear people walking around at all times of the night. If you were on the west side of the hotel in a partial oceanfront there would be a venturi effect from the wind howling when it was windy and in the oceanfront rooms the street is really loud, The garbage trucks going by at four am woke us up a couple mornings. Get a white noise app for your phone to drown out the noise. Despite the loudness I will definately be a repeat customer for the service and price and views!

Pros: right across the street from waikiki beach....good swimming areas for kidsLots of food options within walking distance Zoo and aquarium are down the streetHotel had a ps3 and movie rentalsHotel handed out beach towelsCONS: beach is rocky & sand was not as nice as expected Hotel has no pool and the beds in the room are too softAmenity fee was too high for what is offeredParking is a nightmareArea Is too busy when traveling with 8 year olds would stay on the other side of the island if I were to returnWe had a standard room on the 10th floor and could here everything. Sirens.. doors slamming.. people from the hotel overOverall...I would not stay at this hotel again even though it was a decent experience. I just think there are too many people in this area and a lot of homeless.

Stayed two nights here in an ocean front room and our stay was wonderful. Yes the rooms are small, yes the water pressure is low and yes the beds are on the smaller size, but it was a great stay !!! Rooms were very clean, great beds with fresh cotton unscented sheets and nicely decorated. The hotel was very clean. Friendly helpful staff. It was nice that this hotel offers DVD rentals, a treat for our two children at the end of a long day at the beach. The $18 per night amenity fee is a bit steep considering there is no pool and compared to what other places charge but the overall appeal and good management makes this an easy thing to overlook. This is place has a long history in Waikiki which we adore and is a beautiful and quaint place to stay. Very well run and quiet. Would stay here again without hesitation.

this hotel is located at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki beach. I think it is less crowded than up the airport way. The hotel staff are great and many have been their for years. I have stayed at the circle 6 or more times. It is more expensive than previous years since taken over by by Aston.One bad feature is no microwave. If you need something heated for your children, the front desk is very kind to heat something up for you in their microwave.The showers aren't very good for water pressure, but the bathrooms are nice and adequate. The ice machine is located behind the front desk and the staff needs to give it to you, which they are very good about doing,, no complaints from them how many times you get it.The movie rental machine is great. My kids used it everyday, 2-3 times if they wanted.The beach across the street is perfect. Great for kids. One downfall is the hotel has a 4 person limit per room (code) and we had to rent 2 rooms. Parking is very limited under the hotel. You may have to park off-site a night before space opens up below the hotel. Beds could be rotated for more comfort, as people sit on one side of the beds. Linens could be a little newer on some days- they vary. Basically love this hotel and wouldn't want to stay off the beach anywhere else. We will stay there again when we return. My kids love the hotel too. It is just a walk from the Honolulu Zoo and the McDonalds is right below the hotel less than 1/2 block. Kids can go there and I feel they are safe. Keep checking back and the prices go down, depending on when you go and book.

This hotel was exactly what we were looking for in waikiki. We were travelling to Oahu with our 18 month old and this hotel was in the perfect location for any family. Right across the road is the access to the family beach with the rock wall to prevent large waves. It is also right next to mcdonalds if you want a cheap quick food option and also between two ABC stores. The hotel is a five minute walk to the zoo and approximately a 45 minute walk to Diamond head. It is also within walking distance to all major restaurants and shops in waikiki.The hotel staff was great and very accommodating. However I wouldn't ask the travel desk staff member anything as she was not very helpful.Another amazing feature was that this hotel offered free movie rentals. This feature was amazing to help with jet leg when we were dealing with a toddler up by 3 am for the first few days.Although this hotel advertises parking, it was always full when we were there and therefore had to park 2-3 blocks away.A couple people have complained that the rooms are small but they have areas for storage and open areas next to each bed. Also, you are in a beautiful city, you will not be spending much time in the room.The view is also amazing. Throughout our 2 separate stays here we had a partial view of the ocean which was fantastic to sit out first thing in the morning.Overall i would highly recommend this hotel got any family, couple or song le traveller.

If you want to be close to the beach on a budget this is a good choice. Amenities are nil (no pool, fitness, or business center) yet they charge you a resort fee anyway for WiFi and a newspaper. I don't read newspapers and most hotels offer free WiFI now so little justification for that. Parking is very limited and during my stay I was directed to park at a sister property about 3 blocks away. You will then to pay cash for parking everyday at that garage so just an added inconvenience. Many of the rooms have either an ocean view or partial/peek-a-boo ocean view which is rare in this price range.

We absolutely loved this hotel! The location couldn't have been any better. Centrally located and near everything! The staff particularly Jan John were so helpful and nice. Everyone was nice I just delt with Jan and John the most. The parking was right there on site which made it so much easier with come and go rights. The hotel was a perfect size for our needs. Clean rooms, wonderful view! Highly recommend taking the upgrade if its available. Free movies that were just released was also a wonderful bonus. Would definitely stay again!

The location of the hotel could not be better. Right on the beach and right in the heart of Waikiki (including all amenities). Yes the rooms are small but if you don't plan on spending much time in your room - it's perfect. Especially for the price. It's ideal for two people - likely too small for more than that. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend the hotel.

I stayed here for 7 days in Feb upon check in I was offered to upgrade to an ocean view at a great price so sitting on the lanai in the late afternoon was beautiful with the sunset . The staff was very friendly and helpful. I as a female was there on my own for the first 3 days and felt totally safe with the location being right in the middle of all the action. Walk right out the door and the beach is right across the street. The room was nice and clean only had a shower but that's all we needed . Eggs n Things restaurant downstairs has the best food ..This hotel offers a lot for being a small hotel. I would definitely go back and recommend to my friends.

We stayed during February 2015..The hotel is in a great location, the rooms are small but that didn't bother us as we didn't spend too much time in them.Check in was great we arrived at about 7am and they allowed us to check in straight away. The shower isn't too flash as the water pressure was pretty poor.

This hotel has been nicely redone with an ocean theme, right down to the plastic goldfish in the bathroom. We were offered a nicer room upgrade at a discount upon check in, and jumped at the chance. Good lanais to watch the sunset on the beach from. The rooms are small, but well laid out. My spouse said the shower is smaller than one on a cruise ship. It was so great to swim in the protected areas of the beach, and then just walk across the street and take a shower. Plus, you'll be staying at the first hotel run by a woman in Waikiki. We hope to return.

We stayed in an oceanfront room on the 12th floor with a fantastic view. Check in was incredibly easy which after a long flight was appreciated. The rooms appear to have been recently remodelled and are nice and fresh. The cylindrical shape of the tower lends itself to the rooms having unique shapes but they use the space well. The bathroom is a little small but I'm 6ft tall and fitted in the shower fine. Lastly the view is awesome, it's rare that the real life experience matches or exceeds the website pics but this certainly does. We spent hours on the balcony relaxing taking in the views. The hotel is right on Kalakaua Ave with everything you need nearby.

Rooms are small, bathroom really small, but the views and location are great, very friendly staff,be sure to get a higher floor and ocean front or ocean view. Gets a little crowded with 3 adults lol will stay here again

We spent six nights at the Aston Waikiki Circle and loved every minute! We were on the top floor in 1403. This is the best room in the hotel. The "03" rooms have pretty much the same view as the "04" rooms ("04" rooms are in the centre of the building) but the "03" face due south so they get more sun on the lanai if that is important to you. You want to be at least on the 6th floor for a view. Pay the little extra for the oceanfront room, it's well worth it. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean art deco with a mini fridge and two double beds. Don't let the line up at Eggs n Things restaurant fool you, it's not very good. Location is perfect, close to beach, restaurants, shopping etc. Housekeeping staff did a wonderful job. Elevators are fast for an older hotel. A real gem with lots of history.

Small rooms, but the location is incredible. Nicely decorated, and well kept. This is an older property, but is kept well. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location is right across the street from Waikiki beach and the views are breathtaking. It can be noisy at times being right on the main thoroughfare.

We selected the Aston Waikiki Circle for a three night stay because it was the lowest priced hotel we could find in Waikiki. Given the price that we paid, we were pleasantly surprised by our experience, and our stay, while uneven, greatly exceeded our expectations. Here’s the good news:• Good value, great view – we paid a fraction of what it costs at other oceanfront hotels in Waikiki. For a no frills vacation, the Circle delivers. Upon arrival, we upgraded our room to a partial ocean view for $10/night more which was worth it, though we did have to walk out onto the balcony to enjoy seeing the beach/ocean/Diamond Head. I’ve stayed at the nearby Moana Surfrider before and was thoroughly taken by its elegant colonial ambiance. This time I was still able to enjoy the Surfrider’s lobby and picture perfect outside terrace, but I saved several hundred bucks by walking a few blocks back to the Aston after I was done.• Location – You’re right across the street from Waikiki Beach which is great. I don’t think there are any hotels that have a better location in Waikiki. You do have to walk across Kalakaua Avenue to get to the sand, but that’s fine. You’re right in the middle of the shopping and the heart of the action. This stretch of Waikiki has a great selection of very upscale shops, and more foot traffic than Vegas. As an aside, there sure are a lot of people in Waikiki.• Clean rooms – The hotel rooms are small but clean and tidy. Our room with two double beds didn’t feel cramped, but there’s definitely no extra space. The basics were all there: small single-sink bathroom and even smaller shower, one set of three drawers, mini fridge, and a closet with a safe (though no iron/ironing board).• DVD Collection – Right in front of the elevator there’s a kiosk, very similar to a RedBox, which offers free DVD’s to borrow. It was a fairly large collection, and their new releases were on par with RedBox and way better than Netflix Instant or Amazon. You play the movies on a Playstation which wasn’t too difficult to figure out. Nice amenity. Wi-fi comes with the resort fee and worked on all of our devices.• Breakfast - We didn’t go to Eggs N’ Things which is right there in the non-lobby. I couldn’t believe how long the line was. I wondered if some tour bus social media site gave it a great review because by mid-morning there was a line all the way to the street. I did like having a breakfast option on property.• Housekeeping – Rooms were cleaned well each night. I had trouble with the TV remote and someone came up within minutes to show me how to use.• Circle shape – The circle shape makes for some quirky hallways, garage driveways and room configurations, but in the end it was kind of cool. They should figure out how to have a rooftop terrace.Here’s the not quite so good:• Lobby Ambiance – There actually isn’t a lobby. You pull into the hotel carport and there’s a covered exterior breezeway. When I had to back my car out, I was worried about hitting people standing in line. You check in at a window which is behind the glass like at a bank. The front desk staff ranged from graciously friendly to somewhat grouchy. It’s all fine I guess, but if you’re looking for something upscale, the Aston will be disappointing.• Noise – This stretch of Waikiki seems to have a lot police cars. One night the street noise woke us up, another night it was crying babies and our last night it was people talking at the elevator early in the morning. Fortunately, the A/C drowns out most of it.• Parking – We were told on our first night that the on-site garage was full and that we’d have to park at the Aston Banyan’s circuitous garage which was four blocks down and two blocks over. This was a hassle when we came and left a couple of times, especially late at night, but on our second two nights we were able to park in the garage on-site which was tight but way more convenient (the $20/night to park at the Circle vs. $15 at the Banyan was a pretty good deal).So as I think back on our stay at the Aston Waikiki Circle, a lot of people demand way more from their hotel, but if your needs are on the spartan side and you want to stay in the middle of Waikiki within walking distance to the beach and shopping, this is a great value option which I would return to again and recommend to friends.

BACK to front & sorta center... Jan 23-28th....#1405...view is the same :>) I am thinking that Hawaii now has the bloom from the flower, the homeless seems to be getting worse, parking of cars is higher, there is a resort fee & its NOT a resort....I think that MIDDLE America is getting priced right out of Hawaii,I think we should lease out the islands to Asia,& give everyone stateside some of that $$, I suggest that we all start to do our homework & plan our Va-cay closer to home.The only thing that middle class America can buy is stuff from the ABC store & that can be done online.Several places close by have had a face lift & that's good, but it is very hard to walk over the sleeping/setting homeless & try & eat a meal, again I say don't need to buy a airline ticket & hotel fees including parking & resort fees, we can see that in our own town & doesn't cost anything to see.

I listened to other reviews and got an upgrade to the Ocean front room. It was only $20 more per night than the cheapest room i booked. The view from the 9th floor was spectacular. It was one of the most successful investments I ever made. You will pay triple of the price for such view in Sheraton waikiki, and it will not be that good because this hotel is in the middle of waikiki so yo can have a view both directions, and the Sheraton is on the edge. Room was quite simple. But it had good sized HD TV with many HD channels. Window AC, but very efficient. Restroom/shower is small and can not fit more than one person. Overall it was 1-2 best of my 10 visits to waikiki in the last 3 years.

I stayed in an Oceanfront View room on the 13th floor. The view of the ocean and Waikiki Beach was SPECTACULAR. Absolutely amazing. The room was a bit small, but it was just me so that didn't bother me too much (plus I didn't spend a lot of time inside). The property is directly across the street from the beach, which is perfect. The lanai/balcony could comfortably fit two people (they provide two chairs and a small table). The housekeeping staff do an excellent job of keeping the rooms neat and clean. The shower and bathroom are a bit small (no tub), but the ventilation in the bathroom was surprisingly good (usually I might see a "vent" in hotel bathrooms, but it doesn't blow or suck air). There are two elevators in the building which are very fast--I never waited long, even being on the 13th floor. My only complaint is that the beds are a bit small (they do specify the size all over their website (twin?)), and I am relatively tall (6'2"), so my feet hung over the end of the bed. I slept diagonally across the bed and that was fine. Overall, I would recommend this place if you want to go to the beach and be near shopping and food.

Being our first trip to Hawaii for my 50th, we decided to stay 4 nights in Maui followed by 9 nights in Waikiki. We took the advice of friends who travel every year and stay in an Ocean Front Room at the Circle. WOW the view from our 10th floor room was spectacular! To have this view in any other hotel would cost an absolute bomb. Being Aussies, we loved that the beach was across the road and we were close to everything, especially after a half day trip out we would come back and go straight to the beach. We had been told the rooms were quite small, but we were pleasantly surprised as they were perfect for the two of us, comfortably fitting all our shopping bargains from the Black Friday Sales lol. The room was clean, bright and quiet. When we eventually get back to Waikiki this will definitely be the hotel we will stay in again! Its amazing since we returned the amount of people who have said "Thats where we stay!"

If it is your first trip to Waikiki this is the perfect location, right next to the beach and a short stroll to Shopping and restaurants.However if you have visited before you might want some luxuries like:PoolOn site restaurantBarBigger roomsOnly criticism is staff could have been more engaging at Front desk and have guides in room on recommended restaurants etc, (Cleaning staff were friendly)hence why I only awarded 4 stars

The location is perfect for this hotel. Rooms are small but comfortable and always clean and well maintained. No meals available in the Hotel but when you are in the middle of Waikiki this is not a problem.Stall are vey good and Room service is even better.My fourth stay in 26 years and we always enjoy the "Circle" as it has not changed in an ever changing world.

The Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel is conveniently located directly across the street from Waikiki Beach. The rooms are clean, cozy and comfortable. The only drawback may be if you have to park a car -- parking is limited, and the overflow parking is at a sister hotel a block away. The staff is awesome and accommodating. I would recommend reserving an ocean view room, or even a partial oceanview room. Overall, this hotel is a family favorite, and is our go to hotel when we stay in Waikiki.

This is now our 3rd time staying at the Waikiki Circle Hotel. It is situated across the street from the beach. Get a room above the 10th floor for a great view of the beach, and westward towards Honolulu. The hotel is also just a 15 minute walk from the zoo and aquarium. The rooms are pie-shaped with the width being at the balcony. The bathrooms are small, but functional. There is a decent sized desk with hook ups for laptops. Also a safe, which is an extra charge as well. There are two chairs and a small table on the balcony. Our rooms each time had two double beds in them. They were comfortable, however, my husband and I would have preferred a king bed. Eggs n' things restaurant is located in the open lobby. Staff is friendly and helpful. We stayed 17 days this time. An ABC store is located right next door and has everything a tourist would need from food , liquor, towels, clothing and touristy items. Near the entrance to the parking garage is an area where people put their picnic chairs and umbrellas when they leave. This time we managed to get two chairs a mat, and two umbrellas, thanks to the generosity of someone else. We used them for our entire stay. There are also floaty toys to borrow and return when finished using them too.

Tiny hotel with with a tiny room and a BIG view. It's clean, it's tidy, it's friendly with a comfy bed. What else do you need? We stayed in an oceanfront room on the 10th floor. The best views of the beach, ocean and downtown Waikiki an easy stroll up the street..........BLISS.

Made my reservation too late to get a choice holiday-time condo. Did a lot of TripAdvisor research on hotel options. Settled on this one based mainly on reviews endorsing its blend of reasonable prices with extremely convenient location right in the heart of Waikiki -- probably not more than 25-30 yards from the beach. The accommodations were small but perfectly acceptable for 2 adults in my opinion. Any more than 2 people in the room probably would have felt cramped. Had a wonderful unobstucted view of the ocean from our 8th floor window and lanai. Based on my booking experience it didn't seem like I had to pay anything extra for the view. There are numerous fine dining options and plenty of shopping within an easy half mile walk. The beach got very crowded on the nicest weather days, but in terms of the hotel itself...no real complaints at all.

Just got home 2 days ago and spent 5 nights in this great boutique Hotel. Stayed in an oceanfront room on the 10th floor. The best views of the beach, ocean and downtown Waikiki. Even though the rooms are small, they are well thought out. Free DVD's to choose from every day. Good Wifi. But honestly we spent very little time inside, as the beach is right across the road. Staff very friendly and rooms very clean.

I had expected more from this hotel based on the pictures and reviews I had read. Upon check-in, we found the room to be quite small. The only seating area was around the corner from the main part of the room, in front of the closet; which left us lying/sitting on the beds while in the room. The bathroom was beyond small, one adult max with no elbow room for anyone else. Our room faced to the west, and even the lightest wind shook and rattled the sliding glass door to our balcony. The hotel itself is DIRECTLY across the street from Waikiki Beach, and minutes from great shopping and restaurants. The noise from people and cars was actually less than other hotels we have previously stayed at on Kuhio St though, which was a plus. Absent our door issue which caused unplanned wake ups and loss of sleep, I would recommend this hotel only if you do not plan on staying in the room.. Sleep & go!

This is a great little hotel new refurnished and the staff are lovely and welcoming. The prices are good for the location. As the location is what you want when staying in Waikiki. They have a lovely under the sea/ beach theme in the hotel. I would be happy to recommend this cute boutique hotel.

This hotel was perfect for what we needed. Clean, tidy and fairly price friendly. The best thing was that it is LITERALLY directly across the road from waikiki beach. I'm talking like a 60 second walk, if that. Honestly the only bad thing I can say about this place is that the water pressure in the shower was kind of low. Obviously its not the Ritz, but it feels fresh and I would stay here again!

Before we get started, if you're arriving on an early flight book the room on for the night before otherwise you will not get in until after 1500.Eggs and things is directly underneath the hotel so there is always a crowd lining up to get, but if you take you room wallet down you will receive a 10% discount.The Chinese Lantern as it was formally know is a great located hotel in the heart of Waikiki. You have to purchase an amenities pack which includes, wifi in room, playstation in room with free DVD and game rentals from reception, daily newspaper.Room has 2 x double beds (a little on the soft side along with the pillows) but it may be sufficient for some.We had level 9, oceanfront room and let me say it is probably one of the best views i've had in Waikiki.
