Great location for shopping and restaurants, parking at the hotel is $18 per day (underground). If this is full you can also park around the corner approx 2 block for $80 - 7 days the hotel will give you directions.

I found this hotel browsing through Trip Advisor and at first glance, i was a bit worried about the place, but with a tight budget and a short notice invite to something special, i figured why not? This place is a GEM and allow me to give you my 2 cents :Location: 5 stars! Its right in heart of Waikiki! Thats all i have to say about that. Room: 5 Stars all around. It was clean, it had a great view, beds were comfy, and it was honestly quite the surprise. Service: EXCELLENT. They took care of us even when the other travel website screwed up on something. We were given an ocean view rather than a city room view at no charge and everything was taken care of ASAP by the great staff. OVERALL: Go see this place. Its a nice little spot, and its got some vintage charm and sure to make you wonder why you didnt see it sooner. Cheers and ALOHA!
user_name:
Akira221
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: Booked cheap room and upgraded on arrival to ocean view . Awesome views on beach and lots of people. the room is curved with two small beds not one big one. Great frig coffee maker tv and game machine for DVD. Fees waived cause DVD machine broken. Good AC and lanai. Classic old school hotel in the perfect location.

This place is nice and simple and is so close to everything. When we come back to Hawaii we will definitely be staying there again as the price was so good. The staff were also very helpful and the rooms were very clean.

My daughter and me took a quick girl's trip here and were pleasantly surprised by the boutique decorating, very clean and comfortable, everything you need packed into a small space but very accommodating. The location couldn't be beat, right at the beach and centrally located to all of Waikiki's hotspots, a great view of the ocean from our balcony. The employees were very friendly at all times and the coffee shop located 1 block to the south was the perfect outdoor experience in the morning. We were only there for 4 days this time but it was perfect for a short stay of beach, surf, shopping and restaurants. If you are on a budget but want to be treated well and stay in an excellent room, this is the place! I will come back here again.

We arrived early off a cruise and were delighted when they had a room available for us, on about the second floor with a view over the beach. Unfortunately, this also overlooked rather ugly air-conditioning equipment and ducts. The room was not fancy but the bed reasonable and there was not too much noise from the street below.The main attraction is the reasonable price along with the proximity to the beach and all the eateries in Waikiki which we also found reasonably priced, certainly by Australian standards.

The location was perfect, right in the middle of all the action. Especially on Halloween. Wow!! The view was amazing & the beach was so close. The rooms were a good size, we expected smaller, but perfect for a couple. The old box aircon was noisy, but a few bangs on it & problem fixed. Only thing we didn't like was the extra daily fee added. We didn't read the paper, didn't have coffee in the room & used the wifi maybe 2 or 3 times. (Could of gone to maccas to do that for free) The fee should be if you are going to use those facilities, we didn't. But on the whole, the staff were very nice & we did have a great holiday.

24 hour front desk service, which is very handy if required. Situated close (easy walking distance) to everything in Waikiki. We stayed 10 nights on the sixth floor directly overlooking the sea. The room was very clean and comfortable. Air conditioning worked beautifully and the beds were spot on. All the standard inclusions were there, including Wi-Fi and DVD/Game rentals. These were included in the room charge. The room was serviced each day. It was great to return after a big day out to discover your room perfectly presented. Prices were reasonable and staff always friendly and helpful.The bathroom needs a little more ventilation, but that is a minor gripe. I would gladly stay there again. Highly Recommended.

My partner and I stayed for 8 nights and we couldnt be happier with the hotel. I read all the reviews before I booked and I have to say many of the negative reviews got it wrong. I booked this hotel for its location and the price and I am glad I did. It was the perfect spot with amazing views and close to everything, be it the beach or the shops. We had an ocean view room on the 9th floor and it had everything we needed. We were out and about a lot but the beds were comfy and there was no noise. Pillows were a bit thin but by putting two togethger it did the trick. Rooms arent massive but were big enough for what we needed and plenty of room to put our suitcases. The staff were very friendly and accomoodating and the rooms were always cleaned well. As I said we were close to everything you needed be it an ABC shop, restaurants, rental cars etc. The fact that the water was 20m's away really made it for us,as we made use of the beach a lot in our stay. The best holiday I have had and I will definitely be using this hotel again. Dont expect the Hilton because it isnt but if you want a nice clean with great views, friendly staff and a great location than this is the spot for you.CheersAdrian

What a fantastic place this is. It may not have all the fancy stuff you can get at some of the other places, but just the location alone makes it a winner. Directly opposite the famous Waikiki beach is such a bonus. If you can upgrade to the full ocean view make sure you do. Was so worth the extra dollars. The rooms are small but more than comfortable, the beds were amazing the pillows just right. The bathroom is also small but more than adequate. The soap they supply was the just the best. No little round bars that you lose while showering. Central to all that you want to do. Shop shop shop! Fantastic stay for our 10 nights. Thank you Waikiki Circle. If we should ever return here it shall be.

This was our second time staying here (last time was about 10yrs ago). I choose it primarily because I can get a wonderful view for less than $200 a night, and be at the beach in minutes.Positives: location, view for price, rooms seem to have been udpated recently as the bedding seemed newer and they had flat screen tvs. There is an in room safe. Naomi(? name) at reception was a sweetheart. Plenty of hangers, closet space and deep drawers to stash your stuff. Being able to go down the elevator and having the doors open up right across the street from the beach. Sitting on the lanai and watching the Halloween craziness. Negatives: if I was traveling with more than one person, I would probably stay somewhere else, as the room could get cramped with more than 2 people's stuff. We had 2 double beds, and used the second bed as our luggage holder, and made use of the closets and drawers. With the lanai door closed, street noise was not an issue for us with a/c on ( we were on a higher floor). There are not any amenities such as a pool or fancy lobby if you need that. Its stiff my go to budget choice in Waikiki, don't change!

My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights before heading off to the North Shore and we opted to get a Oceanview Room. Naomi checked us in at the front desk and she was really lovely. Very friendly and helpful - she gave us some good tips to get around. She put us on the 11th floor which was great as it gave us a good view. The room was clean, although the beds were too small for 2 people to sleep comfortably and the A/C was very noisy. The balcony was a good size and from our level we had great views. We did enjoy sitting on the balcony and watching the views. The location was fantastic as it was just across the road from the beach and there's an ABC store and McDonalds right next door for a quick snack. I felt that the hotel was quite expensive for a 2.5-3 star hotel... also the 'resort' fee was expensive ($18 per day) considering there is really no real facilities in the hotel apart from use of the wifi, safe and DVD machine. We stayed for another night at the end of our trip and decided to book an Oceanfront Room - we got put on the 3rd floor which was very disappointing and the price (close to $300) was not worth it. Overall, we did enjoy the 5 nights we stayed at the hotel, although for the price, we probably will book elsewhere next time.

We stayed here for 5 nights. Great location and great rates. Right across the street is the beach (hotel supplies beach towels in your room) and walking distance to shops, restaurants with a ABC convenience store right next door. We chose to have a city view room, as we only needed a clean place to sleep and shower. Yes, the room was on the small side, but who needs a great big room, we're here to see the place, not spend time in our room! Friends had an oceanview and had to move to upper levels because of the noise, other than the hum of the airconditioner our room was great. Annoyed that you have to pay the amenity fee for each day, why they just don't add that into the room cost to begin with. I just hate hidden costs. Bonus however is a little cafe downstairs called Eggs n Things, great little place and there is always a queue. As they rent the space from the hotel, they offer 10% discount on your meals, just another bonus. You need to show your room envelope with the Aston Circle name on it to get the discounts. Would we stay here again... absolutely... location, location!
user_name:
Kirsty G
Largs, South Australia, Australia

review_body: Based on the criteria that this hotel is no more than 3 star, I would give them a 4.5/5.Aston brand does have its' loyal followers, and has carved themselves a very comfortable spot in the market. It's not a luxury hotel brand - there are a handful of those everywhere nearby, and I've stayed at a number of them, but this is a different type of experience.Location is fantastic, being directly across the street from Waikiki Beach. The views are fantastic (if you stay oceanview or better). There are currently only 8 properties that are beachfront on Waikiki, and this is about as close as you can get without paying the premium to be on the beach.Right on Kalakaua, so it's easy to walk everywhere. The Pink Trolley has a stop located about a block away, and you can catch The Bus (if you're headed to Diamond Head, or elsewhere) on Kuhio, 2 blocks away.We also took a couple of tours and rented a car during our stay, all of which were from the Hyatt Regency, located on the next block over, making it very convenient. There's an ABC store right outside the hotel, which is great for those quick 'run out to get something' trips.The 'lobby', or open area with the front desk, is quite small, and doesn't have a great welcoming factor, but is clean, and, considering that it is shared with the entrance to Eggs'n'things, not congested.There are two elevators servicing the entire tower, but we found that we did not have to wait very long.We were in an oceanfront room on the 9th floor. The oceanfront rooms are the ones found directly in front of the elevators, and we worried that we may have some noise from other guests, but this did not prove to be a problem.The rooms, as mentioned, are small. The washroom is definitely tight (reminded me of my first studio apartment)! There were 2 doubles in our room, which worked for us. We mostly lived out of our suitcases. The A/C, which many have complained is loud, is definitely something to get used to. We found that changing the setting to 'COOL' instead of 'Auto' helped, as it was most annoying when it kept turning off and starting up all the time.The noise from Kalakaua was definitely noticeable. Especially, as I noticed that the glass door does NOT sit properly in its' track, which causes a gap between the door and the wall. We attempted to move it shut, but it wouldn't budge.Housekeeping was great about cleaning the room, though we felt like we could have used another towel or two. They do supply beach towels in the room.Security was good - the elevators require a card key, and while there were no chains on the locks, the dead bolts were heavy and the doors were secure.I think this hotel certainly offers good value if priced right. Very basic, no frills, but clean, comfortable, and safe.The daily resort fee has steadily been climbing over the years, and I find that it is getting overpriced. We arrived the night before Tropical Storm Ana passed by, and the front desk always had info posted regarding the storm warnings and advisories.

We have just returned from our 4th stay at the Waikiki Circle and enjoyed it very much. The hotel is in a fabulous location opposite the pools on Waikiki beach, with shops and restaurants close by. The rooms are not large but we have always found them to be clean and comfortable. We don't spend a lot of time in our room anyway and the Circle has everything we need at an affordable price. The staff are always friendly and helpful. Beach towels are supplied which saves having to pack one in your luggage (more room for shopping). The hotel is also reasonably quiet for Waikiki.The only negative is the $18 per night amenity fee which is a bit steep. On our previous visits they delivered the local paper to the room and had free coffee in the lobby in the morning, now there is a coffee maker in the room and they still deliver the paper but unless you use the wi fi (which I heard from others is quite slow) you really don't get much for your money. However this is a minor point as the hotel is still good value considering the position.This is not a full service hotel (no pool, room service, spa etc) but if you are looking for somewhere basic that is affordable, clean and friendly and well located you can't beat the Waikiki Circle. We will definitely stay again.

This is my second stay in this hotel as in many years.. The hotel is a bit dated, however it offers a fantastic location with many holiday makers services nearby. Clean and tidy rooms and very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are little bit too small, however the hotel prices are very affordable. The $18/night for amenities is a little bit over the top. I didn't use the DVD rentals nor the play station, thus the slow WiFi cost me $18/day.

Great location, across from the Waikiki Beach and close to stores and restaurants. The rooms are small but clean and well designed. Personally we found the bed was very comfortable. We had a partial view of the beach for which we need to step out on the balcony where we did not feel comfortable. Common areas could use a face lift. Parking was limited but convenient. Generally speaking, this was good value for the price.

Found this hotel purely on price search. I had a family of 4 going to Hawaii, and needed to save somewhere. Got to the hotel, and they had offered an upgrade to "ocean front" for only $5 more a night. SOLD! Originally, that would have been an additional $25/night.The staff was very friendly and knowledgable. The hotel had free DVD rentals in the lobby, for those times when you didn't want to be on the beach. Room was very small, especially for 4 people. However, we quickly figured out that you are NEVER in the room (except to sleep).This hotel is across the street from Waikiki Beach. In fact, the section in front of the hotel is "walled off" to be calm, so it was perfect for all the families with little ones. That wasn't us, we wanted to snorkel and surf. But that was only 25 yards up or down the beach. Nice.Back to the room. The lanai (porch) was great. Sat out there every day enjoying morning coffee, or nightly adult beverages, just watching the waves, surfers, and passerby's, yes, all from my hotel room. The best part was the next to the last day, while sitting on the lanai in the morning, we were watching the humpback whales breach out in the ocean. Yes, from our room.Don't get me wrong, this is a no-frills room/hotel. However, when on a budget, wanting to spend more money on my experiences, than my sleep, I will stay there again.

Great location but very average rooms. Right across the road from the beach. Very old and could do with new beds. Very small bathrooms and shower nearly impossible to shower in. Not a fan of having to pay an extra $18.00 a night for DVD , play station, wifi which I would not use. Friendly staff and Macca's right next door.

my family stayed here for 4 nights, altough our room had partial view of the ocean, it still worth it. hotel staff was friendly and always accommodating. located in the heart of waikiki beach, surf , sand and shopping. rooms and bathrooms are a bit cramped. the only thing i hated was the fact that we were required to pay extra $18 a night for ammenities like playstation, dvd rentals and slow wifi.

We stayed here for eight nights in September and were delighted with the hotel, great location right on the beach and easy to get to from the public bus which we took from the airport. This hotel was great value and the room was spotless, bright and airy. We choose an ocean front room on one of the higher floors and we got a room on the thirteen floor (one from the top) and it was ideal. The hotel staff were really helpful and we could not have asked for anything more from a hotel anywhere.

A wonderful retro hotel ocean front in Waikiki. Great location. The hotel is right in the center of everything. Mcdonalds next door, subway one block away, and plenty of shopping on each side of the road. The rooms are small but very nostalgic. We loved it. It looks like you stepped back in to 1969 but with modern day technology. Big screen tv, blow dryer, ect... Room was very clean and the staff are very friendly. The view of the ocean was amazing. Ask for the top floor...it's worth it.

This is a great little hotel right in the center of Waikiki. The beach is directly across the street. We had a partial oceanview with two queens on the top floor. The room was $180 with my government ID. Parking fills up fast and if it does you're out of luck even if you have booked a room. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Do not leave beach mats, boards, or anything you'd like to keep as your own at the rack in the parking lot. Although its there for guest to use to store their boards and beach gear, 3 of my kids body boards were stolen from there in a matter of 15 mins. Be prepared for the masses of people and traffic and the noise that comes along with it. But it's expected as you are in the heart of Waikiki. Over all, this is a clean, no frills and low cost hotel in a prime location.

This hotel is in a great location especially for the beach as it is right across the street. This was the first stay of our holiday. When booking in we upgraded to an ocean view which was worth the money. The room was small, the aircon noisy but it drowned out the sound of the traffic noise which was pretty bad. We weren't in their much so even though cramped it was ok.

My best friend and I stayed here for 10 days in September 2014. Upon arrival we were greeted by John and Naomi. Both such wonderful people. We were right away offered an upgrade, and were taken to see the rooms. We went from partial ocean view to ocean view, and it was well worth every penny. We were on the 11th floor room 1106, this is the perfect side to be on, as you have shade in the morning for your tea/breakfast and then you have the sunset in the evening. The rooms are small but for two people it's perfect size, as it has two double beds. I would say they'd be too small for a family of 4. The great thing with this hotel is they provide you with the beach floaties and beach mats and unlimited beach towels!! We used these everyday. As we drink tea not coffee, they got us a kettle right away! The rooms only have showers but are a nice size and people closing their doors seemed to be a little Noisey (echo). The air conditioning worked awesome. They give you a coupon book when you get there, be sure to go through it or carry it with you as it's only for people who are staying at the Aston and there are some great deals, we saved on transportation and meals. The travel booth lady named Rachael was also so helpful. All the staff was so polite, sorry I don't have all your names. Eggs and things is right below the hotel and also is McDonalds and the ABC store. If you are looking to swim with the dolphins, be sure to check out the Dolphin Quest at the Kahala Resort, so amazing!!!! In march my family and I had done the swim at the Sea Life park but I would rate this one is way better. If you need a taxi, call Charlie's Taxi as they are a local company and rates seem to be lower, they offer $29 flat rate from the airport, I would recommend this because if you get on one of the big buses, you end up stopping at every hotel and it takes like 2 hours, this way you get where your going in a half an hour.

great hotel, a bit old, but right in the thick of Waikiki beach - I totally would stay here again! The rooms are a bit small & our balcony faced away from the beach, but still - a great deal for a nice simple room!!!!

We stayed here August 2014. The location was perfect - right across from Waikiki with several swimming & surfing areas, and several rental places. One of the swim areas was protected and perfect for younger children. The room, however, was so small that two adults and two small children were very cramped. Four carry-on suitcases added to the congestion. The room was clean, and we were outside most of the time, so only whined like crazy when we all scrunched in. It was just about the same size as a regular cabin on NCL. The balcony facing Waikiki was worth the extra money. The Eggs restaurant ranks fairly low. We ate there once - had better at Denny's - and choose other places after that. The staff, though, was great! And, don't expect a traditional lobby in the hotel - it's all outside with a class window where you check in. The history of the hotel is very interesting - be sure read about it in the "lobby." Our Pearl Harbor tour picked us up just a block away - very convenient. Now that I've been nearly on the beach at Waikiki, I would choose another hotel next time.

This hotel is located right across the road from Waikiki Beach; couldn't have asked for a better location. It's in a central position, surrounded by shops, restaurants and ABC stores. We'd requested for an oceanfront room so our views were fantastic. We were on the 8th floor, #805, one room away from a direct oceanfront view - #804 would have had the full view. We were high enough that we couldn't hear the traffic.We arrived from Sydney at 8am, after a 9 hour flight. We'd requested for an early checkin when we made our booking and I even sent an email to them prior to departure but when we got there, we were told we had to wait until 3pm to check in. Our room wasn't ready and they didn't know when it would be ready.The room was quite small but we were out most the day so that wasn't a big problem. The shower was a bit cramped though. Loved the bright yellow walls and decor. Housekeeping was excellent. Room was very clean. The a/c unit was quite noisy though.Beware the man with the glasses at the front desk. He was always at his computer and when you approached him, you had to wait until he finished what he was doing on the computer. He wasn't a very pleasant person. The rest of the staff were wonderful, especially the ladies.

Booked ocean view room. Got upgraded to ocean front room for $20/n. Would have cost about double that at time of booking. Great location, views and value. Room available straight away even though we arrived at about 1100. Nice lanai to enjoy view. We were on 6th floor and views were great. Maybe a little lower would be obscured by trees. Room size ok for two. Bathroom was ok for us, but can imagine may be a bit small for larger people. Great wifi in room. Boogie boards for use. Best end of Waikiki IMO.

This hotel may be across from the beach with only the boulevard to cross,which is wonderfull but when we arrived last Sunday, there was soooo many people on the tiny strip of beach that the wonderfull quickly disappeared from my toughts.Much more beach to enjoy on the eastern part of waikikiAs far the Aston goes, no A/C reception area. No facilities except for an ''Eggs n Things'' not associated with the Aston.The front desk is a counter behind a glass.2 Computers on a table and a DVD renting machine. that is it.As for the rooms, yes clean, but tiny. Wearyness starting to show, even if recently renovated.Our room on the cruise ship we had just desimbark had more square footage.On the wall A/C which is noisy and street noise only slows down during the night to sart again at full blast by 6 in the morning.Be aware, location is sometimes not anough!

The location is perfect.Just a few steps cross the street is Waikiki!!!The view from balcony is fantastic!!!The famous restaurant is just down the hotel.I will definitely go stay when I visit Oaho again!

We stayed for our first 4 days in Hawaii. I wasn't sure what to expect but we just needed a place tolay our heads especially when we first arrived. What a surprise on the size of the room - much bigger than the photos show and location, location, location. Quiet, comfortable! Clean and the beds are soooo comfortable. Staff is friendly and Eggs n Things downstairs great place to eat. Would definitely stay here again. We had an oceanview. Got a great view of wakiki beach as well as the park. Miss it.

This place has mixed reviews but let me tell you it is value for money. Ive been to Waikiki a few times and stayed in top end hotels and even though this is not top end, the hotel is clean, tidy and value for money. Each room has two double beds, a mini work area, and fridge, and is constantly airconditioned so when you arrive you are instantly relaxed. The front desk, although outside, has the cutest people who are nothing but helpful! (Queenie I miss you my dear!)... the only issue anyone could have with this hotel is the small shower area, but seriously other than that I cannot think of anything else bad to say about the place. PS if you are hesitant about the beach front view and are on a budget the partial view rooms literally also have the best view!! we had two rooms (one of each) and I think the partial view is as good as the partial view room.
user_name:
ErikTopal
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: I guess I don't want my two-star rating to say it all. This hotel was our first impression of Hawaii, so maybe we were expecting better. But, as soon as we arrived, we realized that there is no hotel lobby. The "front desk" is actually a room with a plexi-glass (bullet-proof glass?) window where you can attempt to communicate with a hotel employee through a hole cut in it. Given how loud it was outside, it was very difficult to hear what the person behind the "desk" was saying. He wasn't exactly unpleasant, but not exactly welcoming either. After straining and asking him to repeat several times, we were finally able to figure out what we needed to do to get parked and to our room.So, parking...we paid to park in the hotel garage, which was actually built below the building. It only could hold about maybe 20 cars, and that's packed in like sardines. We drove down there, and there were no spaces available. So my wife had to go back up to the "desk" and ask them what to do. One of the employees came down and moved a car to make room for ours. Finally...parked!We made our way up to the room, which was tiny. I had expected this from the other reviews I had read, and didn't really have a problem with it. And, it was clean, so that counted for a lot, in my opinion. However the "partial ocean view", while true, was actually dominated by a view of the side of the building next door, a parking garage, and a trash dumpster. Yes, we could see the ocean from our balcony, but just barely. Overall, it wasn't a pleasant view.The room (and entire hotel, for that matter) was old, and in need of a renovation. Strange noises woke us from our jet-lagged sleep throughout the night. It kept occurring to us that this seemed more like a Spring Break retreat for drunken teenagers than a nice hotel room for vacationing adults. Except is was overpriced, which would likely scare away any partying college student.Overall, I just can't recommend this hotel. If it didn't cost as much as it did, I would have at least given it another star and advised that you get what you pay for. But in this case, we didn't even get that. After staying on some other islands and coming back to Honolulu, we stayed up the street at the Outrigger Beach Resort. While much more expensive, at least we felt like at the Outrigger, we got what we paid for. I hate to give bad reviews, but I would have to advise that unless they renovate the Circle, or lower the prices, you should stay away.

This hotel is circular - quite unique! The accommodation is very adequate - comfortable beds and lots of clean towels. We paid less and took a room with no ocean view - our choice. The hotel is quite literally across the street from the ocean. My only real negative is that the check-in/out desk is tiny and often has only 1 clerk working there so one has to wait. When you get your turn they are charming and efficient!

There are a few Aston hotels right on the downtown Waikiki beach area. I previously stayed at the more basic Beachside option but for about $20 more you can get a much bigger room at this Circle hotel next door. Big clean rooms with 2 beds, big bathroom plus alcove for bags and coffee machine bench make rooms very liveable as your gear spreads out over a few days! Best feature is the large airy balconies giving great views over the beach. Rooms are super clean and staff friendly. Note the mandatory service/amenity fee which gives internet access and free videos etc when comparing prices. There is about 4 pricing options with increasing clean views but even the partial ocean view we had gave adequate views

This is a great location and a terrific place to stay - our friends recommended we stay here and get an ocean-view. They were right - the panorama of Waikiki beach right in front of you is wonderful. The rooms are a good size for a couple and well appointed - they are not the most snazzy up-to-date available - but they're good value for the heart of Waikiki! The closeness to the beach comes with a degree of noise - so don't stay here if you're fussy about that - but other than some traffic noise, it's mainly just the sounds of people having fun in the soft rolling surf of that glorious ocean.

Stayed here for 7 nights recently on our honeymoon, location is amazing right across the road from Waikiki beach, it is next door to McDonalds and a ABC convenience store. Check in was swift, room was on 12th floor we paid extra for an ocean view well worth the money the view is out of this world, the room had two big beds , was spotless , had safe and a fridge a coffee maker . Included in the resort fee was fresh beach towels everyday. The only negative I had was been a honeymoon couple all the way from Ireland I thought they would make a little fuss over us but they didn't

Stayed here with my wife and 4 close friends late October 2013 before cruising back to Sydney.A great hotel right opposite the beach, close to good restaurants, but far enough away from the bars and restaurants on Lewers St to enjoy the walk (to walk off the mega servings the restaurants are renowned for and of course the women to have a browse in the shops).The rooms, although having 2 beds are quite adequate for 2 people with luggage but I feel they would probably be a tad too small for a family of 4 but you could make do if on a tight budget. The staff were very friendly and helpful and there is beach equipment for the use of guests as there is no pool, however the swimming just across the road at the beach is just perfect.I would thoroughly recommend this hotel as an alternative to the higher end hotels with it's old fashioned family holiday vibe.If available book the ocean front rooms, the view and the sunsets (with a few Longboard Lagers from the nearby ABC store) is what sets this place apart from the others I have stayed in Waikiki.

We stayed for two nights prior to our cruise. It is still a popular hotel. We arrived very early from our flight. On previous visits we have been able to access our room prior to the scheduled check in time but not this time and we could see how busy they were. This was not a problem for us. We had requested an oceanfront room as high up as possible and we were not disappointed. This hotel is still a little gem and the service we received from the staff member on arrival was very professional. We would still recommend staying here.

I booked for the Aston not really knowing what to expect, while everyone paid top dollar for fancy hotels with pools and gyms, the Aston didnt have that! But what they did have was a clean room, a comfy bed, and the best view in the house! i was directly across the rd to the beach, maccas to my left, abc store to my right and i was set! i would def stay there again! the staff were so nice and i couldnt complain about anything!

We stayed here the last night of our 3 week trip to the US. This place is perfectly located in Waikiki. The rooms are clean and bright. We had a beachfront room - which is exactly what it said, across the road is the beach with nothing infront of us. The rooms are a little on the small side compared to some of the other hotel but perfectly acceptable, we also had two large single beds as oppose to a double but that might have been more to do with what we selected than the hotel. They also have parking under the hotel. I would definitely recommend this place as great value in Waikiki.

We arrived early and were able to settle into our oceanfront room by 11 AM! Although the room is small, we had two double beds, a small bathroom, a mini fridge and desk area. The view was outstanding from the balcony! Everyone we spoke to was very happy with the accommodations. If you want to be on Waikiki Beach, and walk across the street to the water, this is the place to stay! Staff was very friendly and helpful and activities desk was also very helpful. Could not get late checkout because the hotel was completely booked! Would definitely stay again.

We arrived as scheduled on an early AM flight. Went to Pearl Harbor to pay our respects (another annual event). Arrived at the Aston Circle about noon on Aug 13. Told that they had no record of early arrival, even though it was noted on reservation and I called to confirm info. We had ordered 2 rooms and had paid for an upgrade to ocean front. Only one room ready, not ocean front, rather ocean view (they also had no record of our upgrade. Told 2nd room would be ready by 3 p.m. We drove around and explored. Came back, no room, waited for almost one and a half hours for our room. Also wound up being and ocean view not ocean front. Showed paperwork on upgrade, told that as they had no record of this, our papers were not good, to call our booking person. Later, our son and daughter in law's room had defective lock, took several tries over 3 days to correct it, Never moved to another room. Staff was friendly, but property was NOT worth the cost. Parking was full one evening, sent to sister property to park as was shown on their sign. When I got there, the other property refused us parking, saying they were no longer affiliated with Aston properties. Came back and desk clerk went down to the very small parking area (space for about 12 cars only) and moved his car and parked it in the handicapped slot. We were told that the employees park there so they do not have to pay to park elsewhere. So how many of the 12 slots are taken by employees, while guests have to pay $17 for parking whether there is space or not. (BTW: Circle's reservation and on line site shows $15 parking.)I am nor giving up on Aston Properties, but the Aston Circle is off my list as well anyone who asks us about places to stay in Oahu.Edward A

We spent a week at the Circle last June. The rooms are smaller than the photo's show them to be online. It's clean , basic accommodations with two beds , small bath room and a balcony. It's worth the upgrade price for the ocean front view. If you get the lowest priced room you'll be facing the rear and looking at another hotel. Ask for the 5 th floor or higher so you won't have to deal with the street noise below. Great Location right across the street from the beach. Walking distance to many restaurants and bars. We tried the Egg's and things eatery at the entrance for breakfast , for the same money, we went to other eateries the rest of the week and got better food and service and didn't have to wait on a long line to get in. For the price , this hotel is one of the better deals on Waikiki.

My husband and I stayed at the Circle for two nights last week. It was something like our 8th stay, so we knew what to expect. The location is just fantastic, you can't find a more affordable beachfront spot. We splurged on an oceanfront room and requested a high floor and an early checkin - we were extremely surprised when we arrived well before check in (flights for Aus always arrive so early into HNL...) to find both requests had been honoured. We walked into room 1404 and the view was simply breathtaking. (Our last visit had been just before our wedding 2 years ago and I think the staff's levels of enthusiasm and customer service have definitely improved since then, the service was excellent during our brief stay). The rooms themselves have been renovated in the past 3 years and are fun and beachy, though not overly spacious. Definitely adequate for a couple, the main thing is the view anyway. Keep in mind that Honolulu is a big city, and that Waikiki is a busy place - there will be noise late into the night, but the AC at the Circle helps block it out, as do earplugs. The ocean pool across the street is a great spot, it's protected and much like a regular pool. If you get a grassy spot early enough, you can get some shade and sun protection as well.

This hotel is great. It not only cost less than any other hotel on Waikiki beach, but it's clean, fun, retro, & in the hot spot of action day & night. For $10 per night we upgraded to a partial ocean view, & what a view! It was very entertaining to sit on the balcony & watch the action going on on the street below & in the ocean. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The rooms were a little bit small but who cares, considering all that's going on outside.

We stayed here on our second time on Oahu in the same trip (we went to Maui for a week in the middle of a 2-week break) so we saw a lot of it before we even stayed here. GREAT location, couldn't possibly be any closer to the world famous Waikiki beach and therefore within walking distance of so many great bars, restaurants and attractions. We were prepared for the room to be small as we saw this as more of a novelty hotel (it's a circular shape!!) but we were pleasantly surprised. It wasn't the biggest room, but I've definitely seen smaller. Fine for the 3 nights we were there. Everything was very clean and we had an ocean facing balcony - AMAZING view, just incredible. I think I'd stay here again and recommend it to others.

This property is right across the street from the beach in Waikiki in the middle of a swirling vortex of shops and tourists. The staff in the little open air lobby were professional and friendly in handling a problem with our reservation. We were prepared for the small rooms but ours was next to an exit heavily used by staff so the door slammed constantly and piles of dirty towels were visible there. No view. We were able to pay for an upgrade to a better room halfway through our stay--loved the view!The halls were dirty and we couldn't use the stairs because of a bad smell, but the rooms were clean and housekeeping was great. Elevator access requires a room key and is in sight of desk staff, so it felt very safe. (Confession: After an extended stay on Kauai I was not liking Waikiki at all but am trying not to let that color my review of the hotel! Maybe if I were into that crowded beach or the mall-like environment I'd be more forgiving...)

I was warmly welcomed by Naomi (sp) at check in. After inquiring about optional room upgrades she suggested that I talk to John in the morning as they were booked for the night. He beat me to it and called to offer me first choice in room upgrades!!! Very impressed with the service and communication between staff. I was also well taken care of by Queenie, Rose and absolutely everyone on staff but can't remember more names. Housekeeping did a fabulous job with aloha spirit. I could tell the entire team wanted me to enjoy my stay! Truly a relaxing and enjoyable stay. Thanks everyone! I will be back soon!Debbie from Vancouver

This is a great hotel, right on the beach at Waikiki. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable and the service is a treat. I arrived from Australian mid morning and was able to get into the room straight away. What a godsend... The manager was very helpful and patient with a weary traveller. Room rates are very reasonable considering the time of year.A great start to my first trip to Hawaii.

This hotel is a little jewel in Waikiki. Although small, this hotel is in a prime beachfront location at a very reasonable price. The rooms are very clean, neat and well equipped with most rooms having an ocean view. Although, if you like to shop and travel with lots of suitcases, you may have difficulty finding somewhere to put them. The hotel's staff were very polite and helpful. There is even a little tours desk to book your activities. The only downfall of this hotel is that the traffic on Kalakaua can be a little loud if your room is on a lower floor.

Dreaming of coming back soon! I come to Hawaii for one thing- the beach! Yes the rooms are basic but they are clean and when you are right across the road from the beach who cares.The staff are great and helpful, and you can never lose the hotel due to its unique shape :-p

Have stayed there for a week. Great location. They provide free sand bucket and swimming rafts to kids. Clean and basic room.I did not want to pay full ocean view due to high price. So after I saw the hotel partial ocean view picture, I decide to go for it. Paid extra money and reserved partial ocean view room. When I got there, I could not see any part of ocean from window. I asked the front desk, and the lady told me that I had to go out of my room and go to the balcony and turn my body 90 degree, then I should be able to see ocean partially. What a joke. This is not what they show in the picture.So do not be fooled by their partial ocean view thing, not worth it.I stayed in 12 floor, and it is very windy, especially at night even in non windy summer days. The wind is so loud makes me feel I am in a cold winter windy day.

Was just here a month ago for my 20th wedding anniversary! Didn't have a lot of cash but wanted to take my wife and kids. this hotel is right across from the beach!!! Literally step out onto the street and count to 60 and you are on the beach!!! We got the center ocean view and it was just beautiful. The rooms are small but they are clean. My kids are 7 and 10 so they were fine watching TV and playing on their tablets at night. But who hangs out in their room during the day? Especially with the beach right across the street!!! You pay a daily "service fee" but get "free" DVDs, video games, daily paper, beach mats, and water toys!!! Yummy restaurant Eggs and Things downstairs. Plus Mcdonalds is 20 yards away and huge food court 2 blocks away. Can't stress enough how good the location is. The beaches across the street have areas with huge sea walls that make the ocean like huge swimming pools. the parts without the walls have surf and surfers. And you can see it all from your balcony! they have a Hawaiian show right across the street. Realize you are on the main tourist strip, so you'll see and hear all the people walking below, but I had no problem sleeping with the air conditioner on. I loved this hotel and would stay again. Naomi at the front desk was very helpful and took good care of us!!! the only negative was the parking. Not enough! we had to park at their sister hotel 2 blocks away, but we actually liked that better since it was much easier to get in and out of their garage. Would highly recommend this hotel for families on a budget!

This place is basic - but clean, comfy beds, safe, WiFi, DVDs and helpful staff. But the view is awesome. We were on the 12th floor with an ocean front room and it was amazing. Who needs a pool when you can cross the road and swim in the ocean pool. Sure you get noise from the street - but that's the price you pay for this location. Great value for such a great view !! If you like 5 star don't stay here - if you want great views and convenient location then this is the place for you !

If you are looking for a five star hotel, this will not be it. But if you want something a little different this is perfect. First off we have no complaints with this hotel. It is only 14 floors high and 8 rooms per floor. The staff and service was top notch. The view from our room (1406) was very nice. Check in was easy and the location was excellent. The room may be small for some but for a couple it was ok (the room was about the size of one you would expect on a cruise ship). Also you have to go to the lobby to get ice. The hotel noise was minimal but the street noise is a little loud. We are not sure if we would stay here again just because we have stayed here but I would give it a positive stay.

This is a very pleasant place to stay.. we stayed as a couple for 10 days and found it to be fantastic. The rooms are reasonably small and the bathrooms are small but all you need really. We had an ocean view room on the 6th floor which was great, but there was a lot of road noise and people late at night yelling. The aircon was good but very loud, so be prepared for that. The decor was nice. Pleasant colours and modern for Hawaii. Friendly staff and nothing was too difficult. It is located at the zoo end but not far to walk at all to anywhere, and you are right opposite the beach too. I recommend this hotel without hesitation!

Yes, it's all about the location. Hotel is weird but not in a bad way. Rooms are small the bathroom even smaller. Bed was very comfortable and everything was very clean. If you have the chance to pay extra to face the ocean, do it. It's worth the money. Really close to bus stops, downtown Honolulu. There's an ABC store and a mc Donald's steps away. Waikiki is not my favorite beach but it's where the bars and stores are. Price is not bad. I say, go for it and you'll not regret it.

The good:- Naomi was consistently lovely to deal with- The location; directly opposite Waikiki Beach- Right above Eggs n Things - The cleaners were always polite, friendly & accommodating.The bad:- Naomi was the ONLY one nice to deal with... The other front desk people made you feel as though you were interrupting something far more important- There is no FoyerArriving in from Australia in the morning & not being able to check in until the afternoon, without having anywhere to wait or change or get things out of your bag before u hand it over to be locked away  Overall it wasn't awful but, I would choose to stay next door at The Pacific Beach Hotel. The rates are usually comparable but the Front Desk staff at Pacific are nicer & there's a lot more space.

This hotel is at best a very basic accommodation. As other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms are extremely small and the shower (no tub) tiny for even a normal sized adult. You will be hearing street noise until later at night, and again in the early morning as the delivery trucks start arriving. Our air conditioner was so loud it almost drowned out (but not quite), the exterior noise. I finally gave up and shut it off so as to get some rest.On the other hand, the location can't be beat. It is right across from Waikiki beach, and is near to a number of restaurants and stores in easy walking distance. The Honolulu Zoo and Honolulu Aquarium can easily be walked to. There is a McDonalds next door and an ABC store on almost every corner.So, if you are not as concerned about the room itself, and are looking for a more affordable and clean place to stay in a good location, this hotel will work for you.

I read a lot of great reviews about this hotel so I guess I am left a tad confused. While the price is great for Waikiki (150/night with AAA discount) - the rooms are really really small. I don't know how 4 people could stay here (all rooms have 2 beds) because my husband and I were tripping all over each other. The bathroom is TINY and the shower curtain has no lining so it leaks EVERYWHERE. E-V-E-R-Y-W-H-E-R-E. The room reminded me of being on a cruise ship - which are known to have small sized rooms. If you stay here I would recommend getting up early because you will be woken up by every sound in the curved hallway. When we arrived we were under the impression that there would be hotel parking - but it is almost funny how many spaces this hotel actually has. There are about 20 spaces in the entire parking lot. 20. Including employee parking. No wonder the lot was always full! We waited for about 2-3 days before we were able to get a space. We would call prior to parking at the designated alternative hotel (4 blocks away or so - which was about a 10 minute walk) to see if we were able to snag a spot. On our 3rd day or so when we got back the hotel receptionist was rather rude and told us "Well I have been trying to call you all day - we have a spot for you." which she repeated about 3 times. "I have been calling you and calling your room and you don't answer." Who stays in their room all day when they are in Hawaii? And why give me a hard time about it like I was putting you out? Strange. We spent the day at Hanauma Bay - so we left at about 7am and to back at 12pm - which I didn't think was that long to be out of our room anyway.Also one night we got back and the elevator had trapped someone in there - and they were frantically trying to open the stairs for us since the other elevator wouldn't come down. It seemed to really freak her (the receptionist) out the the elevator did that. When other patrons at the hotel joined us in the lobby area and asked what was going on the worker (a young gentleman who spent a large amount of time smoking outside while on his cell phone) gave them a really rude response without a real explanation. They stuck a huge laundry basket in there to prevent people from going in that elevator.Overall it as a very mediocre hotel. I honestly don't understand the reviews saying how amazing this place is. My husband thinks that they should just tear the whole place down to start over. If you are really struggling for a room and do not care about any luxuries and want to stay ON Waikiki then go for it. The friends we were traveling with got a room a block away at the Aston Beach Hotel and it was a million times nicer.

So if you're a five star hotel person who is very particular, look elsewhere.For the rest who are traveling as a couple to Waikiki, this place is fantastic! One of the least expensive, if not the least expensive beach front hotels. As others have said, the rooms are very small, like almost inside stateroom cruise ship small. But for a couple they were big enough, and the views? Oh yeah!!! I was offered ocean view for $15 more a night (and yes that was in addition to the ubiquitous resort fee). I took it and an I ever glad I did! Pay the upgrade, the view from the balconies are possibly the best I've ever had. We ended up spending a bunch of time out on the balcony just because it was that good.The staff at the front desk were super friendly and helpful. Beach towels provided which is nice. Included in resort fee are free DVD rentals and WiFi. Didn't use either (jetpack for WiFi), and never turned on the t.v., due to the view outside, so I can't comment on those.Waikiki beach is literally across the street so who cares about a pool. Like I say, if you're not pretentious, you will love it!

We stayed post cruise at The Waikiki Circle Hotel in February this year in an Oceanfront room on the 14th floor....one word...OMG..BLISS!!!...It isn't a 5 star hotel but with a view like this..who cares?? We had a smooth and speedy check-in,with the reception staff being very friendly and full of the ALOHA spirit.The rooms are newly renovated and bright and cheerful.the location ( across the road,literally from Waikiki Beach)is fantastic.ABC stores on every corner,to help with all your souvenir purchases and forgotten toiletry items etc.Walking distance to many fine eateries,bars and retail outlets.I would definitely stay there again..as a matter of fact i am booked to stay there again on October 2014.

We booked the Aston Circle for a one nights stay in Waikiki before we headed back stateside after a Maui/Kauai holiday and did so primarily because it was the lowest price with decent ratings. To say the location is perfect would be an understatement, which is the second reason we chest this hotel. The rooms are very small, but nicely appointed for the size. We selected 2 beds instead of a double and are glad we did. The wife tosses and turns, so having our own beds was nice for the night. Nice desk area with coffee maker along with TV and PS3 which we did not use. The bathroom is very small and the shower is the size of a phone booth, so if you're on the large size, find another hotel. We upgraded to a full ocean view (it is a circle, so some have full, partial, glimpse, no ocean views). We sat on the balcony watching people surf and walk on the main road below and you could tell people were jealous of our awesome perch. If you need the Ritz or Four Seasons, pass. If you need a great location, small room, great service you will not be disappointed. Aloha and Mahalo.

This hotel is in the lower price range for right on Waikiki beach. That doesn't mean it is cheap. We had a ocean front ocean view room on 10th floor. The view from the balcony was wonderful and the breeze delightful. Yes the room is on the small side, but we fond it okay for 2 adults. I don't think I'd want do share with 3 or 4 adults or children. Everything was clean and desk clerks helpful. There is a breakfast restaurant attached to hotel and Mc Donalds next door. There were a couple of places to pick up take out. We brought back to our balcony because we enjoyed it so much. It saved us quite a bit of money bringng to room but that wasn't why we did it. There is not a traditional lobby for this hotel. There is outdoor space and desk clerk is behind what looks like the drive thru window at the bank. That is also where you get ice. Just ask for ice. We will go back if in Waikiki again. In fact I think we are booking again in Sept. Seems like we always have someone who's never been there.

The room was tiny and the internet cut in and out. There was only a shower and it was a very small bathroom. Housekeeping did an awesome job. The balcony was nice and we could see part of the beach even though we had a city view room. Amenities charges was $15 a night but that included wi-fi and unlimited dvd and game rentals. Parking was $18 a night and was limited since there are only a dozen or so parking spots. Location was bar none. Can't beat directly across the street from Waikiki and the middle of shopping and restaurants.

we would not stay here next time. Room is very very small and all rooms are same size. The are the shape of an pie. No Microwave. Dirty carpet. And old smoking smell in hallways. Elevator is small. Front desk is by the elevators and watch you coming in/out. No parkings.

This was my 1st visit to Oahu and I couldn't be happier with my hotel choice. We paid a little extra and got an ocean view. It was well worth the money as we had an unobstructed beautiful view. Tons of restaurants and shops are only a 5-10 minute walk. The beach is even closer just being across the street. The rooms are a bit small but are nice are clean and modern. This place is probably one if the best values in Waikiki. I will definitely be back.

We have stayed here every trip to Waikiki in an ocean front room. The room is quaint, clean and has all the amenities you need and the balcony provides unobstructed views of the gorgeous beach just across the road. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable and can help to provide directions or transport. If you're looking for affordable, clean and a relaxing atmosphere, then this is the hotel for you. Close to shops, restaurants, bus stops and beachfronts, the hotel offers the best value for money.

We stayed here for two weeks (ocean front room).Great place to stay,close to everything and just across the road from beach.Staff were always friendly and willing to help.Loved this place.Great job to the team you made our Hawaii stay awesome.Thank you

My husband and I stayed here for 3 days. Stayed in an ocean view room, with double beds, I believe all if notAlmost all rooms are double beds only.The view was amazing, and relaxing. The room was more on the smaller side but okay. The bathroom is very small, Toilet lower and small, shower small. The problem with the Shower is the water always comes out, because once you Turn it on the water shoots straight outward so I had toStand outside, close the curtain and try to stick my hand inTo turn on the shower to the desired setting with the curtain closed , but no Matter what the water still leaks out, and it gets the floor All wet outside.We were charged a mandatory amenity fee, which you areCharged no matter what which was $18.85 and includes Wi-fi, a daily paper and coffee, and unlimited movies andGames. We also paid $18 a day for parking , but hotel Parking very limited and maybe has 15 stalls or so, so mayNeed to park at other nearby hotel if lot full.Many eateries, and shops nearby, close to the zoo and Beach. The view is what made it more enjoyable and theFact that I got a discounted internet rate, other than thatIt's pretty much the norm of a standard room in Waikiki .Lobby is very small. Only 2 elevators, of which only 1Was working during our stay, but we weren't really Inconvenienced by that. You also will need to go to theFront desk for ice. Overall, average other than the great view and location.

Right on the beach and close to everything else you'd ever want to do or see. Small rooms with no room service, pool and very few amenities, but for the price, you simply cannot beat it in Waikiki. Staff is friendly and rooms are clean and recently updated. Our only complaint was one of the elevators was being upgraded, but it's supposed to be running again in the next week.

I booked this hotel through expedia which was the cheapest we could find, we had been saving forever for this trip and we did a package deal for airfare and Hotel together. When we arrived we informed them that we had a disabled person in our group and they informed us that they had parking on top near the outside of the hotel and that the other people parked in covered parking. We parked in this area that they directed us to and when we went out to use the rental car the next day the front winshield was shattered from a bottle that was thrown from a window of the hotel by one of the hotel guests. The Hotel staff said they knew about the incident, and had filed a report, but that the hotel was in no way liable for the damage, even though they are the ones that told me to park in this uncovered area right up next to the hotel.The car would have been safe covered, but the disabled parking is sitting right next to the 14 floors of rooms with balconies that are directly above the car spaces. The glass deductible is 500, and the replacement cost is $485.00, so I am out of pocket the entire amount for the replacement of the windshield. The hotel manager was very curt and could care less about what had happened. I had to spend the day we had planned on this once in a lifetime trip to Hawaii filing police reports, working with insurance, hotel staff and car replacement. We did not have money for this unforseen expense, and so we could not sight see to the places we had wished to see while we were there and ended up spending alot of time in the room. A trip we saved up for was ruined, we had no money now to go and do things, and the disability precluded water activities. Something we had planned to be a great one time vacation became a sad trip of lost opportunities. The hotel sent us a letter as soon as we arrived home stating they were not liable for anything and we were responsible for their guests behavior breaking the windshield of the rental car. The reports from the hotel states that it was someone from the hotel rooms above that did this, but that mattered nothing to them. I am uploading the copies of the reports from the hotel, so you can judge yourself if this is the type of hotel that you want to trust with your vacation. I would advise against this, as they care not for their guests and our trip was ruined by trusting that the car would be safe where they directed us to park.The Hotel letter said that the car was not in the care, custody or control of the hotel, and yet the report submitted by the hotel staff said it was on property and that it was in the space they told me to park in, and that it was from their window that the item was thrown.

Pros: Clean, room had a mini-fridge and wifi. Definitely an excellent location, we loved sitting on our balcony and watching the beach and street below. Cons: The bed was slightly hard, the room was tiny (but you shouln't be in there anyway, this is Oahu!) and there is no pool.Overall, I think it was an excellent value and would definitely stay there again.

We had a wonderful stay at the Ashton Circle Waikiki. It was very clean, very convenient and a very friendly helpful staff. We surely will recommend Ashton to our friends. We were convenient to just about everything.

Pros:- clean and updated room with a coffee maker and small fridge which e definitely made use of.- checked in at noon even though check in isn't until 3. The room was ready and we were happy!- directly across the street from the never crowded beach- walking distance to many shops and restaurants (McDonalds is next door as is an ABC store where you can buy almost anything you need)- good views of the ocean from the majority of their rooms since the building is a circle!- strong AC- clean shower and bathroom with lots of hot water - delicious breakfast joint downstairs and hotel patrons get 10% off (don't let a long line fool you, it goes rather quickly)Cons:- there is a daily amenity fee of $18+tax which gives you wifi, use of the safe, the daily newspaper, use of the dvd service (similar to red box) and maybe a few other minor things I can't remember. It may be picky but I'd prefer to had these things built into the daily cost. We id make use of the safe, the wifi and the dvd service so it wasn't all a loss.- the room is a bit small but we weren't very concerned since we spent most of our time out of the room- there is no option for a queen or king bed, just two full beds in each room (not the biggest problem for us though)- it's such a popular area that it gets congested at night (again, not a big issue for us since we walked most places)Really, I'm struggling to think of any real cons that would prevent me from staying there again. We stayed for 8 nights and had a great experience overall.

We were a group of 5 adults from Canada and Germany, meeting up for a 3 week hawaiian vacation. We wanted an inexpensive, beach hotel in the heart of Waikiki. The circle hotel did not disappoint! The hotel websites pictures and descriptions are bang on. The rooms are basic and compact, but EVERYTHING is just a few steps from this hotel. It was perfect for our 4 nights in Waikiki. A fabulous location at a reasonable price.

Great little hotel right on Waikiki Beach.If going to the beach with ease is your thing then this is the place for you. They have free beach towels that you just throw back into a box in the foyer, they look after your room key at reception. So basically, 2 minute walk across the road to beach without having to take any valuables with you. Really friendly and responsive staff. Next door to ABC shop. Tour and activity desk in foyer. You don't spend much time in your room so don't be worried about 5 star. Take note when booking that a mandatory Amenity Fee is paid when you leave. This was $18 per day which covers Wi-fi, daily paper, safe and tea/coffee.

Nice, Clean rooms in a Great location. I was on top level with the ocean front view. The balcony view is spectacular only few steps away from the Dukes statue and the hop on and off trolley stop.ABC store and McDonald's next door is very convenient. Hotel staff are very friendly and there is a tour booth in the hotel to book tours :)Would definitely come back again :)

I went to Honolulu with 3 good friends from here in Sydney and Melbourne on a Hawaiian Airlines Friday night flight with he funniest crew ever and met up with another good friend of mine who was arriving from London later that evening. It was nearly 20 years since I had been to Honolulu on a 2 day stopover and everyone I spoke to, had said it had changed a lot and was a very classy and fantastic place for a holiday.I was celebrating my birthday and decided to stay at this lovely little hotel right over the road from Waikiki Beach which had been recommended to us by another friend who always stays here when she goes to Honolulu.I had an Ocean Front room 4 levels up because I don't like heights and like to be close enough to see the hussle and bussle of the street below and since I live on a noisy main street here in Sydney, I knew the noise would not bother me in Hawaii. 2 of my friends had a room next to me which was not quite ocean front but still with a great beach view and my other 2 friends had separate rooms on the 10th level with magnificent views over the ocean but way up high from the street level. They both loved their rooms. We arrived just in time for the Honolulu Festival ,therefore my room was brilliant for a fabulous view of the parade on Kalakaua Avenue and my friends on the 10th level had the best views for the fireworks display on the Saturday night. They were magic,much better than Sydney's NY's Eve fireworks.The Aston Circle is a gorgeous little place with delightful and very helpful staff, the concierge, Angel ,is exactly that, an extremely helpful, lovely man. There is no restaurant attached to the hotel but you can have breakfast at a café below called 'Eggs and Things'. Mmmmmmm we didn't try it, not to any of our taste buds, but it seemed to be popular. We ate at the utterly fabulous Moana Surfrider and The Royal Hawaiian Hotels.My room was just heaven for me, very clean and the bathroom has a good hairdryer. I have read some reviews saying that the rooms are small, but we all thought they were perfectly adequate for 2 people, I think some people must travel with all of their belongings and cram their rooms with luggage.I slept with my balcony door open half way as the weather was divine and I could hear the waves all night long, it was magic. Can't do that in Sydney without the huge cockroaches coming in!! I did have to close the sliding door in the early hours about 6am, because the traffic and general noise did start to build up.O'ahu is such a beautiful island and next time I will visit the other islands. The people are so helpful and polite, it is a pity we don't get the same level of service here in Sydney where they are much better paid. The pay is not that great in Hawaii and therefore you are expected to tip but it is a pleasure to do so. There is a side of Honolulu that is not so pleasant when you walk around near the park at Diamond Head in the early hours and see some of the poverty, it is such a shame to see and realise that not everything is as you see on Waikiki Beach.Having said that, Waikiki Beach is a gorgeous beach to relax and makes for a thoroughly magical holiday. I will definitely be going back.

I'm not sure if I've already reviewed our hotel in Waikiki so here we go; it's very central to everything right across from the beach so the location is perfect. It's value for money. It's not 5 star but it was clean. We somehow got an upgrade for free and the room was quite nice and had amazing beach views. Lower levels facing the main road would be noisy. Downstairs is an amazing breakfast place and probably the most popular eatery in Waikiki with line ups all hours of the day. There are hidden fees and charges / tourist taxes etc with this hotel but I think that's the same for all hotels so double check. 1 downside was the lifts - one was broken so we waited quite a while. I'm sure that's fixed now though :)Good place at a good price..

We stayed here in May 2014 along with daughter her husband and 2 children. They did not have any floor space to walk around beds as it was congested with luggage, not much space to store anything for 4 people. However we had a room with 2 double beds Nd only the two of us, plenty of space, but unfortunately for us we were on the Honolulu side and all we could hear day and night was the air conditioning unit from the hotel next door. Units on the Diamond Head are not affected by this noise. Staff very helpful, room clean.

We only needed a room for one night, so I picked this hotel for it's location and the price was ok. One of the smallest rooms I've ever been in. The four of us with our luggage could barely fit in. But we did manage and for one night we survived. The location is excellent and the people at the front desk were very nice.

the pictures are hella nice and the room looks so biginstead the room is tiny, especially the bathroomaccording to the price I don't think it is good for me to pay 200+ per nightyou can't even bent your kneesbut the location is perfectso it's a fair hotel

Stayed for 7 days, excellent position, great views. Rooms are clean and tidy, small bathroom but big enough for 2 people. Only complaint would be the pillows. Too flat!! Can be a bit noisy but overall would highly recommend this hotel

Stayed there for a day during my recent trip to Honolulu. Fantastic location of the hotel, right across from Waikiki Beach. It has one of the most magnificent balconies in Honolulu because of the circular shape of the building. Room comes with free DVD rentals that you can get recent releases from the machine on the ground floor. It has also a PlayStation inside the room as well in case you want to do something else at night. Overall, friendly front desk staff, affordable rate. I would not hesitate to stay there again!

For the price and location, this hotel can't be beat! You are literally across the street from the Duke's Statue and Waikiki Beach. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again. Parking is convenient and inexpensive versus other hotels on the same street.

I went when it was still high season so most of the beach front places were booked and pretty expensive. This hotel doesn’t offer much in amenities but its location is unbeatable! We had ocean view and it made everything even better! Rooms were small but reasonably sized for two people. It was clean and well maintained at all times. Parking was convenient too.

Spent 3 night here. We were lucky enough to get a room on the top floor facing the ocean. Reception was very lovely. The room was clean. Although it was small it wasn't too much of a big deal. There was a PS3 in the room and they provide free movies & games for rent, free wifi & beach towel usage all included in the $20 a day ammenity fee.Perfect location. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again at all.

We spent 3 days prior of joining the Pride of America fantastic location great ocean views staff are very friendly nothing was a problem. We would be quite happy to stay here again and recommend to anyone else. Very close to everything. Request a high room floor.

I have been staying at the Circle for years. I love the location- steps away from the beach, the zoo, park and transportation! The rooms are nicely updated and all have a great view with large balconies. (Some balconies at other hotels are very small so you have to set your chair sideways). DONT rent a car, you don't need it. Take the bus or walk. Everything is close.

I have stayed at this hotel many times never been disappointed. My family and I love the location right across the street from the beach. It is close to everything in Waikiki, restaurants, Aquarium,shops. etc. The rooms are a little small compare to other big hotels but very comfortable. it was built in the 1960s and I love the shape of it. It has a lot of character. Very Friendly staff, clean rooms. WiFi, They have parking and also a Restaurant down stairs. I recommend booking rooms that are ocean view so you can sit in your Lanai and watch all the action at the beach and sun go down every night.

Just spent 7 nights at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel and i loved loved loved it! I was in an ocean front room (room 504) and the view was amazing! Yes the air conditioner wasn't silent, and there was some occasional noise from reversing trucks but luckily i can sleep through a hurricane so it didn't bother me.To have complete ocean front room directly across the road from the beach and so close to shops and restaurants in this price range is fantastic. I had realistic expectations about the room and the building itself. The room is not massive but it has everything that you need: a fridge that chilled my Mike's Hard Lemonades perfectly, a desk for writing my memoirs, 2 beds (double size in Australian speak) and a modern bathroom.All the people (noticeably Americans) who are complaining about everything, obviously have a Champagne taste with a beer budget. They want everything the Westin offers for a third of the cost. The room was clean with nice decor and the service was great.

Stayed here for 8 days. The location was good, being close to Waikiki Beach and a lot of pick-up/drop-off locations for local tours. The ocean view room we had was small, but clean. You definitely need floors higher than 5 to get any sort of view. Hotel was showing it's age and could use some improvements, like a faster elevator (we tried the stairs once and they were disgusting). Restaurant near the lobby always seemed to be busy. Internet Wifi worked well, but would not suggest providing credit card information from the hotel as our numbers were stolen.

This hotel is suitable for a one-nighter. We stayed prior to embarking on a cruise. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are basic and clean. The hotel is ideally located for Waikiki Beach (which frankly is really nothing special). If I were ever to return to Honolulu I would definitely be looking for a better quality hotel.

Booked the Waikiki Circle two times now and have not been disappointed. We did not go to Hawaii to stay in the hotel. The rooms are a little on the smallish side, but all we did was sleep there and enjoy the fantastic view of the beach from the balcony. The breakfast was good. Located across the street from the beach was no problem at all. In fact, for the price savings it's a no-brainer for me. Parking below the hotel is very limited. You are a very short walk down the street to all the major attractions and restaurants. Book a room ending with a 4,5,or 6 for the best views. Higher the better! Look for the discounts that are regularly advertised.

We have stayed here twice and when we go back to Hawaii we'll stay again. It's a few years since we stayed last but I can see from the photos it hasn't changed.....thankfully, apart from the decor obviously.First time we had a partial view room, second time was full sea view. It is worth the extra for this view. Rooms are spacious enough and clean but one of the best things about this hotel is the location. Ok, it doesn't have the fancy pool and restraunts but they are all your doorstep anyway!Pay your money and take your chance, we did and haven't regretted it at all. Xxx

Oh boy, what an awesome holiday we have had and to spend 10 nights at this hotel to finish our trip off was absolutely heaven. Location location location!!!We stayed in room 604 with a full ocean view that was to die for. We were high enough to see over the beautiful palm trees and view the ocean and it's activities. A definite return here is calling us.A spruce up would benefit this hotel as it is ageing.
user_name:
Christine C
Tirau, null, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights from 27th April. Fantastic position, we had room 903, shady balcony most of the day, with great views. Room had all we needed and was clean and comfortable. Just walk across the road to the beach just great. We were able to walk nearly everywhere. Nice friendly and helpful staff. Really enjoyed our stay.

I spent 10 nights at this fab hotel, staff where kind and friendly, amazing view from my ocean front room. Rooms where clean and tidy. Great location close to good shops and restaurants. Will most def be returning to this hotel and recommending to my friends.

This hotel is right across the street from Waikiki beach! It's a no frills hotel with no bar or pool but the ocean is across the street, & there is a restaurant (Egg's & Things--GREAT pancakes!) in the lobby. The rooms are small but very clean & every room has a furnished balcony which is great for eating breakfast or watching a sunset. There is a $18 a day resort fee, but that includes coffee & Wi-Fi, a safe, daily newspaper & unlimited movie rentals from a kiosk in the lobby. There were 3 beach towels in the room for you to use also. Maid service was great. John & Jan at the front desk were always pleasant & helpful with any questions I had. I stay here every time I go back to Oahu, which is once or twice a year, & plan to continue for many years to come.

Probably the smallest hotel on Kalakaua Avenue, set amongst the big hotels, Waikiki beach "Kuhio beach park" is directly over the road. There is no enclosed lobby or a pool but with the beach and the main strip right out the door you don't need them. There is a choice of views from partial ocean thru ocean front. We had partial but didn't spend enough time in the room to be concerned. The room is not huge but has enough space for a couple with our luggage for a five week trip. The room was clean and well maintained with a safe, fridge, tv, in room wifi, DVD player (rental downstairs included). Beach towels also provided. The staff were all friendly and helpful. If you are after a room with direct access to Waikiki Beach and no expensive frills like gyms, pools, and excessive lobby's then this is the place for you.

Location of this hotel was great. Close to beach, easy walk to shops and restaurants. The hotel was also clean and tidy and the staff were helpful. We had a car which we parked underneath the hotel each day (at an additional cost). We were a family travelling so we had 2 rooms, 2 adults with youngest child in 1 room and 2 teenage sons in the other room.
