From this aspect we found the rooms very small especially when there were 3 of us in a room. My tall teenage son found the double bed uncomfortable as his feet hung over the end. We did use the DVD service which worked fine. In addition to our 2 rooms, family had booked another 3 rooms. Unfortunately the hotel could not accommodate our request to be altogether, we were spread across 3 floors and even our teenage sons were not given a room next to us. That was a little disappointing.Our other main gripe was the noise of the air conditioners. You could not sleep with the doors open as all the air conditioners were noisy (this hotel and next doors). Not sure that this was the best hotel for us, but the location was great and rooms were clean.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel in an ocean front room on the 6th floor for 1 week, the view is spectacular, the room clean and well presented and beds were blissfully comfortable. There is a small restaurant at the bottom of the hotel but beware get in early for a seat as its extremely popular, there is a McDonald's next door for convenience if necessary but you couldn't want for a more central hotel with the beach just across the road.

Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. I had booked an ocean front room, which is well worth the extra $$$'s. Waking up to sunrise and seeing the sunset is unforgettable. It is a 'budget' type hotel, no concierge bringing up your suitcases, no fancy doormen opening the door, but the room is just perfect. It is spacious, we had the family in the room most days, 7 people in total, and it did not feel small. Shower is however quite small and so is the whole bathroom, but was sufficient. House keeping was average, but adequate. No pool, ,but there is no need, it has the beautiful Waikiki beach right outside, beautiful water, just amazing. My previous stay was at the sheraton Waikiki, big difference in price, but definitely returning to this hotel for the view and location. Yes it has a few homeless people around, not directly outside the hotel, but they don't do any harm, don't ask for anything. McDonalds is right next door and there is a restaurant outside the hotel that does delicious steak eggs and rice, and gives you a 10% discount if your a guest at the hotel, it gets quite busy though. Definitely recommend this hotel.

From the moment we entered the foyer we were treated with a smile, nothing was a problem. We were offered a room upgrade offering ocean views, fantastic location right across the road from Waikiki Beach. Were given a discount book for Oahu which we did use. Two videos to rent each day, free use of floats, beach mats and rings and beach towels to use. Had a great stay.

We were on the 14th floor and the view was amazing. The hotel is directly across the street from Waikiki Beach. An older hotel but very clean. Our room had been recently remodeled so the bathroom was very nice and I thought the room was a good size. We had a makeup desk outside of the bathroom which was really nice for doing your hair while someone else is showering.

I stayed at this hotel Sept 2012 while on my Honeymoon. The hotel is in a great location. Literally right across from Waikiki beach! We had an Oceanfront room that was on a higher floor. Perfect view! The rooms were very clean. They aren’t huge, but there was enough room that we didn’t feel cramped. Rooms seem smaller I think because of the shape of the hotel. The hotel staff was really nice, both the front desk staff and the tour desk were helpful. If you want to go to a restaurant the locals go to, just ask they are more then willing to give you some options! There is a movie rental in the lobby that’s included in your stay if you want to rent some. The location is perfect. Close to tones of shopping and restaurants. The have a small parking area for those who rent a car, however we never had a problem finding a spot. If you are looking for a fancy top of the line hotel, I don’t suggest you stay here. However if you are looking for a hotel that isn’t going to cost you a small fortune, however that is still clean and in a great location then I would recommend the hotel!

If you are the type of traveler who doesn't want to spend your vacation hanging around your hotel but want to be out in the middle of the action, this motel mighty be right for you. Rooms here are very well priced for being right across the street from Waikiki beach. The rooms are quite small but clean. Outside noise can also be a problem. Rude neighbors were also a problem but that can happen anywhere and motel personnel were very responsive to this issue

This hotel was right across from the beach, very clean and had a friendly staff. It's an interesting circle shape so the hallways curve around giving the rooms a couple of nifty angles. Incredibly comfortable beds. We'd definitely stay here again. One caveat--parking is at a premium and we were only in town one night so recommend a taxi or airport shuttle for transportation.

Aston Circle on Waikiki isn't fancy; but the location and cleanliness of this hotel makes up for it. If all you want is a clean room in the best location then this hotel is for you! The only negative I have is I would have liked a microwave in the room. But, that is a little thing.The week my daughter and I stayed was comfortable and relaxing. The ocean opposite is your pool and a variety of good eating spots are an easy walk away. Would stay here again!

The hotel is right on Waikiki's beachfront thoroughfare. Prince Kuhio Beach is right across the street as well as a stage underneath a banyan tree where performances are held (hula, singing, etc.). The staff is very friendly and helpful. They're plenty of excellent restaurants nearby and great shopping. Try Duke's at the Outrigger Hotel. You can schedule tours right at the Waikiki Circle and the rooms are cosy, but very clean.
user_name:
DCDog50
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is an ideal hotel to use a day room after your cruise! Perfect location and within walking distance of many sites such as the zoo and aquarium. The beach is right across the street.The rooms are small, but for use as a day room, it is perfect!
Best Holiday Ever!Right in the middle of everything and right on the beach.No pool or restaurant but you don't need it with the sea so close.Would go back any time! Well worth the flight from UKGreat

The hotel, although lacking in amenities such as pool/mini-bar/restaurant on site, is so well positioned that the lack is not noticed. The views from the front of the hotel are to-die for - looking right along the beach in both directions. Aim for a higher floor and you won't be disappointed. Staff were friendly and helpful.

I was a bit worried about renting a room here. It was one of the cheapest places, but I was trying to stay on budget. We got there LATE at night, they were amazing, got us taken care of and to our room quickly. The rooms are really well decorated! They are so cute! Clean, comfortable, perfect!!! Great views! There wasn't anything we didn't like. It was in the best location too! Right on Waikiki beach, come on, I thought I was dreaming! I will tell all my family and friends about this place! There is absolutely no reason to spend more than what we did! We loved our time there! There was no fitness room or pool, but come on, you are in Hawaii, go to the ocean and get physical! No need for either of those here!

I recently had an 8 day stay in Hawaii, just got back yesterday. I must say that I loved this place. It was perfect. The location cannot be beat, the price was reasonable. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I've been to Hawaii many times before, even staying at other Aston properties. This was my best experience to date, by far. True, there is no pool, and true, if you are looking for luxurious appointments this is not really what you will find, But, the room was clean, neat, and comfortable. And the views.....breathtaking. Its right in the heart of Waikiki. From our balcony I was close enough to people watch, yet far enough to enjoy the stunning scenery. Swimming/surfing a mere feet away from our door. Even had a parade and fireworks right off the balcony. I can't recommend the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel enough, I really can't.

Best thing about the hotel, as you may have guessed from my title, is the location.Right in the middle of everything Waikiki, access to shops, restaurants, beach etc...the rooms were a nice size and clean and the staff helpful. Its reasonably priced for what you get and I would stay againOnly slight issue was, we were located on the rear side of the building, our room was overlooked by a car park so privacy was compromised and felt we had to have the curtains shut whilst we were in the room, there wasn't much of a view. There was also some noice which woke us up in the morning, work going on in the car park and also footsteps etc.. outside the room.
user_name:
Michael W
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: For the price and the location, nothing beats this! The hotel is decent but we didnt stay in the room much. If you're looking for something convenient and on a budget then this is perfect. It's a place I keep coming back to. The beach is across the street and that's fabulous!!!

It was nicely located across the beach. It very much had an Asian influence as the rooms were very tiny to north american standards. They were clean and since I was in the room by myself it was fine. It had a fridge and coffee maker which was handy.It was clean! Found the overall hotel old but that seemed to be the trend in Waikiki, must be hard to keep up with all the tourists traveling.Restaurant on the main floor was way too over priced. I think there was some sort of article raving about it in the past. Not much for the $ found Dukes way better for breakfast and nice outdoor location.

This hotel was a very good stay. You absolutely cannot beat the location; it is right on Waikiki. They have underground parking available right at the hotel, and it is within walking distance of shops/restaurants/bars along the beach.The rooms themselves were a bit dated, but they were clean and comfortable. We honestly did not spend much time in it, as we spent much of the time on the beach and seeing the sites. We went in the off season and the price/value was fantastic.

This hotel is very basic about infrastructure, but don't worry!!! you won´t need it.The location is perfect. Just across Waikiki beach and if you book a ocean view room... OMG the sea is almost sleeping with you.There is no lobby, just 24/7 front desk (and believe me, it's enough). The hotel has a excellent price in comparison with the surrounding hotels (much more luxuries of course). The room size is OK, there are complimentary toilette products. The decor is a really outdated, with an ocean theme. The hotel is a little outdated, and because it is just over Waikiki beach and its popular street, it could be a little noisy at night.There are a lot of restaurants and shops around. That is the best of Aston Waikiki Circle: the location. For a 15 USD fee you get safe box, wifi in your room, coffee maker and surf and body boards. And for another 18 USD you´ll have parking space.I absolutey recommend this hotel and if I go back anytime to Honolulu, I will be back right here.

Clean, comfortable and amazing location. Staff is ready to assist if you need them, yet allow for your privacy. Would stay here again. You must book the oceanfront room overlooking Waikiki. It is worth it.

This hotel is basic - really no lobby, no pool or gym and few amenities but it is located directly across the road from the Kuhio Beach Hula Mound with great views of the ocean if you book an ocean view or partial ocean view room. The rooms are decorated nicely and have a good layout for 2 people - wouldn't want to squeeze in anymore though! Unfortunately, there is an extra $15 per day "amenity fee" that includes a daily newspaper, free DVD rentals, coffee packets, local phone calls etc. Kalakaua Avenue runs along the front of the hotel with access to lots of restaurants, shops, and tourist trolleys - just one block away on Kuhio Avenue runs the local bus. Although having the huge sliding glass doors is nice for the views, the area is very noisy with late night traffic and early morning deliveries so a enjoying a good sleep can be difficult - ear plugs help!

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle for 4 nights February 11 -15. This was our second stay at The Circle and it did not disappoint. Location, location location! We had an ocean front room (which I recommend you book in the first place instead of hoping for an upgrade). It is directly across from Waikiki Beach. You can literally leave your room, go down the elevator, cross the street and you are on the beach in three minutes. It doesn’t get much better than that.Now the rooms are relatively small and because the hotel is a circle, the rooms are more or less wedge shaped. While our room was big enough for the two of us plus our three large suitcases, it’s not really big enough for much else. But since you’re not there to just sit in your room all day, it’s not a big deal. And the room was very neat and well cleaned. Since our last visit the room and the bathroom have been redone. I do wish they had installed a screen door going out to the lanai. I would like to be able keep that open and not run the AC. There is also now a restaurant off of the lobby area that we ate at our first morning.We had a rental car and did pay parking charges of $18 a day. I’m okay with that, as not everyone who stays there is going to have a car to park. If you use the service, you should pay for the service. Also, others have mentioned having difficulty with getting a space in the garage. Granted the garage is not huge, but we were able to get a spot each night, so no problems there.What I don’t like the fact that we had to pay a mandatory daily “amenity fee” of $15 for use of wi-fi, etc (since we didn’t need wi-fi or the other services provided). While this seems to be a trend with hotels these days to make their rates look lower (much like airline baggage fees), I don’t like paying for services that I don’t use. Yes, I knew about the charge before checking in, but that doesn’t make it right. Either raise the room price slightly so everyone knows the actual price and then offer “free wi-fi” or make it an optional charge. After all, how much does it really cost to provide a wireless signal?But all in all a wonderful stay – if we were to return to Honolulu would definitely look at The Circle first for our lodging.

My husband and I spent 8 days in Waikiki in Feb 2013 after a week long Hawaiian cruise.Booked the place on-line and took our changes. The place was absolutely lovely!! The staff we were told, were family from the original owner. Wonderful place to stay, oceanfront room on the 14th floor, it doesn't get any better. We walked every day along the beach, took surf lessons and watched the beautiful dancers at night. The nightlife was incredible, everyone out enjoying the shopping, the scenery and everything in walking distance.The hotel staff was amazing!!! Kind and very helpful explaining their culture and various things to do and see. Our room was spotless everyday, there wasn't anything more we could ask for.We would highly recommend this quaint hotel, and hopefully we will return to Hawaii and spend our visit at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel. Kudos to them for making our stay a memorable one

Great hotel! Was super happy with our choice this time...our fourth trip to Waikiki. We asked for an ocean front room and we were on the 11th floor with a beautiful view. Hotel is located perfectly in the center of the strip. I found hotel staff to be very helpful and friendly. Only minor issue was that upon arrival, which was early, we were forced to change in the bathroom on the street level because there is no lobby or shared hotel space...it's just 2 elevators which go directly to the various floors. The bathroom was pretty nasty even though it required a code to get in...kind of what you'd expect if you were going to MacDonalds...but once we were checked in this was a non-issue.The rooms were very clean, had 2 decent size beds (my wife reminded me that the bed was a little short for me and I'm 6'...and they were a bit on the soft side), a nice balcony (my wife mentioned it didn't have a screen), mini-fridge, tv, the usual. We could have used a bathtub since we were with our 8-month old...and these were shower only. Another minor inconvenience....other-wise it was a great hotel. Highly recommend it!
user_name:
Jonathan S
New York City, New York

review_body: This was our 3rd stay at the Circle and we just adore this hotel ! ! Location is great. We were lucky to again have an oceanfront room on the 14th floor and the view is to die for!! Best view for your money in Waikiki.From the balcony we could see turtles swimming at the beach across the road everyday and we were even lucky enough to see some whales spouting off shore one evening.This time we had 4 adults in the room and before we arrived we were worried about how we would all fit but it was fine. There's plenty of storage in the cupboard and under the beds for suitcases (We had 8 suitcases and 4 carry on bags) and we all managed in the space we had. The room and bathroom are small but so clean and fresh and the balcony (lanai) is wonderful! Wi-fi in our room was quick and reliable. The staff are lovely and very accomodating. This is not a 5 star luxury hotel and there is no grand foyer or restaurant or pool or room service however it is in a perfect location directly across from the beach and close to lots of restaurants and shops and an easy 5 minute walk to the heart of the Waikiki shopping strip.We think the Aston Waikiki circle is a hidden gem and would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Waikiki.

We stayed here this past Feb 13-17, 2014. The hotel is fairly clean and the AC is nice. We stayed on the 12th floor--some nights you could hear the wind go crazy through the balcony sliding door! and you can feel the building move...if you stay on the upper floors, you have to get used to walking in a circle to get to your room, haha.The location of this hotel is awesome--as it is right on the main strip of Waikiki--and very convenient. However, the downside is that the amenities you have to pay extra for--which in turn would make up the price of this "affordable" hotel. Wi-Fi mandatory charge of $15/night, as well as to park in their garage is $18/night. --Be sure to get there early (there are only 22 available spots to park in the garage--if it gets full, you have to park at another hotel down the street that they suggest) I get it that these features may be needed (b/c it is IMPOSSIBLE to park on the streets of Waikiki)-but I don't think hotel guests should be charged for parking--but I see that it is pretty popular for Waikiki hotels to do so.The rooms are small, really only big enough for 2 people. Bathroom is small too..we did have a bit of difficulty with the shower head--since it would shoot the water out beyond the shower floor and we would have to tamper to adjust it correctly--and once we did the water pressure was low. Other than that, we were pretty satisfied--I mean... you ARE in HAWAII!!!
user_name:
Jessica C
San Diego, California, United States

review_body: The location of this hotel is great, just across from famous Waikiki beach. However, the rooms are small and the customer service is poor. There is a very small lobby, so if it is raining no where to sit. The uphill location of the lobby is very hard on handicapped individuals in wheelchairs or even seniors who walk with canes.

This was my sixth visit to this fantastic little budget hotel. Granted it is not for everyone, rooms are all the same, except for their orientation, showers are small, no bathtub but if you choose a room with an ocean view, it more than, makes up for what is lacking. Also, the hotel's location can't be beat, just across the street is a fantastic swimming beach, shopping and good restaurants are nearby. There is a new amenity fee which most hotels now charge, annoying yes but the WiFi always worked and it was nice having the paper at the door. Housekeeping does an excellent job and all the Desk Agents are friendly and knowledgeable, especially Naomi who remembers me each time I return. Her Waikiki knowledge is unsurpassed and she is always eager to give you good advice. One morning I wanted something interesting for breakfast and she suggested I eat with the fishes. Across the street at the Pacific Beach Hotel, the restaurant has an enormous salt water tank with skipjack and other ocean fish. I liked it so much I went there twice, the waitress I had was pleasant and suggested the Kona Coffee Press when I asked for strong coffee. At $12 a pot, it was not cheap but excellent and worth the splurge, made easier by the extremely reasonable rates at the Circle. Again, as I've mentioned before, do not expect a resort experience at the Circle, it is a friendly, well run budget hotel, with great rates, excellent staff and a sublime view.

At first I was a bit hesitant to book a hotel without a pool, but after spending a week at the Aston Waikiki Circle, I had no regrets. My family had a wonderful vacation staying here! We are beach lovers, and this hotel has such an amazing location across from Waikiki Beach, we had no time to miss the absence of a pool. We were too busy having fun at Waikiki!The rooms are not large, but are kept very clean and also have a mini fridge and balcony. I loved having access to unlimited beach towels, free beach mats, and kids beach tubes. Also, there are free movie rentals which you can watch in your room. Most hotels in Waikiki charge the 'resort fee' anyway, so you are stuck with it wherever you go. When compared to the bargain rate of this hotel and what you get, we didn't mind.The staff were friendly and professional, and we loved eating at the restaurant. We kept an eye on the queue from our balcony, so when it was short we would go down and be seated quickly, unlike other diners who had long waits because the food is so amazing there. I also liked that there wasn't any lobby or resort stores to go through. Often we were in our bathing suits and just wanted to get to the beach as quickly as possible.Overall, the location, cleanliness, value and easy access to Waikiki Beach are what made our stay here one to remember. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend this hotel to others.

Older mid-level hotel with no pool, lobby, or other amenities, comparable to a small Holiday Inn. They stuck us with a "mandatory" $19/day "amenity fee" to cover things that are free in respectable hotels: wifi, in-room safe, local calls, newspaper, coffee in the room. Andrew, the "manager" behind the plate-glass window refused to give me a refund even though I wasn't going to use any of those things. He said I should have read the fine print in Orbitz. Andrew refused to apologize or do anything to work it out. I spend over 200 nights per years in hotels all over the US, and I will not stay in an Aston again. For a few bucks more, we stayed in the lovely Marriott Courtyard Waikiki two blocks away, with its rooftop pool, bar, and free live music. Next time, we'll stay there the whole time.

Quality of property was fine...small rooms/bathrooms like everyone says. Clean, comfortable bedding and plenty of hot water. I don't have a big problem with the concept of the 18$ per day amenity fee...I strongly dislike that it is not optional...If you get a partial ocean view room...there will be no view from inside the room...only when you stand on the balcony...that being said...the balcony did have 2 new chairs and a small table if you wanted to sit outside...Contrary to what Aston says...not all hotels in Waikiki charge an amenity fee...many do have free wi-fi etc...shop around carefully. I would have scored this hotel higher had the amenity fee been optional.

An outstanding hotel with wonderful,sweet and helpful staff. Everything was perfect. Balcony with a stunning view over the ocean. The room was very clean and nice. Perfect size with coffee and the. I cannot complain on anything!

When other hotels in this area have sky high prices, this hotel is a good value. It is right across the street from Waikiki beach. This is not a top luxury hotel and the rooms are small, but it is very clean (even the shower curtains which so many hotels neglect). The bed was very comfortable. We paid an extra $20.00 a night to be on the ocean side and felt it was well worth it. We enjoyed looking out over the beach and ocean and also people-watching. For people on more modest budgets this is a good choice. On nice days, you will be out and about most of the time, anyway. Restaurants are nearby, and a hula show is held at Waikiki park three times a week.

Love this hotel! There are no real extras or amenities but, the location, cleanliness of the room and interaction with the staff(what little there was of it) was all great.This is a basic hotel and room with very few extra's. There is an in room coffee maker though! If you want to be pampered and a 5 star luxury resort, this is not it.Pay the extra for an ocean front room and get as high up as possible. I slept with my sliding glass door open all night every night. Probably wouldn't have done so if I were lower, closer to the noise of the street. I would have zero issues staying here again.Egg N Things restaurant on lobby level is a great way to start your day! Spectacular breakfast food! Get there early. There was already a line at 6:30am.

It is great hotel - I love the fact that it was local entrepreneurship and that it was a woman who started this business. This is the best location and views. The only comment - I had a room above the ground floor roof with HVAC vents which were noisy....

We arrived here in the middle of the night after a long flight only to be told that apparently we didn't have a reservation, despite the fact that we had already paid for the room and had written confirmation. The man behind the desk then told us he had no free rooms and perhaps we should try again tomorrow and then literally turned his back on us. Not the friendly welcome to hawaii we had been expecting!

Four star accommodation in a five star location. The building is much smaller than a lot of its neighbours but it’s right across the road from the best swimming beach in Waikiki (see pictures). If you’re not too fussed about having a large living space, and can manage in two smallish double beds, then this is an excellent choice. Staff are friendly and helpful, there are lots of quality eating options very close by, including The Cheese Factory and the legendary Dukes at Outriggers. For clothes shopping you can’t go by Ross for quality at unbelievably low prices. A hint for breakfast: duck into the ABC shop next door the night before and pick up sandwiches or sushi that has been reduced to clear and put it in the bar fridge in your room.Then as you enjoy breakfast on the lanai (balcony) of your ocean front room, you can slowly wake up to another day in paradise.But remember, this place is a secret, so don’t tell anyone!

OK, so its older ( as are most of the hotels on the strip), smaller, fewer amenities ( namely no pool) and looks like a pineapple BUT it has everything ( well almost) you'll need for a holiday to Hawaii.As there were 5 of us we needed two rooms.Both 'partial' ocean view on 7th ( of 14 I think) floors. It looks kind of cute against all the neighbouring behemoths. Rooms are small but functional and all have balconies. Have been 'recently' renovated ( I'd guess within 5 years).The staff ( front of house and housekeeping) were excellent.The location is superb.Downsides: no restaurant ( although no shortage of local options), maybe a little tight on parking, no pool/gym ( but theres the Pacific across the road and a gym 20m away), and its pretty noisy around there.Oh, I found the beds a bit soft, and I was a bit put off by the mattress cover ( which was industrial, but I suppose its a 'honeymoon' destination...you get the idea).We thought for the price range it was great. We didnt care about the $15 ( now$18) 'ammenity' fee as you'd normally pay for internet, movies, newspaper anyhoo.

we stayed here for 4 days but were out most of the time. beds are plastic wrapped and small. the resort fee and the parking add 30$ per night to your bill. central location in Waikiki area. clean. if you are going to explore the island and just want a clean place to stay at nights then I strongly recommend this one price wise!

Stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle January 9th and 10th 2014Everything was perfect. Clean and quiet ( city view side).What really made it was the check out with NaomiEven though it was extremely busy she was very accommodating patient and organized

We stayed here for 8 nights and knew what we was getting into. It's a small hotel but views are very good. We had a partial ocean view. Rooms small bathroom smaller but very clean and very friendly staff. We really enjoyed our stay here. Great location as well.

My mom and I stayed here for two nights prior to our Hawaiian cruise and the night following our cruise. The rooms are quite small due to the shape of the building and it is not inexpensive, but they are absolutely spotless and the location could not be more perfect! It is directly across from the beach! The staff (Jan and Naomi) were so helpful and friendly! We would have eaten at the restaurant downstairs, but the line was always around the block, so we walked down to Jimmy Buffets for a nice breakfast buffet for $14. The walk from the hotel to Diamond Head is about 2.5 miles, shopping is plentiful, and well, the beach......oh, the beach.

Loved our stay here! We were offered an upgrade for an extra $20 per night and were not disappointed. Full ocean views with a balcony to enjoy the amazing views which I would argue are the best in Waikiki! Rooms are a little small as is bathroom, but hey, who come to Waikiki to spend time watching tv and showering in their rooms?! If that's you, don't come! Right across the road from the beach and everything else you need. We even started buying champagne and watching the glorious sunset from the uninterrupted views of our balcony. Beats the crowds at the expensive resorts that are paying five times the price for the same thing as this hotel! Check in was a breeze and staff were fantastic. Will stay here again and highly recommend.

This place is much smaller than what appears in pictures. The bathroom is minuscule. I wouldn't recommend it for more than one night. The beds weren't very comfortable but not horrible either. Good location and clean. Staff was nice. I would probably stay elsewhere next time, particularly at $250/nt incl taxes (peak season).

The only reason that I'm giving this hotel 2 stars is because of the ocean view from the balcony. Otherwise, I would give this hotel a ZERO star rating... It was our 2nd time at Honolulu.$15 plus tax for amenity fee includes wifi which was horrible and it got disconnected very often...For the service, except for the lady who checked us in (who was extremely kind), all other staff were very rude and unkind. Two hours before our check out, the maid refused to give us more toilet paper that we needed as we didn't get room serviced that day and the day before. She gave us attitude which cost her a tip. I'm pregnant and I had to go to washroom which explains why we needed toilet paper 2 hours before we checked out... Also, the lady at the front when we checked out was very rude and condescending, as if I do not understand English. Yes, I look Asian, but I'm originally from Canada... This experience was very unacceptable for me who travels a lot and I wouldn't stay at this hotel when we return to Honolulu.

Only stayed in Waikiki fro 2 days. Perfect location across from the beach. The staff were very nice. Would recommend the ocean view if your there for more than 2 days and plan to spend time in your room. All other rooms look to the surrounding hotels. Originally booked a city view. They offered a upgrade to partial view when we arrived for $10 extra a night. Well worth it. Not sure what the amenity fee of $15 per night was for?????

This place is a Cooper Mini in the land of trucks. In other words, a small hotel surrounded by gargantuan resorts and hotels. But it is a great place to stay, and had a great location.Check in was smooth, and it is actually outside, or at least partially so with a covered check in area. With my ears still goofy after flying in, the street noise and from hearing damage from sitting in the front row of a Night Ranger concert 30 years ago, I found it a little hard to hear the check in person, but it went smoothly.As noted elsewhere on here, the rooms are smallish, but certainly fine for 2 people. Closet and desk space around a corner gave a nice storage area for "stuff."The hotel has obviously made quite a few orbits around the sun, but the room was up to date, smelled good, and was clean. Stayed there for a week, and housekeeping did a great job of cleaning up each day.There was a $15 a day resort fee or some darn thing. I knew about it, just add it to the bill. This hotel is no different than others in that regard. Why they don't just add it in? I'm not a marketing major, so who knows. There was in room wifi for each room. Nothing great. I averaged 2-4Meg download on various tests. It was in room only tho. Tried it on the balcony/lanai and it did not work. I'm guessing the interference from all the rest wiped it out. Speaking of being on the balcony/lanai. What a great spot for views and people watching. We were in room 904 which I think was an full ocean view room. And it was, you can see up and down the shore. You can't see Diamondhead from the hotel, because the hotel is back where the shoreline dips in a bit, but it has a great view of Waikiki beach, which is just across the street.I had a great time just sitting out there and watching the people walk by. It was Christmas week, and it was crowded. Of course, just listening to the ocean added to the view. Though you won't just hear the ocean. It is kinda noisy around there. It faces a busy beachfront street. But I live out in the middle of Iowa where it is super quiet, and it didn't bother me. In fact, I slept with the lanai door wide open every night. Really the worst thing might be the garbage trucks with their beeps at 6 in the morning.As for sleeping, I thought the bed was great. Maybe it was the beautiful breezes blowing in, but I slept like a baby (the good kind of baby.)Not much interaction with the staff, but friendly when I did. Nice touch by the hotel...on Christmas they left a tree ornament in our room, and a card signed by 20 or so people, which I presume is the staff. The ornament will be a nice memento to hang on the tree for future Christmases.Only 14 floors, elevator trips were quick. I don't think I ever waited more than 30 seconds for an elevator. Had an Eggs and Things restaurant near the entrance. Lot of long lines and seemed to be popular with Japanese tourists. Went there once, I don't get the popularity. Nothing wrong with it, but you can walk right next door and get cakes and eggs from McDonalds that tastes just as good for about 1/2 the price with next to no wait.The room has a fridge, might have been nice to have a microwave, but not sure where I'd put it tho. I think free DVDs are available, but I didn't use that feature. Also they supplied beach towels, so don't waste your suitcase space for your own.Here is who I think this hotel is good for...Good price point compared to other neighboring hotelsCouplesyou are going to be spending a lot of time at the beachyou don't need a poolyou are a low maintenance hotel guest(You don't need room service and other amenities)You don't need your picture taken in a glamorous lobby You can deal with a certain amount of outside hustle and bustleyou want a good view of the oceanyou like the thought of a hotel that is not cookie cutterDon't stay here if:you want a poolyou want to see and be seen with high roller typesyou want to stay on the 30th floor of a hotelyou do not want to cross a street to be on the beach4 or more full sized people in the roomYou want/need a microwaveWant a king sized bedAnd in short, I'd stay again, I loved the place, the location and the price paid for where it was.

The Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel is a great place to stay!!! The front desk employees, particularly John and Jan, are very friendly and helpful, the housekeeping staff is also very friendly, and extremely accommodating, and the rooms are comfortable and clean.There are safes and coffee in the rooms, and the views from the ocean view rooms are incredible (see pictures). They also provide beach towels, and the restaurant, "Eggs and Things" is a great place to have breakfast.My granddaughter and I recently stayed there for a week, and it was a wonderful experience. My mother and I stayed there two years ago, and we, also, enjoyed our stay.I will definitely stay there every time I visit Waikiki.Janis E.North Idaho

After booking direct & paying in full 6 months in advance we were told we could not get in until we payed a further $15.70 (US) per day AMENITIES FEE. This we were told is for room service, daily paper, soap, shampoo, toilet paper coffee & sugar, wi-fi & use of in room safe(key operated). When we argued we did not want papers or coffee or wi-fi, we were told it didn't matter. We Had to pay. There was NO mention of them anywhere on the website at time of booking.After getting in to the room we find 2 x double beds (not a queen as shown on their website). A noisy wall A/C which rattled the glass siding balcony door. (We had to pull the filter out of the a/c to have it cleaned). Only 1 chair in the room (A desk chair), tucked around the corner near the wardrobe. (Yes, they had 1 of those).After paying for our amenities, we often had to go to reception to get our paper, soap coffee etc. which were not supplied.The noise of delivery trucks from about 5am every day doing deliveries to local shops & the motel, (All trucks have reversing beepers), made it hard to have a sleep in. The reception, check in area is definitely not the most impressive. The upside of this hotel is it's location & the view from the front balconies.When booking from Australia for any hotel in Hawaii makes sure you ask about the amenities fee & get it in writing if they say there are none, (I believe it is a common practice & we got off cheap).

The Aston Waikiki Circle is a comfortable basic hotel in a great location.No airs or graces, no fuss on check-in. The lobby is open to the street - and just across the road from the beach. Rooms are small but comfortable. No tea/coffee in room, but supplied in lobby each morning. However I asked for a jug and tea making facilities and the hotel was happy to supply them for me. Ocean front, ocean view and partial ocean view rooms are the best. Other rooms face away from the sea. The hotel is small with two elevators which operate quickly, no waiting time as in some larger hotels. We love the Circle hotel - levels 5 - 7 perfect for people viewing from the balcony! No pool at this hotel, but hey, there is a natural pool/breakwater right across the road. Perfect. Food a plenty within steps of walking outside. Coffee shop was closed for renovations on our last visit, but previous visits it had always been great for breakfast.

I stayed at this hotel in Nov. 2013 with three freinds . Great value for money location very good staff helpfull, have booked to go back again. Only down side is the rooms are not real big, but that was not a problem for us.

The recent reviews are accurate. Yes, the rooms are "small", and it doesn't have a pool, but the location is excellent. The rooms reminded me of a standard cabin on a cruise ship. I had room 1107 which had a view of the building to the north, but on the balcony had an excellent view of the ocean. For some reason the breakfast restaurant on the street level is incredibly busy, with a convoluted system of ordering, paying, and eating. I'm thinking someone from Toyota management designed the system. McDonald's is next door, as well as an excellent breakfast 1/2 block away, to the south. The whole thing reminded me of Japan. My only complaint was their laundry. I dropped off my laundry in the morning, and the laundry service "was late" and it was never done. I suggested they find a more reliable company for their laundry, and they suggested they couldn't. Really? In Honolulu? I guess that's what happens when you don't have many repeat customers who want this service. The location is excellent, you can walk out of your room in your swimsuit, take the hotel-supplied towel with you, right across the street to one of the nicest beaches you'll ever have. Pretty sweet.

This hotel is in a very good location , we had an ocean view room on the 12th floor which had the most amazing views . The room was kept clean and tidy and was quite reasonably priced . The only thing I really could mention is the windows are not double glazed so there is noise from the street , at first I found it difficult to sleep but soon became accustomed . There were many restaurants to choose from we used to have breakfast at "Dukes" but found down to the left was a cheeseburger place that did breakfast and was a lot cheaper . If I went back I would more than likely stay here again .I think it is probably the cheapest hotel along that stretch of road .There is no swimming pool , but the beach is directly across the road . You can hire sun umbrellas and chairs . In the room there is a fridge and right next door is the ABC store where you can buy beers etc The room we had was small , but there was two double beds in it so basically the other bed taking up space . Wifi is in the room and DVD's are free at any time . On leaving we were charge another fee ( Amenity) which covered these items plus phone calls , newspaper etc and that was 15 dollars a day .Apparently most hotels in Honolulu have this . So all in all I would recommend

I originally reserved a "partial ocean view room" and partial is an exaggeration! If you go on to the balcony and look very hard you can see a sliver of water. What you can see is other Aston properties next door and close enough to count freckles on a tourist's nose. :-) I complained to the manager and he had no ocean front available that night but in the morning i was upgraded to ocean front for an additional $30/ night plus tax and fees. While we're on the subject of fees; this property as most on Waikiki charge "activity fees" approximating $17/day. Why they don't include this in their room rate is beyond comprehension.The hotel is in a great location across from the beach, walking distance to the zoo and easy walking access to shopping and dining in the area. I walked to Diamond Head in about an hour and then climbed to the peak, moderately strenuous and do it early. :-)The rooms are NY small and bathrooms are even smaller, they're clean and adequate with large screen TV but not HiDef. You do have a coffee maker and cove with a desk which was comfortable for business folks like me. There is also a small fridge to keep liquid refreshments.Because i was traveling alone and just needed a place to sleep and work, this hotel was satisfactory. If my wife had joined me, an upgrade to 3-4 star hotel would have been my choice.

This quirky hotel has an excellent, central location. If you stay here spend the extra $$ and get an ocean view on the upper floors. You can't beat the views because the hotel is probably one of the closest to the beach. They have a very limited number of queen rooms so try to grab one of those also. If you don't want an ocean view (we stayed in a partial ocean view before upgrading) there are so many better options in Wikiki.

We stayed at this hotel with friends and found it to be a great hotel despite it's dated exterior. Great location & the rooms have been modernised. The staff are very helpful. Oceanfront rooms are well worth it. We would have preferred either a queen bed or king bed instead of 2 doubles which I feel took up more room than necessary. It doesn't have a pool but when you've got the ocean & ocean pools across the road, who needs it? Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

stayed there for 2 days n awesome view n service was fast n friendly. beach was across street n easy to find stores n restaurants. everyone helpful n room was clean n very well kept. i would recommend to my family n friends. cheap n reasonable rates too

My brother & I stayed at this hotel for 6 night from 25/11 to 1/12. Perfect location right across the road from Waikiki Beach. Arrived on an early flight from Australia & our room was avail early which we appreciated. We had an Ocean Front room. At check-in was given the 4th floor, asked to be moved to a higher level which was done the very next morning. We had room 1305 on the 13th floor, view was amazing. Reception & house-keeping were great. It's my second time at this hotel & would have no hesitation staying here again... Location can't be beat, close to restaurants & a short walk to the International Market Place...

We stayed here 5 days & had also stayed here in 2008 ... Checking in was efficient we didn't have to wait until 2pm, the rooms are clean,housekeeping great,right across the road from Waikaii beach & close to all transport & shops ... Eggs & things are at the entrance & the food there is great however you have to be early as there is lineup is long.

We recently stayed at this hotel and were very happy with our room.I was a bit dubious at first going on reviews but as our time got closer it was decided that we would only sleep there. We had a partial ocean view and felt it quite adequate. Yes the bathroom was a bit small we had no complaints. Room was serviced every day.and the management and staff very helpful. Across the road is Waikiki beach. My daughter stayed in oceanfront and that was spectacular views.

Perfect location on the beach with beautiful views from the ocean front rooms. I have stayed here on two separate trips to Honolulu and will return to this hotel again. The staff were friendly and accommodating and the hotel is central. No pool at this hotel but why would you want to use a pool when you are literally steps from the beach. In my opinion, you can't beat the view for the price. Thanks for another great stay, Aston Waikiki!

Lets face it, you are staying here for the view, which is very hard to beat if you pay the extra for an Ocean Front room. In my opinion the best view rooms are those that end numbered "04" and the higher you get all the better, i.e. 104 is at the bottom and very noisy and there are 14 floors all up, if you can get above the 10th floor it should get a lot quieter. That said, the air conditioners are very old and noisy themselves. It looks like the hotel has had a mini makeover to freshen it up and the rooms are bright and cheerful, but they are very small and all have 2 double beds, no other combination. Personally I would hate to have more than 2 people in one of these rooms, even if you can sleep with 2 small children, what do you do with them once you get out of bed. We had trouble finding somewhere to place our suitcases for 2 people, let alone 4. The location is excellent, smack in the middle of Waikiki shops and right opposite the beach. Lots of options for dinner nearby and excellent for watching the sunset from your balcony. You can see some of the nightly entertainment from your room and the bus stop is very close by too. I thought the NON OPTIONAL AMENITY FREE of $15.71 per night a total rip off, they bundle a bunch of stuff you don't want and make you pay for it daily. If it is not optional it should just be included in the Room Tariff. The bundle included WiFi, DVD's, In room Safe, Local Calls, In room Tea/Coffee, and a daily Newspaper, stuff most hotels include anyhow, and who wants a daily newspaper? Reception staff not really interested, but the gentleman at the Tour Desk was excellent, a big thank you to him for his efforts. My favourite was the Maid for room service, who monitors how much shampoo and soap you are using and will not leave any more until she deems you cannot get another day of use out of opened stuff, was very worried on last day, wasn't sure I had enough soap for shower before my flight! That being said I would still stay here again, just for the views!

Such a lovely hotel, pleasant staff, clean rooms, located directly across from Waikiki Beach. Clean towels and bed made daily. Newspaper delivered to the door daily. Loved our stay. The restaurant downstairs always had a long line of customers waiting, so we never got to try it. McDonalds is next door, quick and easy breakfast there. Sunday night there was a hula show on the beach, lovely to watch. Plenty of activities on the beach.

Location was absolutely perfect it was right on Waikiki Beach. The rooms were comfortable and clean, we had an ocean view room and it was great, for the price it was the perfect place to stay. Hotel was very central to everything every kind of restaraunt market places nearby plus trolly/bus service

You can't go wrong staying here. Like most other reviews said; the check in desk is in the open, the rooms are small, and it can get noisy. However, if you do your research ahead of time, you are aware of all of this. The check in desk was safe. If you are out exploring Oahu, then who cares how small the room is. The noise isn't as bad as some people make it seem.We chose an oceanfront room and the view couldn't be beat. Laying in bed staring at the ocean from the room was amazing! If you want to pay twice as much to be on the 45th floor of some resort, then go ahead and do it, but with this hotel anything above the 8th floor your view will be amazing.Beds were definitely soft, but comfortable overall. Bathrooms are small, but offer the basic amenities; toilet, shower, etc. Decor looked to be updated recently and the room smelled fine. The balconies don't really offer much privacy. The room offers a safe, work desk, closet with sufficient storage, taking into account the size of the room. The staff was friendly and the housekeeping always had our room ready early. Best part of the hotel was the location; it can not be beat!The breakfast spot on the ground floor was non-stop busy. A lot of complaints about not having a pool. My response = you're in Hawaii! Waikiki is right across the street, who needs a pool?!?!

As many other posters have said, the location of this hotel cannot be beat. I had been to Waikiki before, and knew this older hotel is in a primo spot. I'm also drawn to kitschy places and liked it's unique architecture. I really wanted a true ocean front room, and after shopping around, this seemed like the best value. I reserved online and requested a "great room". At check in, the staff was fantastic. I I was given room 504. I was very pleased as it was high enough up to enjoy a great view, but low enough on the fifth floor for good people watching in ever bustling Waikiki. Almost the entire ocean front side of the room was glass. You could literally lay in bed, and gaze at the beautiful Pacific. However, the giant blind did a good job of keeping most of the light out for sleeping. The room itself was clean and obviously recently updated in a nice bright modern island motif. The only negatives were, as others have stated, the bed is very soft. However, I did not wake up with a backache like some previous experiences with soft beds. Also, there was no option for a single King or Queen, only 2 doubles - not ideal for couples like us. My only other comment is that if you're sensitive to noise, both the AC and the avenue were pretty noisy. I usually sleep with a fan or other ambient noise, so it wasn't an issue for me.

Stayed at this hotel prior to our cruise.As most reviews have indicated the rooms were abit small but given the age this is understandable.The upside is the great location across from the beach and of course the spectacular views from the partial ocean view room.If you are staying at this hotel for longer the than one night go for a full or partial view it is well worth the little extra.The rooms are well equipped for 2-3 people.Check in and check out was a breeze.The activity and excursion desk in the lobby area was a bonus and manned by very helpful people(thanks for your help Angel) Doug F

we stayed at the circle hotel oct 17-21.....great hotel..the staff was great thumbs up jan.....the roomwas awesome a little small but with all the provisions.....we were in room 402 partial ocean view with views of other hotels.....our lanai was awesome......we will stay here next time...miss hawaii already......thanks..

Definitily the best hotel location in Waikiki, just across from the beautiful Waikiki beach. The parcial ocean view room has a great view of the beach The room is ok, it is very clean, there are microwave, mini fridge, chairs at the balcony but the Bathroom is too small, specially the box

We have just returned from a 8 night stay at this hotel. I was very impressed! The staff were helpful, the rooms were clean, we had paid for a partial ocean view and certainly had that. We arrived early in the day and were offered a room on several floors. We chose the 13th floor. We had an amazing view of the ocean from our balcony. The DVD hire was great too. Being so close to pretty much everything at Waikiki was fantastic. The only downside was the noise from the air-con system from the hotel next door. I would definitely stay there again.

My family booked 2 rooms, on 2nd & 3rd floors with ocean views. I was disappointed upon arrival as the exterior isn't impressive, but the rooms are nicely renovated and the views unbeatable. Ocean across the road, shops & restaurants 5 mins walk. Was a pleasant stay en route from the main land after a hectic 5 week holiday. Will be happy to return.

This is a simple hotel. Nothing fancy but there was a nice view from our balcony (rm 402)-though I'm sure some of the other rooms aren't so lucky. It serves as an acceptable place to stay as the location is convenient (literally right across the street from the beach and within walking distance from all the shops and restaurants) Reasonable parking prices ($15/day) safely in the garage under the hotel. Free wifi.Disadvantages: hardly any water pressure, (don't know if it is all the rooms or just ours) also there are lots of bums in the immediate surrounding areas. Otherwise pretty good, I was pleased with it.

We recently stayed at the Waikiki Circle, the staff were very helpful and we enjoyed our time their extremely, we had a room that was ocean front and it was great.It was nice to just walk across the road and have a swim and to be able to use the floats that were provided by the hotel.the hotel was located conveniently to trolley stops, shops, restaurants.

I stayed in a partial ocean view room and the view was still pretty good. It has a reasonable view of the beach. I would say approx 1/3 of the total view. Each floor has 8 rooms, with each floor being circular shaped. The very centre front room is the oceanfront room. The two either side are the ocean view rooms. They all have excellent views. Then there are two partial view rooms each side of the building with one city view room at the back. You are given the chance to upgrade upon arrival for a cheaper rate than if you book it initially, but that is only if there are spare rooms available. The decor was modern, the rooms small but fine for two people. Clean and serviced daily. Beach towels are provided and you can return the used ones and ask for clean ones as often as you want. The location was great, just walk across the road to a lovely part of Waikiki Beach. I will stay there again as it is well priced for its location.

I have stayed at the Waikiki Circle before. Love this no frills hotel. Staff very friendly. I didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room because I wanted to explore the island but the time I did spend there was VERY enjoyable. Will definitely want to stay there again when I go back

We arrived at the hotel fairly early in the morning and were told there was a room ready if we wanted it now or we could wait until 3pm for normal check-in. Of course you accept the room that is ready after a 10 hour flight. DON'T! You are given a room on a low floor that they would normally not book out and, unless you ask, they don't offer to move you to a better room. We were on the third floor and there was a lot of building works next door. There is also lots of kitchen noise from an alley between the buildings. We stayed there for three days before a cruise and on our departure, we asked for a better, higher room on our return. Our second room was on the Diamond Head side of the building on the 14th floor and had the best views though as mentioned by others the rooms are small. The hotel would be better to put in one Queen or King bed rather than the two doubles. That being said, we give enough praise to the reception staff, particularly John, who were pleasant, obliging and nothing was a trouble to them. They are a credit to the hotel. Of course the location is the absolute best and we would certainly go there again.

We stayed here with a balcony room with a beautiful view. It happened to be the week of the Honolulu marathon and a wonderful parade on Pearl Harbor Day. What a place to watch both of the events and enjoy the sunrise and sunsets. The rooms are quite small but total adequate for my husband and I. Right across the street from the beach and many restaurants very close by and of course an ABC Store. The price was excellent too.

Superb location on Waikiki. Just close to everything.Rooms are small bathrooms are not luxurious, but u know what expect when booking.Only downside was there was no ocean view from the bed even in ocean facing rooms bcoz of planning issues

I chose this location because it was right across the street from Waikiki beach and central to everything. $10 a day resort fee. First of all, the rooms are small but clean and kept up. The alarm clock broke after the first night but when we arrived back later we had a new one after we called the front desk. Everything is new and we enjoyed our stay here. For some reason though it was pretty windy the time we stayed there because we could hear the wind all night outside which kept us up but only on that side we were one as you couldn't hear it at the front of the building...weird. All and all, we enjoyed our stay. Bathroom is pretty small and the whole room is compact but it worked for us and we had a good stay. It felt clean and safe but it's not a luxury hotel. Pretty basic but stylish and cute. We liked it but I've since stayed at other locations since trying this out on my first stay. I'd stay again if the price was right and it's close to everything. This hotel has no swimming pool but the beach is across the street so it makes up for it.

Stayed here for 9 nights in a city view room. The view was crap, but the price was pretty good considering the location. In my opinion, best location in Waikiki. Central to everything, including the best part of Waikiki beach. Will be staying here again next trip, just next time it will be in an oceanfront room.

Upon arrival I rolled my eyes not seeing what I expected, but when checking the people were very nice and very helpful. I had called and requested a high floor because we were on an anniversary trip and did not wish to be bothered by the Waikiki Beach noise. We were placed on the top floor what a wonderful view. The location was awesome, right across from Waikiki Beach so we just had to walk across the street to the beach. Room was very clean, but very small so do not count on putting the capacity of 4 into the room. No pool but who needs it with the ocean right across the street. We spent four night and enjoyed ourselves very much.

Just returned back and overall the hotel was nice. Just as the other reviewers said, its located directed across from the beach and in the middle of endless shopping and tasty restaurants. One thing about the beach that I haven't read anyone mention is the issue on homeless individuals hanging out in the area. Don't be alarmed they are harmless for the most part, but it's very unfortunate to see so many of them at night camped out on the beach and sidewalks.The rooms are newly renovated, but the only issue I had was the shower. The bathroom is a little small but my main issue was that the shower doesn't give you much space to really move around without touching the walls or shower curtain (ewww) because the shower head was too large for the overall shower. My husband is 6'3 and he was cramped. The shower head was so huge that the water would splash on the floor and cause a puddle to lead to the bedroom. I literally had to place towels at the edge of the shower just to keep the water from going everywhere. The overall design of the shower was not thought out properly during renovation. Other than the shower issue..the room was fine. I mentioned the issue to management and they said they would take care of it which I hope they did. I will try to upload the footage we took of the shower. The bed was average. If you need a firm bed then this hotel may not be a good choice because the bed has a soft cushion. The rooms only offer a fridge, no microwave, so don't plan on reheating any food that you may take back to the room. The balcony is really nice anytime of the day you want to catch a cool Hawaiian breeze and NOTE: you will also make new friends from neighboring vacationers from the surrounding hotels who are also hanging out on their balcony's, so you are never really alone out there. The wifi connection is slow especially for the 15 per day service charge. The staff was very attentive and polite. The hotel also offers a 10percent discount for the Eggs n Things Restaurant which is located directly on the property. The food there was okay. If you plan to park your vehicle, there is an additional 15 per day to park and spaces are limited, so plan accordingly.

We booked this hotel as a quick stopover and ended up staying for four nights. It is located at the end of the 'Las Vegas Strip' of Waikiki and just a fabulous location. We arrived late on a flight from Anchorage and were given a room..ocean front..on the third floor. There were air conditioning units under the balcony that were pretty noisy. The next day, we asked if we could upgrade to a higher floor... they gave us a beautiful room on the 10th floor...facing the ocean and WOW... we are enjoying a wonderful part of Waikiki and O'ahu. Having been to the islands many times and when we are on this island, we always stay at the North End. Can't say enough about the great staff here. Rooms are very simple, but very clean and very comfortable. Balcony is wonderful... air conditioning is good. Bathrooms are small but the show heads are placed high and good water pressure. If you are given an 'Ocean View' room, it will be an excellent view. Some local people told us to walk up to the next block and catch the #2 bus to Chinatown, the Art Galleriies, the State Capitol buildings, Iolonie Palace, the original Missionaries homes and the Aloha Tower. We will stay here again!!

On my review last year I gave this hotel 5 stars. They delivered on what they promised.This year they have added wifi and dvds. (To go with the $15 per night service charge) The in room wifi was slow at best, much of the time it was worth connecting to one of the free hot spots in range. The DVD player which is a PS2 played roughly half the movies that we tried to watch from the hotels free rental seservice. this was even after the PS2 was replaced by maintenance. The a/c was extremely loud in this room as was the howling wind through the corridors. Especially when the cleaned was on the floor and had propped the fire door open.Whilst I'd still recommend based soley on location I'd also say it may be best to consider other options.

Our first impressions of this hotel was not a good one. The front desk on arrival was not very polite and was quite rude. We could not get into our room, but he did offer to store our bags, but gave us no map of the local area or any suggestions on where we could have breakfast, so after a 17 hour journey we just walked and walked and eventually was so tired thought we would head back to the hotel and try and check in, yes they had a room ready. I knew that check in was not until 3pm, but had spefically emailed them prior to our arrival to ask if we could have an early check in, as we were also departing early, and was told they would try their best, this guy on front desk on our arrival did not even ask for our name, just said "check in not until 3pm"!!!!!Our overall stay was fine and when we got to our room, after checking in, our stay was plesant. Every other staff member or front desk was quire helpful after our arrival experience. Yes the rooms are quite small, but hey Honolulu has so much to offer that it did not matter to us at all. The rooms were clean the only thing is that we had a partical ocean view room, but directly out our window we were facing into another hotel and the parking of a hotel behind, I would recommend a full ocean view room, as when we also went to sit on the balcony it was like a wind tunnel and too windy to sit out there which was a shame.Would we stay here again, possibly, location perfect!!!!!

So glad I booked this hotel. It was right across from the beach. Views from my ocean view room were amazing! Some of the reviews on here I'm not understanding. This is not a 4/5 star hotel people. But it was clean and I was barely in my room. So why complain about it being small? My room had 2 double beds. Not small at all. Only complaint I would have was the shower head. Strange that it was facing out and not facing the wall. I got wet the first time I used it, as I didn't realise the shower curtain should be closed when turning the water on! Would have been nice if the staff informed me of this one flaw.

We stayed here for four nights at the start of our honeymoon, and while the rooms are basic enough the location is perfect. We were charged a $15 daily amenity fee (not optional) which included wifi. The wifi was great because we could contact family back home, but it was painfully slow. The amenity fee also included use of the DVD rental system in the lobby - but most of the DVD's were too scratched to even play.The location definitely outweighed these negatives though and if we were to return to Waikiki we would probably stay again.

Ok so it might not look much from the roadside but this little hotel is fantastic and so centrally located. The rooms might be on the small side but are tastefully done - right down to sea themes on the buttons for the curtains. The staff are friendly and helpful and the views from the ocean front balconies are awesome. They know their stuff with cab companies and activities too. Loved our three days here.Michele, Auckland, New Zealand

Stayed here for a week at the start of September and was very impressed. For the first night we stayed in a city view room as this is what we had booked being half the price of an ocean view room. We asked for an upgrade on arrival and managed to get a full ocean view room for the second night onwards for an additional $40 a night. Much cheaper than booking one originally. I would suggest doing this but not in peak season as you may not be able to upgrade when there. On the other hand, the beach is just across the road so if you do have a city view room, a better view is only 2 minutes away.The staff were very helpful at check in and the rooms are serviced to a good standard every day - leave a tip and the service gets even better!There is a good restaurant outside which is worth queueing for if you like omelettes, pancakes and waffles. Plus you get 10% off staying at the hotel. The hotel is located near the shopping centres where you can find loads of different restaurants, there is something for everyone. I would stay here time and time again.

We stayed at the Circle Hotel for a week on our trip to Waikiki. When we first arrived, we were booked on a back facing room through Priceline, but decided to go with the upgraded ocean view for $20/day and let me tell you, it was worth it! We were on the 11th floor and the view is unobstructed!. You can sit out on your patio to watch the surfers during sunrise/sunset while eating a spam masubi! The hotel is located right across from the beach, you literally cross the street and you're there. Nothing beats being this close to the ocean and not only that but you are right in the middle of everything. The international market is a 5min walk away same with the Honolulu Zoo and if you need to ride the bus, it is right outside!Another good thing about this Hotel is that it is located right next to the Pacific Beach Hotel which is where alot of the tour companies pick you up for your island tour, cruise dinner, luau, or snorkeling adventures!There is a brand new Mcdonalds that opened up right next to the hotel, not for me personally, but I know alot of people enjoy their food and they are very affordable.As far as the room is concerned, it is fresh and is cleaned daily. The only thing that I think could be updated is the safe in the room, it was the old key safes and I was afraid that I might lose the key the entire time. Also, the bathroom pressure was REALLY low. It took me twice as long to shower because of this, but not a big deal. The staff is friendly and very knowledgeable and there is a restaurant right outside the hotel that always has a line. We never tried it but they give you a 10% off for being a hotel guest.

This hotel sits right on Waikiki Beach overlooking all the action and is amongst all of the restuarants and shopping on Kalakaua avenue. The rooms are clean, tidy and all that you need, maybe the airconditioners could run a little quieter. Definetly book an oceanfront room, the view is spectacular and more than makes up for the lack of onsite facilities such as you would get in a 5 star hotel. This is the third time we've stayed at The Circle and it won't be the last. Can't wait to go back!! Great value for money.

This is our favorite place to stay in Waikiki!! The location and price can't be beat. We love the balcony and view. We were directly across the street from the ocean. The view is unobstructed!! This was our second time staying at this hotel. It is so clean and newly renovated. We will be back next year!!

This hotel is probably not the best hotel in Waikiki but it's definitely ok for a short stay.I also think it's time to renovate the rooms, they look a bit old but very clean.Concerning the location: super! Just across Waikiki beach and a lot of small shops!

Steps from the Beach, exceptional service from the staff. Rooms are clean and fresh and the view incredible from the Ocean Front Rooms. This was my 4th stay at this hotel and will only stay here in the future.Located close to the very best eating places in the Beach area.A well maintained property with good attention to guests. I recommend this Hotel to any traveler to Waikiki Beach.

This place is so cool. I mean for a start, it is literally a circle and each room is its own piece of tropical pie in the sky. The rooms are small yet so well designed that they feel big. Luggage gets hidden behind sliding mirrored doors, and the curve of the hotel allows for a designated office nook that does not feel like it is in the bedroom. The bathroom has fab frosted aqua bubble glass in the door which makes it feel like you are in a fish tank when you are in there. The addition of a toy pet goldfish enchanted my four year old. I love Waikiki and over the years have stayed in a cross section of hotels including the Hilton Hawaiian Village, the Royal Hawaiian Hotel, The Parc, Trump, Reef Outrigger to name a few. All of them have their own appeal but the Waikiki Circle is without doubt the most lovable. Capturing a classic retro Hawaiian vibe reminiscent of an old Elvis movie.

Within a few staps from the beach, restaurants and shops. The location of the property is perfect. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful, especially Naomi. We had an ocean front room, the views are spectacular, drinks on the balcony at sunset were an everyday must. Rooms are small, but clean and have the essentials. Would definatley return.

My partner and I stayed her for 5 nights in August. The room was fresh and clean, quite minimal but had everything we needed. We chose this hotel purely for location - right across the road from Waikiki beach. We paid extra for an Ocean front Room, and it was so worth it. Opening the curtains on the first morning and stepping out on to the balcony to see paradise in front of you! The staff were very friendly and happy to help. The Lady on the activities and tours desk was very helpful and didn't try and push any trips on us. We wanted to go to Pearl Harbour independently and she told us we could take public transport at a fraction of the price of the organised trips. I can't praise the location of this hotel enough. Many of the larger chain hotels would not have been able to offer their guests the views we had, and I'm sure they would be charging a lot more in comparison.We had an amazing time here and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

The view from 13 th floor is breathtaking its so good to wake up and look out at Waikiki was spectacular I am definitely going to stay again The rooms were very clean and if you area person who just wants to get on with itYes the rooms are small but I do again maybe a 1king would be great Loved my hotel loved my location

I was at first skeptical about staying here after reading the reviews about the room being small. The hotel wasnt recommended or listed in many travel books. I am glad we stayed here. It is across the beach with a beautiful view of the Waikiki beach. I literally wore a bathing suit, grab a towel and walk across the street. It is efficiently small and I found myself keeping my things more organize in a smaller space. I was able to afford an ocean view room that cost less than $250. Aston Circle match the lower price from another website. The balcony made the room much more spacious. Here are some negatives: limited parking (I was able to park at the hotel after the 2nd night), the WIFI was very weak, ice must be obtain at the front desk (ice machine will not fit in any floor). My concern for future occupants is that a McDonald is newly built right next to the hotel. I hope the fumes will not permeate the upper floors.

If you want great value for your money in Waikiki, try this hotel. I've stayed there 4 times and will stay again! It's small, very clean and has the best location on Waikiki beach. Try to get the 5-8 th floor, centre balcony and the price is very reasonable depending on when you want to go and that goes for any hotel there. Why not have more spending money in your pocket and stay at this hotel, you won't regret it. Close to everything you need including the ABC chain of stores. Restaurants all within walking distance including the fairly newly opened restaurant at the front of the hotel, accessible from the Main Street. Waikiki Beach straight across the street!!!! The staff have always been a joy to deal with and are very accommodating.

Rooms are great. Position was excellent. Ocean front rooms are amazing.This hotel overlooks Waikiki Beach , close to Resturants and Bus Travel just along the road from Hotel. Is good having 24hr lobby service. Plenty of good shopping nearby.Beach has safe swimming for children,

We started our journey in Hawaii here in March 2013, we stayed here for three nights before heading to the other islands. We stayed on the 6th Floor in the Ocean Front room. The room was well kept and everything we needed was provided. The Wi-Fi was excellent, the view was magnificent. The air-con was a little noise when it kicked in and out, but wasn't that we couldn't sleep. It would be great to substitute some of the double beds for 1 king-bed especially in the Ocean Front room. There was only the two of us and we slept separately.When we came back to Waikiki after visiting the island we stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani - they couldn't even provide us with Wi-Fi in our room. I would have rather stayed at the Circle!I would definitely stay here again and recommend staying here!

My wife and I stay in this hotel for 6 nights in July 2013 on our first visit to Hawaii. We stayed in an ocean front room at 14th floor and loved sitting on the balcony watching the surfers on Waikiki beach and lovely sunsets. The view from our room (no 1405) was just amazing! (see my attached photos and you understand what I am talking about).The room were small but more than enough room for two people (see my photos). There is nothing to complain about the cleaning! Reception staff were really nice and very helpful.Wi-Fi at the room with good capacity in the morning and during the day but with low capacity in the evening (too many users?)This hotel is good value for money!RegardsSvein-Magne Tunli from Bergen, Norway.

This was a return visit to the Aston Waikiki Circle and we were not disappointed. The staff were very helpful and co-operative and we appreciated the playstation 2 in our room, and free dvd's each day as part of the amenities fee. The promotion of stay 5 nights, pay for 4 was particularly appreciated. The room was clean, and serviced every day and anything else we required was quickly attended to. Very effective air conditioning was welcome. The location of this hotel is a feature, and very close to the beach, shops and restaurants. It was perfect for our family holiday and would recommend this hotel to other travellers, and would not hesitate to return again given the opportunity. Thank you to the management and staff for your service.

At the time the price appeared to be cheap but when I got there I was told there was an extra $10 a day charge for the extras such as internet and daily papers. The staff were friendly however which helped otherwise I think all in all I would have been disappointed. The rooms were extremely small we had two adults and a child and there was no room in the room we had. Bags in the small corner where we had no room to unpack them. The shower was really small and the head wasn't very flexible and the water kept spraying out of the shower curtain. Water pressure was terrible and for a female made it hard to wash my long hair. All in all you get what you pay, rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Great location right on the beach with eggs and things down strairs. Make sure you get a beach view great for singles or young teens traveling not for families. We knew when we booked but there is no pool or fitness centre. If your looking for a gym there is one just down the road a few meters. McDonald's was being built next door whilst we were there.

The accommodations here were average, but it did the trick. Our room was clean. The location was nice, and very close to Waikiki Beach and many restaurants and shops. Don't expect to be wowed by the property, but overall I thought it was a solid value.

What a wonderful vacation at Waikiki circle hotel.
