The staff was very helpful,the rooms kept spotless.Our view from the 13th floor oceanfront room was outstanding.We could see Diamond head all the way to the Sheridan.It was close to everything,walk to the zoo or aquarium and walk across the road and your on the beach.There is a info center in the lobby to set up tours ect.It even has a small parking garage for cheap.
user_name:
Jeff G
Portland, Oregon, United States

review_body: I think the hotel must be the oldest in Waikiki -- great position, very average condition - ocean view is just that the view is really of the building next door. First offer at the front desk was for an "upgrade" !! more $ ofcourse -- speaks for itself

Very happy with this hotel - had an ocean front room on the 10th floor - room was a little on the small side and the shower head faced the curtain opening - but the room was clean and cool and the beds very comfortable. Perfectly located just over the road from the beach. Great views, and no noise issues. Wifi worked perfectly on mutliple devices. Room was serviced nice and early so always ready for us. Would definately stay there again.

Hotel has great location, just few meters from Waikiki beach, Hotels itself is freshly renovated. Rooms are not so big, but size is sufficient for people who wants to enjoy Hawaii. We have got room near the McDonalds building. Noises from McDonalds construction was heart up to our room on 9th floor. When I have asked receptionist for exchanging room, they provided me 2 possible rooms, where I can move. In that case I would like really appreciated local staff. They want it to help us as much as they can with information or advice where to go.Finally we kept our original rooms and we do no have problem with construction noise, because during the day we spent our time outside a hotel. So if you want to stay in good hotel just on Waikiki beach for reasonable money, you can choose that hotel and you will not do a mistake. Alo-ha

The hotel itself is great. Room appointments are good, especially given the odd shape a circular hotel allows.Lots of construction noise from the new McDonald's being built next door made the balcony all but useless to enjoy during the day. Access to the beach was fantastic though, so who needs the balcony anyway?Beds were uncomfortable - probably need a new mattress.

Location: Location! Location! Directly opposite Waikiki Beach with both protected and open beach directly across the road. An ABC Store downstairs is very convenient as is the onsite café. Great central location.Room: (Ocean Front). WOW! Stunning water/Waikiki views daytime, awesome sunsets and night time lights. The recently refurbished room felt very Pacific with colors of the sea. Comfortable bed and always clean room. The bathroom was a little small (but who stays in a bathroom in Waikiki!!). From the balcony, some street noise but for the location - it cannot be beaten.Service: WOW! Checked in late PM with a lovely Aloha welcome from a very friendly and helpful lady at Reception. Daily service was unobtrusive and when we did see cleaning staff, they were always so friendly, happy and smiling with an Aloha greeting every time.Facilities: Reception always friendly and attentive and very helpful. Tour desk staff helpful too. Internet access at Reception is good. 'Free' DVDs ok (paid for in amenity fee) while some didn't work (possibly an external company look after these). Eggs'n' things - an onsite café/restaurant open for breakfast through brunch and dinner. Good value if you can wait in the daily queues - a testament to how popular the place is and worth the wait for good food at reasonable prices. Staff always friendly and very helpful. If your order is for one take-out - you can jump the queue with the staff taking order on mobile and you pay at counter - much quicker! (McDonald's is opening soon too (says opening Summer 2013) - right next door!Pool: The pool was always clean, a beautiful turquoise blue with great views and is very popular - it's called Waikiki Beach!..directly opposite the Hotel...It's Awesome! :-)For: Location and such friendly and helpful staff. A very welcoming, relaxed atmosphere where nothing seems a problem.Against: Stay was too short! only 7 nights.Overall: Very friendly staff in a casual, relaxed setting in a great location.

After what seemed like forever,(about 18 hrs)we arrived in Hawaii and a pre-arranged taxi got us to our hotel . The Aston Waikiki Circle, I thought it looked pretty ordinary but I was very tired and just wanted some sleep. at reception the friendly receptionist informed us that the rooms we had booked wern`t actually available, but for a small suppliment we could upgrade to a better room,after much discussion and explaining that it had been booked and confirmed months ago we reluctantly agreed to an upgrade. the upgraded room was OK, and we took it.the hotel is directly opposite the beach and this is its main selling point.please note there is no swimming pool though and sunbeds on the beach are very expensive,seriously expensive.as previously mentioned by others the air conditioning is extremely noisy, not that it bothered me,traffic was also very noticable, all in all though, we enjoyed our stay at this very centrally located hotel, we did loads of trips, ate some super food and had a thoroughly good time, our daughter got married at a local venue and our group,(20) constantly met up in each others hotels, the night we checked out a very tired couple were at reception and we heard the receptionist tell them sorry the room you are requesting isn`t available but for 10-15 dollars we can upgrade yoyu to a better room!! ps Forgot to mention the building site next door.

This is the third time that I have stayed at the Circle. Go back each time because of the great location, service and staff. Like past visits, the location is the same. Across the road from the beach, the staff are the usual friendly and helpful and the room is always clean and comfortable. If you are looking for over the top luxury or space than maybe this is not for you. If you are after honest clean quiet accomodation than give it a go. Do try to get a high room floor as the lower floors can be a little noisy due to the traffic and Eggs and Things eatery on the ground floor. But overall very happy with the stay.

Excellent location, good prices and very nice staff.We stayed in an ocean front room and loved sitting on the balcony watching people walking past.Directly across the road is the beach, which is fantastic.The only thing that was irritating is the lady that sits downstairs trying to get you into a "special deal of the day". Every time we walked past, she would pester us!

Great staff ! (at the front desk and cleaning staff)Beautiful view !(Waikiki Beach...)Comfie room !(Clean beds and bathroom)Friendly atmosphere !(Guests as well as staff)Perfect holiday !Yes, the air con was a little noisy....it didn't bother us !Close to the restaurants and shopping...across the road from the ocean...We wannnnnaaa go baaaaack !Mahalo !

We stayed at this hotel for one night precuise on April 24,2013 The location is outstanding !!!! It is right across the street from Wakiki beach. It is in a great location! We had and Ocean front room on the 14th floor. We had a fabulous view of the ocean. It was magnificent. The room were smal but more than enough room for two people. The staff were very nice and helpful. Our flight landed early and we we able to check in early. Spend the extra dollars and get an Ocean front room.The view is so worth it!! If you are looking for a hotel like the outriggers or some of the other more expensive hotels this hotel is not for you. if you want a hotel with great views of Ocean and clean rooms with a nice staff. Give this hotel a try. There were plenty of places to eat and shop. The hotel is right across front the beach. Everything is within walking distance. All of the rooms have balconys. they will also store your luggage for you if it is needed. Ask for a rooms on the 10th floor and up, that way it wont be as noisy.Would definitely stay here agan . the beds were comfortable. Rooms were basic but clean. There is no room service but plenty of eating places within walking distance. Do Give this hotel a try. For the price you cant beat it. It was the cheapest hotel I found on the strip.

This hotels in a great location beautiful views of the ocean, with in walking distance of down town and diamond head. Very basic hotel with very little service. Cleaning staff were friendly. A/C very noisy and the noise from the street was sometimes to much. WI-FI was quick. Beds comfortable and bathroom clean. Overall expensive and not extremely flash but worth the $$ for the views

This hotel may not have as many luxuries as many others do, but the location is great, and the room had everything we needed. Great view of the shoreline from our room so that we could watch the surf and try to go out there when there weren't as many people on the waves. The A/C was very loud in our room, but thankfully I had my earplugs. Clean, simple, everything we needed, and for a better price than some others.

First stayed here many years ago & the magic is still here, fabulous restaurant downstairs, incredible location across from the Waikiki/ Kuhio beach - only 10 steps across the road ! Retro decor but recent, the bathrooms are fresh. The beautiful staff: nothing is too much trouble & always courteous. WIFI, DVD, local calls & daily newspaper included in low resort fee.The Oceanfront balconies are your best options too seek the sun and view the surf & the amazing street/ seascape views. Today we re on Lvl 8 - perfect views & our bed is very comfy. I am an international flight attendant & I get to stay in some amazing hotels all around the world - this little gem is still an all time favourite! It's an iconic landmark with a strong following amongst savvy travellers !

This is a very basic hotel with limited facilities so if you like a bit of luxe, then this hotel's not for you. I have stayed here several times over the years and absolutely love it because, despite its limitations, it is in a sensational location, directly opposite the beach and with superb views of the surf, Diamond head and Waikiki. This time I took my own kettle (they now have coffee makers in the rooms) and I also take my own breakfast cereal and bowl as there's no breakfast option at the hotel (the room has a fridge). The airconditioning sounds like a jet engine and on my stay in May 2013 the McDonald's store next door was being rebuilt so it was pretty noisy. The staff are friendly and some of the housekeepers have worked there for 20+ years though the rooms sometimes don't get cleaned until mid-afternoon. I'd still stay there again as it's good value for money.

This hotel is in a great location, right across the road from Waikiki Beach. The staff were helpful. The bed was comfy. The room however left a bit to be desired. The air-conditioner was so incredibly noisy we had to turn it off to sleep. A look out on the verandah revealed a machine so rusty it's amazing it still worked and stayed on the wall. There seemed to be a wind-tunnel effect out on the verandah it was unpleasant to be out there, even though it wasn't a windy day/night, and the wind was so strong it kept rattling the doors out to the verandah and it kept us awake. The wi-fi worked well. You will be charged a mandatory $15 per night for internet, movies, playstation and coffee whether you use them or not.

I am in the travel industry and have stayed in many hotels over the years. This little gem is a real treasure. The rooms are as everyone has stated very small but for 2 people they are just fine. My sister and I enjoyed an ocean view room and loved waking up in the morning and watching the surfers from our beds then moving to the deck for bagels and a mimosa. What a great way to start the day. I was going to start naming the staff we appreciated so much but I've decided not to in case I missed someone as every last one of them was terrific, very helpful and always wearing a smile. The location is second to none and the price was great. We both agreed that any time we are in Waikiki this is were we want to stay. Aloha, and have a great holiday!Judy

This hotel is in the perfect location. Right across from the beach and within walking distant to everything. Rooms are small but we have 4 adults in each room and were fine. Just don't spend to much time in there. Internet was great and worked fine. Reception staff were really nice and very helpful. We stayed here on both ends of our trip and I would stay here again. When comparing this hotel to others that were on the beach you couldn't beat this hotels price. Hotel doesn't have a pool but that is what the beach is for across the road.

Right in the middle of the action opposite Waikiki Beach. Just 14 floors, 8 suites on each. Little delay from use of the lifts. Convenient to a variety of dining experiences and availability of booking for excursions excellent.

Great little hotel right in the heart of things - also straight accross the road from the beach. The room was clean and enough space for 2 adults - loved the balcony - had a view of the beach and it was amazing - so nice to sit out there and enjoy a drink and the view. The hotel provide ice for our drinks whcih was great and they also have a fridge. Would def stay at this hotel again. Beds were so comfy too :)

As you have read in other reviews .. the rooms are small, but well furnished. I did not mind the sound of the air conditioner. I prefer some white noise to help me sleep. The room is not fancy, but fit our needs. I wanted to see the sights .. learn some of the history and culture of Hawaii so I did not plan to spend much time in the hotel except to sleep. I enjoyed getting up with the sunrise. The surfers arrive early and it was a treat to sit on the lanai and watch them catch some early waves. I also enjoy photography and early morning was a good time to walk the beach right across the street. The lighting is better then as well as you avoid the crowds. If you have a large family and want to spend lots of time in a hotel this may not be the place for you, but if you just want to sleep I highly recomend this hotel for the price and location.

We stayed in an oceanfront room on the top floor and the view was awesome! So glad we paid extra for the oceanfront. My parents had a partial ocean which looked at a garage so this was much better. Rooms were great though the double was a bit small for two adults. Location was great - right across from the beach and in the shopping strip.

We stayed here 3 nights before going on a cruise. The location was great. Lots of shops, bars,restaurants,and corner stores for everything you need.Across the street from Waikiki beach, walking distance to aquarium, shows a few blocks down, a luau across the street, a market within walking distance.Took a cab to the pier for 15.00 dollars.The room itself was small but we only slept there and it was fine for us.The beds were comfy and clean.They gave us a free upgrade ocean view which was perfect.The staff were helpfull and we booked our excursion to Pearl Harbour at the lobby @ a discount.I would stay here again.

Our room was an oceanfront room on the 13th floor (yes there is a 13th floor, lol), we had a great view of waikiki beach and the location was just steps away from everything. We didn't find the room too small at all, if I had to choose something that I wasn't too keen on it would be the loud air conditioner, but it didn't bother us at all. The staff was very friendly, and helpful. It would be my 1st choice to stay at if I ever went to waikiki again :)

Very expensive - you really do pay a lot a night just for this beach view! Staff very friendly. Room and bathroom small, but nice. Balcony good, and yes the view was amazing! The DVD rental service was a really good idea, especially when it rained all day! The location on the main road by Waikiki beach, is convenient, but very noisy. I was woken at 5am on a Sunday by some beach service with a microphone!! Nice to have a fridge in the room, and safe. Shops really close. Wifi free and very good I thought. And be prepared to feel dizzy - your in a circle!

The rooms are small but nice and clean. We had a great view of the beach right across the street. There is a $15 dollar service fee per night automatically charged to your bill and also $15 parking garage fee if you have a rental.

We have just spent three night in this hotel. The location of the hotel cannot be beaten, just cross the road and you are on beautiful Waikiki Beach. We were pleasantly surprised by this property. Our room was spotlessly clean and well furnished. Toiletries were supplied and a coffee/tea maker. There was a good supply of towels and good quality bed linen. We had arrived by cruise ship early in the morning and even though check-in time was not until 3pm. the reception staff kindly checked us in by about 10,00am. The only very small complaint was that the air conditioner was noisy, but overall our stay was very pleasant and would recommend this hotel - it is good value for money and the view out over the beach is amazing.

This is one of the smallest hotels in the area, but it’s a great value for the area and Waikiki beach is right across the street. Parking is $15/night, but there’s not many spaces beneath the hotel and the spaces are VERY tight. The room was fairly circular since the entire hotel is a circle, but there was decent space to move around. There was about a 32” flat screen LG flat screen TV and a PS2 system. You can get free movies and PS2 games in the kiosk in the lobby during your entire stay. The bathroom was small and the shower was very small. There was a small refrigerator, a closet with a safe, a coffee maker, a small desk and a very big balcony with 2 chairs and a small circular table. There are many stores and places to eat all along the strip on both sides.

i had one night to spend in Honolulu at the end of a stay on Molokai so i did not want so spend a large amount of money. Found the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel with a very reasonable rate. When i first arrived at the hotel I was a little disappointed, as the lobby was out side and there was not restaurant or bar in the hotel. However, as I should have known there was no shortage of restaurants and bars within in a very short distance, The staff was very helpful and courteous. The Hotel is one of those circular buildings that have the rooms around the elevator. Upon arrival i had been upgraded to an ocean view room, even thought i had received a very reasonable rate. The room was not luxurious but very clean, and comfortable with a nice view and nice balcony overlooking the beach. The hotel is directly across from the beach. The hotel provides beach towels and accessories for free for use at the beach. Again the staff was really polite and helpful. Across from the outside lobby is a very decent restaurant serving mostly breakfast foods with an emphasis on the local favorites loco moco in a variety of styles. There are several bars and other restaurants very close to the hotel. So after the initial small bit of disappointment, i found the Aston Waikiki circle great for what i had in mind. A one night stop close to a variety of things to do.

Location can't be beat, no pool, but no biggie since it is across the street from the best beach in the area. The staff was very nice and the rooms super clean. Rooms are so tiny you can barely get a suit case in. The bathroom was so small my husband had to sit on the toilet sideways!The noise was the worst part. The neighbors were constantly banging the doors closed and the traffic from the street was so bad I woke up thinking a motor cycle was in the room! For the price it was not bad, wakakiki is very pricey, crowded and touristy. But I do love Oahu, very pretty island.

The Circle was great value for money and has everything you need but nothing you don't need. Our family had a tight squeeze however managed to fit just fine. The DVD kiosk downstairs is good for entertaining the kids however the good titles are usually out and the WiFi speeds are what you would expect for a hotel. Overall a great hotel for the budget.

Stayed here for a week in mid-April. It's a good, solid hotel. Room was very clean and location was superb. I have no complaints. If you're looking for plush accommodations with all the bells and whistles this is not the place for you. However if you're not interested in room service, mini-bars and the rest, this a great place to stay. Beds were comfortable, closet was good sized and the room was quiet. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again or recommend to anyone.

The Circle hotel was a great price for the location it was in. I would chuck my bathers on and run over to the beach for a dip, and if I forgot something, I could run back over and grab it within 5 minutes. It's nothing fancy, a couple of beds and a bathroom but it has the essentials for a comfortable trip and the service is great.

My fiancé and I stayed for a week at the Aston. I have nothing bad to say about the hotel. Rooms were clean, small but we didn't spend much time in the room anyways. We upgraded to an ocean view, I highly recommend that. The view is unreal ! Staff was great, helpful and always pleasant.I would definatly stay again at the Aston Circle !

When in Honolulu, I always stay at Aston Circle, it has the best access to the strip and Waikiki Beach. The Hotel is clean and nice, not extravagant, but nice. The rooms are rather small, enough for a couple, snug for a family of 4 , but the beach and views are second to none, for the money. I paid $150 per night and had ocean front...the ocean was about 100 feet away.

Stayed here because the conference hotel room block (Hyatt Resort) sold out. Glad I found the Circle. Location couldn't be better. I was thrilled that they allowed me to check in at 10am because there was a room ready. Staff were friendly. Room was partial ocean view. I didn't use the lanai because of limited privacy -- it faced another hotel's lanais. In fact, I had to remember to shut my curtains for privacy as the windows don't seem to be one-way. Very small room, which was perfect for me even tho it had 2 double beds. Bathroom/shower is tiny, but sufficient for one person. If my husband and kid had come, I would have gone crazy with lack of space for luggage/storage. But then again, we would spend very little time inside the room, so maybe not a big deal. Unfortunately, construction on a McDonald's is going on next door. (really?? Waikiki needs more local food, dudes!!) The construction makes it not so convenient to walk down the street. I rate the room "average" for sleep because the A/C unit is loud! But Waikiki is loud too, so sleeping with the door open was not an option.Oh, and the hotel has an "Eggs n Things" restaurant. I didn't try it, but seems to be quite the rave experience, considering the waiting lines beginning at 6am.

As other reviewers have highlighted this is a pretty low frills hotel, but the rooms are clean (worth paying the $15 or so dollars more for a pool view as you can get a decent sunset from the balcony). Great price compared to other hotels in the area, although I did find myself getting slightly irritated by the additional charge for 'amenities' that you'd probably expect to be included (tea and coffee, WiFi, use of the safe, $15 a day for use of a gym) but still the overall cost was very reasonable. For staying in Waikiki the location couldn't be better though, very central and right on the beach. Speedishuttle are really good (look out for the guys in red shirts at the airport). They'll take you right to the hotel and pick you up there at a prearranged time for your return flight for about $25 per person all in. The restaurant in the hotel 'Eggs n Things' is really popular - queued out of the door in the mornings. I ate there a couple times around 5-6pm, when there was virtually no queue and the food is really good and cheap. I would stay there again.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle for a week in January 2013. We booked the hotel primarily because the price was good and the location looked to be very good as well. As it turns out, the location is excellent. The hotel is located immediately across the street from Waikiki beach. The hotel itself is a bit of a unique design (hence the "circle" name). The rooms have apparently been updated recently. We took a city view room since we weren't planning on being in the room much besides to sleep. The view ended up being of a parking structure and the adjacent hotel/condo's hot tub. Although small, the room had good features such as a safe, mini fridge, closet and TV with PS2/DVD. One of the neat features of the hotel was the included DVD rentals - there is a machine in the lobby that guests of the hotel can check-out free movies from to watch in their rooms - very convenient if you're looking for something to do in the evening. The only real complaints about the room were that the air conditioner was fairly loud and the hotel does not seem to have rooms with king/queen beds (we had two doubles and I think all of the rooms are like that). They also have limited parking available at the hotel for a fee which we took advantage of for a few days (be warned - the lot is quite small so I would assume there might not always be spots available, although we had no trouble). Overall, we'd recommend this hotel for a traveller looking for a good deal for an excellent location.

We were there in October, family of four. This isn't the kind of hotel you lounge around in, no pool, not much of anything...except a great location, we loved the location, right across the beach! Everything is within walking distance. Every morning, we walked to a nearby restaurant for breakfast then head out to the beach. Laundromat was also nearby. The only big negative we encountered was the parking. On days we went out on excursions, by the time we got back, there was no more parking. We had to park at their sister hotel's parking lot. It wasn't that far and it was nice walking around with our boys so for us it wasn't a big deal. Overall, we liked the hotel and would most likely stay there again next time we go to Hawaii.

Great location across the street from Waikiki Beach. Great for getting to the beach. Bad for all the foot traffic--not an escape from the hubbub. You can easily walk anywhere along Kalakaua Ave. The staff was great. Although small (almost cramped), the rooms had a cool retro look. For the price a good value. No pool or restaurant. Also, people in condos (or apts) were very nearby and could easily see into our room.

This review is long overdue, but as I am already planning this year's visit, and going back onto Trip Advisor to see the recent reviews made me finally submit this one. If you are looking for a full amenities hotel experience this is not the place for you, but if you are looking for excellent value in Waikiki this can't be beat. I have been to Hawaii many times over the years and have stayed at both high end and lower end hotels. Since discovering the Circle, I have stayed there my last 4 visits. Yes, the rooms are small, but really how much time are you spending in your room when paradise is outside? I definitely recommend spending the extra for an ocean view or ocean front room and ask for a higher floor. The location is ideal - the beach is literally across the street, great unobstructed ocean views from many rooms - better than many higher end hotels. The balcony is a good size and although the rooms are small, they are fine for 2 people and the space is well planned out. Yes, the bathrooms are tiny but again, no wasted space. The renos done a year or so ago have brightened up the rooms. Staff is always very friendly and helpful. Close to all the restaurants and shops, easy walking distance everywhere in Waikiki. Love it!

This was our second stay in this hotel. We chose to stay here again because we found it to be reasonably priced and ideally located. We arrived at the hotel and were quickly checked in. We had a room with two double beds and a full ocean view on the 18th floor. The room was beautifully decorated and completely redone. The bathroom was also redone but the shower is still really tight! The rooms are incredibly small. We have stayed in the room with three adults and found it to be okay. I'm not sure that four people would find the space adequate. You need to remember that you are not going to spend a lot of time in your room. The hotel now charges a "resort fee" of $15 daily. The fee includes Wifi (which we used), a daily paper (which we read), and in room coffee (which we drank). There was also a safe for storing your passports. The fee also includes a Play Station and free movies which we didn't use. We could not get over the transformation in the hotel. If you don't mind tight quarters, the location which is directly across the street from Kuhio Beach Park cannot be beat! We loved our stay and we will be back!

We stayed for 3 nights before acruise,I was a little nervous about the hotel because there was so many variying reviews ,we stayed in room 1104 oceanfront and We loved it.the view takes in the lenghth of Wakiki Beach.I could watch the surfers waiting for a wave( very opptomistic hardly any waves in Wakiki) from my bed.The rooms are not large but they are well laid out and very clean and comfortable,the staff are friendly and helpful.It is next door to an ABC shop so you get most things you need.We enjoyed hawai and hope to holiday there again next year we will stay in this hotel again.Just one thing to remember the flight from Autralia arrive 6.30 am and checkin time is 3 pm so try for an early check in wnen you book.

Once more I got to organise the travel arrangements for our annual trip, Hawaii was calling us again. We have previously stayed at a high end on the beach hotel in an ocean front room – nice, & a really really nice hotel on the beach in an ocean view suite when we took the 17yo, this time it was just us so we looked for something a little cheaper as we still wanted an ocean front room, well did we hit the jackpot. Firstly because we are just over 50, you get a discount, yes!! Secondly where can you take 89 steps from your room to the sand in 4 minutes, well we could. No waiting for the lift, no huge lobby, no bar, (doesn’t matter, my other half played bartender & got those Californian Chardonnays to me from next door at the ABC Store quicker than the bartender at the Sheraton) (& 2 mini bottles for $3.50, are you kidding me?) for a drink on our 9th floor OCEAN FRONT room in the afternoon after our swim at the beach, did I mention 89 steps from the room in just 4 minutes. Didn’t need a pool either, beach across the road, amazing! Checked in with no problems, was asked if we would prefer a queen bed or 2 doubles, so jumped at the queen knowing the rooms were on the smaller side. I was a little apprehensive as our door was directly opposite the lift door, but I did not hear a thing the whole 5 days I was there. We needed a couple of extra pillows, not a problem, I had just hung up the phone & there was housekeeping at the door with them. Did I mention the view from the balcony, spectacular, did I mention the price for this view, unbeatable. Yes the room isn’t large, but there is everything you need, TV, dvd hire, wifi, bathroom amenities, room safe, coffee, refrigerator, air conditioning, which brings me to my only gripe, can you please install split systems & get rid of those noisy box aircon units, luckily it wasn’t scorching hot, so we ended up running the aircon on fan only, slept with the door open, which I closed with my foot (you are that close to it lying in bed) as the sun came us because I didn’t want any feathered friends waltzing into our room. The night before check out I asked where we could get a cab, no problem says the desk clerk, just come down when you’re ready & I’ll call one for you. There was a crowd at checkout, us & another couple, this is a crowd at this hotel, just loved it & it’s so quirky with its pie shaped rooms. We cannot fault the service with this hotel, it’s not the Ritz, but their website shows you what you get & there isn’t any false advertising, I actually feel we did very well for our money. This oceanfront room was about 1/3 of what we would pay elsewhere & we didn’t need any of the “extras”, this is Waikiki, everything is at your doorstep anyway. Thanks for a really good stay which was part of our 30th wedding anniversary trip. Mahalo.

Our family stayed here in 3 room for 3 nights on the way over to Kona for the Ironman then for another 2 nights on the way back... Small hotel with friendly staff and clean rooms... The price is great for the location... Close to all the restaurants & shops... Great to grab a towel from reception walk across the road for a swim on Waikiki Beach... If your looking for a great location at a good price then this is the place...

Hubby booked this hotel without the benefit of my fabulous research...what can I say? We came here after a fab stay at the luxurious Westin Ka'anapali Villas in Maui, so right away it was a letdown to end up at a funky high rise motel on Waikiki. Truly that is what it is. The Good:Location-it's right across the street from Waikiki Beach, near the Duke statue, and SO CLOSE to all the fabulous shopping along the boulevard. Can't beat that.Staff-All so nice, and helpful. There is no lobby, just a counter with staff behind glass, but they were always so helpful. We had a problem with our door lock, and the housekeeper rang up the maintenance man, and it was all fixed right away. Nice!The "Meh":Rooms-While they were charmingly decorated in a retro look, and the bed was comfy enough, the rooms are truly small. The bathroom also was tiny. But it was all clean, so can't complain too much.Balcony-OMG, it was pretty scary to go out on that balcony. We were in #1307 (yes, 13th floor!!), so we had a decent ocean view. But going out onto the balcony made my legs weak. And the sliding door really didn't close correctly, so I was quite sure I would wake up at night and wander off the balcony and over the side. There was no screen slider, so we couldn't open the door and let breeze in. Whatev, I got over it by day two.Parking-We are ADA, so we were able to take advantage of the handicap spot near the "lobby", but it looked like a small parking garage was what others had to deal with. If full, there were other Astons nearby, so maybe it all works out. Not sure about that.So there you go. This is NOT a resort, and I guess the pricing is great. I truly think I could have gotten better room with some research and taking advantage of AAA or Starwood membership. If you want to see the real luxury, check out the Moana Surfrider nearby. Woo hoo, now that is where I am staying next time!

This was my fourth stay at this hotel. I was surprised and pleased by their recent renovation. Rooms are very cheery and the bathrooms are much brighter, the overall job was well done. I spent a quick five nights to get away from the dark and cold winters we have in NYC. Each day I was met with a fantastic view of Waikiki and at night a terrific sunset. My room was on the 10th floor facing the ocean, well worth the extra money. As usual the staff was amazing, very friendly with lots of Aloha spirit, especially the Housekeepers who always greet you when they see you. There is finally a restaurant at the hotel, Eggs-n-things; however, because it is a tourist destination it's not much use to the hotel guests. Still, my favorite breakfast spot is Duke's at the Outrigger. It's touristy too but has good food and nice views of Waikiki. Already, I have planned my next trip to the Waikiki Circle due to the bargain airfares to Honolulu and I look forward to spending a restful week at this fantastic little budget hotel that can't be beat.

The Waikiki Circle Hotel has a great location across from the beach in Waikiki. It is not fancy, does not have a pool or fitness room. The rooms are a bit small but clean and the beds are comfortable. If you are looking for basic clean accomodations at a reasonable price, in the heart of Waikiki this hotel is a good choice.

This was mine and my partner's first time in Hawaii and we chose this hotel through a friend's suggestion. We got given a room on the 3rd floor, ocean front. The room was clean and well lit, both by the lighting & daylight through the big glass door.The shower area was small and the room was compact in size. Towels were restocked with fresh ones everyday and the day's newspaper was supplied. The in-room fridge door did not close / seal properly so we used the free (supplied by the hotel front desk) ice to keep drinks cool. I had trouble sleeping on the first few nights, as I slept on the bed close to the glass doors & main street so it was noisy till the early hours of the morning. Thankfully, the room has two double beds so I moved to the bed furthest away from the street. We experienced issues with the free DVD rental and the Playstation, on which the DVDs were played on. The hotel inspected the Playstation and replaced it but the issue still continued. DVDs were sometimes scratched so we went out, read our books or used the free wifi, in the evening. We also made use of the parking, beach towels, luggage scales & discounted meals from Eggs n things, which I thought was very convenient and made our stay stress free. Lastly, I had newspapers taken, probably thrown out, which I wanted to take with me and had souvenir submarine magazines, within them. I should of packed them away but they were not located anywhere near the trash can. The staff were helpful and friendly. Even when we enquired about the laundry service, the lady at the front desk advised us to use the Laundromat 3 mins walk away because it was cheaper, which I really appreciated her honesty as our holiday was coming to a close & we had little money left.

We had an ocean front room on the 12th floor, recommend not staying below 4th floor.Hotel was very reasonably priced compared to all the othe ones nearby.An older hotel but our room was very clean and compact with safe, wardrobe and fridge and 2 double beds.Excellent location but Waikiki is very noisy!

This review is very sadly overdue, as we have stayed at this wonderful hotel 5 times and this is my first time commenting about it.Our first stay was before the renovation, so a couple of years ago.We shared our room with our teenage son, as it was his grad present. The room is exactly as depicted in other photos. We always get full ocean front, floor 11.The view is spectacular and totally worth the extra money!! It can be a little cramped, so use the space under the bed to store your extra stuff, like suitcases, snorkel gear, shoes, etc. Don't leave things to dry unattended on the chairs on the lanai, I sadly watched half of my best swimsuit fly away.The staff at the front desk are very accommodating, John, Jan to mention just two are super people to deal with. Also, we somehow have had the same wonderful lady clean our room each time. I'm sorry that I don't know her name, but she does a fantastic job.As others have said, the location can't be beat, close to everything. Yes the bathroom is small, but it is perfectly appointed with everything you need and a place for everything.We have a habit of putting our things away after we use them, so nothing is left out.The updates are great, fridge works really good, keeping our drinks cold for when we need a little cooling off in the afternoon. We love this hotel, planning on being there again soon. The beds are very comfortable, and housekeeping is happy to get extra pillows if you need them.cons: ...there's only 1. The lineup for the restaurant is always really long, but this restaurant is not affiliated with the hotel, so maybe find somewhere else to eat.

I planned on a short trip to Oahu, prior to a longer trip to Maui. I was looking for beachfront and affordability. I got both with Aston Circle in Waikiki. The web page photos didn't give a true picture of this hotel, and truth be told, we were a little hesitant when we first approached this little hotel sitting among the tall highrises. But we were pleasantly surprised as we entered the our room. The whole hotel is circular (hence the name!) and the room had a curve to it. It was tastefully decorated with sea-ocean colors and theme. It was a bit small, but when you consider the amount of time spent in the room, it really didn't make a difference. Our small lanai overlooked the beach and main street, and we were in short walking distences of the zoo, and many restuarants and stores. It wasn't flashy and crowded as were many of the bigger places surrounding us. The staff at the front desk, which was located OUTSIDE under the overhang, was so very friendly at all hours of the day. I would stay there again in a heartbeat, and recommend this hotel to anybody not needing all the extras of the larger hotels.

This hotel has been recently decorated and was clean and tidy and is on the beach front. On arrival we were upgraded to a full sea view room but having asked for a quite room, we found the traffic and people noise too much and were promptly moved to a side view with less noise. We had a nice view of the beach and sea from the side. An ABC convenience store was next door and very handy for all the things you need including salads etc for lunch.All in all a 'nice' hotel that was reasonably priced but if a lot of 'little things' mean a lot to you. I suggest that you upgrade to a more expensive hotel.

Traveling with a 7 month old, this was a great hotel to stay. The Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel is located right across from Waikiki beach and close to restaurants and shops. There is a popular restaurant in the hotel itself but we found cheaper and less crowded options within a couple of minutes walk. The hotel didnt have many facilities like a swimming pool, hot tub etc but we spent most of our time on the beach so it didnt matter. Beach umbrellas and floats were available to borrow and we used the hotel travel desk to book excursions. The rooms were a bit old but clean and spacious and we were provided with a crib on arrival. Overall, we had a pleasant stay and would definitely return.

We booked through Priceline and got a decent deal on the hotel for waikiki area. We arrived late but had a good customer service with the gentleman at the lobby who was very accommodating and helped us with a parking spot (which was full)The location is great for tourists but sadly, the property itself is in need of some TLC. I suppose you get what you pay for. But it will be a fantastic choice for families on budget!

Recently stayed at this property as part of a two week trip to Hawaii. The view from our room was gorgeous. Loved sitting out on the deck in the morning having a coffee and watching the sun go down at night. Truth of the matter is any hotel really along the strip in Waikiki is going to be in a great location and most likely offer you a wonderful view of the ocean and beach. If you chose to stay at one of these properties I would recommend not spending the extra money for the view and get a room facing away from the strip. Why spend the extra money when you can take the elevator down walk 100 feet and be on the beach? Reason I am suggesting this is facing the strip is very noisy. If you are a light sleeper you are going to be quite annoyed by all the street noise. More specifically with this property I was happy with the staff, they were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very small but you get what you need and honestly when in Hawaii how much time are you spending in your room? Hopefully very little! I don't think we would stay at this property again. Although we didn't hate it, the street noise and the noise from the other rooms with doors slamming constantly from people coming and going was a bit much for us.

Amazing I love it very convenient close to beach McDonalds and all kinds of cool shops also close to the zoo have stayed three times will stay again for sure. The price is fairly cheap for just across from the beach the view from our balcony was breathtaking

Several years ago, my travel agent booked this hotel for us. When we got there the front desk staff gave us a room on the lowest level with a view of the parking ramp! We asked for a better room but were told it would cost extra so I paid an extra $250 out of pocket for three nights. After the trip my travel agent showed me that he had booked an ocean view room AND PAID EXTRA for it and scolded me for not phoning him on the spot! Felt really scamed by this hotel! The rooms are small pie shaped contraptions in which you would not want to spend much time.

Great location to stay if you just need a room. No amenities of the the resort type. So if you want the step out to the beach and Waikiki center this is the hotel for you. The room and bathroom are really small. No fancy pool. Nice place just not a lot to it.

We stayed for over a week in this hotel and it was everything we needed for our stay in Honolulu. We thought we would miss the pool but not at all! The location is perfect.You have the beach right in front of the hotel! You do definitely want book ocean front view room and on the higher floors. We did not have any problem in the hotel. It was a great stay and for a reasonable price in comparison with the hotels in the area.

Hotel is small (in a nice way) and staff are efficient. We had a full ocean view room which is more expensive but totally worth it. Rooms are quite small but very clean and cute! If you are on the larger side I would recommend going elsewhere as the bathrooms are tight (and I'm not a big person). The location is great- right on the beach in the middle of Waikiki. If you don't like the hustle bustle of a touristy area then don't stay in the heart of Waikiki as it can be a little noisy but we loved it. We would definitely return to this hotel :)

I loved this hotel. Nothing fancy really, not even a real lobby, but rooms were clean and comfy and staff was great! Best thing is views and price for that view and awesome location. Every room has a view and I have paid a lot more for views over parking lots. Location is fantastic! Beach is right there as is everything else. We had a car and went all over Oahu. Parking is 15 a day, very good for Waikiki. Staff was great and very responsive. No frills but aren't missed.
user_name:
Rochelle L
Avon Lake, Ohio, United States

review_body: The Waikiki circle hotel is great value for the beachfront location and a short stroll to some great shopping!The room decor is very welcoming and was a good size for us travelling as a couple. The bathroom is a little small and the air con is a little noisy but it didnt affect our stay at all. We had a fantastic view of the beach and up the street from the balcony. Not advisable to leave anything on the balcony as it is very windy. Street noise was not an issue to us up on the 5th floor. The hotel was clean and comfortable, would definitely stay there again!

This is a very different experience. You can take an elevator from your room, walk down a ramp or steps and you are ready to cross the street to one of the best parts of the Waikiki beach. The rooms were refurbished last year and are clean and pleasant with everything working. There is no lobby, looks like you are going to a movie by just going up to the window.Stayed last year for a week and prices were a little over $100 per night. With nothing improved or changed we paid about $165 per night this year. Part of that is a $15 per day charge for safe, etc. I think in addition it is either $15 or $25 more for parking. This is for a city view room. Last year we had been comped a ocean view and the view was probably as good as any in that area. I think that has risen to $250 or more per night. If prices rise any more we would not stay there again in spite of location, location, location.

Great location if you want the hustle and bustle of Waikiki Beach. The room decor is really cute. The rooms are tiny, though. I was one of three adults in one room and it was fine for one night but we couldn't have stayed much longer than that without stepping on each other's toes. But for a couple, it would probably be fine. The parking is difficult if you have something larger than a compact car.

The room was extremely small and the bathroom was definitely comparable to a Motel 6. The view is from outside the room and the elevators were confusing. Good note was the breakfast. We only stayed one night, but I would have been extremely upset if we had booked several days.

If you want to be right at Waikiki beach, don't expect it to be quiet. We knew that, still chose the Aston Circle. Friendly check-in, small but clean and comfortable room, we got an upgrade to an oceanfront room and so enjoyed a great view and quite a bit of noise from "downstairs". Parking is 14$ per night but was worth it for us. Overall a good location to explore Waikiki for a two day stay.

We got an ocean view room. Was definitely worth the extra $$. Beautiful view. Rooms are small, but very clean & updated. Convenient location. Also had read comments about not having enough parking spaces. We had no issues with parking. Always a space available. (It's best to have a small car though.) The front desk staff were very nice & helpful. We enjoyed our stay!

Good location and own parking garage. Rooms without seaview are with view to nextdoor hotels garage.Aircon is fairly noisy, so if you don't like noise when sleeping, take earplugs with you.Hotel has mandatory fee which includes newspapers, internet and dvd-renting.

I was quite upset that upon making my reservation and through mulitple follow up conversations that I could request a late check out. However, upon arrival I was told this would not be possible only to be directed to call the moning of check out to request a later check out. I called at 759 and was told that none were available. When questioned I was told that people were in line at the front desk to request the late check out before me, all on the top floors nonetheless. I felt misguided and even lied to by multiple staff on the security of a late check out. In addition, when asking for local places to dine, Denny's was suggested. Hmm? Upon check out I did not receive a full bill because the system was not working properly.The beachside rooms were louder give the location but that is forgivable.

It’s been a while since we visited the island, but I couldn’t go on without mentioning how much we enjoyed our four night stay at the Aston Waikiki Circle. It’s a small boutique hotel, but the rooms are immaculately cleaned and the ocean front rooms are to die-for. You can’t get any closer to the beach, and there are numerous restaurants and shops within walking distance. You definitely get your money’s worth here!

We were intrigued by this hotel when we researched hotel options for a one-night stay in Honolulu on the way to Maui. We wanted to stay directly at Waikiki beach but were turned off by the chains' standard offers at exorbitant prices for an ocean front room. So we opted to take a risk, considering it was just for one night.What a pleasant surprise! We liked our ocean front room on the 11th floor and cherished sitting on the balcony and looking at Waikiki beach and the bustling activity on Kalakaua Avenue below. The building's strange circle shape, the reception behind glass (not bullet-proof, as one prior reviewer had suggested), the quirky pastell blue color scheme in the room, the small Motel 6-like window A/C (which we did not need at night), the functional small bathroom--all of this reminded us of travel in a different period, in a very positive way. We commend the owners for having preserved many of these characteristics and for having avoided a cookie-cutter modernization of the rooms akin to the thousands of chains' hotel rooms on the strip.We also found the hotel price very competitive for Waikiki. There was, of course, a resort fee of USD 15 for "amenities" that many guests probably won't use (like movies), and we paid USD 15 for parking below the hotel. All of this is what needs to be expected for a stay in Waikiki and it thus did not bother us. We would recommend an ocean front room, for the views; traffic noise was not an issue on the 11th floor, and the A/C noise from neighboring hotels was far enough away that it did not spoil our marveling at the view.So pick the Aston Circle if you enjoy--like we did--reliving some of the 1960s/1970s feeling.
user_name:
SGECHAMPION
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: No view (avoid rooms ending in 7 or 9 if that's what you want), but we weren't in the room much anyway. We had a partial ocean view from our 12th-floor lanai, but it was so windy out there we couldn't sit outside. The wind also rattled the glass door; we had to wear earplugs to sleep.The room was tiny and oddly furnished, but it was an efficient use of space and had cute, modern decor (love the bubble-glass panel in the bathroom door!). Would have preferred a queen or king bed instead of two doubles. Very limited parking in the garage under the building, but convenient if you can get a spot. Free Wi-Fi and DVD rentals, pleasant staff, good price -- I'd stay there again.

Our 2nd trip since the remodel, front & center, #1403, great return trip for us, we have a system, get supplys at Costco on the way to the hotel, & live better on the beach :>), we stayed 2 weeks & had a rental car 1st week, went to all places around the outer island, & then turned in the car in the Waikiki area & they shuttled us back to hotel, & used Roberts Hawaii.com for the shuttle on the day we left, best location on the strip, upgrade your room with a better view....rooms are tiny & are pie shaped, very basic hotel, but I went to Hawaii for the view, not to be waited on...Best tip is....restaurant Eggs & Things in same building, always long lines, $$ prices, order your food to go & you will get it faster & go to beach area to eat, 10% off meal if you show hotel card, also hotel line to get in.

Second time at this hotel,right across the road from a fab beach. Got upgraded to partial ocean view, no extra charge. Friendly check in staff. Service staff very polite,greets you whenever they see you. Plenty of beach towels. Wifi, dvds very reasonable rate.

Rooms are quite small but there is everything you need. Rooms are also very tidy and the service in the hotel was good. The view from the ocean view room was amazing but on the other hand some noise from the main street down below. Also the small balcony is quite worn out and not very inviting.Location is also superb as it's just across the street to Waikiki beach and only few minutes walk to main shopping and restaurant area. Didn't try the restaurant downstairs but seems to be very popular as there was a line almost all day.We stayed only two nights after returning from Maui and on our way back home. The staff was kind enough to store some of our luggage during our time in Maui and this was very much appreciated. Also a crib for the baby was provided without any problems.If you're planning just a one or two nights quick stay in Waikiki and don't want to spend a fortune for the room then you should look into this. For this purpose I would really recommend this place but if you're planning a romantic holiday then you should look elsewhere.

Very small but tidy rooms, we had an ocean front room which was beautiful-sitting on the balcony-also small-but directly across the road from a palm tree lined park and the gorgeous ocean. Happy, friendly staff. Right in the middle of town, short walk to all the shops. Highly recommend.

Our recent stay in Honolulu was wonderful thanks in part to the delightful Aston Circle Hotel! The location could not have been better--directly across the street from Waikiki. The rooms are a bit small and we had two double beds for a family of three-I did know of both issues going in, however. The staff was very helpful--Jan, at the front desk seemed be on duty day and night! We were so pleased to be able to use the air mattresses which were available in a "help yourself" box. I would recommend paying extra for an ocean view room. It was very clean and fun, quirky decor!

We stayed in January 2013, and we were very happy with our choice in Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel. If you're like us and like to be right where the action is happening and don't mind a little noise, you'll like this hotel. We had an ocean front room on the 9th floor, room 904, and the view was awesome. The room was small but organized in such a way that they made good use of the space. It was clean and seemed to have been recently updated with fun modern decor. The air conditioning worked well, there's a mini fridge, a coffee maker with 10% Kona coffee provided. There is an obligatory $15/day amenities fee, but it does include unlimited DVD rentals if you have time to watch a movie. It didn't affect our sleep, but there is quite a bit of noise outside from all the fun happening in the area. Every night there was a special little free show across the street from us at the park. They light tiki torches and have hawaiian dancing and singing. It's quite nice and there was always a big crowd of people watching. Plenty of great places to eat nearby. There's no pool, but a great swimming beach is just across the street so we didn't feel this was a negative. Our room, as well as all the others I believe, had 2 double beds, so if you're used to a bigger bed this might bother you. This is a nice little hotel for the location and for your money.

What a pleasant surprise! Great value! Step across the street and you're on Waikiki Beach! Clean, comfortable, and friendly! Why pay twice as much? Booked the room on Priceline, so I was apprehensive, but had a pleasant surprise when we checked in. Right in the middle of all the action! Restaurants galore, breathtaking view, shopping and the beach! This is the best kept secret in Honolulu!

This was our third stay at the Circle. We had been there before it was purchased by Aston Hotels and liked the convenience and the rooms. The hotel has been upgraded and is even nicer than before. There is a garage downstairs for parking rental cars, making it even more convenient. We upgraded to a "ocean front" room facing Kuhio Beach and had many nice cups of coffee on the balcony overlooking Kalakaua Avenue, the beach, and the ocean beyond. The nicest thing about this small hotel (in comparison to the huge high rises around it) is that it has a "ohana" (family) feel to it. The lobby is small and you don't feel like a number on a door. Since we were there before the Eggsn Things restaurant opened on the first floor - long lines but good food.

I was traveling with a colleague in and out of Waikiki over the space of a few weeks and stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle 3 times for 1-2 nights each time. In total, I had the opportunity to get a close up look at 6 different rooms (3 of mine and 3 of my colleagues) which made for a higher than average sample of the accommodations. Of the 6 rooms, there was not one that was quiet enough to enjoy the balcony. The lower floors are overwhelmed with street noise, and the upper ones are overwhelmed by the noise from the room's air conditioner exhaust vent and/or the industrial air vents from the surrounding hotels, which have grown up around the Aston over the last 50 years. Inside the rooms, the air conditioners are vintage low-budget models of the cheap motel variety. This made sleep nearly impossible - turn them off and the humidity was unbearable, turn them on and you're sleeping next to jet engine.The reception area is a vaguely delineated open space in which you are crowded by the never-ending lineup for the Eggs 'n Things restaurant (see below). The staff at reception are pleasant enough, but it is difficult to hear them through the glass, much like when you are trying to get information from a ticket agent in a city subway. In addition to being annoying, it makes any hope of private conversation with the staff impossible. I was told it was because their area behind the glass was air conditioned, but it certainly leaves one with the feeling you are in a rather unsavory neighborhood. The Eggs n' things Restaurant has a perennial lineup of Japanese tourists (apparently it is featured in some popular tourist brochure there); in addition to adding to the noise and unwanted bustle of the hotel, makes it impossible to walk down and get a quick bite to eat.The hotel was probably something to behold in its heyday back in the 1950's but it is well past it's best before. Having paid $200 per night in Waikiki, I didn't expect luxury; but I certainly expected something better.

We stayed at this hotel for one night on our first night in Hawaii. The location is great, right across the street from the beach and on the Main Street of Oahu. The rooms are average, and the balcony is tiny, but can't really complain for the price. I would recommend this hotel if your looking for a good view and want to be on Waikiki beach. If you plan to have breakfast downstairs at "eggs n things" make sure you get there early as the queues in the morning are huge!

If location and price is all that matters, this is a hotel for you. The beach was right across the street. The water had an area enclosed by a seawall which made it swimmable even for young children. There was a free Torch Lighting and Hula show at the beach almost every other day. Right at the hotel was also the popular restaurant, Eggs N Things, which always had a long queue. While the building façade looks quite dated, the rooms are newly and nicely refurbished. The downside is that their standard rooms are really tight especially for our family (with two children). Closet spaces were small and with our bulky luggage lying on the floor, there was hardly any room to walk around. If you do not mind sacrificing a little comfort because of space constraints, the hotel comes highly recommended.

We stayed here during January '13 and found it to be ok for what we needed after touring for 4 weeks on the mainland US. Beds are comfortable but a little small and rooms are very tight if you have a family of 4 like myself. Being on the main strip opposite waikiki was very handy for the beach and shops but it can be a little noisy at night as the glass doors aren't insulated. Rooms looked recently renovated and were very clean and the housekeeping did a great job every day. There is no reception area such as with most hotels as the office is outside next door to an 'eggs and things' outlet but still undercover. There is no pool or laundry facilities which isn't a great problem for most visitors. Also the a/c is a wall unit which is very noisy and impossible to set at a comfortable temperature. If you are just looking for a cheap, clean room opposite the beach and don't want the fancy things then this is the one for you.

We enjoyed our 5 day stay ending 1/14/13. Cute, clean rooms and friendly staff. Very well situated in Waikiki with fantastic views from our 13th Floor ocean front room. Not much more $ for Ocean Front...and well worth it! Great room for couple...but, might be tight with children. No lobby or pool...but, so easy to get in and out to the main Street below and beach across the St.No restaurant...but, Mc Donalds right downstairs for quick breakfast/coffee. Plenty of fancy breakfasts nearby if that's what you want. I would definately return to Circle on my next trip to Waikiki.

Reading through many reviews on tripadvisor, I find that our American cousins appear to expect much more from a hotel room and overall service than we Brits do. From a British point of view (party of four adults), we have travelled half way round the world to be in Hawaii, we want to see what it has to offer. Eating out prices are what you want them to be but always much cheaper than UK equivalents. Hawaiian market area gets you some good value.The Hotel... is functional with no frills, but as with most holidays to the US from the UK are room only, that is what you get a room. The hotel has no bar or restaurant, but there are plenty of bars and restaurants in the surrounding area. The Rooms... Some doubles some twin queens (our party had one of each) The rooms are not the largest I have ever been in and nor are they the smallest. There is adequate space for two adults and there holiday luggage (3 weeks worth in our case). The rooms are ok to relax in with TV but are not suites, but then why do you want one, your on Oahu how long do you want to spend in your room ? A note of caution, Sea Facing rooms have a view to die for, beware of rear facing rooms with the bin store and view of a car park.The Staff, the only staff you will come into contact with are the knowledgeable reception staff and possibly the very efficient cleaning staff. As the hotel does not have any other services it does not need them. The Extras, there is a store where left behind beach toys (boards etc) are available from. IF you are just "playing" on the beach then it saves purchasing.The Location... Slap bang opposite Waikiki beach. Close to everything Honolulu has to offer. Restaurants and bars galore. No need for a car here, public transport to Pearl Harbour is easy, but guided tours are available close by. Recommend Dukes and Cheesecake factory to eat or Cheeseburger in paradise (turn left out of hotel, 1 block down) or Dennys are good for breakfast. Coffee from ABC stores or McDonalds, all within 25 yards of hotel.This is not a luxury hotel, but it was good enough to say it is functional, If we had gone to a more up market hotel I do not think we would have got value from the hotel as we would not have been in the place enough to get it. You don't travel halfway round the world to look at a hotel room do you ?

I was warned rooms were very small! They were, but not too bad. Bed was so comfortable! Just over the road from the beach it was a wonderful position and I didnt have to walk too far to go anywhere. A big bonus when one is getting on in years! Staff were not very friendly at first. But next day when I praised the hotel they were a little friendlier. If they are overworked and tired when new guests arrive they should address this, as it gave the wrong impression. A smile and a friendly greeting goes a long way! It was full occupancy but all was quiet which was good. No pool is necessary with Waikiki beach over the road! Room was very clean and bathroom too. Never saw staff come to my room so dont know how to rate them. I would be happy to stay there again. There is a breakfast restaurant at the entrance but huge crowds waiting deterred me Is it part of hotel? Luckily Maccas was next door!

We spent 3 nights in this hotel. This is good hotel, definitely not 5 stars; I’m surprised that it has been rated that high. However, if location is your priority you could rate this hotel as 6 stars. Location is superb - right across the street from Waikiki Beach and in the center of everything. Another very positive thing - the view from the balcony is just simply splendid. Room was small, but since we did not spend much time in the room it was not a problem. Bathroom was small as well, with really narrow shower cabin. Even though hotel has parking, sometime it’s full to capacity and guests asked to park in another parking located couple of blocks from the hotel; not a big deal, merely a small inconvenience. There is breakfast place that is not entirely belong to the hotel, but located right next to hotel’s front desk. However we did not have a chance to eat there; lines were really long. I was wondering what exactly they are serving for breakfast to deserve such long lines, but had no chance to get an answer. Would we stay in this hotel next time – probably “yes” since location is worthwhile to overlook all other small inconveniences.

This retro hotel is right across the street from Waikiki Beach, making this a prime location. The hotel rooms have been updated but the hotel has no amenities, save complimentary beach towels and chairs. There is no pool and it was impossible to eat at the restaurant due to the constant line. The rooms are small, but the space is used well. The rooms are difficult with kids or with more than two adults per room. If you want to be right in the middle of the action, but don't plan to spend much time in your room, this is the hotel for you.

Let's start with: this is not a 5 star hotel! You pay a lot more for one of those. We were only here one night prior to boarding the cruise ship. We got to be on the top (14th) floor which was great! The hotel is built in a semi circle which maximizes the ability of everyone to have a little ocean view. For our room you did have to go to the balcony to see the ocean.The rooms are small- but adequate because-really- who spends a lot of time in the room while in Hawaii! We loved being so close to the beach and the shopping. It's a pretty part of Waikiki. There are a few maintenance issues that kept me from giving it a 5 star- the lights at our bedside table didn't work! And the mini fridge didn't get cold. I would have called if we were going to be there longer. Otherwise would book here again.

We had one night at this hotel on arrival into waikiki prior to leaving for the north shore the following day. Check-in at the hotel was smooth no problems, fast, friendly.Rooms were small - we booked a partial ocean view and that's exactly what it was. Could see the water from the balcony however also looked directly into the air con vents of the hotel next door. The cleanliness of the rooms was excellent as were all hotel amenities. Would recommend this hotel for people who want to be located near the beach centrally located and on a budget. Parking was very limited at the hotel and we had to park at their sister property banyan tree which was about a 10 minute walk however reasonably priced so not a problem for us.

Perfect location in the centre of Waikiki beach road with good access to shops, restaurants etc. Eggs n things below the hotel is just amazing if you love omelettes(beware of long queues...take a to go to save time). Rooms are of decent size with all basic amenities though i felt shower place could be a little bigger. Considering its Waikiki and the location i would still stay a perfect place to stay if just need hotel for sleeping over in the night!

Our room was clean and spacious, at least for the european standards. Hotel personnel were helpful. The only disappointment is that we discover they charge a "mandatory amenity fee" of 10 USD per night to use the DVD, safe and Internet, so add 10 bucks per night during planning phase. High rooms located on high floors tend to be noisy in case of wind. I would anyhow reccomend it.

We stayed here for a week over Christmas and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. I did'nt mind the 'drive thru' type lobby style at all although it did make communication a bit difficult. The rooms are smallish but not overly so , and they have all you need ;fridge ,safe , tv ,closet, coffee-maker etc. Any qualms about the room however are completely nullified by the location and view from the balcony. We stayed in room 305 [only the '05' rooms are fully water frontage] and , whilst a little miffed we did'nt get a higher floor as we booked 7 months in advance , virtually ALL our time in the room was spent soaking in the rays and the view.My only real negatives about the hotel is the daily $10 Vegas style 'resort fee' that is charged that covers things like Playstation , DVD rentals and such - things that are fine for a family but un-used and un-touched by your typical couple - it just seemed like a blatant money grab. Also the shower is tiny and if you don't be precisely careful how you arrange the shower curtain - you will end up water all over the bathroom floor.If price is a concern yet you still want LOCATION and OCEAN-FRONT views then you will un-likely find any better than the Aston Waikiki Circle and we will almost certainly [barring a lottery win] stay here on our next trip.

My wife and I booked this hotel for our first trip to Honolulu as we wanted to be right on the beach, but also didn't have the budget for the Outrigger style hotels. This hotel is right in the middle of the action, we found the location to be perfect as most tourist attractions pick up at the corner right next door. The reception desk is a drive thru window style setup right before the elevator. The room had an awkward layout, no doubt due to the circular design of the building. They don't offer single bed rooms, so we had a double bed room which made the room feel cramped as walking space was limited. The bathroom was small and the shower doesn't give you hardly any room to move. They do have a refrigerator in the room as well as a desk and closet area. There is a TV and PS2 gaming system which can be used to play the games or DVDs which can be checked out at the reception desk. WiFi is a little spotty, but free none the less. They do not have microwaves in the rooms, this was something that I didn't expect. I have never had to look at the amenities listed on a hotel website to verify that a microwave is available, but I will start now... Since there was no microwave you had to basically eat out every meal or eat chilled products. The halls and elevators are not climate controlled and seem musky and hot at all times.Summary:Decent price for a decent hotel. Read through the hotel website and make sure that they have all the things you want. We were disappointed to find no microwave, but checked the website to find that was our fault as one was not listed. Location is good, but rooms are small and provide an awkward layout. The beds were average as well, they weren't the worst beds, but they weren't bad either. Housekeeping is incredible, they come by at all hours of the day to clean, if you end up sleeping until 2pm, that is fine, just drop the door hanger out that says cleaning needed whenever you go out and they normally will have finished within an hour or two.

I am a travel nanny so I was on business with a client and their hotel next door Aston Waikiki Tower which is gorgeous was booked so I was given a room here as it is right next door. I really not sure why what I experienced makes me feel that this place barely rates an average when so many seem to like it. When I priced it for our time frame it was averaging $145 a night for a city view and about $180 for an ocean view. May others got such a great deal that this place was okay.Pros: Great Location. Yes it is a noisy busy tourisy part of Waikiki but it is nice to walk out and just be where all the action is in the am or evening.Very nice staff and housekeeping. Reception does remind you of a drive thru window but the folks are nice and helpful.Cons: Rooms are very small. The city view room I had looked over the air conditioners and faced the hotel behind me. You felt you had to keep your curtains closed and that made the room very dark as the lights are not bright. Granted, it is a circle hotel so that wedge room doesn't allow much room for walking.Pros: Saving grace on this small room is there is this tiny little L shape at the end where there is a desk so you can set up your computer. If you can use cable plug for your computer, it is free.Cons: Noisy area and the wind was something else the two days there. My breeze door literally rattled so much at night I was afraid it would fall off! Even if you didn't want the air conditioner on, you had to have it on to drown out the noise.I can handle small bathrooms, no problem. But the tub would not hold water and I bathe the kids in my room sometimes and we had to stuff wash clothes around the drain to hold water.I rate it average because of the location. Bed comfort is okay but pillows were lumpy and uncomfortable but then I have a thing for needing decent pillows. For a lot of folks this is minor.I am coming back to Honolulu with my husband in February and when trying to find a budget but decent hotel, when this one would come up on the sites, the price was usually around $145 and to be honest, not worth it to me. Maybe the ocean rooms would be brighter and more appealing but not for the price offered,.I feel like I am the only one here that felt it was like a Motel 6! Despite the great location, I really would not choose to stay here by choice.

My friend and i are in our early 20's, and we chose to stay at the hotel as we were looking for a hotel stay on a budget and this was recommended to us by an older couple. When i initially got to the hotel i freaked out a little bit because the hotel "lobby" is nothing more than a desk enclosed with security screening in an otherwise open/outdoor area. We arrived early and they gave us the option of taking a room on the third floor, or come back later and go on the tenth (both city view). We chose the latter based on trip advisor views, and we were glad about this decision. We stayed for two weeks and during this time we found the staff lovely and extremely accommodating, especially given we were probably a little bit noisier than the older couples that make up their usual clientele. Of particular mention is our maid, and also the night watchman (an iranian man). Sorry i cannot remember either of your names!In terms of the room i loved the colourful atmosphere and compared to other hotels "standard rooms" I found the room to be quite reasonably sized, and my friend and i were never pressed for room. I can see how it might be difficult though if you had more than one child, or anyone older than pre-school age.The only downside of the hotel is probably the size of the shower and the low water pressure. The air conditioner i found to be not too noisy, and it was incredibly efficient meaning we rarely had to have it on. As for the lack of the lobby/porter/pool: you get what you pay for. Don't expect such luxuries for such a cheap price (it cost us $1800 for two weeks). Besides, with the beach literally across the road you don't need a pool.I have also stayed with my family at the sheraton princess kaiulani before, and i can assure you these rooms were a lot nicer and cleaner, beds a lot more comfy, and the air-conditioning a lot more efficient.Would i go back to the circle again? Absolutely. Would i recommend it to others? Book now!

First impressions are lasting impressions... service provided by Naomi at front desk was flawless followed by John and Guy who also served me. This Hotel welcomes you with Hawaiian warmth and a sense of family. Location, Location and a hop and a skip to the beach, transport is literally at your doorstep,,, not to mention ABC stores.. blink they are everywhere! The rooms are smallish but i was really never in my room but to sleep, shower and drop my bags and bags of shopping. Housekeeping was efficient and i felt safe at all times staying there. The decor of the rooms were clean and made you feel at home. Lets talk views... i had Partial Sea views and was in awe of the ocean and the city views. I loved my stay at the Circle and my 50 th Birthday in Hawaii was MAGICAL. Mahalo!

The location of this hotel it absolutely perfect. You are close to all the shops, night life restaurants and beach. The rooms were clean and functional. The hotel staff were always very helpful and friendly. I'd definitely stay here again.
