The room was very clean, smelled fresh, the beds were nice, pillows a little flat and hard but other than that not bad. Balcony looking at Waikiki beach, desk and chair, wifi, flat screen t.v, refrigerator, safe. The room was small but bright colors and amenities didn't make it seem too small. A bit noisy at night, being right on Kalakaua Blvd. but great location. Close to good restaurants and shopping. Restaurant in the lobby, ABC next door. Nice, friendly staff. Parking is limited. I'd stay again

We stayed at Waikiki Circle for 4 nights in july 2012. Our room was on the seventh floor and had a partial seaview over Waikiki beach. The room was very small but nice, the bathroom was newly renovated I think. We didn't spend so much time at the hotel but they have a nice free movie/games-rental services if you like to spend the time inside. Each room have a playstation! =)The location is perfect since you just go right outside and cross the street to get to the crowed Waikiki beach. Right next to the hotel you have Eggs n things and each day the line is loooong to get breakfast/lunch/dinner there. Hotel guests have a discount.The staff was friendly and guests can borrow beach towels each day. To the right of the elevators you have a tourist agency that helped us book a helicopter trip over Oahu.

My daughter and I stayed at the Aston Circle the week of Thanksgiving. The view from the balcony was amazing!! It is a great location - close to the beach, shopping, restaurants! I would definitely stay there again. The location and price make it the perfect choice!

Though the room was small, it was comfortable and not claustrophobic. Beds were nice, pillows a bit hard and thin. Shower only, no tub. Balcony was nice, view of Waikiki Beach across the street. Nice size flat screen t.v. bright colorful decor. Desk, refrigeraton and safe included. Ther is a $10.00 resort fee per day and a $15.00 parking fee. Ice is downstairs. I liked the room, was convenient to good restaurants, shopping and the beach. A bit noisy at night from Kalakaua Ave but I'd stay there again. Good value.

This is one funky establishment! If you want something that combines retro architecture with old school rooms and a view of the Pacific that will make you see new shades of blue and turquoise that heretofore you have never witnessed, this is your one-stop time machine. The only thing that's missing here are Ozzie and Harriet. Oh, by the way, the price is old school as well; such a deal!Rooms are just as you see them in the traveler photos...small, quirky, and with a shower that is okay for little people such as my wife and myself, but a nightmare for offensive linemen and amazons. The front desk people were very friendly and helpful with everything and will bend their palm trees over backwards to help you with directions, restaurant suggestions, and just about any of the 'ins and outs' of Waikiki.Many of the Waikiki Circle reviews talk about the location; it is spectacular. I cannot even fathom that there is a place that is more appropriately placed within a five minute walk of just about anything that matters. (I chuckle when I see the reviews about the Aston Waikiki Circle being close to an ABC Store....what isn't? Throw a rock in the air with your eyes closed and you will hit an ABC Store. They are everywhere!).First trip to Waikiki? Want an ocean view? On a budget? This is the place.

Aston Circle was good value for money .. we stayed at a different hotel the 1st week of our hawaiian trip and then checked into Aston Circle. We have passed the hotel and didnt think much about the front lobby and the big queue at the restaurant in front . We hoped it would be as good and the Circle didnt disappoint. True, the room was small but you are out for most of the day either at the beach or doing some other activity at another part of the island. It was clean and that was a big plus for me. We booked the ocean view and it was amazing and relaxing just checking out the waves in the morning to sitting on the balcony come 5pm to enjoy the sunset. I would stay at the Circle again.

My family and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel Nov 12 - 24, 2012. Check in was easy & quick. Staff where always friendly, helpful & doing their job well. We shared a small room with 2 beds. We travelled with our two small children. One the negative side our room was very tiny - located on the side of the hotel, 3rd floor. We were above the garbage bins. I found it loud in the morning. A few times the crashing sound of the garbage truck would wake me up. Our toilet backed up 3 times for no apparent reason. Each time they would quickly fix the issue. The shower was very small and designed in a odd shape. This made showing the children annoying. My husband is 5'11 and his feet hung off the edge of the bed, so while they seemed like "full" beds I think they were a bit on the small side. The air con was very old and loud. Next time we are trying another hotel. All in all its a 3 star with a great location.

This is my honest review on this hotel,this hotel is right on the main road across from the beach no shuttle buses drop you off in the driveway only on the main road outside the hotel,this is what our driver told us.watch out for the traffic when you get off the shuttle the main door is on the right hand side so we had to hop out into the traffic oh by the way to bad if you got little ones we had to guard our ones with our lives just to get them to safety on the side of the road where our bags were dumped as the public walked through them and around them.so to the check in we are a family of 6 we paid for 2adjoining rooms city view only to be told we had been split up and to boot put on separate floors when we explained what we had paid for the lovely gentleman behind the counter said the hotel does not have adjoining rooms but we can put you on the same floor only one room will be city view and the other room ocean view thats all they had available at the time and that we had to pay an extra $15 per night for the ocean view room.ok now the rooms my room was the city view room when I opened the door I was shocked I couldn't believe how small the room was you literally open the door and there's the bed the bench top that the tv was sitting wasn't wiped down you could see cup rings left behind from the last lot of people I went straight to the sliding door opened it our balcony was on top of the roof we were greeted with cigarette butts a paper coffee. Cup and a sock strewn outside.as for the bathroom 2people can't be in it at the same time you have to do the shimmy if there was 2of you in there it's soooo small,the shower box is so small it's roughly the same width as the toilet in a aeroplane or I couldn't even stretch my arms out to my side it's that pokey,this room is so small personally myself its only good for a couple not a family,i did ask if I could get a refund at reception so we could move on but it would of been a lengthy process....staff were friendly even the lady working behind the activities counter who was using a handheld mirror and tweezers To pluck her eyebrows when I was there to purchase tickets was very helpful......just saying...so to ask if I'd return to this hotel ....no I will not return.

Older Waikiki hotel with circular motif. Layout is unusual as hotel doesn't have a lobby. Chech in is done with a person sitting in a small booth behind bullet proof glass. Our experience started badly when we were told that our reservation was for two days earlier. I showed the clerk the receipt from Hotwire on my phone (w/ today's date), however this wasn't accepted. I placed a call to Hotwire and the hotel reluctantly acknowledged the reservation. The rooms, beds and bathrooms are small. There are small balconies and a large sliding glass door, but there isn't any privacy because of so many adjacent condos and hotels. The rooms were clean and included the basics. Service wasn't that great. For example, I phoned the front desk to ask for the Internet password and was told I had to come downstairs to get it. There is a lot of noise around this hotel. You will pay a "resort fee" to stay here, in addition to the room charges and taxes. When I asked about this, I was told it covered things like Internet. I don't see any association between a resort and Internet access. This hotel doesn't offer any services I would associate with a resort.

I booked this place to stay for 6 nights in October 2012. I had read the positive reviews and thought that it would be a great budget place to stay in with my boyfriend. This place is more suited to backpackers or similiar. The hotel location is great.. right infront of the beach. The reception & lifts smell like eggs because there is a place called 'eggs & things' next door :( Our room was extremely small and there was just the 2 of us. The bathroom & shower is really really small. The airconditioner is SO loud. The beds & pillows were lumpy and uncomfortable. My boyfriend is 5'11 and his feet were hanging off the end of the bed! We laugh about it now but it was not good at the time. If your staying in Hawaii, stay somewhere really nice! We stayed at the Hyatt last year and we wanted to save money this year so we stayed here at the Aston but decided it is not worth it, just pay the additional $70 per night for a nicer room!! Oh and watch out for the $10 per night 'amenity fee'

Older, smaller hotel, simple rooms, but clean and well-appointed rooms in a fabulous fabulous fabulous location. Many with a beach view! Good for families.Older, smaller hotel, simple rooms, but clean and well-appointed rooms in a fabulous fabulous fabulous location. Many with a beach view! Good for families.

Very convenient location but our room was so noisy even with the doors shut and curtains drawn. The problem was the constant drone of airconditioning units, the traffic pretty much cleared by late evening. Would be easily solved with double glazing or even a door which closed fully.The rooms are small but not an issue for us, the ocean views were outstanding. The noise....... if you dont like noise then look for someother place (sure it may be quieter on the other side of the building) I also wasnt a fan of disposable coffee cups!

Good accommadation for what we were looking for which was close to beach ,walking distance to everything and with a balcony. Got all of these and a good view onto the ocean from our partial ocean view room.Everything clean and tidy and operational and within expectation. Staff were excellent when required and they went extra mile on departure day which we appreciated.Only downside was room located on 2 nd floor (206 ) and sat above where dumpsters were and staff used area as a smoko area , got a bit noisy at times for short periods and once had a garbage odour wafting up for a short period. Minor stuff really and relative to what you pay. If you want 5 star then book 5 star anything else go in with the apporiate expectation. Would stay again but on floors higher up.

If you are looking for the spa and the mini bar do not bother with this hotel.......but if you are looking for a place to sleep well and leave your luggage then this is it!! The room was clean and everything you needed. The location was perfect across the street was the beach and up and the street was very nice restaurants to McDonalds. Shopping was every where and the street entertainment was the best!!.

Having spent a week in Kauai prior to flying to Oahu we were looking to stay somewhere right in the heart of Waikiki. The Aston Waikiki Circle’s location certainly did not disappoint and the bustle of the city was a welcome contrast to the natural beauty and unpopulated charms of Kauai.Located directly opposite the world famous beach, the location is spot on and it’s an easy walk along Kalakaua Avenue or a block back to Kuhio Avenue for all of the shops, bars and restaurants you could ever need.We utilised the parking lot underneath the hotel for half of our stay and it was priced reasonably compared to other parking in Waikiki and a welcome and convenient option for guests with a car.The hotel is a quirky building, as the name suggests it is circular in shape with the rooms spread out in a fan formation from the central elevator shaft. Our room was comfortable and well equipped, the house-keeping staff were polite and did a great job of keeping the hotel and our room in good shape.We were unlucky with our room, it was on the first floor and at the rear of the building, located just above the rear entry and garbage area for the restaurant ‘Eggs N’ Things’ located below the hotel. It could get a little noisy because of this but it wasn’t overly intrusive and i’d imagine due to the layout it would be one of very few rooms in the hotel that had any such inconveniences. If you’re choosing your room, i’d certainly recommend going for a higher floor even if you don’t pay the extra for a full ocean view.The only real issue we had was the $10 a day compulsory resort fee, an unfortunate additional ‘tax’ on what is otherwise a well priced hotel - For this you get wifi, a daily paper and dvd rental, none of which were of any real interest to ourselves. Whilst I realise a lot of people cannot live without wifi, for us a vacation to a paradise like Hawaii is a nice excuse to escape the constant connectivity of life at home so it would have been nice not to have been forced to pay for this along with the unused dvd rental and daily paper.As mentioned the restaurant Eggs N’ Things is just below the hotel at street level and you’re entitled to 10% off as a guest of the Circle. There are often queues for this famous diner down the boulevard and I would certainly recommend it for cheap and decent quality food. The menu has Hawaiian favourites such as Loco Moco as well as Omelettes of all varieties and plenty of other options. Well worth a look. To summarise, if you’re looking for a well priced and quirky hotel with a beach front location right in the heart of Waikiki then the Circle really is an excellent option.

I just stayed at this hotel on vacation and it was great! Very charming and the price can't be beat. Excellent view and having your own private balcony is amazing. The room was very clean and the beds were comfy. The showers are on the small side, but it is all about location, location, location. Walk right out of the hotel and onto the beach! We kind of liked the fact that it was on the smaller side because it made us feel more at home. We would stay here again and highly recommend it.

What a great time, checked in at 11:30am when room was ready no waiting the staff was great thanks Jan and John. Super room super clean. The room was perfect size for the wife and I, Great views of the ocean and Waikiki halloween and one last thing never had problem with parking!!!

We stayed in June 2011. We had an excellent stay. The hotel price was amazing. Right on the beach, walk to everything. Very very clean, staff were very helpful. Rooms are not large but why go to Hawaii if all your going to do is stay in the room. I would recommend to couples. Not great for children there is not enough room for a cot or space for them to play within the room. We have stayed at expensive places in Hawaii and here and I recommend this place every time. Its half the price of other ocean front locations.

We stayed here for 10 nights, ocean view room, my wife and 20 year old daughter. We got there early, rooms ready we got straight in, open the door and went ok, looked about as big as our 20ft caravan, but after unpacking and checking everything out we all looked at each other and all agreed this place was all right. Bathroom small, but was spotless, Room was squeaky clean had everything you need, and the view was fantastic.Location is the best, first time in Hawaii but would stay here again. Rooms are made up early and the cleaning lady's did first class job, no pool but you know that, beach is just across road, food is everywhere, public transport is just in front,Tour booking downstairs. Eggs and things down stairs, never went, but Asians love the place, but if you can't find anything to eat within 5 min walk, that you would go back to again, and again, you must be a pain in the bum. Did hear other people say it was small, but your not there to sit in room all day, beds good, a/c a bit noisy but not big problem.Great value for money, I would say go for it, you'll have the best time, we stayed 5 nights at bellagio before this so had good idea about rooms, have been to 5 stars through out Asia, the Circle is fine

I agree with previous poster want to say "stay away" so I won't have any problems booking here again. I Love this little boutique hotel. Yes, if you are looking for some huge room, this ain't it - but more than adequate for 2 people. And yes, if you have ever done any cruising the rooms seems absolutely spacious. Well-thought out and loved the layout and design touches. Felt like I was Judy Jetson and had been transformed back to my childhood. We were only in HNL for 3 nights after a week in Maui and knew that we wanted an oceanfront, so it was well worth the splurge. We were all the way top floor, direct oceanfront, absoluely fantastic views. Front desk very friendly, maid service, prompt, efficient and good. Loved the fact that even though a small bathroom, that someone had the forethought to provide 3 good, really sturdy hooks in the bathroom. We have stayed next door in the large beach tower condo complex and that is great for a long stay if you want a full kitchen, etc. But the location, pricing of this hotel cannot be beat. I was hesitant initially with some of the reviews I read, but don't be this place is adorable and I have travelled all over the world. It was a fun and convenient place to stay. I do think there is one caveat that you need to be on a higher floor to avoid the street noises. So definitely request a room up a ways if at all possible.

We are from Australia and stayed at the Waikiki Circle Hotel for five days in October. I honestly can say we absolutely loved the position and we found the room to be super clean and quite quirky compared to all the other square rooms in Waikiki. Other reviews say the rooms are small but we found it to be big enough for us. You certainly aren't paying premium Waikiki beach front prices so I couldn't complain. When we arrived after an all night flight with no sleep at all about 9am we asked for an upgrade to Ocean Front Room from a Partial Ocean Front Room and they put us straight in on the 7th Floor and for only an extra $25 per night. Definitely go the Ocean Front if you can as the views are just amazing. We slept like logs as the beds were very comfortable and if there was any street noise we definitely didn't notice it. The lifts (elevators) were amazingly fast so never had to wait long. We knew there was no pool here when we booked but you certainly don't need it as you have your own little ocean front pool out the front that was just amazing. If you don't want to pay the earth and want amazing views and beautiful sunsets from your balcony and close to everything in Waikiki then this is the hotel for you.

We stayed at the circle in September 2012 for 5 days before our cruise. We have 3 boys aged 12, 9 and 2. This location was booked for us based on price and location.Good Points:Excellent LocationClean and Tidy HotelGreat views from high floors.Cheap price.Not So Good Points:No Porters (we travelled from Aus with 3 boys and were going on a 2 week cruise so we had heaps of luggage) It took me 4 trips up and down the elevator in 30 degree heat with 3 hours sleep from our flight from Sydney with a screaming 2 year old. Get the point.........Rooms were way too small - no room for luggage. Bathroom way too small - could not bend over in shower and I am avg height and build.Air conditioner sounded like it ran on diesel - effective but noisy.Verandah was old and tacky - did not satisfy us either as far as safety is concerned so the kids were not allowed out. Railing was rusty with large gaps between rail and wall.No breakfast options so you had to roam the streets or go to McDonads for Breakfast. This is a pain when you have 3 hungry boys every morning.We will definitely go back to Waikiki as we loved our trip howeve we will book our own hotel with larger rooms, porters and a breakfast option.I guess this Hotel was OK and you certainly get what you pay for however for us and our children it was not suitable.If you have more than 2 children and they are young I would recommend another hotel with a breakfast option as every restaurant along the main strip will have a line up of Japanese tourists from as early as 6.00am.

we booked this hotel for our honeymoon and we wasnt disappointed at all, we asked for a ocean front ans we got room 1005,,,, wow amazing !!!! the view was spectacular.The room although people complained its small, it was certainly big enough for 2 of us.There was adequate hanging space plenty of drawers too.The room was cleaned every day fresh coffee and clean towels provided too.I couldnt find a bad thing to say about this hotel and we are deffinatly going backloved it !!!!!

Stayed here last month on our honeymoon. We booked an Ocean View Room and it did not disappoint. The view was breathtaking from our level 11 room. Although the room was small, it had everything you needed in a room. Eggs n Things was located downstairs, but didn't get to eat there, as the queue was long all the time. No need to worry, as everything else was within walking distance including McDonald's, ABC store and the beach being just footsteps away.There was a DVD rental down at the lobby, which we used twice and was great if you want to have a quiet night after dinner.The staff were friendly and helpful, and we would stay here again.

My husband,15 year old son and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel for 11 nights in September 2012. Our flight from Australia landed at 7am and when we arrived - extremely tired due to crying babies on our flight we were amazed that we could go directly to our room as it was ready, and on the 14th floor - ocean front might I add. We originally thought bookin time would be around 2pm. Our fellow passengers staying in other hotels had to wait unitl the afternoon to book in. I cannot understand all the complaints from some of the reviews. Prior to seeing our room I was concerned about the room size and shower. We are a tall family but didnt find the space any problem at all. I found there was enough room for our luggage and all that we required. The glass front window was no problem at all. The staff were very helpful and friendly along with Judith from the tours booth. We had access to everything we wanted and met some of the most down to earth and friendly people you would wish to meet. Many others had stayed at the "fancier hotels" but would now stay at the Circle. Our room had all that we needed and the "double" beds were very comfy. Our Wifi worked well and we used the safe. I dont have a complaint about the $10 per day resort fee as it is now a general charge through out Waikiki. We used public transport or walked and didnt see the carpark so cannot compare. The location was just perfect, within walking distance to all you need. The laundromat is just 2 small blocks away and I found the staff there just great. We absolutely loved the Circle and would not stay anywhere else when in Waikiki.

Good: Amazing location. Right across the street from beach. Within walking distance of restaurants. Good wifi connection; works for video chats.Neutral: Basic room, but has amenities (i.e. mini fridge).Negative: The front desk with the glass separator feels unfriendly, like you're at a high security bank or something.

Well as most all the other reviews note..the room is definately small. My 75 year old mom and I stayed for 5 nights. She used a walker (liken to size of kids stroller)..sometimes it was a challenge to dance around it..but I have to say everything in the room is placed so it all can fit. The closet is very room for luggage storage. The safe is old fashioned with a lock and key. Paper at your door each day...although I did not read it. I wasn't able to get the free wifi to work on any of my devices. The front desk staff gave me a number of the internet provider. I didn't take the time to check into it. As all the other reviews state..the desk staff was very very helpful and polite. The lobby was a little different in that it was open air..and seemed more of a "ticket booth" atmosphere when you approach. There is a computer kiosk in the "lobby" that you can use for a fee, however it is free to print your boarding pass for flights out.I had read in the reviews how small the rooms and bathroom were..so was prepared for the size of shower. Biggest complaint was the cloth shower curtain was not long enough and if I didn't make sure the bathmat was placed right against the shower stall edge..it would flood the bathroom floor. Water temp and pressure was good, towels plentiful. When I requested additional face cloths the first night, maid remember to bring each day there. We rented a car and parked just one night. It was an additional $15 fee. Parking very tight..had to have help in backing out with a "spotter". When we first arrived we were placed only on the fifth floor with a partial ocean view (what we reserved)..not caring to look at McDonald's room..we upgraded to ocean view..and got room 1005..it was fantastic! Many reviews indicate that the air conditioning was noisey..I didn't notice. I also didn't notice the noise from the restaurant (which was always busy). I DID notice the traffic noise..ambulances ect. Beds were a little on soft side, linens were clean, new, plentiful and three pillows offered for each bed. Two elevators serviced the whole hotel..and we never had to wait long. I did see the bin that offered free use of beach toys (blow up rings..floats..ect) but did not utilize this..also I didn't utilize the free beach towels. No vending machines in the hotel..ice is retrieved from the front desk. Note to those with mobility issues. There are about 15 steps to climb from street level to get to lobby area. A sloping driveway is available..but feels kind of steep after a day of walking and sight seeing. there is a Mobility lift on the stairway, however my mom never used it.The convenience to everything in the immediate area is fabulous! The McDonalds is half a block (breakfast averages $15 for two combo meals)..the ABC store is a half block the other way. Waikiki beach just across the street..and its never a difficult time to cross, as light and cross walk are right in front of McDonalds.

great hotel ,the location spot on across frm the beach ,we had a front ocean view room and its a must.The staff very friendly and helpful,room clean bathroom clean and good supply of towels.The only downsides are noisy aircon,when they delivere the news papers at 3am they chuck them at your door onto the floor very noisy but other wise would stay there agian and again.Yes the room is small but its has all your needs as u only sleep there as u have shopping and swimming to do.

Stayed here mainly because of the price and good reviews. The hotel is in a good location for access to the beach, shopping, and the zoo, but is far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Kalakaua Ave. Desk staff was helpful but hard to hear through the glass barrier at the front desk. The room was small and the bathroom smaller, but there was enough space for everything. As others report, the air conditioner is noisy, but it helps to drown out street noise. I was impressed by the view from the balcony despite it only being a partial ocean view room (#1107). Overall, the hotel is fine for a few nights' stay in Waikiki.

stayed here for 2 nights. Great Location, right infront of Waikiki, 2 blocks away from International Market and tons of restaurants and all the bars. There is a very busy breakfast place right underneath, as well as a mcdonalds and a ABC. Views from the room were alright, depending on where your facing (we were facing East) we had a great view of Waikiki, but also the wonderful view of the roof of mcdonalds. Not to mention you can have a nice conversation with the people staying in the hotel next to ours from the balcony. Free Wifi, and beach towels. This was just a affordable and nice place to stay for a couple nights that we had to stay in Honolulu. Pro: Location, price, view, parking (paid), cold AC.Con: LOUD(right on the busiest street, so close your patio door), I found out Mcdonalds has 5 fans on their roof that goes all night. Small rooms, reminded me of dorm rooms, but with a killer view.

Noisy air conditioner, noisy hallway, noisy street. The hotel would not let us keep our car parked past noon so we could finish our boat tour. The shower is too small. The bed is too soft because of worn springs. Our first room with ocean view #404 had an air conditioner that didn't work properly and so the room was hot. I have stayed in Motel 6's that were way better than this. Do not stay here, it ruined our stay in Waikiki.

I'm staying at the Aston Circle Waikiki hotel. I hate it. The pictures are staged, I swear. The rooms are TINY! And they are all the same. The term "full sized beds" is loosely used. They are about 6 inches wider than a standard twin. There is a musty smell. The hallways echo all the way around and the "partial ocean view" means that if you are tall enough to see over the HUGE tree, you can see the tops of the sail boats. And the fridge in our room doesn't work. AND THERE'S NO MICROWAVE! Ugh. They are so overpriced. The walls haven't been cleaned in god knows how long. This place NEEDS to be downgraded to a MOTEL, not a HOTEL!

We stopped here recently for 3 nights on a stopover to the mainland. Yes, the rooms are small, but for a 3 night stay, the Circle was great value for money. Ideal location right across the road from Waikiki Beach, and the sunset view from our balcony was five-star. The staff on the front desk also couldn't be more helpful with any query from a family of Honolulu first-timers. Highly recommended!

I was looking for a room with good value an I found it in the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel. The rooms were a little small but all I needed was to sleep there. The rooms were clean an I had a partial ocean view, which was very nice from the lanai. The location was also very good just across the street from Wiakiki beach, short disance to a laundry as well as ABC stores. The staff was very helpful as I need assistance with a couple of things and they help me take care of them. They also have a lot of amenities also. I have stayed at other Aston Hotel an this one is up there with the others. I would go back again.

At first you need to decide what sort of vacation you want to have in Oahu. If you're looking for huge fancy rooms where you will spend a lot of time, going just to Waikiki with one day trip to Pearl Harbor I think you will go somewhere else. We on the other hand wanted to take the car and travel around the island as much as possible returning to our room just for sleep and in the end spend 2 days on Waikiki beach before flying over to Kauai. For this purpose, the hotel is just perfect and the thing is, you'll pay about as much for oceanfront here as you would pay in most of the other hotels in Waikiki for city view at best. And the experience of sitting on your lanai and watching the sun set over the ocean with absolutely nothing to block your view is just unforgettable. Another plus is, that unlike many other hotels, this one is really right on the beach, just across the street.The size of the rooms seems to be an issue in many reviews here. Honestly, I think the rooms are exactly what you need for 2 people, but I wouldn't recommend it for a family with kids. The rooms are newly renovated, they're really nice looking and clean. Just look at the pictures.Now some downgrades. If you're going to rent a car, the parking is pricey everywhere in Waikiki. The hotel charges you 15 bucks/day which is approximately the average rate around. However the parking lot, which is beneath the hotel is incredibly small. It's full all the time and I strongly recommend you to reserve your parking in advance. If they're out of parking spaces they'll send you to a hotel nearby, where the rate is 10 bucks/day but it's some 10 minutes walk from this place.Another thing is the amenity fee. When you book your room, they would show you the rate per day and total for your stay including all taxes. There is just one little note, that there is 10 dollars/night amenity fee (for safe deposit box, daily newspapers free DVD rental etc.). I thought OK, it is just an option which I would decline, I'm only gonna need the safe for which I will pay extra. What a mistake!! The fee is mandatory. I wouldn't mind it at all but I think it's a dirty trick to present you some rate and then it shows up that it's actually another 10 bucks/night extra. Why don't just add it up to the rate in the beginning?To sum it up, yes, I would definitely go back again, now knowing exactly what to expect. And a little advice, ask for the room on the highest floor possible, the views of the Waikiki are just spectacular!!!

this place is in perfect location rooms are small but if only going I sleep there no problems staff friendly helpful very clean great place for the price this is my 3rd stay and I think the hotel is Bering enter each visit I will be back for another visit soon

If you want a big hotel with all the amenities then forget this one. However, if you just want somewhere clean and good value and in a great location, put this hotel on your list. There's no breakfast included, but loads of places to eat nearby, with shops up and down the road, including a good ABC almost next door. Waikiki Beach is just across the road with safe bathing areas and surfing. The rooms weren't the biggest, but more than adequate, clean, well furnished and looking recently decorated. We were in 803 and the view from the balcony was great. If you like tea, then take your own teabags - the hotel didn't have any other to offer than a few Earl Grey tea bags in reception. Parking at $15 was a bit pricey, but no doubt the location bumpes the price up a bit. Four blocks away at $12 if you want some extra exercise.

After spending 11 nts in a 150 sf cabin on a cruise ship, these rooms at 265 sf did not feel terribly small to us and the size of the shower was certainly adequate in comparison as well.We booked our ocean front room several months in advance and were given an unbelievably good early bird rate as well as the Hawaii 5-0 discount (yes you only have to be 50).We were pleasantly surprised that they had a 3rd floor room available for us at 8:30 am or we had the option to wait until the check-in time of 3pm for a higher floor. We took room 306 and though we were at the tree line, the view was still pretty darn good.This hotel is more like a seaside motel with a casual flair for independent travelers. You won't get any pampering or find the usual amenities, but you will get a very clean room, friendly service from the desk, and a spectacular location for views and access to the beach, restaurants, tours, shopping etc. at a fantastic rate. They have a rack to store surf boards at no charge, my son rented a board for 3 days for $50 total from Koa Board Sports (a block away). You can take the bus anywhere from a block up on Kuhio, where you will also find a number of restaurants at a little better prices and smaller if any lineups, especially for breakfast i.e. Denny's, Ihop. I don't know why people complain about the $10 per night amenity fee. It has to be billed separately because it does not fall under the category of "accommodation", so what's the difference if you have two lines on your bill? it's better than having 20 lines like you do with hotels that charge for each local call & movie, safe rental etc. These extras fall under the category of "incidentals", like any other business there are charged categories.Other than the a/c being a bit loud (we had ear plugs), we were perfectly happy at this hotel and sitting out on our Lanai in the morning for coffee and watching the early surfers outside was definitely worth the trade off for what a higher scale property could offer inside the room.

I really want to say "Stay away" only to be selfish and not have anyone else stay there. This is the BEST hotel in Waikiki. This is the second time we have stayed there. It is as everyone says, across the road from the beach. It doesnt have a pool. But with the Pacific ocean across the road who cares. It doesnt have a fancy restaruant but it does have Eggs and things. Why? who knows did not get near it for the line. As it is a round hotel there are different rooms for different rates. We had a city view room which as it implies faces away from the ocean. Still a partial ocean view though. Further around to the front is Partial ocean view. More ocean than city. Than around from that is Ocean view where a member of our party stayed for the extra money. The view is very good. He was on the airport side so had a great sunset view from his 13th floor balcony. Than there is the full ocean front. Facing straight onto the ocean. Only one of these on each floor. The rooms are not big but do have 2 very comforable double beds in them. Small bathroom but clean and efficent. The A/C is old but worked great. The staff i thought were great. Very friendly and helpful. I have stayed at 5 star hotels across the road and will stay at the Circle over them anytime. So much so that booked to stay again in June next year. So its a BIG YES from me.

Stayed in this hotel for 10 nights with a mate when we went to Honolulu. Overall it is a good hotel. It is very very centrally located and is within a short walk to most places that a tourist will want to go. It is directly over the road from the beach and has a number of convenience type stores very close by.The price of the hotel was competitive and for this reason you are not getting a luxury hotel. You are however getting a clean hotel with average to small sized rooms and air conditioning.Recommended for budget travellers or those who do not need all the luxury that more expensive hotels will give (which I think can sometimes take away from the experience). I would happily stay again.

I never write reviews, but this hotel was perfect for a first timer's trip to Oahu. The beds were a little small, but we weren't huge so it wasn't a problem. The location is perfect, and the price was amazing. The rooms were a little small, and didn't include an iron, but overall we would definitely stay here again!PS stay away from "Eggs n Things" the restaurant in the lobby. We saw a steady lineup out front from 7am on to late afternoon and thought it was because the food must be amazing. Honestly the worst omelet of my life.

My wife and I stayed for 11 nights in September 2012. Overall the hotel suited us ideally and gave us what we were looking for which was a clean and comfortable no frills hotel in a GREAT location. Having stayed in Waikiki the previous year at the property next door, we kind of knew what we were getting and it did not disappoint. Staying at this hotel is almost like staying at a rented condo (minus the maid service) because there are no amenities as such and you won't find a staff member unless you go looking for one. This may not be everyone's cup of tea but it suited us fine. The Hotel is located on Kalakaua Ave and is directly across the road from Kuhio Beach. This part of Waikiki beach is split into walled sections, creating in effect 3 large saltwater swimming pools. In terms of location it is perfect. Up nearer the end of the strip beside the zoo but close enough to all the busier bars, shops etc with out them being in your face. We stayed in room 1307 which was an ocean view room. Nice view out to the ocean and down Kalakaua if a little side on. (not diamond head) If booking be aware that ocean view is not ocean front and so if you want that panoramic 360 view, stump up for ocean front. Air Con was older, noisy but worked well, Lanai was spacious, bathroom was small but clean and shower was a little cramped for me.The only 2 real negatives would be: 1. each room has 2 double beds instead of a king/queen. I assume the reason for this is so a family of four can theoretically stay together. I think personally the room is way too small for anything more than 2 adults and there is no way I would be sharing the room with 3 other people, even if they were kids. Perhaps a mix of configurations would give greater flexability and allow those travelling as a couple to have a bigger bed and more floor space.2. This did not effect us as we were on a higher floor but bare this in mind: They have recently opened an Eggs n Things breakfast/brunch place in the lobby area. For those not familiar, Eggs n Things is super popular (esp with the Japansese folks) and there is literally a line/queue from 7am unitl the early afternoon. Now as I said, on the 13th floor this was no big deal for us but if you were placed in a room lower down you would be subjected to the noise and smells from the restaurant all day long. (Hvaing tried it, I have no idea what the fuss is about)All in all, the Circle is a great choice if you want no frills, clean accomodation in a beachfront location and despite not being anything special, the location itself would bring me back if I should visit Waikiki again

Just returned to Australia from Honolulu and booked this hotel based on reviews from this website. It has all been described in previous comments and it lived up to the positive reviews posted here. If you want absolute luxury stay at the Royal Hawaiian or Moana Surfrider and pay $400 + per night. If you want a value beachfront accommodation and a little extra cash to splurge elsewhere, this is the one for you. Customer service is excellent especially John and Guy on the front desk.

I have just stayed here for a week. What a hidden treasure this hotel is. We arrived and were offered a upgrade to a ocean front room for $10 and WOW what a view. The whole checkin process took less than 10 mins and we were on the beach in 20mins. The staff were always frinedly and helpful. The room was cleaned every day and fresh towels provided. We had no noise at night from outside or other rooms. Within walking distance or everything and the trolley lines in just down a two minute walk. The room was great for the two of us. Even three would be Ok or a family with two kids. I would definitely stay again, just look around and do a price comparison, we saved just on $1000 staying here. Moremoney to invest in other activites.

Stayed here two nights September 2012 before heading to rental cottage on North Shore. Originally made reservations online but then had to change dates via phone and the customer service guy was very nice. I asked about the difference between Oceanfront and Oceanview, as there was a price difference, and he said Oceanview would be fine-he was right, see the pic. Our rate was $159 per night for Sat and Sunday. There is no room service, and the in house restaurant is Eggs n Things- inexplicable line out the door all the time- I am sorry, but there is no way I am waiting in line for a hour for a $14 omelet or a waffle topped with canned whipped cream unless David Beckham is serving it with his shirt off. Pluses: Location! Right across the street from the beach for this price is unbeatable. Clean room, decorated nicely. Beautiful view from 805. Coffee maker, old-school safe with key, world's fastest elevator, lanai, mini-frig for half-n-half and snacks, thick walls- did not hear a peep from neighbors or elevator. The usual flatscreen we never turned on. Minuses: I am ok with there being two double beds, but not with both of them being the softest, most uncomfortable things I have ever slept on. If we had stayed more than two nights I would have had to sleep on the $2.99 water floaty mattress from the ABC store. If you have a bad back, beware. Even my husband, who can sleep anywhere, was hurting. Also, Waikiki is noisy. This is not the fault of the hotel but just be aware that you are in a city and you will hear a lot of street noise until the wee hours when you will finally hear the waves. I mean 3 am. The shower is the tiniest thing I have ever been in. About 2 x 3--maybe. Or 20 inches by 30. Constantly worried about losing safe key. $15 parking in tiniest garage (don't rent the full size sedan!) and $10 amenities fee- for wireless and safe, I guess. Bottom line- if you are on a budget and have a good strong back, this is the perfect place. But I have to three star it because of the truly awful beds.

We have just spent 2 weeks at the Circle and could not have picked a better hotel! For starters the location right across from the beach is great and the price compared to others with similar locations is unbeatable. Check in was alright (not the hotels fault – we had an early arrival so no rooms ready), but they got us in as soon as possible which was appreciated.Our room had amazing views, I highly recommend requesting a high level. We booked an ocean view room and it was worth it! Our room looked right down the beach to diamond head. The room was small in size but fine for 2 people (any more might get squishy). The bathroom is really small!! But it’s a small sacrifice to make for the location. Everything in the room worked fine – TV, safe, WiFi, fridge etc. The only 2 minor complaints we had was lighting (there really does need to be a main light in the room as it gets quite dark at night) and the AC is quite noisy during the night and woke us a fair few times. The room was always cleaned immaculately and the maid was one of the most fantastic people we dealt with on our trip (level 13). She was always so happy and accommodating and always offering us extra towels etc on days we didn’t get our room serviced. All the staff were great though we wouldn’t have a single complaint! They were always happy and friendly  The only restaurant is Eggs n Things at the bottom of the hotel. We didn’t eat there as the line was always ridiculously long. There are plenty of choices really close by so there is no problems getting food. We booked a few tours through the tour desk as well and the ladies there were really helpful and a pleasure to deal with.The $10 daily resort fee gets newspaper, internet, beach towels, and dvd rentals. I don’t really understand these – I’d rather the nightly rate go up personally, but it seems to be a common thing in Waikiki (and possibly the US??).Overall I would highly recommend the Circle (and already have!). Its great value for money and the staff make your stay the best they can.

This hotel has been remodeled as noted on website. Excellent location with water front worth the price. We had 11th floor and although little weak kneed we love the view. Do not expect roomy accommodations, 2 people is tight. Shower is about 2 ftx2 ft. But within walking distance of all good spots on Waikiki.Across from beach but with nothing in front of building feels like beach side. Hotel has on site restrurant but few other amenities but within the block so not a problem.

Unlike the last reviewer, We had a fantastic time at the Circle in October 2010! This was our second visit and I brought my mother for her first Hawaii vacation, and also my wife. We had requested two adjoining rooms on a high floor. This can be a tough request for any hotel, especially a smaller property. Well, they had us on the seventh floor, ocean front, two rooms right next to each other! Every interaction we had with the staff was top notch, we feel we are treated more like family here, much different then you would at any of the other mega-properties. Our rooms were exactly as the photos show! People need to start using their brains, do a little research and make intelligent choices! Every review on here says how small the rooms are, parking can be difficult, and the services are very limited! Bottom line....WE LOVE THE CIRCLE! And we are returning again this October....We cant wait!

My wife and I last stayed here 10 years ago and were sufficiently impressed to come back - and were very pleased to find that it had been recently renovated! We paid a bit extra for the Oceanfront rooms (3,4 or 5, with 4 being the best) on an upper floor, but it was well worth it. The rooms are relatively small (but still have 2 double beds, so not all that small) but well appointed and clean, and for a 180 degree view of Waikiki Beach from Diamond Head to beyond the Pink Palace, I think the room price is very cheap. The $10 daily resort fee gave us towels for the beach and free Wi-Fi, and we were very happy with that. You also receive an "Aston" discount coupon book. This time, we actually stayed for 2 lots of 2 nights each, with a week's cruise in between, and were very pleased when the Circle looked after 2 of our bags for the week we were away - without charge! The staff on the front desk were always helpful and very friendly, and always willing to go just that little bit extra, which makes your holiday memorable for all the right reasons. This is a really lovely hotel in a great central location,very convenient with outstanding views from the front rooms.

This hotel has THE WORST customer service I have ever experienced in a hotel- EVER. Hands down. EVER EVER EVER! Let me preface this by saying we stayed here in October of 2010 so things MAY have improved- I really hope they have. The circle hotel has a prime location- but when we stayed there- the photos of their hotel rooms online were not actually of their hotel. The pictures appeared to be of modest rooms, so we thought we'd try and save a few bucks. BAD IDEA!!! Upon checking into the dump of a hotel, we were shocked at how tacky and dirty the rooms were. When I called the front desk out on their photos online, they pointed to a brochure on the desk of the SAME photos, explaining that the rooms will look like that in the next couple of years when remodeling is complete. WHAT THE HECK? Deceitful marketing at the very least. We "upgraded" our rooms to an ocean view (which was really nice looking OUT), they charged us an additional $25 or so per night. I can't tell you how uncooperative the staff was and how grossly misrepresented the hotel was online. Honestly- the way it was back then was a hostel not a hotel. That would be an accurate feel for the room.

My husband and I spent a week at this hotel in late August. I booked it after doing some research and discovering the incredible room views/hotel location at very reasonable prices. We booked and I'm so happy we did. The Waikiki Circle Hotel is very cute and beachy in a fantastic location. It's right across from Waikiki beach and close to many stores and restaurants. The lobby is an open air concept which we both found fun and inviting. All our interactions with the front desk were positive. They were all very helpful and friendly. We booked an ocean front room. Thanks to the tips of fellow reviewers on here, I requested a higher floor and a queen sized bed (instead of the doubles). I honestly didn't think we would get it but we did. We were put on the 12th floor and were given the queen bed. The room was exceptionally clean and modern. It's not too big but how much space do you really need? The view was simply incredible. We had the most beautiful ocean view. Every night, we witnessed the most spectacular sunsets right on our balcony. We were both very satisfied with our stay here. The only thing we don't really get is the $10 a day resort fee. I know almost all the hotels charge it. There wasn't really anything extra we were given besides free movie rentals, but the popular ones are always out anyway. I'm not putting this on the Circle Hotel. I just don't get this fee in general. Otherwise, great stay! We'll be back.

Just got back from a two week stay at the circle. The hotel has been renovated since we were last there, they have done a great job!You can't beat the price for the ocean front rooms. We had a very happy time at this hotel.thanks to guy and naomi on the front desk.wonderful location, clean, with great beds.

We had a stop over here on way back to Australia from North America, and found it to be a good choice. Good price, excellent location and friendly helpful service.Rooms were clean and nice, though a little small, but when you stay in Hawaii you really want to be outside rather than in anyway!Staff were very nice and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

We chose this property to wind down after a hectic month of travelling, and for this purpose it was fantastic. The location was the top feature, as the service was pretty much "do it yourself", but adequate. The rooms were clean, and we spent a few hours on the balcony just watching the world go by opposite the beach. Easy walking distance from good eating places and the international market, and the public transport left just across the road. The rate was very good, and we enjoyed our stay there to the point we would return again at our first opportunity.

I'm rather late in writing this review. My granddaughter (18) and I stayed at the Waikiki Circle in June to celebrate her graduation. I chose it because of the reviews in Trip Advisor and also because we were on a fairly tight budget. I will echo all the wonderful things said by other reviewers. The location could not be beat, especially at the price we paid. Yes, it is a little noisy, but what do you expect in the middle of Waikiki? I have been there a few times before, and prefer the slower pace of Maui. But this was a first for my granddaughter, and she loved being in the middle of everything. While the rooms are not spacious, they are very adequate, especially when you don't spend much time there. The staff were friendly and even supplied us with a city bus schedule so we could travel on our own to Pearl Harbor (very easy & cheap!). We also appreciated the availability of beach chairs, umbrellas, etc. Just grab what you need, walk across the street, and there you are at the beach. I have to say that I was not too impressed with the restaurant in the building, Eggs n Things. It took a long time to get a seat and the food wasn't much to write home about. I would rather walk a block to Cheeseburger in Paradise, a much better breakfast. All in all, we had a wonderful time and I would certainly stay at the Waikiki Circle again when in Honolulu.

A nice hotel, close to everything. The beach is just across the street. Most of the rooms have a beach view. The rooms are not huge, but are clean. There is no breakfast, but there are many options around. We recommend

We stayed 1 night before a cruise and a couple nights after a cruise. The hotel is in a great location. We could walk to all the shops and restaurants. The rooms are clean and beds were comfortable. The staff were very helpful. Yes--the rooms are small--but the price was lower than most other hotels. We were very happy with our stay.

This was a weekend getaway for a friends wedding. I was a by myself so my criteria for a good hotel is pretty simple. Has to be clean and must be able to get a good night sleep which means comfortable bed and no noise. I had a partial beach view on the second floor. As for clean, it was pretty good. The room was pretty nice. Did not find dust or cobwebs. As for getting a good night sleep, for being right on the street of waikiki it was pretty quiet. Every now and then there would be a car that would need to use their horn. More noise was noticed inside the hotel when people would be talking loud passing my room to get to the elevator. So overall for me i gave this a 4 star.Now some of the nuances of this hotel. It is in a shape of a circle so my room was in a shape of a trapezoid as well as the bathroom. I would say the room would comfortably fit 2-3 people but no more. The bathroom is quite small. My elbows could touch one side to the other side of the wall in the shower when i was washing my hair. There is a balcony in each room it seemed. My room's balcony door did not actually lock. They had it different lock welded on. There is a $10 amenity fee which it seems most places charge some kind of amenity fee. So what you get with this fee; You have a playstation 2 in your hotel room which you can rent a movie or game to play for free on the first level. The only place you can get ice it at the front desk. You get beach towels at the front desk too. There is also boogie boards, beach mats and inflatable inner tubes at a first come first serve basis to use. They also have a place to store surfboard if you bring in your own, i don't know if they charge for that or not though. You get your own personal internet access which the fee covers. Also coffee maker in your room and newspaper delivered to the front of your door. There is a safe with a key. You get a mini fridge. There is a charge for parking which is $15 currently. But parking is very limited. I would say they had about 15 parking spots max. They were able to have others park at a partner hotel but it look like it was a few blocks away. I was able to get a spot so i don't know the details. You also get 10% off if you eat at Eggs n Things. I never ate there but there was always a line for breakfast/lunch, but it is also a pretty small place too. Overall it was a nice place especially for the price and being right across the beach.

My wife and I stayed here in early August for a few nights and thorougly enjoyed our stay. We had an oceanfront room and the view was nothing short of sensational.We first arrived at the hotel late at night and I have to admit I wondered why I had booked it. The front desk is behind a piece of glass and I first thought I was in the wrong area. Check in was fast and friendly however and we were in our room in no time. The room (and bathroom) is small and the air conditioner noisy but you soon get used to it. I don't know what other reviewers were talking about but we certainly had wi-fi in our room (as will as a wired connection).When we woke up in the morning and opened the curtains the beautiful unimpeded view of Waikiki beach lay in front of us. It was simply amazing! It more than makes up for the small room. You feel like you are at the beach without having to fight over a piece of sand!The room is clean and tidy and to be honest is all you need. If you want a big room stay somewhere else but be prepared to pay significantly more if you want a similar view.Location wise the hotel is directly across the road from the beach, has shops around it and is a short walk from everything in Waikiki. This visit was my 14th time to Hawaii but the first at the Waikiki Circle. It was the best location I have stayed at in Waikiki. We have no hesitations in recommending the Aston Waikiki Circle and will certainly stay there again.

Perfect for us. Spent 10 days there in April of this year. Had every thing we needed and more. Quaint & boutique style about the hotel. Amazingly friendly staff. Spotlessly clean. Looking forward to our return although this time we will spend a little more time relaxing instead of running from one fabulous venue to another.

I stayed at this hotel for three nights during a working vacation. I chose the hotel primarily due to its location as I wanted to have shopping, the beach and restaurants nearby. After reading several reviews, I opted for an oceanfront room instead of the less expensive room options. This turned out to be the highlight of my stay.In terms of overall impressions, this hotel is not the gold standard in Waikiki. The rooms are small, sparse on amenities and showing their age. The front desk sits behind a glass barrier, the parking is limited (but dirt cheap) and the only onsite restaurant has waiting lines all hours of operation. Yet despite all these issues, I would still recommend it to travelers. It is all about its excellent location and manageable size. Too many hotels in Waikiki are massive complexes placed well away from the main streets and have no self-parking options. At the Aston Circle I was able to easily come and go as I wanted without waiting for, and going bankrupt over, valet parking. But it was the view from the room that memorized me time and time again during my stay. Yes, sell the silverware and go for the oceanfront room. There are few room choices in Waikiki at this price that give you so much to see right in front of you. Almost like box seats at a concert. Remember, though, this is Waikiki and it is “on” almost around the clock so it can be noisy. Even early in the morning with delivery trucks. For single travelers, couples and small families who want to be close to everything and have minimal needs from the room, this is a good choice. I doubt I would have bothered to write a review if I hadn’t chosen the room type I did. I am avoiding making details comments about the WIFI (it works), the staff I encountered (everyone is friendly and helpful) and so on. I just can’t get the memory of the view from the room out of my head. Give the Aston Circle Waikiki a try!

Fantastic location. Stayed 4 nights including 4 July in an ocean view room. Rather windy on balcony but great view. Rooms small but ok, clean and comfortable. Would have liked wifi and thought compulsory $10 daily fee silly - should be included in room rate. However overall good value. Would stay here again.

This hotel is adorable. Literally across the street from wakiki beach. It is retro in the best way. The price is unbelievably cheap for the location. The circle design is funky and it works. The rooms are charming and spotless. Every one has a balcony. If you want a large American room, stay elsewhere and pay twice as much.

Yes, it's small and unusually shaped (a circle), but it worked for us for the four nights we stayed. The negatives are that there is no pool, small rooms, and no wifi (although you can hook your laptop up to a landline). Also, we got two beds that were too small for us to sleep together. The positives are LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION and the price. It's right on Waikiki Beach and the views from the room are spectacular! The hotel is walking distance from nearly anything you want on Waikiki, including many restaurants, souvenir shops and bus stops. TIP: If you plan to ride the buses and have an iPhone, download the free app "Da Bus". It gives up to the minute updates on where buses are and routes you can take around Oahu.

So I've stayed at the Waikiki Circle about five times now. And every time, it has been a great stay. The staff (from John to Naomi) were terrific and very helpful. The rooms can be on the smallish scale but it was clean and the location can't be beat. You are in the middle of waikiki and across the beach. they charge a new $10 amenity fee per day for Internet access (not wi-fi) and two DVD movies a day. There's an Eggs n Things Express at the lobby now. Long lines for so-so food. I'll definitely be back and stay here again.

My family and my boyfriend and I stayed here in November/December 2011. We booked the hotel due to the proximity to the beach and the great rates. There was a minor hiccup as my boyfriend arrived prior to my family and I. He apparently was not on the reservation, but the hotel was really good about it and called me at home and confirmed he was supposed to be there. After that call, all was cleared up. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and cutely decorated. We got our goldfish! I was happy to see it as we had read about it in the reviews. My only 'beef' so to speak with the rooms is that they are all two double bed rooms. I would have preferred a queen or king, but we made it work. Also, the shower is only a stall. There is no tub. But that was fine for our needs. We did have an issue with our phone however when we notified the front desk staff they promptly sent someone up to deal with it. The same when we had a problem with our shower, though the cleaning staff fixed it before we could notify anyone. The hotel couldn't be more perfectly located. Directly across the street from the beach and near to lots of tasty restaurants and shopping. We didn't use 'The Bus' this time round. However, there are many stops around Waikiki that are easily accessible. We did get a parking spot with no problems for our 3 day car rental. Something else I really liked about the hotel is that there is a faucet just on the edge of the open lobby so you can wash your sandy feet/toys before heading up to your room. We spent a great deal of time sitting out on our lanai at night and thoroughly enjoyed that. Because we were on the 13th floor the wind whipped around the building pretty good on the windier days. So be mindful of that. We very much so enjoyed our stay and would happily stay here again!

The Aston Waikiki Circle was great for what we needed. The rooms were really really small for a family of 4 but if you are organized you can get away with it. The location is awesome (just across from Waikiki beach) and the parking was great. Parking cost $15 a night (cheap for Waikiki) and you get a remote for the garage gate (arm) that you open to get in. This allowed for an easy in and out every day when we did our sightseeing without having to worry about the garage being full when we got back which was fantastic. We had a partial ocean view which meant we could sit out on the balcony which was a decent size and look out on waikiki beach. The balcony was big enough for a couple of chairs and a small table so we ate a few dinners (picked up form the International Market Place) there looking at the water and night life. We had 8 nights at the Circle then 3 nights at the Aulani and to be honest, I am glad we stayed there before the Aulani because it would be hard to adjust to the small room but it really worked out well as we had not planned on being in the room that much. We were on the 9th floor and had no problems with other buildings but we could hear some street noise but very faintly.There are really no amenities to the hotel (except for a DVD rental) so what you get is a clean bed in a small room in a fantastic location which was all we needed.

I stayed here in June/July for 2 weeks with my boyfriend and we liked the hotel very much.The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. I arrived after an overnight flight from Australia, got there around 12:30pm and the room was ready. Other people have commented how small the rooms are but we found it adequate for us. (I can understand if you had 4 people in one room it would be a bit crowded!)Clean linen and towels, comfy bed to sleep in, great location and of course a fantastic view (we were on the 12th floor so I'd definitely recommend a high room). The nicest thing was having a drink on the balcony overlooking the beach!The cleaners cleaned the rooms even if you left quite late in the day (sometimes we would leave at 12 or 1pm, and come back to find the room was cleaned)The only slight downside was the air con in our room was a bit rattly and noisy but we got used to it and it ended up being like white noise in the background while we slept. The location, being right on the beach and the main street meant if you didn't have the air con you probably would have heard all the noise of people from the street (esp as we were there over 4th of July, things were a bit loud but it didn't matter to us)If you want a 5 star hotel with all the trimmings, this is not for you.If you're looking for a no-frills, no-fuss, but clean and pleasant hotel in a central and beautiful location, this is a great choice!
I would recommend this hotel for those who want to be close to the beach and the downtown area, at an affordable price. Great views.

Pay extra for the oceanfront room- it's worth it. Sit and read the complimentary paper each morning from your porch while watching the surfers and all the activity along the main drag in Waikiki. We booked for the first week in July and had a partial view of 4th of July fireworks, a prime spot for the 4th of July parade. The park across the street had several evening performances which we enjoyed from our perch above the crowds. Clean room. Friendly service. Limited parking is available on site, underground. There is satellite location two blocks away but if you choose to park below the hotel, choose a smaller rental car when heading out from the airport as the spots are tight in the circle-shaped parking lot and on several occasions required one of us to get out and guide the driver as so to avoid hitting the walls.Only downside- the rooms are very clean and updated but they are small. The other person traveling with me is 6'0 and he had to crouch down in the shower. A beefy gentleman chatted with us in the elevator- I mentioned I'd be writing a review and he said, "Be sure and say the rooms look bigger in the picture!" Noted, sir. Please know that before you book, the beds and bathroom are on the small side- I wouldn't put 4 adults in the same room together and if you are a larger person, you might not be comfortable here.However, my traveling companion said he would definitely book the same room again- the spectacular views, excellent location (walk to Duke's, the Honolulu Zoo and the aquarium, beach just steps away) and the price made for a really amazing deal.

What a welcoming smile on arrival - mid morning. I was given a choice of view levels plus I was given my room immediately. Excellent views - which I asked for, & paid extra. Clean rooms. Very comfortable bed. Good reading lighting. An adequate sized refridgerator. Rooms had been recently re-decorated and renovated with a beachy theme and colours - very tastful & calming. Bathroom adequate, but tight and spotlessly clean. Air con was quiet, lift worked efficiently and rooms maintained to a high standard with daily service .. Reception delivered a kettle for a tea drinker. Reception was most helpful, as was the tour desk. You just cannot beat American hospitality.

This was our third time at The Circle. It has a wonderful location-right in the heart of Waikiki. The view from the Ocean room is spectacular and while the room is small it is clean, the beds are comfy and the shower is great. The staff (John and Andrew) were very helpful and a very special thanks to Guy who went out of his way to help my daughter and I with our many,many questions.We love The Circle and we hope to be back next year.The only down side was the introduction of a $10 amenities fee (this I feel should be optional).

stayed at the Circle with my family last week for just one night prior to cathcing a cruise. coud not have been more happy with my mostly random selection. Hotel is next to one of the best parts of the beach (especally for our kids), resturaunts and fun shops all around, staff that met us with pleasant smiles and extra effort at every level on service front and all at one of the best prices available. Would book again in a minute if we head to HI again. Thanks Circle for helping us start a great vacation!Travelled 6/16-

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in April and found it to be a clean and tidy place to stay. We had booked a city view room but on arrival (late at night) we found we had been upgraded to a partial view room. This gave us a side view of the beach from our balcony which was very nice. Our only problem was the noise that was coming from an air conditioning unit on the roof of the building next to us and even with the sliding door closed was still annoying and a little loud. The staff were welcoming and helpful, and the location was directly opposite the beach. Easy to walk to a number of different attractions from here, such as the zoo. The trolley buses stop nearby, and these will take you on to many other sites around town. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Husband & I arrived mid afternoon and were upgraded to room 1304 which had jaw dropping ocean views. The service from the front desk was A1 throughout our stay - nothing was too much trouble although the lady in the information kiosk seemed to get ignored probably because she was tucked away behind the lifts. The number one reason for staying at the Circle is the fabulous location - you've read it all before - beach and lagoon swimming literally across the road, surfing and sailing just beyond, trolley and bus stop across from Hotel, convenience stores steps away, McDonalds and free wi-fi 'next door. The Hotel itself now includes an amenity fee of US$10 daily to cover the safe, a sachet of coffee daily, newspaper, wired internet, and refrigerator. Also a Sony PSP, DVD player with PS games and DVD's from foyer kiosk. Oh and free use of beach towels and beach toys.We loved the renovated rooms and its quirky shape - yep it was small and cosy but not so different to the tiny rooms offered to tourists in Europe. It was super clean with plenty of towels, crisp sheets and flat screen TV. The alcove with wardrobe, desk, refrigerator offered a separate space to read, email etc which made it feel bigger than it was - but what a view - sitting out on the balcony really made our room feel huge!Our days were busy so we always slept soundly. AC noise was never a problem from other rooms, and there was very little if any traffic after midnight. Even the close location of the floor lifts did not disturb us. The only 'noise' was from the ocean waves!We tried the 'eggs n things' restaurant only once because there were so many other places to try breakfast - but it was amazing how people would line up for an hour just for an omelette.We paid US$207 all up (incl taxes etc) per night which was on the high side - we booked via the Aston hotel site 6 weeks prior. Compared to other hotels offering the same stunning views the Circle Hotel gave the best value.We would stay again.

We stayed at the Waikiki Circle early in June. We were in room 908, a partial ocean view. Positives:Location, short walk to International Market, across from beach, trolley stop just across the road. Clean, room was spotless. Neutral:2 double beds, which we were well aware of when we booked.Room size, again we knew what we were getting when we booked. But I don't know how you would fit a family of 4 in these rooms! Negatives:NOISE! Every morning at 4am we were woken up by the thud, thud, thud of the newspapers being dropped at each door. Then as we were next to the fire stairs we endured the BANG of the door being left to slam behind the paper deliverer. If you stay here, please respect other guests and close your door gently!!Eggs and things.......now I am pregnant so maybe its just me, but the smell of eggs in the lobby is not pleasant! But there was always a queue so maybe it tastes better than it smells! Tour desk lady was not interested and really not very helpful. So don't expect much from her. Balcony, we didn't use this space due to the noise from the surrounding buildings airconditioning units. This may be better in the full ocean view. But to be honest, if you can't afford the full view, don't bother with paying for the partial view because it is too unpleasant on the balcony to enjoy it. Save your money and go with city view. Overall I would not reccomend this hotel. Mainly due to the poor nights sleep that we endured due to the noise. If you are on a tight budget, it is a good option to consider. I'd prefer to pay a little extra and get some sleep.

The location of this hotel is perfect! It's right across from the beach and in the middle of Waikiki, so everything is within walking distance. We had an ocean view room which was amazing and got a great deal (20% off) by booking in advance. The hotel room is minimal and not the most spacious, but it was so cheap compared to other hotels that I don't think you can really complain. By American standards, people may be disappointed, but I've spent way more on worse "3 star" hotels in europe. At least these rooms were clean and had a television. My only two complaints are (1) parking, it is self park and very difficult to get in and out of with all the pedestrians and (2) the walls are pretty thin so I hope you don't have obnoxious neighbors.

I booked this hotel over hotwire for a 2 night night stay in hawaii. I work in the travel industry and have stayed in hundreds of hotels. This hotel was rated a 3 star (comparable to sheraton, hilton etc.) and was certainly NOT that. There is no lobby (only a street kiosk) and the rooms were tiny and very very loud. The staff were not overly friendly, nor helpful. I paid over $400 for a two night stay here on hotwire (first and last time I would use hotwire, I felt very ripped off). This hotel is a $80/night room at best.

This hotel is in a great spot on the strip, within easy walking distance of the beach, shops and restaurants. We had a city view room but we could still see the ocean from our balcony on the 11th floor. Unfortunately it was so windy we couldn't sit on the balcony to enjoy it. The room was very good, it appeared to have been recently renovated, and there was plenty of room for the 2 of us. The complimentary coffee (1 filter pack a day plus 2 packs of whitener) was a bit mean, if you wanted more you had to buy it. The internet fee was also very expensive, but with McDonalds next door and their free connection this didn't matter. A daily fee for these services was about to start, $10 per day seems expensive. We arrived early from Sydney and our room wasn't ready, but check in stored our bags and gave us towels for the beach so this wasn't a problem. This hotel was great; a top spot, pleasant room and great value.

A great little hotel in the most happening part of Waikiki! My experience was great all through. Easy reservation procedure, prompt responses to queries from the reservation dept. We were to arrive early morning so I had requested for an early checkin. I was glad that my request was accepted and we were checked in immediately upon arrival. We had booked a partial ocean view room for 7 nights although I must say that the view from the ocean front room was awesome. As we did not intend to spend too much time inside the room, I did not bother to go for an upgrade. The partial ocean room also did provide a reasonable view of the ocean. As the building is circular, the adjacent balcony does not come right in front of yours and is a bit to the side. On the first day, we were given a room on the 6th floor looking over the adjacent McDonalds. Upon request, we were moved to the 10th floor room on the next day which was a much better location. Yes, the noise of the airconditioners on the adjacent buildings could be heard but it was not so bad once the balcony door was shut. It was very windy during most of our stay but the direction was such that it did not bother us if we stayed in the room. The room had a pretty big balcony/lanai. The rooms were tiny for sure especially with 4 of us including two fidity boys. Waikiki circle is a no frills hotel, no concierge, no spa, no inhouse restaurant (Eggs-n-things, which is housed in the same building is not a part of the hotel). But, we had read reviews beforehand and factored in all the negatives when deciding on staying at this hotel.The hotel is neat and clean with nice clean linen and towels. Beach towels can be borrowed from the reception.
