They now charge a $10 amenity fee which includes in room coffee maching, internet connection (wired), Sony PSP and DVD player and unlimited subscription of DVD and playstation games from the kiosk below. The best about this hotel is its location - right in front of the beach, within walking distance of eating places and convenience stores. The front desk staff members were nice and helpful.Before making the reservation, I had weighed the positives against the negatives and concluded that this hotel would suit the taste and liking of my family. My experience was exactly as I expected. For someone who is looking for a more glamourous hotel and cannot be comfortable in small rooms, this hotel may not be a good choice, however, other hotels at the same location are priced much higher.In conclusion, Aston Waikiki gives excellent value for money!

This is a great little hotel. It's location is perfect...right in the middle of all of the Waikiki action. I had a straight on ocean view room AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING. I arrived in Honolulu at 5am and although I could not check in that early they did hold my luggage so we could have breakfast and walk the strip. Our room was then ready by 12 noon. The room was small but enough for the 2 of us. It was clean, it was clean, did I say it was clean and did not have any funny hotel smells! The only amenity that I needed was the amazing beach right out the door!

We very much enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is located right on Waikiki beach and we had an ocean view room on a higher floor (can't remember which, might have been 11) so if you get an ocean view room ask for one as high as possible. The view is just jaw-dropping.It does seem quite small and no-frills compared to the hotels around it, but we didn't mind that at all. The room wasn't very spacious, but there was plenty of room for the 2 double beds, tv, desk, wardrobe, etc. The decor of the room is light and airy. Everything was very clean.Wifi wasn't available at all, which is why this review isn't 5*. There was however wired internet.We didn't try Eggs n'Things downstairs (this isn't part of the hotel, it's a separate restaurant) as there were huge queues every day and the day I queue for an hour for a $11 omelet hasn't arrived yet. McDonald's next door do an excellent breakfast as well :) And free wifi!There are some lilos and other beach things available to borrow, have a look before you buy your own. There are lots of ABC stores around to get a drink and a snack and some tourist tat.Would stay again.

This was our third time staying at the Circle, and we wouldn't stay anywhere else. It's much cheaper than any of the other hotels right on Waikiki Beach, because you aren't paying for services you don't need (such as day spas or room service or a hotel pool). Everything you need is nearby. The rooms are small-ish, but are clean and comfy. Really though, you don't go to Waikiki to stay in your room. Close to local buses and trolleys that will get you anywhere on the island. Beach (and surfing lessons) are right across the road. For a good coffee walk up to Island Vintage Coffee at the Royal Hawaii Centre (just past International Markets on The Cheesecake Factory side of the road).

This hotel was fantastic! It's located on the main strip in Waikiki and directly across the street from the beach. Absolutely perfect location! The room itself was clean, had a balcony, and all the regular perks (shampoo, coffee maker, etc), but it was quite small...but who cares!? You're not in Hawaii to stay in the room! Loved this hotel and would DEFINITELY stay there again and recommend it to anyone going to Waikiki.

We stayed at this hotel at the start and the end of our 3 week honeymoon and found it perfect for us. If you are looking for 5 star accomodation then this isn't for you. But if you want clean rooms with great showers, friendly hotel reception staff, free beach towels and beach gear to borrow and right across from the beach then this is for you! You don't spend a lot of time in your room in Waikiki, but this was a great base to work from. It's brilliantly situated, all you need to do is cross the road to Waikiki Beach! We paid extra for the sea view when we stayed at the start of our trip and it was the as good a view from any part of Waikiki at a fraction of the cost of many of the other hotels. At the end of the stay we had a side room which was noisy due to the wind (the forecasts told us that winds were stronger than normal) which is why we have rated this hotel a 4 and not a 5. If we are ever lucky enough to return to Hawaii then we will definately be staying there again. Another review has said that Eggs n Things (restaurant under the hotel) isn't worth a visit but we would disagree. Yes, there are plastic plates and cutlery, but it's all part of the experience! You order before you get seated, then pay, then sit down, but we enjoyed it and the food is fresh and good - the pancakes are fresh and fluffy and the omelettes filled you up for the day. We had a wonderful time at this hotel.

The hotel is fine if you're looking for something basic, but in comparison to others in a similar price bracket it's not great value. The rooms have two small doubles making the room feel very small and the bathrooms, while adequate, are tiny.Our room was had a very partial sea view but faced directly to a neighboring hotel which made you feel very overlooked as it's so close. The only curtains are blackouts so unless you want to be watched by your neighbors your room is in darkness. Air conditioning is so loud, you can't sleep with it on. Finally, the breakfast restaurant down stairs - over rated!! Seems to be popular but i tried it. Paper plates, plastic knive and forks and over priced. Not my idea of a good breakfast, I would compare t to breakfast from a service station. There are much better places so don't waste your money.
The hotel is RIGHT across the beach. The view is beautiful. Hotel was very clean, staff was very nice. Great places to eat nearby. Overall we has a great experience.

We stayed here 3 nights on a recent trip to Oahu. The best thing about this hotel is the view. Make sure to get an ocean view or oceanfront room. If you don't, there is no real reason to stay here. It's along the very busy Waikiki strip and there are people walking around all day and night. It can be somewhat noisy too. The room is small and the A/C was noisy. My husband and son also had a problem with the shower head only being as tall as their chins. The shower is very small. That being said, we did have a pleasant stay. I do need to mention, they gave us a coupon book which included Rabi Transportation. I arranged for them to pick us up the next morning for a ride to the airport. Rabi never showed up and hung up on me when I called, even though he agreed to pick us up. We then had to get a taxi and almost missed our flight. I would not recommend anyone use Rabi!

I stayed at this hotel for my first trip to Hawaii and I wasn't disappointed. If you're on a budget like me and are low maintenance then you will like this hotel. It locates next to the beach and also at center of Waikiki downtown area so you'll have access to many shopping stores and restaurants. Although it not luxurious compare to Hyatt or Hilton but for the price that I paid, I thought it was worth it. My room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a little small with no bathtub but I didn't find that to be an issue. The staff was nice and friendly. My room was clean everyday. One thing to know before you go is that the bed is full size and not queen size just incase if you're planning on sharing the bed with someone. Overall I had good experiences with the establishment. No major complaint and would recommend staying at this hotel.

Cute little hotel, they keep to the theme of circles and fish, it's adorable. Room sizes more like a European hotel, so don't walk in with your American standards. Fabulous location, it you're headed for the beach, DO stay here. Literally walk out the front door, across the crosswalk, and lay your towel out on Waikiki beach. Clean, small, no pool, no fitness center. Perfect for beach-goers. Extremely windy lanai. Do not put your swimsuit out there to dry, it will blow away.

This is one in a series of seven reviews for seven hotels and resorts I stayed at during a recent trip to Hawaii (Maui and Oahu) in the month of May 2012. This is part of a continuing series of my impressions and experiences staying at various hotels and resorts while traveling to attend concerts worldwide. This review is for the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel on Oahu, Hawaii. Additional photos published on my website.Property: Aston Waikiki Circle HotelLocation: Waikiki – Oahu (Hawaii)Address: 2464 Kalakaua Avenue, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815Phone: (877) 997-6667Website: www.astonwaikikicircle.comRoom Type/Class: Ocean Front Hotel Room (Room 306)Date: May 21-22, 2012Booking Source: DirectOverall Rating: 3/5 [Note: Score is totally subjective based on price, location, and comparison to "like" properties within same area and price range]My stay with this property was the last night of my trip. I had an early flight out of Honolulu the next morning (checking out before 6am) and was checking in fairly late the prior afternoon, so wanted to find a place to stay that was relatively inexpensive given the short stay (about 12 hours total). This property appeared to be located close to shops, dining, and the beach in Waikiki and was a short drive to the airport, so it served my needs in that regard.This was my first visit to Oahu, so I had no hands on experience with the area, and referenced TripAdvisor reviews for some feedback from others that have stayed at this and similar properties.The entrance to the hotel is located off a one-way street, with beach and ocean on the other side of the street. It would be easy to pass by, even with GPS, so my approach was slow in trying to find it.Once at the address, there appeared to be two options – drive toward an up and downward lane with a gate blocking the entrance, or up toward a small lot with two short term parking spots. All in all, it was very tight with no signage, so it was a bit of a guess as to what guests checking in are supposed to do. I opted to drive up to the area I had to guess was adjacent to registration, and parked in one of the two small parking spaces. Unlike most anywhere you park on the Hawaiian islands, I was not greeted by a valet, so decided to bring my luggage to a window that appeared to serve for registration. There was a sign posted that their parking lot was full (photo below) with directions for parking to a sister property that did not appear to be very close. Certainly not convenient.There was no lobby or anything of the sort – check-in was facilitated by talking with staff through a plastic window, the interior of which is more like what you might expect to find at a car wash, rather than a hotel. Lots of clutter and disorganization.There was some confusion and discussion among the employees at check in, though they decided to allow me to park on site (down the ramp with the up/down arm referenced earlier); they provided a remote to open the arm. There is an added charge of $15.71/night for on site, non valet parking.I took my bags up to my room, since they were already pulled out of the car, and then went back down the elevator to park my car for the night. One in the parking area below, the first impression is that there are much fewer spaces than rooms in the hotel, so it would appear to be common for guests to have to park at the remote sister property or make their own parking arrangements, which is no very convenient.The hotel itself is very unusual by design – it is a tall cylinder, and each floor is a small circle of rooms.The room itself was fairly basic and outdated, but appropriate for the price point and location.The bed was low to the ground and a bit rickety. The shower in the bathroom is smaller than most small closets, and with the showerhead pointed right at the shower curtain, which goes all the way to the floor in the standing stall, it would be easy to flood the floor of the bathroom with water.A small desk was also provided, with wired (ethernet) Internet service that was an extra fee of $9.95. There was also an empty refrigerator and a key operated safe in the closet.The room also featured a small balcony, and at least in the case of my room, a great beach and ocean view – probably the biggest benefit of the room.This was actually the only hotel of seven during this stay where I turned on the TV, and the reception was horrible – more snow on screen on some channels than actual show/content.It is somewhat kid-friendly, as there is a PS2 in the room, and a DVD rental kiosk down by the elevator.If you are coming to Hawaii with an expectation of service and luxury, you will not find it at the Aston Waikiki Circle.If you aren’t going to spend a lot of time in your room, want to be walking distance to most in and around Waikiki, and just need a place to crash at night that is not too expensive (depending on your room type and any kind of special offers available), it is worth a look. But I would highly recommend securing one of the ocean view rooms and seeing if you can make parking arrangements in advance (i.e. reserving a spot on site). I don’t feel any room would be worth more than $150/night, as there are so many other options and special offers at other properties.

I stayed at this hotel in the first week of May, 2012. The location is fantastic - directly across from Waikiki Beach and close to all the shops, cafes & restaurants. My room was clean & comfortable and with a bar fridge & free ice, sunset drinks were easy! Do yourself a favour and pay a little more for a ocean view....sitting on the balcony looking at other hotels would be a drag.To attract more guests, the hotel could provide free wifi....there was only a 'pay for use' internet computer at reception. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this hotel for those not looking for 5 star luxury.

Good value,great location,friendly staff.Small rooms but clean and comfortable.Opens right across the road to the beach.Not ritzy but seeing you want to be out of your room most of the time this is a good selection.

Stayed there for three nights in a double double room with three others, room is a little small for four people with four small luggage, but we can still maneuver. There is hairdryer, refrigerator, large flat screen TV, in-room safe(fee), coffee maker, i-Pod dock, individually controlled a/c, Wi-Fi(fee) available in each room. For us not spending much time in room, this is just perfect for us. Room service and other hotel amenities such as jacuzzi, swimming pool, spa, conference rooms, are not available. However, they are just nothing important for us at the price we paid. We were there for sun, beach, food, shopping......Front desk agents are all brilliant and helpful, so is the lady at the travel desk where we booked our Polynesian Cultural Center tour package. Parking charge is roughly about $16.00 a day at underground self parking (clicker provided for in and out), I suggest to call to reserve one as spaces are very limited.Hotel is located 15 minutes drive away from HNL, across the Kuhio Beach, with tons of shops and restaurants surrounded. Restaurants such as MacDonalds, Subway, Burger King, to casual dining and even fine dining such as Cheesecake Factory, Hard Rock Cafe, are all within walking distance. International Markets is about 2 blocks, high end name brands stores are along the entire strip, ABC Stores (one of the local attractions in Honolulu I think) are all within your eyesight which sell souvenirs, drinks, foods, swimwear, etc.....Local tour bus stops are along the entire Waikiki Beach areas which you can jump on anyone of them.I will definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there in the future.

This is a small hotel with tiny rooms, but they have been nicely updated, have balconies, and ours included a small 'fridge. Despite being so small you have to ask for ice at the desk (not enough room on the hallways for a machine), it's a very good value for an "ocean front" room on Waikiki. We stayed in 1204 for 4 nights after being upgraded from 405 (we had asked for the highest floor available, and the 4th is what we were put in the first night after asking for the 13th or 14th floor when we made the reservation). It makes a huge difference how high up, and which angle of this "chinese lantern" shaped building you're in. If we had not been promised a better room after the first night, I'd have been booking into another hotel. If you can manage to get into rooms ending in 04 (the best) or 03, you have a direct view of Waikiki beach, and you avoid some really bad mechanical equipment noise from the roof of an adjacent building. The difference between a room ending in 05 (noise-exposed) and 04 was huge. You will not see Diamond Head from your patio because of taller buildings, but the view directly out, and "towards Ewa" is truly lovely. There is a convenient McDonald's with its free wifi (you'll pay extra in the hotel). One of the ABC stores very nearby has 4-day bus passes (not all of them do) and stops are conveniently located right in front of the hotel, and up on Kuhio (3 short blocks). (Call "The Bus" in Honolulu and ask them to mail you a free bus system map for Oahu/Honolulu.) Avoid the "Eggs and Things" restaurant in the lobby. It has high prices and unaccountably huge lines. There is a better to be had for breakfast at Arancino di Mare a couple of blocks away. Or you could get your McDonald's breakfast and take it across the street to the park. The sheltered beach swimming area is directly across the street and beach towels and floaty toys are provided if you ask at the desk. There is an outdoor shower to get the sand/salt water off. The desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Some real aloha going on there, despite the limitations of the building. This is the quieter end of Waikiki Beach (that being a relative term), and we were glad for it because the area around the Royal Hawaiian and the Sheraton is really nuts.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Waikiki Circle. We paid more to get an oceanfront room, and were very happy we did. The view was AMAZING. It was wall to wall ocean! The rooms are very small, but have everything you need. They seem to be updated and fresh and the beds were very comfortable. There was no table/chairs in the room, but there was a desk/counter and one chair near the closet and mini fridge. A newspaper outside the door every morning. The lanai was nice except for the outside a/c units that were very loud and dripped on us. The pay parking garage was very small, but I did like the fact we could get our own car as we needed it. No pool, but who cares with a big beautiful ocean out front. Restaurants very close, ABC store next door. I'm not a frequent visitor to MCdonalds but we did enjoy the 'Hawaiian style' breakfast platter very much...eggs, rice and spam! We loved this hotel, and can't wait to return!!! Did I mention the view?!?!

Have stayed at this hotel four times now and decided it was about time I wrote a review. We love the location, and price of this hotel. Yes it could be a bit bigger, yes it could have a better reception, pool ect. but for the price we don't care. We are across the road from the beach, and the view from the ocean view rooms are great. We are in walking distance to everywhere we want to go and after looking into the price of some of the other, better known hotels for this holiday it was back to the circle for us. I just couldn't justify paying that much more.

Stayed 6 nights at this hotel, Aston Circle Waikiki,it has been refurbished and is in a good location across from Kuhio beach(Waikiki extended) and the small Kuhio park ( east of "Duke statue) where on Wednesday, Saturday and Sunday nights there is a free Polynesian Hula demonstration as the sun goes down and the torches are lit along the paths.Value for money, with even a bucket and spade for the children, beach towels, "li-lo" beach floats, and rings for "big kids" . Just sign for and return when finished. The only draw back is the west side is over the air-conditioning units of the buildings below, so do as we did and pay the extra for a full ocean front room above the 5th floor. Fabulous 180* views and a passing parade, people, boats, planes etc.you could sit and watch all day and night, if there wasn't so much to do. Egg's and Things is near the foyer for breakfast with a discount coupon from the hotel of 10%. Pancakes to die for. The meals are huge. Sometimes a line,(Sundays) but well worth the 10 min wait,( during the week, between 6.30 and 7.15) unless of course you are the type who prefers to get up late and then you may have a much longer line,saw 25 or so waiting, about 9am. The hotel staff were attentive to our needs, when we arrived at 10.30 am from our OZ plane, and so secured our bags till the high room was ready later in the day and sent us off to the Cheese Cake Factory for lunch. We needed to rest after that monstrous feed. Portions are huge in Honolulu.This hotel is great, in a handy location, clean, and value for money, with a very useful discount book which has most things you need, and which can be booked at their information desk in the foyer.

My husband and I stayed at the Circle for a week in May. We've stayed here a few times now and do so because of the fabulous location and the view from the room - has to be Ocean Front. Can't beat looking out the window when you wake up and seeing Diamond Head, palm trees and the ocean. Ahhhhhhh.The front desk staff were helpful and allowed us to check in early (saving us having to kill time hanging around on the street after a long flight). They don't have wifi yet, but apparently it is coming. Parking was a pain, and we ended up parking at an alternative site (cost less too). The room servicing staff missed leaving coffee for us a couple of times, and took us pulling up the sheets on the beds as them already being made, therefore not making the beds. The room was clean and the refurbishment is good. Pity they didn't replace the outdoor furniture too (our glass table was badly cracked). The two double beds make the room look much smaller and an option of a queen bed only would have been good and given us more room. Double beds aren't great for two people to sleep in either, so we slept in separate beds!! (Slept well, but not very romantic!!)Yes, you only get a room - there's no pool or bar - but the beach is across the road and you can visit any bar at any hotel you like. You really can't beat the price for the location and the view. And yes, it does get noisy, but every hotel I've stayed at in Waikiki is noisy - there are so many ABC shops receiving deliveries first thing in the morning that you really can't avoid the noise.Didn't understand the attraction and the long lines for the Eggs and Things restaurant - food didn't look great and it wasn't that cheap. Plus it was an "Eggspress" express restaurant so there was no time to relax and enjoy... Give me Maccas with complimentary pineapple any day!My only gripes about this hotel were the newspaper delivery person who insisted on slamming the complimentary newspapers down in front of each door at 4:30am every morning (very noisy guy) and the awful bacon smell that wafts up occasionally from the Eggs and Things on the ground floor.  I would definitely stay here again.

The location for this hotel is unrivaled. Right across the road from the beach, with many restaurants and shops within walking distance. The staff were friendly and helpful. They helped us out with bus routes/timetables and we were given a discount book upon arrival. You could also book tours on site which was extremely helpful. The rooms were clean as well. The negatives - while clean, the room was tiny. There were only 2 of us, but we could hardly move around. Not sure if it was just our room, but we had 2 double beds which made it very cramped. The shower/bathroom was also small. We did pay for a 'partial ocean view room', but mainly the view was of the building next door! only when you venture onto the balcony, lean over and look past your neighbors balcony could you see the ocean. Also, the loud noise from the air conditioning of the neighboring building was terrible and gave us grief while trying to fall asleep. If your main priority is location, I would definitely recommend this place. But if you after an A+ room, I would look elsewhere.

Overall, a pretty good hotel. We only stayed for one night as we moved on to another hotel, but my first impressions were average. The staff on the front desk are very friendly and very helpful. The biggest issue is that on our floor, at about 7am in the morning, the noise of the staff outside. Too loud. Also, if it's a very windy night, the corridors of the hotel are also noisy.Overall, the room's are pretty good. Bathroom nice, clean and spacious; on the other hand the rooms are a little small but clean. Nice TV, but the hairdryer didn't work.Good for just the night or a short stay.

We paid more for the view and it was well worth it. The room was clean, big enough and looked right out on to Waikiki beach. The hotel provides beach towels (and were friendly while doing so...) and it's only a few steps to the beach.There were some additional charges. $15 for car parking, $40 for a wired internet connection (no wifi available) and there's no breakfast. We walked past the ridiculously long queues at Eggs & Things - it looked pricey and nothing special.I'd stay here again for the location alone.

We chose this hotel over cheaper hotels like the Sheraton and Ohana East largely because of the reviews on this site. We were very disappointed. Rooms are tiny and only have double beds. AC is loud and the lanai is pretty useless because of the noise from the neighboring building's AC unit. Thin blankets too. Only redeeming feature is the central location

This was our 7th time to stay at the Waikiki Circle, out of 21 trips to Oahu. We love it here! The front desk staff are excellent people! They are very friendly & go above & beyond to help us with whatever we need. They treat us like family, which makes our vacation that much more special. From our experience they are the best in all of Waikiki!! This is what keeps bringing us back & staying here! The hotel is centrally located and right across the street from Waikiki Beach. It's very affordable. The rooms may be a little small, but you can't beat the view from the ocean front rooms! We love sitting out on our balcony enjoying the view of Waikiki. We always recommend this hotel to our family & friends who are traveling to Oahu.

We have just returned from 6 days' stay at this condominium. We have stayed in Waikiki a number of times, but not in such a great location as this. Sited across the road from the beach, this accommodation is hard to beat. We read the reviews on Tripadvisor before booking and therefore we were expecting smallish rooms which would have not been suitable for family groups but ideal for couples. What we appreciated most were: the friendly and helpful staff, the clean rooms with daily maid service, free beach towels and access to a variety of beach chairs, lilos etc. We had booked an ocean view room but upgraded for an extra $15.00 a night to an ocean front room on the eighth floor and what an investment it proved to be. We could sit on the lanai and watch all the sights day and night and soak up the amazing view. From other reviews we were expecting it to be noisy, but we slept like babies. Far less noisy than previous, more upmarket accommodation elsewhere in Waikiki. The beds were really comfortable as well. Downsides could be no dining table to sit at and no wifi, but, hey, this is a holiday and it proved to be a relaxing one as well. Would definitely stay again.

This hotel is really a very good choice for who is looking for a good localization and view.All the employees as very likeable, and all that you need you can find near the hotel.The mais thing for me is that it is beach front.All the furnitures in the room are new and is very pleasant to stay.The bathroom size is really small, but it is a small detail if you compare with the other advantages.If I come back to Waikiki, I will stay at this hotel.

Stayed at this hotel April 26th for 4 nights. Wonderful experience start to finish! The view room our ocean front room was amazing and the balcony was large. Staff was also 5 star. Thanks to Jan and Guy at the front desk for their great service. Will be staying here again!!
Yes the room was a bit small - shaped like a cake slice BUT brilliant water views - great price - top location. Definitely go back next time.

We loved the atmosphere of the hotel. The room was very clean, coffee was provided every day (not something all hotels in Waikiki do). ABC store next door, and Eggs and Things off the lobby. We got take out from Eggs and Things the first night, food was good, 10% discount with your room card holder, but still a little pricey. Loved the Loco Moco. The only downfall was we were unable to smoke on our lanai, which we found to be silly, as the smoking area was down in the driveway, and we were on the 2nd floor overlooking the driveway, and the smoke went up and right into our room!! Room was a little noisy, as we were facing the street on the 2nd floor. For the price and location (right across the street from Waikiki beach) it is a good place to stay!!

cactus140
Death Valley National Park, California

review_body: Stayed here mid March for 5 nights with my adult daughter. Great location, rooms are clean but very cramped and small. Ok for 2 people. Beds are comfortable but one is against the wall and other against slider. Ocean view room had a small slice of ocean but more view of the side of other hotels, a parking garage and the kitchen and dumpsters below us. Hotel staff is pleasant, short on any real amenities. There was no internet in the room without charge but looks like with the new resort fee that will change. McDonald's has free wifi next door though. A decent value for the location but would stay at the Sheraton Princess or Aston Beach Hotel (have stayed at both) for about the same money and same good location.

We stayed at the Waikiki Circle for 10 days and were very happy with our experience. The value was great for being right next to the beach. We did not miss having a pool as we spent our time at the beach or touring around. Staff were very helpful. It is worth the extra money for an ocean view room!
we , my wife and i found that this hotel is a 4 star hotel due to that the finest beach is just across the street and that you are right in the middle of Waikiki beach ,

Stayed at this hotel recently for four nights. Found it to be great value for money. Across the road from Waikiki Beach. They even have floaties for free if you want to laze in the beach. The overall experience was pleasant. Staff were friendly, we arrived early - around 10.00 am and our room was ready - which was great after a long flight!! The room was quite small, but clean and big enough for two. There is a really good restaurant at the bottom of the hotel - alway a big line up for food, mainly for breakfast. We had an ocean view room - right at the front - it is the best so see if you can get one.

We booked two nights at the Aston following a Hawaiiian cruise. We got a great rate from Booking.com. The hotel is clean, updated and in a geat location. It is not a fancy hotel like its neighbor, the Hyatt, but neither is the price! Location, cleanliness, value fr the money and helpful staff make this a great choice for beachfront on Waikiki.

We spent a weekend in Waikiki, we had come from the Hyatt in Maui ( 4 days) so at first is always interesting to adjust to a modest hotel. What we first saw was an open lobby next to an Eggs and Things restaurant ( always full so we never ate there) with friendly staff. We were able to upgrade to a room with a view ( no waterfront view) my sister had stay there the week before and told us not to stay in the rooms to the right ( facing the water from room) because there is some machine in the building next door and it is loud- but there was not availability on the other side, we had to get use to extra noise...We still were able to see Waikiki beach from the Lanai...The rooms are small and is a circular building. We were 3 with 3 big suitcases. The thing is that the value was there, yes we pay around $120 for a water view room with no buildings in front of us, right across from Waikiki Beach! There were other inconveniences like no Wi Fi!!! extra $10 a day for connection ( I was able to connect for free from the lanay) and $2 for safety box i the room? and extra $15 for parking.I will still stay there next time, it serve the purpose, great location, clean, comfortable, updated ( flat screen tv but movies are $16?!!!) but next time I'll make sure to make reservation on time for a waterfront view in the left side of building....

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle for five days. The rooms are small, but everything else was great. We had an oceanfront room so we had a great view. The room was always super clean. Great location, we walked everywhere we needed to go in Waikiki. The staff was always pleasant to talk to and answered all our questions.

For our second visit to Oahu, we stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle hotel from March 22nd to March 31st, and we had a very pleasant stay. We knew the rooms would be small, based on the reviews, but there was enough room for the three of us, it really wasn’t a problem since we were only in our room to sleep. The shower was quite small, and water pressure was only okay. We managed though. It was clean, and that’s the main thing for us. The cleaning staff were friendly and efficient. I did like having a coffee machine in our room and the small fridge came in handy. Our balcony partially faced the ocean – room 602 - I think next time I would get a full ocean view room, since our room was close to the supplies room and we could hear the door slamming at all hours of the night (even with ear plugs). The air conditioner was also very noisy. I would say the noise was the only bad thing about the hotel – I had only one full night’s sleep due to the noise, but I figured for the very reasonable price of the hotel, I would catch up on my sleep at the beach.The location was fantastic – right across the street from the beach! The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, and had copies of the bus routes and schedules, which was useful. There were two computers in the open lobby – access cost $5 per 20 minutes, and there was a printer to print off boarding passes (for a small fee). Beach toys were available to borrow, and although there is a restaurant attached to the hotel, the lineup was always so huge, we never ate there. We did see the menu and prices were no different from other restaurants with full service (e.g., Hula Grill at the Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach, Margaritaville, etc) so we never bothered to stand in line (we did go down Seaside and Kuhio Ave to the Seaside Bar & Grill for an excellent breakfast of 2 huge pancakes, 2 scrambled eggs, and 2 slices of bacon – for $3.95 this can’t be beat – see review).We were able to have our room for an additional 12 hours on our check-out day, since our flight didn’t leave until 10:30pm. That was a very nice option, and it only cost $75 – we were able to spend the entire day at the beach and did not have to worry about storing our luggage or having a place to shower – it meant we had a full last day of our holiday. I know this is not the fault of the hotel, but the taxi that they called to take us to the airport over-charged us by $10 – he took a left turn out of the hotel, continued on for a few miles, and then finally headed in the direction of the airport – there was no shortcut involved. I would suggest that maybe they use a taxi company that they know will not rip off their clients.I would return to this hotel, but I would request a room as far away from the supplies room as possible.

Unlike many waikiki hotels on back streets,this one on main road,with Waikiki(Kuhio Beach park) Beach right across street. Free hula shows at bandstand over there some nights. I have stayed at this location since early 90s,when privately owned by a Chinese lady who built it after Statehood--her picture in lobby. Then the rooms were $40/44/48; depending on the higher level of 12 story hotel. Now it an Aston property.and was freshly refurbished last fall.Two Aston properties are on both sides of Circle,and think they are condos. When I visited in Feb,a new Eggs and I had opened in lobby overlooking street. It would have been nice if I could have ordered takeout, but only waiting in line was available.This is a simple clean room with balcony place. If you want shops and bars and many restaurants in a hotel,look and pay more elsewhere. Best rate for me was Entertainment card,which they do make a copy of at checkin--think I got partial ocean view down to $120 that way. If cheaper city view,try to get room higher up,unless you want to look at parking structure form your balcony. Strangely, that area of waikiki by 10pm is quiet with hardly any traffic or pedestrians. Sleep quality notch down for me,only because think only two double beds offered,and I am tall,and used to queen beds.

We stayed at the Waikiki Circle for 10 days over Easter and I have to say it was very successful! Excellent location, friendly staff and although quite small the room was enough for my partner and I. Beautiful view from the our Room 10 05. Best to request a room higher up as you are on the main rd, it could be quite noisy at the lower rooms. Mahalo for your service and I will definately be recommending this hotel to friends and family. Regards,Kate (downunder)

I would NOT recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. The only reason why people give high ratings at this hotel is because it is cheap. Well, guess what? You get what you pay for. My friends and I booked two double beds at this hotel. We were shocked to find out that there was no floor space anywhere in our hotel room. Don't consider staying here if you're visiting Hawaii with more than two people. There will be no space to place your suitcase. My friends and I always felt crowded and cramped in our hotel room.When it got hot and humid at night, I wanted to leave the AC on while I was falling asleep. Unfortunately, the AC always made a rickety sound that was so loud that I couldn't sleep with the AC on. We visited Hawaii in August which is one of the hottest times of the year. I wasn't able to sleep comfortably. Then we left the window opened one night to keep our room cool. We woke up with mosquito bites even though we stayed on the 10th floor.This hotel room does not have a bathtub. It only has a shower stall. They used a white shower curtain. Unfortunately, the shower curtain was orange at the corners which was disgusting. I didn't want to know how old and unclean the shower curtain was, but we had to make-do with what we got ourselves into.If I ever go back to Hawaii, I would not stay at this particular hotel. It's uncomfortable, cramped, and unclean.

Stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle from March 25th, 2012 - March 30th, 2012. Could not have been happier. Fantastic location in Waikiki. Fantastic staff, Naomi, and the other staff members are great (sorry I forgot their names). The rooms are a bit small, but great otherwise. A small microwave would be a welcomed addition. But otherwise WE LOVED THE LOCATION, THE HOTEL AND STAFF!Kevin & RosaGardena, California

We just came back a few days ago. Had a very good experience at the hotel! If you want something affordable, this is it! It's steps to the beach (even though the work was being done on the beach in front, we still got a good view... unlike Marriot where there was a big pile of sand) that was only closed off in the morning for the project. No pool, but we knew this and we weren't planning to use the pool anyways. Rooms were a little tight, but we knew that too. Good size cold fridge. Double beds, but comfy with comfy pillows! Clean rooms. This we all knew before we went.Wow stuff we didn't know:1. Borrow beach toys, floaty stuff, boogie boards, noodles for free.2. Complimentary beach towels (sign out from front desk, borrow to your hearts content)3. 10% off at Eggs and Things4. Booklet with coupons at shops in other Aston hotels (especially kids free foods)5. Complimentary Whole Living Magazine6. Complimentary paper every morning on your doorstep.Front desk staff was very helpful and friendly! We had a late flight and they stored our luggage for free after check-out until we left for the airport. We had a great time! We stayed on the 9th floor!

I loved this hotel because the rooms were all renovated as well as the washrooms. The location was more then perfect. I woke up and see the surfers just in front on us in the water, The rooms were small but who cares , I was always outside. There is no pool but a beautiful beach in front of the hotel. By the way they lend you beach towels and boards, The hotel is just in front of Duke's statue. On Fridays and Saturdays you can see hulas shows for free at sunset. The prices are more then great compared to other hotels around. There is a fridge in the room and plenty of ABC stores around. The only thing I didn't like: the AC was loud.I didn't rent a car and used the BUS that goes every where. At the hotel they give you a map and in the back you have all the attractions worth visiting with the BUS lines.A place not to miss is Hanauma Bay (7.50$ pp). You will be able to see plenty of fish even without snorkelling gear. I saw a big turtle as well. Bring food and beverages cause there are none by the bay which is a marine reserve. You would have to go up the hill to get anything to eat or drink.There are showers and toilets, as well as rentals (lockers and masks).Coming back I stopped at Diamond Head, nice views but bring water and sneakers.We took a surfing lesson with Bigwave Dave (www.surfwithdave.com) and it was just WOW and yes I stood a few times on the board and I am 50 (it was my birthday gift from my daughter) I also bought the CD with the pictures but I thought it was pricey (60$). I got as a memory.Oahu was great,I'll go back for sure.Ana

Great place to stay and perfect location, can not fault. Just right across from the beach and transport was so easy to use. The staff are friendly and helpful. Our rooms were ready when we arrived. Rooms are as described but as you are not in them for very long - just to sleep - they do fine. They are cleaned everyday and with any problems they are fix ASAP.McDonalds and the ABC shop are on either side of the hotel with Eggs & More just outside the lobby (always a queue to get in). Free towels and beach toys to use - just sign them in and out.Walking distance to everything - zoo and aquarium to the left and shopping, eaterys & did I mention more shopping to the right.Would recommend this hotel to anyone

Our family of four had two separate rooms at the Circle. Our teenage boys shared a room and we were next door. The location is outstanding, right across the road from the beach. The hotel has boogie boards you can borrow and there is an ABC store next door for supplies.There was noise from the hallway most mornings which woke us up but the kids slept through it. The beds were comfortable.The rooms are clean and comfortable - we weren't in them much, we were out exploring incredible Oahu!We had a car for the whole stay and always managed to find a car park in the small garage under the hotel. Parking was $15 per day and we paid for internet.

Having stayed here many years ago I remembered the fantastic location of this hotel. Years on, the location is still great and the hotel has had a makeover.There is also the added bonus of having a travel assistant in house to help you out with any bookings or information you require.Short walk to bars, restaurants and shops.ABC (convenience) Store is right next to this hotel.

Circle Hotel is a super spot to stay if you are staying in Honolulu. It might not be for people who go to Hawaii to saty in the hotel, but it is very affordable, and right at the beach, I don't think you can beat it in Honolulu.

I read the reviews on tripadvisor prior to booking the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel and totally agree with what was said. The location is absolutely perfect, right across from the beach. There is a McDonalds right next door and many restaurants close by. Yes the rooms are small but they are kept clean and we really weren't there to stay in the room. However the beds even though just doubles were very comfortable. I would totally recommend this hotel! Hotel staff were always very helpful too. We were going to get a room with an ocean view but didn't end up getting one. Probably would have been nice but again, we were out and about most of the time

We chose this hotel on the recommendation of our daughter who stayed here last February. My husband I stayed for 6 nights and we loved this hotel!It's not fancy, there's no grand lobby or bell boys but the staff are great and helpful and available 24 hours. We liked the fact that it a smaller hotel. There was never a crowd near the lift - which we never had to wait for.Our room was on the 14th floor, oceanfront, and what an unbelievable view! Every time we can came back to our room the view took my breath away. We spent every evening on our balcony watching the sunset and the surfers.The rooms and bathroom are small but very comfortable and fresh. For the value for money (we paid US$155 per night for oceanfront view) and location we would definitely stay here again.
Loved the view and the location. What a value! Could not have been happier

I stayed here for a week last July and I could not have been more pleased. The hotel is close to everything in Waikiki! The beach, shops, restaurants, International Marketplace...everything! The staff was great and I had no problems with accommodations or checking in/out. I really liked the look of the hotel too, the rooms were recently renovated but it still had this old school charm to it. I will gladly stay here again.

Stayed 3 nights at the Circle, mid Feb 2012, and which has just been refurbished. Best rooms are oceanfront, ok, they cost more than partial ocean views, but give views of Waikiki Beach as good as any other hotel in the area at a fraction of their prices. The unusual shape of the hotel (like a Chinese lantern) was ideal when the property was built, as can be seen from the black and white photo in reception, when the property was surrounded by sand dunes and palm trees with a view in every direction. Progress has caught up, and hotels and condo's have now almost encircled the hotel. However, the position, is superb, it's at maybe the best spot on Waikiki Beach. For price and sea view, it's a winner, with a balcony. Room size, well, it is a circular building and is rather quaint and "compact". Room comfort and cleanliness, very good. Amenities, it's just a place to stay. There's no restaurant, however, there is an Eggs n' Things diner at the front (no business connection to the hotel). But it's only open from 6.00 am to 2.00 pm, and there's always an endless queue of mainly young Japanese tourists waiting to get a seat and serving. Would I stay there again, most certainly.

This is possibly the most noisy hotel I have ever used. We had room 704, with Ocean View, for 3 nights. The problem is that Waikiki's main road is between the hotel and the ocean, and there is minimal soundproofing. We were woken around 5 am each morning by the beeps of the reverse warning of a truck collecting garbage.There are no public facilities, no breakfast offered, not even any wine glasses available. The hotel follows the outdated business model of offering Ethernet Internet access at $9.95 per day, when the current model is to offer free wifi.On the other hand, it is well placed and only a short walk from the centre of Waikiki, and the front desk staff were pleasant and generally helpful. Overall, not bad value compared to other hotels in Waikiki.

My late husband and I stayed here on our two trips to Hawaii. The first time for a week and the second time for a whole 26 days!! We love it. GREAT location!!! We sat on our lanai and watched the runners light the torches every night and watched the sunset......low price and best location!!!

We stayed here for a few nights after a long flight. We found the location fantastic. Despite being on the main street, it was quiet in the rooms. The views were spectacular if you have an ocean view room (or even partial). The rooms were clean, albeit a bit cosy. The bathroom was tiny, but that was ok for us as we were only using the room to sleep. There isnt much room to really spread out outside the beds. We had an ocean view room with a fairly small balcony and a TV with cable that worked... kinda! The facade of the hotel is noticable - being the only circle shaped hotel on the main road. Dont let the foyer put you off. When we first got there, the foyer looked like a cheap tacky motel, but the staff were nice and helpful, and rooms a good win. I have recommended this hotel to a few people and they have said it was fantastic considering price and location. Definitely a find. I would stay there again if I was after somewhere cheap and clean, and still close enough to all the action.

This cool little hotel is a steal, just across the street from Waikiki Beach. The rooms are just big enough, and stylishly decorated. Essential amenities are great quality. Beach towels, chairs and toys are free for the asking. The view of the beach from many rooms is unobstructed. Best of all, the hotel fronts the Kuhio Beach Pavilion, where the nightly hula show takes place. You are just a short walk from the famous shops, restaurants, parks and zoo. And just a hop across the street to a gorgeous, family friendly beach. We took advantage of the partial day room rental on our last day, which gave us the opportunity to fully enjoy our last hours on the Island by taking a sunset cocktail cruise, then showering and packing and squeezing in one last great dinner before our midnight flight home.

As very seasoned and, we admit it, rather “spoilt” international travelers we were truly in doubt as to choice of hotel for our 4-night stay at Waikiki Beach as we didn’t want to spend a fortune on the accommodation but neither wished to deviate from our demands for a central, front-row and direct beach access location as well as a full ocean view. By co-incident I stumbled across The Aston Circle – and, voila, here was the perfect match to meet our criteria. Following good conversations here on TripAdvisor pro and cons were turned with fellow members - and we are more than happy that we made this hotel our final choice. We booked one of the slightly more expensive oceanfront rooms and attached a request to the form for upper level – absolutely worthwhile. The latter had been duly noted and the receptionist handed us with a big smile the key to a room on the 12th floor (the hotel is 14th story high “only”). Our feet were swept totally away when we entered the room and met with a 180 degree undisturbed view of Waikiki Beach and the turquoise ocean as an endless backdrop! No reason to draw the curtains as you have complete privacy and hence, this panorama unfolded for our eyes every morning as could be fully enjoyed from the bed as well. To the room is a small balcony with a couple of plastic chairs and a coffee table. As the name so very well indicates, the hotel is shaped as a circle and hence the rooms do get sort of a funny shape. In spite of same and although likewise on the small size, the room was very light, airy and with a tropical decor and offered a good king size bed, a tiny corner with cloakroom and sink and a small bathroom with shower. Basic with no frills, but definitely clean and well maintained. American guests may not think much of the little bathroom, but we were all fine with it. And we loved the little humoristic features such as a tiny children’s sand bucket with shovel placed in the bathroom and a tiny orange rubber fish greeting us on the edge of the sink.OBS: If you are suffering from claustrophobia you may not like the open-fenced balconies that are placed outside the building as, admittedly, a couple of times it did feel a bit scary “hanging” on the wall in that height, but yet again, the view is so breathtaking that it’s all forgotten in a split second. Further, you have the option of a lower placed room, of course. The hotel has no other facilities as such apart from a tiny open air lounge/reception area and a tour-operator desk. But what else do you really need, when you have the mile long golden sandy beach and the bluest water just across the street? No need for a pool. Beach towels could be picked up with the reception, so all you had to do was to put on your swimsuit and flip-flops in your room, take the elevator down to the reception, pick up your towel and make your way across the street and place yourself in this water-wonderland! OK admittedly, it would have been nice if some sun-umbrellas and beach-seats could have been provided for – but you can find same at a small public beach-booth located just where you cross the street and from which surfboards and other watersport equipment are for rent. Neither does the hotel have a restaurant, but yet again – who need that when you have the entire Waikiki Beach with its numerous restaurants just next to you. It’s really only up to you to make your pick! Next to the hotel you do likewise find an ABC convenience store and several of the traditional budget take-away restaurants such as McDonald etc. Further, pick-up/drop-off for the many tour-coaches take place just a few yards down the side-street. Finally, a tiny green area/park is also to be found just across the street. Here several late afternoons we experienced free luaus – or even better – we could watch most of it from our very own balcony and hence at the same time enjoy a sundowner and the breathtaking orange sunset on the waters… We couldn’t have asked for a better location!OBS: Having no own garden-terrace, ocean-bar, restaurant etc. we enjoyed very much to stroll the short distance to legendary Moana Surfrider where we dined or sipped cocktails al fresco listening to the lapping water or local live music.OBS OBS: Even better than to rent sun-umbrellas – go to ABC and purchase your own at USD 15!The staff at The Aston Circle we experienced all to be very friendly and accommodating. We arrived midday and as our room wasn’t ready this early, we were immediately offered to change our clothes at a small toilet by the reception and leave the luggage with them in order for us to get as much out of our day as possible. Whenever we came to pick up a beach towel or to ask for directions we were met with a smile and a helping hand. Check-in/check-out went fast and smooth and one of the added bonuses to staying at The Aston Circle you are never wasting time as with its only 14 floors and limited number of guests you are never stuck in queues anywhere.As you may reckon we were fully satisfied with our stay at The Aston Circle and will most certainly choose to stay there again should our way take us to Hawaii again. As long as expectations are kept in perspective you’ll have a good time here and most certainly get value for your money. Especially, Europeans

This was my 4 time at the Circle--rates have gone up a bit but then everything is a bit more expensive in Honolulu.. Same good service, same beautiful view.I didn't care too much for the new coffee maker in the room--prefered the coffee at mcdonalds. For good value I highly recommend this hotel--hope to go back next year.

We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Waikiki Circle. Check in was quick and easy. Our room was comfortably appointed. We knew the room was going to be small, but we spent very little time in the room. Our ocean view room had a very nice view of Waikiki Beach looking toward Diamond Head. The registration staff were very helpful. The only downside was the noise factor from below. We were up on the 9th floor and at night could still hear noise from the street below. This was a minor annoyance considering the awesome location, directly across the street from Waikiki Beach!

Lifelong dream to visit Hawaii and choose this hotel because reviews and affordability. Was a quaint, clean, covenient stay with no waiting for elevators. MacDonald's on one side and ABC store, with a bit of everything, on the other. Coffee machine and fridge allowed for meal expense cutting. Paid the extra for an ocean front room, which is an added must. Tour pickups were just arond the corner at neighboring hotel. No internet, but, MacD's had free wireless and was able to connect from our balcony while enjoying the beautiful view and warm breeze. Not a luxury hotel, but, luxury costs. If you have it then pay it. Some street noise, but, then, Waikiki center! Would return to Hawaii and Aston Circle in a heartbeat.

I was here for the last seven days of January...amazing hotel, amazingly friendly staff, extremely clean room...paid a little extra for an ocean front room...super!! This, without a doubt, will be my new place to stay when I visit Honolulu!!

Stayed here for a week in January. Very clean room and balcony view was amazing (room 1103). Right across the street from the beach. For some money saving tips: go to the apple store and use their ipads. Also for wifi go to Mcds, Starbucks, or apple store. Also, eggs and things way over priced. Find a restaurant called Seaside Bar and Grill. Very cheap breakfast that will fill you up all day! Only downside to hotel was their beach towels. Very old and worn out. But at least we could sign out new ones every day.

Great location, like every hotel in Waikiki there is a street noise problem (I was on the 13th floor in an Ocean Front room). The rooms are tiny (which is no surprise if you look at the photos on the hotel website), and feel even smaller because of the two double beds. The room was clean, I couldn’t hear any noise from the adjacent rooms. The air con unit in my room was quite loud and blew water on me every time I went out onto the balcony.It was an easy walk to the ‘Football Express!’ shuttle bus for the Pro Bowl. Staff were all friendly, being a small hotel you never have to wait long for an elevator.I would happily stay here again, it is in the ‘busy’ end of Waikiki but just outside the really hectic part which I found perfect.The current Waikiki Beach works had virtually no impact on my view, they are working in a very non intrusive way.

Cons: no lobby, no pool, no restaurant,no king sized beds (?), tiny selection of pay-per-view movies (which turned out fine, cuz they cost almost $18??) - and lastly, the only "con" I really cared about was the sub par cleaning of the bathroom countertops. Ucky.Pros: Oceanfront room was perfection (room 1304 to be exact....& since when do hotels have 13th floor)?? The room was a good size, but of course oddly configured -- it's the shape of a circle, what do you expect? Lol.For us, being directly across the street from Kuhio Beach was perfect. My husband pulled is surfboard out of the hotel's locker, and was in the water within 5 minutes. We rented chairs & umbrellas from Beachboy Aki everyday, and could not have been happier.For the right price ($150 for ocean front) we would happily stay here again.

The Waikiki Circle Hotel is located directly across Kalakaua Avenue from Waikiki Beach. The hotel has been recently renovated so that it has a bright, up-beat, family-oriented presentation. The staff are uniformly pleasant and friendly. The Waikiki Circle Hotel is particularly well situated if you intend to walk the Waikiki area which includes beaches, an aquarium, zoo, Kapiolani Park, Diamond Head, and numerous high end to medium shopping venues. The area's restaurant selections are nearly limitless. This is an area where you can be doing something every minute or just relax on the beach. Rooms have balconies, refrigerators, coffee makers, large screen TV and Internet connectivity.

Fred B
Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: Excellent location just across from Waikiki Beach, very convenient for everything, just a few steps to MacDonald, money saving for breakfast. ABC stores nearby. Trolley bus stop across the street, a couple blocks away for bus stop going to Diamond Head, Zoo. Walking distance to Food Pantry for grocery, fruits, salads, sandwiches etc.Staying at the beautiful ocean front room was a wonderful thing. Room & bathroom are small but it has everything, sitting at the balony with such a great beach view, watching beautiful sunset. You just love it.You won't mind to pay for more for the ocean front room, it's worth it. It's even better going for higher floor if it's available. There is a restaurant "Eggs & things" at the hotel, Crepe is excellent. Long line up each morning. I ordered take out, ate at the room balony, enjoying the great beach view.Overall, I love this little hotel, sure will come back next time in Waikiki.

Excellent hotel for the money.The location cannot be beaten,right acroos the street from the beach.The hotel is super ok.The trouble is with the resort itself:1.Too many homeless and too many beggars on the streets,especially within Waikiki beach area2.Too many homosexual couples on the beach;I have a feeling this resort is a hub for them.I wasn't very comfortable, especially when you travel with kids and family,you feel kinda funny to see all those male lovers with their bikini and all that...Yak!I know is afree country,but still...

I booked this hotel 9 months ahead so I got it on cheap rate though we were given a parking lot view with partial ocean view I still think its value for money considering its just in front of Waikiki beach.it is located on a shopping strip of Kalakaua Avenue , McDonald is just steps from doorstep where you can access wi fi and Eggs and things restaurant located in the lobby where you need to be very early to avoid long queue. There are 2 available computer on lobby for fee ,free online check in is available and you only pay for printing.Staff are helpful and rooms are cleaned everyday.it is manned 24 hours so checkout is not a problem.this Hotel is by far value for money,there is no amenities which is okay because we are out most of the time and we use the room mainly for snoozing...

I have stayed at this hotel 15 times over the last 8 years - and will keep coming back. Staff are friendly and helpful (and the majority are the same staff which does say something). Rooms have now been remodelled and have coffee makers and larger fridges which is good. New beds and decor and really nicely tiled bathroom (although still small). Easy walk to everything - zoo - aquarium - international market place etc. Free towels for the beach - which is across the street - what more could you want. The wired internet access was fast

This hotel has been our "home" for 4-5 times....1st trip since the remodel & its really cute.......people must remember this hotel is round & the small rooms are pie shaped, coffee is now in the rooms & the ice is still at check-in desk, the size is not a issue for our family, as we didn't go to Honolulu to stay in the room, this hotel is directly across the street from the beach, if you can afford it get the partical Ocean view or better....it will be money well spent....they have sand buckets in the room for kids & they have "freeby" borrow water toys .....they have a large number of places to eat very close by....the restaurant Egg's & things is in the same building....they have rather high prices, & also have long lines, so the food must be good, you have a McDonalds next door & Cheesburger in Paradise a few feet away, & Starbucks a few blocks away, McDonald & Starbucks have free WiFi ..........Our way of thinking is get the reasonable hotel with the best value & the best view & location in Waikiki .....& save your $$$ for the souviners .........all major trollys stop a few feet away on the beach by the Duke statue.....this hotel also has the police station just steps away.The only negative is about this hotel...is the parking.....there are 21 or so spaces....these spaces are just under $16 with taxes.....OR you can park at the Waikiki Banyon 4-5 blocks away for $10 a day or $60 wk, you can check each morning to see if there will be a opening at the hotel to park.A BIG ALOHA....to Jan at the front desk...greatest Employee for the "Aston family"

We stayed in this hotel in July 2011 as a family of 4. The rooms are TINY but very clean and furniture that fits well in the space. We enjoyed our balcony looking over Waikiki beach. Parking can be a bit of an issue, but if there are no spaces left the hotel will allow you to park at a sister hotel about 3 blocks away. Great location for the price.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Perfect location, best at Waikiki!The design (new but "1962"-style), belive me, Simon&Thomas will go bananas! Excellent.Our sunny, wonderful room, so beautiful, always so clean (the hole hotel was, even at Christmas day!) with flat-TV, newspaper every morning at the door, large comfortable beds, swimmingtowels at the reception.....I´ll loved it.....And the cool, unstressed people in the reception, with humor and always so nice to talk with! They really love their hotel, very nice to notice.Will come back! Soon!Marianne and Torsten from Sweden

Aston Waikiki Circle is a great place to stay across road from beach and The Duke statue. A convenient place to stay near everything and neat clean and reasonable but book early as it is the best location and value but no restaurant (don't need it as alfresco dining is all around you). Didn't stay this year as I didn't have time to book early enough.

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle for 5 nights in November 2011. We were in Honolulu for a wedding and found our stay convenient and very comfortable. Our room was a partial ocean view visible when you stood out on the balcony. That wasn't an issue for us as the beach was right across the road and though its popular, it has clean, warm and calm water to enjoy swimming and a few hundred meters away, surfing or other beach activities. Yes, Waikiki has become a tourist sink but we were close to lots of great restaurants,nightlife and shopping. If you want to get away from the hectic atmosphere rent a car (don't rely on the bus!) and head out to hainauma bay or the north shore. Would have been good if we had wireless in our room but there was a MacDonalds nearby!
Very friendly staff. Booked a partial ocean view and upgraded at check in for $10/ night to ocean view. Great location across from the main beach close to shopping and restaurants.

I’m a regular traveller to Waikiki and usually stay on Kuhio Avenue, but thought I would try something different. I had heard and read good things about this hotel, so decided to stay here for one night before staying at another hotel with some friends for the rest of my stay in Waikiki. I booked an Ocean Front room with two double beds from hotelclub.com.au for a really affordable rate. I landed in Honolulu at 8am, so I wasn’t surprised that my room was not yet available, and wouldn’t be, until after midday. But, once they realised I was on my own, they were able to offer me a room with only one double bed, but on a higher floor (12th floor – there are only 14 floors) that would be available sooner; Perfect!The location was/is amazing, you literally cross the road and you’re at the beach! Not to mention Yoghurtland being a stone's throw away too! I would suggest booking an Ocean Front room; the uninterrupted view of the beach (and the sunset) is well worth the little difference between the room type rates. Due to the nature of the building, the rooms are an odd shape, but it didn’t bother me at all as the design and layout of the room accommodated the shape of the building. However, I wouldn’t suggest any more than two people staying in each room – purely due for comfort in terms of physical space. The bed was heavenly and is one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on – and I stay in hotels quite often. All staff were super friendly and accommodating and endeavoured to meet my needs at all times. Considering the view of an ocean front room, I am surprised at how affordable this hotel is. The only bad thing about my stay was that it was only for one night! I would have extended my stay at this hotel, but unfortunately it was fully booked!I’m returning to Waikiki in a few months and will most likely stay here again and I will most definitely be recommending this gem of a hotel to anyone travelling to Waikiki – trust me, you will not regret it.

This is a 3 star hotel, but it does have some very good points. We were lucky enough to get room 1304 which is ocean front --- couldn't beat the views of Waikiki and high-up enough to miss most of the road/pedestrian noise. While on our balcony we discussed that the less expensive 1303 would have been fine for us as it had a great view too. The balcony is wonderful with two chairs and a small table. The room had an exellent fridge -- much better than most hotels. The beds and pillows were top quality and we slept like babies. We rented a car for one day to drive to the northern beaches (highly recommend this), but we didn't keep the car over night so didn't need to park -- but we noticed that there was a "lot full" sign in the office window each afternoon. The elevators were great, never had to wait to get up or down, even one afternoon when some kids were playing with the buttons! (brought back some memories :-)) The staff were extremely nice and helpful -- there was a great wake-up call feature on the phone too. The hotel had discarded floats and boogie boards for use, great idea. Ok, downsides. The rooms are tiny, and the bathroom is mini! We are two average sized people and we were forever bumping into each other. The second bed was used for luggage which helped, but we both agreed that one queen bed would have made all the difference. I guess two doubles accommodates families or those who don't want to share a bed, but if we'd had a kid with us the room would have been hysterically too small. I read on some other reviews an air of anticipation for the openning of "Eggs and things" -- the breakfast/lunch joint attached to the hotel... It's very average. We found it to be over priced for a basically take-out place (order at register where you are asked to tip? And then called to pick up food on paper plates with plastic cuttlery). Besides all that, it was the worst feed we had while in Hawaii -- including the airport! Walk a couple of blocks to Moose McGillicuty's where you get a great breakfast and even a decent cup of tea!Over all, we'd recommend this hotel, but don't take your kids!

We had an ocean front room with a balcony right across the road from Waikiki for less than most rooms even a couple of blocks off the beach. Sure, the room was a little small but it was not a small as one may think for the price and it was very recently remodeled - anyways, who goes to Waikiki to spend a lot of time in a hotel room?! The hotel is directly across from public access to the beach and within easy walking distance of the zoo, aquarium and other points of interest. We found the staff friendly and helpful. When we go back to Honolulu we will absolutely stay here again.

My dad and myself spent 10 days here. It's location is great , with views of Waikiki beach. Location - its walking distance of most " things to do " in Waikiki.The hotel doesn't have anywhere to eat , but so many places are close by. ( an eggs and things was due to open soon after our visit)Places we likes to eat - loved "The cheesecake factory" and at The Outrigger the " Duke's Canoe Club"Nice clean rooms , well maintained and no noise!!Well recommended

This hotel is older, but has recently undergone extensive reservations. It is basic, but clean and very pleasant. What it really has going for it is the location, it can't be beat! Technically it is across the street from the beach, but there is no hotel on the other side of the street so the ocean view rooms have an unobstructed view of the beach which quite beautiful! There are loads of shops and restaurants on Kalakau Avenue, its a great street for strolling after dark. We stayed at this hotel and at a much fancier resort nearby and I have to say, I preferred this place. Even the toiletries, the Aston plumeria scented lotion, is really nice! The price is a bargain too!

An excellent place to stay. Was here for 5 nights during our 15th anniversary and was on the 12th floor with city view. The location is one of the best in Waikiki as you are just across the street from the beach and they just opened the restaurant Eggs n Things.They provided free rental of boogie boards and other stuff for the beach and are very helpful with any questions. Not to mention the person running the tours desk was not pushy at all.Only issue was they did not have WIFI at the hotel. You could purchase the wired hookup for $9.95 a day or $27.95 I think for the week. Instead we were able to tap into a linksys connection for free as we were on the 12th floor.Everyone there seemed really friendly and the people we met all seemed to have stayed there multiple times.If I come back to Honolulu I am definitely staying here again without hesitation.

This is the second time I stayed at this hotel and it didn't disappoint again. The location is fantastic. It is right across from the beach, surrounded by shops and restaurants. The trolley service that takes you to ala moana mall has a stop right across from the hotel. The staff are very friendly. The room I stayed in was a partial ocean view room with two double beds. The room is very clean and quiet at night. The only thing I will be critical of is that the Internet service isn't free. Hotels should be giving Internet service for free these days. Bonus point for this hotel is that an Eggs n Things restaurant just opened on the hotel's lobby. Overall, great location, friendly staff and great value!!!! I'll definitely stay here again when I visit hawaii.

This was out 5th stay . Yes the rooms are small, but you can't beat the location, view, friendly and helpful service by both Front Desk and Houskeeping staff. Stayed 15 nights and enjoyed them all. The room renovations are great and the imminent opening of Eggs n Things out front will be an added bonus - particualrly if the hotel can make some arrangements for Hotel guests to avoid the typical Eggs n Things breakfast wait at their other establishment. Looking forward to our next stay.

My husband & I were there 11/12-11/19. Hotel staff was extremely friendly & helpful. (Special Hello and Mahalo to Barb & Guy for all they did!!) We stayed in oceanfront room 905 & could not have asked for any better value or view from our balcony. It was so beautiful that we immediately dropped our bags and ran to take in the view!! We suggest you take a pair of binoculars - due to the unobstructed view, you can see for miles. Our room was more spacious since Guy was able to get us in one with only a queen size bed & the vanity was separate from the bathroom making the bathroom more spacious. Room was very clean & once the restaurant opens by the end of Dec it will make it even nicer. Some reviews stated it was noisy, but the hotel itself was fairly quiet. As for the traffic noise - yes, if you get an Oceanfront or Oceanview you will have traffic noise since the road is in front of the hotel, but that should be expected. The traffic noise did not bother us - we felt the tradeoff of being able to hear the beautiful sounds of the ocean was well worth it. We cannot wait to return & have recommended the Circle to all I work with. A huge "Mahalo" for making our first trip to Hawaii beyond description!

When we first walked into the hotel they seemed to have some renovations going on so we were a bit put off but once we got to the room we were quite happy . We were upgraded from an ocean view to an ocean front which was wonderful . We loved how clean the room was and the location was great . Just had to cross the road to get in the ocean . Shops and restaturants all around . The staff could have been a little friendlir but the view made up for everything .

Aloha, My wife and I spent five nights in the Waikiki Circle in November 2011. I must admit that when we walked into the room it seemed small but it was something I came to accept as the location of the hotel is terrific. The Circle is on Kalakaua Avenue directly across the street from Kuhio Beach Park where we would sit to drink our morning coffee and watch the surfers start their day. Our room was on the 12th floor facing the Pacific. The balcony allowed us a very nice spot to watch the activity on the Kalakaua after we had come in for the evening.The pricing for an oceanfront room, which was literally a stones throw from the beach, was amazing. The hotel has been renovated recently, it is immaculately clean and there are many conveniences at your door step. I do warn those who fall into the oversize category that you will likely not be comfortable at the Circle.

Just spent a week there. Had an ocean view, not ocean front room. Rooms are small, especially by modern North American standard, however they are very nicely updated, and spotlessly clean. Beds were small but very comfortable with nice bedding. The beds were high enough off the ground to store suitcases underneath. Flat screen, bar fridge, big balcony, and free coffee and beach towels. The only negative is that the ABC store next door has a very loud a/c unit on the roof. Higher floors are better shielded from that noise.The location is ideal. Check in took only a few minutes, as did check out. My wife and I would definitely return. We were sad checking out yesterday as we had a perfect week long vacation.

We stayed at Circle Hotel for 4 nights and it was amazing. The size of the room is perfect for both of us and we had an oceanfront view room on the 11th floor. The view from our room was breathtaking and priceless. Oceanfront view is the only way to go and you will never regret the view. It was heaven on earth. They will be opening a restaurant soon which will be great. The location is the best in waikiki, walking distance to everywhere. The beach is just opoosite and you can jump down the beach at any time. We had an amazing experience at the hotel.

This was a nice hotel as far as the decor but very inconvenient if you have a rental car. They do not have enough parking spaces for the rooms they have and even though we checked in early in the day, we were sent to another Aston property to park our car. It was a long walk and kept us from going back to get the car in the evening to go out to dinner at a place that was not within walking distance of the hotel. They refused to comp the parking fee even though we complained and offered no other remedy. They also put us on a lower floor than we had requested with no explanation as to why.

I try to ask my clients what kind of lodging they prefer - majority wants a nice comfortable bed and a clean bathroom.
