Perfect - this is the place - afterall, most people don't plan on spending their vacations inside their hotel rooms! I was here with my sisters. It is not a luxury hotel - in my opinion, it's a 3 star (bathroom only has a shower) with a 5 star luxury view. The location is right across the street from the beach - you are steps away from McDonalds and their famous ABC stores for pop, snacks, etc. The front desk staff is very nice and helpful. If you are wanting to save money but yet get a great hotel with a balcony and a view - this is it!

Spent 3 nights at this hotel and couldn't be happier. Ocean front room was exactly that, could wave to family swimming at beach from room. People watching from balcony so much fun. Room quiet for sleeping and absolutely spotless. Staff very helpful and cheerfully let check in early without warning. Right in the heart of Waikiki, walk to everything.Cannot believe this hotel doesn't have a higher rating! Fabulous x

This hotel is right across from Waikiki Beach and rooms at the front have a fantastic view, the higher up you are the better. The rooms are the smallest I have ever encountered, not helped by 2 double beds instead of one Queen or King size. I was seriously concerned our luggage would not fit in the room let alone open, but managed by rearranging other stuff. Place could use some maintenance, bathroom door does not close, balcony door does not close properly & makeshift sliding lock wouldn't stand up to much, not great when you are on the 3 rd floor & workmen are on the roof out front. Did like the lamps with the iPhone connectivity in them. You have to pay daily for the room safe & no Wifi in your room is a bummer.Would I stay here again, yes, just for the view & location.
We spent 6 days in this hotel .It was very good, close to the beach and main streets.This place is clean but no restaurant inside.We would love to come back to this place.

My husband and I just returned from 10 nights staying at this hotel. We had an ocean view room on the 12th floor. The room was small, as others have mentioned, but as there were two double beds and a desk in the room with enough room to spread out our bags and belongings we did not feel cramped at all. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the view from the lanai just beautiful. The only complaint would be that the old air conditioning unit in the room was a bit noisy and at night noise from the air conditioning unit on the roof of the building next door seemed quite loud. ( some of the other units had newer air conditioning units) All staff were very helpful and pleasant and we would definitely stay there again. The location could not have been better for the price paid.

We stayed at the Waikiki Circle this week. The place is clean and cute and the location is the best. It is across from the best part of the beach, near Duke's statue. It is convenient to restaurants, shops, public transportation and other places of interest. They are putting a restaurant on the premises in the next month which will make it even better. The best thing about the hotel is the personnel who work there. They are friendly and helpful and always willing to assist. The room was small but clean and ample for the two of us to live in. The room was so reasonable and Aston offers special rates that make it an offer you can't refuse. We will stay there again - definitely!

Hotel was very accomodating, actually allowed me to choose a room. They issued me a temp key for another room just in case I did not like the view of the room assigned. I had a ocean view room 707. It was nice. I will attach a pic. They are in the process of building an Eggs and Things, should be coming in December 2011. The rooms are small but was big enough for 2 people. Now I wished the beds were a little bigger. I couldnt comfortably sleep in the same bed with my hubby, so on some nights we opted to do the I Love Lucy style and sleep in separate beds. The hotel location is great, right across the street from the beach, down the block from all the stores and shops. Dukes restaurant and Tiki's Grill are within walking distance. Great hotel.

The only reason I didn't give this a perfect score is because there isn't the convenience of a restaurant for breakfast inside the hotel - however, this was under construction when we were there (last summer) and the breakfast area should be done by now... other than that, the staff were very helpful, the location was absolutely perfect, right on Waikiki beach (like seriously, right on the beach), and the view from our balcony was straight out into the water. So many places nearby to eat and tons of stuff to do. Definitely try the shaved ice cream and hike to the top of Diamond Head!

We have stayed here twice now. Our first stay was in '09. When we visited Waikiki again in '11 we didn't even bother checking out other hotels. Room prices are slowly rising as they have been renovated. Rooms are small but not uncomfortably so. We had two adults and an 11 year old and had no problems. Of course, we're in Hawaii, we don't stay in the room much. As in all of Waikiki, parking can be an issue. They oversell their parking garage, so if you get back late as we did one night you may need a desk clerk to help. They have an agreement with another hotel for overflow parking but we never had to use it. The main selling point is the view from your lanai. Get an ocean FRONT room. This hotel is not what people think of when they think of a luxurious Hawaii vacation, but when you are sitting out on your ocean front room lanai you have a better view than 99% of those other hotel rooms that are charging a lot more.

This was so close to a 5 star review. Great location in Waikiki right opposite the Duke! There are numerous restaurants/shops nearby, and a very handy ABC store right outside. rooms are clean and bright, and all you need for your stay. While by no means luxurious, you get a great deal for your money, and a nice big balcony. Parking is available at hotel for about $15, but limited, so make sure you tell reception if you need a space. There are beach towels available free of charge, and also a handy 'borrow box' of beach accessories previous guests have left behind, like body boards and mats. Great idea! This would have been a 5 star review if it wasn't for the charge for using the in-room safe. I just don't understand why they charge $2.50 per night for something which is in the room anyway - it's not as if it's to cover lost keys or anything, as they will charge you $35 if you do this. I know it's not much money, but it's the principle of it, and it feels like just a way to get more money out of you. You are made aware of charge in advance, but it's just strange as the safe and key are in room whether you use them or not, so why charge?To finish on a more positive note, the staff is really friendly and helpful with any enquiries you may have. There is also a tour desk at the hotel. Although we didn't use this, it was good to know they were there if we needed them rather than take a chance with one of the street vendors, where you don't know if you are getting a genuine deal.Great place, and would definately return!

This hotel is in the perfect location for the beach however it is way over priced for what you get.The rooms are very small,there is no tea/coffie making appliances,if you want a cupper you have to takethe lift down to the lobby but not before 7:00am make it from hotwater flasks & take back toyour room,don`t leave it untill after 8:00am or you will miss out.The barthroom it SMALL notmore then one at a time.The hotel has no where you can have a snack/meal you have to goout & if you dont eat Mackers for breakfast then you will go hungry untill 9:00am when thecafes open when you find one.
Great location right across from the beach. Clean and efficiently designed rooms with lanais. Staff was always pleasant and helpful. Will definitely return.return

A group of 4 girls stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle in late September. We had a ocean front room with a lanai which was perfect. we were on the 8th floor and didnt notice any street noice at all. The front reception staff were always friendly and helpful. The price for the location was excellent considering the hotel is located across the road from Waikiki Beach.
Great Location, Super Cute! Parking was right underneath; no need to valet.

We stayed at this hotel for three nights in October, 2011. We chose the cheapest room, which in Australian dollars, it was $105 a night. It didn't have much of a view, it didn't really matter as we were not in the room that much.It was opposite Waikiki beach, a great position for everything. It didn't include breakfast, but being in the heart of the place, there were shops all around. There was an ABC shop just next door that sold fruit, yoghurt and such things for breakfast, fresh sandwiches and salads for lunch.Wifi was in the room for $10 a day, or in the foyer, internet for $10 for the day.Brewed coffee was complimentary in the foyer for a few hours each morning.The daily newspaper was free each morning.The room was serviced daily, very clean, toiletries supplied.Compared to a lot of other hotels, it was a really good place to stay for the price. If you are not looking for luxury, it was a good place to stay in the best position of the beach.I would stay there again or recommend it. If it is a view you are looking for. book a more expensive room overlooking the beach, for about $30 a night more, which is still reasonable for that part of the beach.

The location for this hotel can't be beat, right across from the beach and on the quieter end of Kalakaua Ave. (if that is even possible). We stayed here for 5 nights. We were late checking in so we ended up with a room on the 2nd floor with a nice view of the air conditioning unit. The staff was very accommodating and offered to change rooms for us if one became available but due to time and the fact that we only really slept and showered in the room, we just stayed with it. The room was small but very clean. Honestly I wouldn't recommend for there to be more than 2-3 adults in one room. The shower was really small but adequate. There is no wi-fi access, even for a fee. The internet is wired and I think costs about $10/day. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking is very limited. I suggest parking at the Waikiki Banyan which is a couple blocks away. It is $10/day (no tax) and there were plenty of spaces. Overall I would stay here again for the price and location.

I was kinda unsure about this place, due to the low price I paid for 5 nights, But what a deal, directly across from the center of Waikiki Beach, mcdonalds next door for quick food and alot of quality food within walking distance. The ammenities were normal, but the rooms are great for the money, We had a city view which faced other hotels, but we spent the days at the beach, so at night, it was a pleasent spot to cool off.

This is a decent and reasonable lodging option in Waikiki for those who wish to be close to the beach but, are on a budget and/or seeking a convenient base to operate from while sightseeing around Oahu. I have stayed at this hotel twice (1993 & 2011) - each time for a week. The hotel is located on Kalakaua Avenue directly across the street from Kuhio Beach – it is a 30-second walk from the lobby to the beach. Kuhio Beach is the eastern portion of the Waikiki shoreline close to Kapiolani Park and proffers protected swimming areas because of the breakwater. Though not the newest structure, it is a modern hotel with several rooms having excellent views over the waters of Waikiki and Mamala Bay. The hotel itself is a modest edifice comprising 14 stories but, at the same time, it has a rather distinctive appearance because of its round shape. The guest rooms are adequate in size, sensibly furnished and decorated in a tropical theme but, the bathrooms are small. The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel recently completed a major renovation of all rooms. There are eight rooms per floor and all are virtually identical in layout and furnishings including the balconies. However, there is one BIG variation amongst the rooms – the outside view/scenery aspect. As I suggested earlier, this aspect is also one the hotels greatest attributes because the views from some rooms are among the best to be found in Waikiki – bar none. Of course, the room rates are governed by this fact. If a view is important to you, then I highly recommend that you select the “Ocean Front” category and, specifically, any of the room numbers ending with either –04 or –05. The higher the floor, the better, with the two best rooms being 1404 & 1405! Sitting on the balcony, sipping a beverage and watching the sunset is a gratifying experience. If a view is not important then choose the “city” or “partial ocean” view categories but be forewarned that your view will be that of an adjacent building/hotel. Speaking of prices, I suggest you visit the hotel’s own website and check out the various specials and deals before booking reservations through any other source. The room rates and various promotional packages they offer are worth the money and some give you a great bang for your buck! The guest amenities proffered by the hotel are rather basic and few. The hotel provides beach towels, boogie boards, daily newspapers, internet service (for fee) and parking ($15.00/day). However, parking space is limited and be forewarned that they may not have parking stalls for all guests on site if too many bring cars (though they offer an off-site lot as an alternative). The best thing to do may be to not use your car more than necessary once you've arrived and leave it parked (until you depart). There is also a tourist excursion/activities desk in the lobby. Though the hotel itself does not offer many amenities, there are plenty of options and opportunities for dining, shopping, entertainment and outdoor activities nearby. Adjacent to the hotel are a McDonalds restaurant, Haagen Daaz ice cream store, creperie and ABC souvenir store/mini-mart (incl. liquor section). Moreover, a short walk in almost any direction will elicit a multitude of options too numerous to mention here. The famous Duke’s Canoe Club restaurant and the International Market Place are each about a 7 – 10 minute walk from the hotel. After all this positive commentary I must observe that there are a couple of negative items to mention but they are minor and may be inconsequential for some. One issue is the noise emanating from outside which can be heard within some rooms - particularly if there is a lot of traffic, loud passersby and/or noisy crowds outside (which is often noticeable in the evening). This may prove problematic for sleeping. Requesting either a high floor or a room away from the street may remedy this concern. Secondly, the low-level, ambient hum from the air conditioner may be bothersome for some. For light sleepers and people from other time zones, these various noises can make sleeping difficult and the room environment less relaxing. Thirdly, if you prefer or are used to a firm mattress, then the beds in this hotel may prove disappointing because I feel they are soft and lack support. In fact the bed may be uncomfortable for two people sleeping together in the same bed because their combined weight creates a depression/valley in the mattress. Finally, I wish the hotel offered a few rooms furnished with just one queen or king bed per room instead of two double beds so that couples could experience a more romantic setting during their stay. Doing so would also make those rooms appear to be more spacious. Getting to/from the airport is fairly easy. If ground transportation has not been pre-arranged, and you are not renting a car, then I recommend one of the several shuttle or van services that exist and charge between $7.50 - $11.00 each way (with better pricing if you commit to the roundtrip). If you have little or no luggage, then the public bus is an option and it costs only $2.50. Use Bus Route Nos. 19 or 20 headed east with Waikiki as the final destination. The buses stop outside both the international and inter-island terminals on the departure level service road. You can go online to pre-book ground transportation or simply do it upon arrival. Some of the shuttle companies have representatives in the baggage claim areas promoting their services. I recommend this hotel because of its location, simplicity and great views. It is not upscale and lacks the accoutrements, pretentiousness and sophistification of such establishments. But, for what it offers - which is relative comfort, cleanliness, convenience and value - this is a great hotel!

I choose this hotel because it was reasonably priced, right on the beach, and had good reviews here. The location is awesome, with a beautiful beach directly across the street. The hotel rooms are fine and perfectly clean -- not extravagant by any stretch, but completely adequate. There is noise from entertainment at nearby hotels or on the beach in the evenings, but with the in-room AC going, I didn't find this to be a problem. The internet is wired only and costs $10/day or $40/week. It is spotty - I had to call the helpdesk twice - once because it wouldn't connect at all and once because it had slowed to a crawl. After the second call, the helpdesk guy said there was something physically wrong with the line and that they would send someone in 24-48 hours and I should change rooms. When I told the front desk, of course all rooms were full, so the following day they changed me to another room. The internet connection was not much better in the second room. I could check email and slowly load pages, but skype connections kept dropping and wasn't fast enough to allow video most of the time. The front desk staff was fine. I did not find them overly friendly or helpful (it seemed that I was an inconvenience when the internet did not work, no one ever said sorry for the trouble it caused me). They did only charge me for one week's internet rather than 9 days. They also charged me 75 cents per phone call made from the room, including those to the helpdesk for the internet. Use of the in-room safe is also an additional charge. Other hotels are very near - you can see into other rooms and they can presumably see into yours - close your curtains! There is no tub, just a shower. Would I stay there again? Yes probably. It was a good budget hotel, clean, and the location was perfect. I'd rather spend my money doing stuff than on a hotel room that I won't be in much.

I knew that they only have double beds, but I don't think everyone knows. It was no problem for me though because I got some sleep! Very cute hotel! Really nice people that work there and very close to beach. The hotel even has boogie boards and innertubes you can borrow!

Had the pleasure of staying in this lovely Hotel with my family [from Australia] in October. Its location is superb. Yes, it is a smaller older building but its value and location more than make up for that. The rooms and decor are all clean and fresh. Although compact everything has been well placed throughout the room. Even with a family of four we never felt confined. My favourite was sitting on the balcony admiring the amazing views. We all felt comfortable and safe during our entire stay. There is the added bonus of a McDonalds next door to Hotel [where you can sneakily access free Wi-Fi] and the great swimming beach is across the road so there is no need for a Pool. They even have the free use of towels and various beach items like floating rings and boards [the kids will love this] I would gladly visit this Hotel again. I recommend the Ocean Front rooms and try to get a room as high as possible. Mahalo Aston Circle & Hawaii

We stayed at the Aston Circle in August because of the recommendation of a coworker, and we are very glad that we did. My wife and I stayed in a premium view room, and my parents stayed in a premium view room a few floors up. You definitely want to be as high as possible. There are some trees in the park across the road that are nice, but block your distant views if you are not above the 5th floor. We left the door open at night, and the temperature was very comfortable. Kalakaua Avenue is busy day and night, which is fun, but noisy at night (which is why I rate the hotel a 4).The front desk staff were very helpful in finding us a place to park. And I particularly enjoyed the funky wedge shaped (smallish) room, and the balcony.Waikiki isn't really my thing (we headed to the windward shore after this) but I would definitely make this hotel my first choice if I come back to this part of Oahu.

We love this hotel. This was our second visit and the renovations are lovely. It has all been said before but you cannot beat this hotel for location and value for money. Cannot recommend this little gem of a hotel highly enough. Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here 2 nights before cruising the islands for 7 nights and then stayed again one more night after the cruise. All of the staff was friendly and the location is unbeatable. The rooms are somewhat small but you will not be staying in the room very much anyway. The 1st 2 nights we stayed on the 11th floor and the last night on the 2nd floor and I agree with some of the other posters that higher is better as it is somewhat quieter. Shuttle busses to area shopping stop right across the street is you are going to be stayinf for a while and need to purchase some items. You will be charged extra if you use the room safe and internet is extra also. There is only an shower in the room and it is just slightly larger than the one we had on the cruise ship. I would not hesitate to stay here again if we visit Hawaii again in the future.

hotel was excellent great location watched surfers from balcony each morning they even had locking racks for our rented boards. rooms are small but good layout ,staff was always pleasent and helpful ,mcdonalds 20 steps away .cross the street and on the beach as good as it gets !!!!

Stayed here for a few nights during our stay in Hawaii. Had an ocean front room (ample room for the two of us), nice decor and very clean, was so lovely to sit on the balcony and watch the goings on and the surfers out on the water etc. Very friendly staff. Did not miss the fact they do not have a pool - don't need one - the beach is right across the road - hotel provides beachmats, lilos etc. for your use - first in first served - but always seemed to be available. Great location - handy to shops, eateries and bus routes. Would definitely stay here again if we come back.

Very helpful staff and a superb location at a good price. It is noisy when the band at nearby hotel starts up at night, but this is the main street at Waikiki and one shouldn't expect peace and quiet right? Worth paying extra for the beautiful view across the ocean and Waikiki!! Rooms are nicely decorated and good enough size.
Did not miss not having a pool or restaurant, plenty of other choices close by. Very clean, and bright room, comfortable bed, and nice bathroom. Very pleasant staff. Would come back again.

If I could decorate a hotel this is exactly how it would be furnished! It is an older hotel that seems to have been remodeled and repainted- so it's very clean. My only complaint would be the fact that since it is older and the rooms are all on a circle, you can easily hear the noisy elevator. We had the air conditioner blasting since it was so warm, and a partial ocean view which situated us far enough from the elevator to really be affected. So when booking consider that the more expensive full ocean view rooms would be closer to this noise. Friendly, helpful staff and the location also make this hotel a great choice.

Loved our stay at the Circle. The new refurbishment of the rooms very tastefully completed with excellent deco and colour scheme very pleasing. Front rooms have excellent expansive views. Beach across the road and everything else all very close. We find the room size okay and comfortable albeit small. The staff very helpful with tips and suggestions. Free coffee and newspaper each morning. Wifi at nearby Maccas. Surfboard lockup very handy and community chairs and mats available. Love to revisit.

Loved the Waikiki Circle Hotel for the location and it's unique history! I stayed at this hotel 15 years ago and was happy to return. The rooms were newly renovated and the property is just across from the beach. We were given a low floor room facing a very noisy ventilation machine on top of a short building next to us! We still got a good view of the beach from the balcony and the noise can be blocked by keeping the balcony door shut. The room can be improved by having a newer air-conditioner with less noise. It was overall a pleasant stay with nice bed and good location in the Waikiki area. No complain for US$110/night during high season.

This hotel is on the beach at Waikiki, just walk across the street and you are there! The rooms are nice, but what makes the stay here excellent is the staff. Guy at the front desk was great, told us about places to eat, and they have a rack filled with boogie boards, chairs and sand mats out front for the guests to use. No Wi-Fi but you can snag the signal from McDonalds easily. Restaurant was being remodeled but not a big deal. Free coffee from 0645 to 0900 in the lobby, just take a big cup with you or buy a large coffee at McDonalds and save the cup.I have stayed several places in Waikiki and this is my new favorite place. Parking is underground by the front lobby and easy to use. Loved staying here and will tell all my friends what a great place it is. Some have commented on the rooms being small, the shower small, etc. but you don't really go to Hawaii to sit in your room or balcony do you?

Only sleeped their, but it was nice small. but their at the beach. some small roaches, dint bother me was my first time in Honolulu will be staying at a different place next time. the staff there was great 5 stars

This place is a phenomenal deal. It's clean, cute, and great location. The air conditioners are little of an eye sore, but so what. We had a room on the 12th floor....great view! They are adding an "Eggs n More" restaurant on site which will be a very nice addition. They were doing sidewalk work when we were there but seemed to be working quickly. We were there 2 nights and saw it go from dirt to a nice stone path maybe 75% done before we left. The rooms were very nice. Clean, fresh updated linens. Yes, the rooms are small but we usually take cruises where the rooms are 1/2 the size so that wasn't an issue for us. The rooms are VERY clean. The maids didn't seem to understand that empty McDonalds bags were garbage unless they were in the can, but eh, so what. I took that to mean they were extra careful not to throw away anything "assuming" it was trash. I was trying to really come up for a complaint about this place but really couldn't. The staff was wonderful. Our TV remote wasn't working so we mentioned to the front desk up leaving for a few minutes. It or the batteries were replaced by the time we returned....a nice LG flat screen too. I guess I would say that my only complaint was that the only option in rooms is 2 double beds. I was told there aren't any rooms with 1 Queen or King. Again, so what. Then the only other thing was free wi-fi would have been a nice feature to offer, at least with there being a lack of others, like a pool. $10 a day is a bit steep especially when you can go to McDonalds about 10 yards away for free Wi-Fi. Another good thing....there is a great ABC Store with souvenirs and a good "grocery" selection right next door.

This 1960's structure is tired it has to be said. It's a noisy location and the foyer desk seems like it's out in the open and it nearly is. Staff were helpful on check in and held bags when needed. This is right on the best part of the beach but passing scooters, sirens and on one occasion a violinist opposite in a beach shelter, made sleep nearly impossible. It's budget priced so you get what you pay for. Quaint old structure that may have had its day.

We had such a great experience here. 7 days, June 2011. The front desk staff was very helpful with all our questions. The room was great with the new look. Shower is TINY but manageable. Everything was so clean! Just across the street from the beach! McDonalds next door and same with an ABC store. You can borrow boogie boards and chairs and beach toys. Great view even from our "city view room". The lights at night are fantastic from up high.Looking forward to going again and staying here many more times!

I stayed 4 nights at the Aston Circle in May 2011.I paid a little more for an ocean view room and wasnt disapointed with my room or the view!! I would definitley stay here again.The hotel was directly opposite the beach,and within a ten minute walk to the near-by sights.The hotel doesnt have a pool but this doesnt really matter as Waikiki beach is a 2 second walk from the hotel, and the hotel supply beach towels.Excellent choice if your looking for a clean,comfy base from which to sight-see.Ok so the shower room wasnt huge but it was clean and did the job!! The Sea theme decor was really nice and refreshing. The free coffee and buns available in the lobby during the morning are a nice breakfast to take down the beach with

We usually stay at the Queen Kapaolani or the Waikiki Beachside and these hotels are much better value. We stayed in ocean view room and had towers of lanais from 2 otherhotels looking onto ours as well as lanais from our own hotel. No privacy at all. Also had 2 3/4 beds and the room was really cramped. Tiny shower. We won't stay there again.
Oceanfront room was very cheap considering view and position in town. Clean room. No free internet but was able to connect to McDonalds free wi-fo from my room on 7th floor. Will stay here again.

We have been to Hawaii several times, but this was our first stay at the Waikiki Circle Hotel. We will definitely be staying at this hotel again!! The view of the beach from the room balcony was extraordinary. The hotel is located right across the street from the beach and the nightly hula show can be seen from the room balcony. The complimentary use of boogie boards was very convenient. The hotel was recently updated and is very fresh and new. This hotel has very convenient parking and is close to everything in Waikiki. EXCELLENT VALUE!!

Stayed at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel in April 2011.My Dad and I went for my 25th Brithday.I've stayed at several hotels in Waikiki, and can rank this on in my top 5.Hotel is right across the street from the beach. We stayed in a side view room, and could see the beach perfectly.The lobby is open air and the front desk associates are very friendly.The elevator is a little slow, and the rooms are a bit small, but comfortable and a GREAT value for the location!Will stay there again when I go back to Waikiki,

Not a 5 star but if you don't plan on spending much time in your room why pay more than $100/night?The best amenity is the location is directly across the steer from Waikiki beach. Other than that there is no pool and the restaurant is being renovated. Rooms are small but clean with flat screen tv and balconies

We went to Hawaii to celebrate our joint 50th bithdays and wanted a hotel that had a view from our room. Our room on the 11th floor looked directly at the ocean and the hotels along the beach. Absolutely magnificent and sunsets to die for. All from our balcony!! The location and views are definately the best thing.The room had two double beds and a separate bathroom. Certainly not a large room but very adequate. The room was clean and fresh after a recent renovation. The staff at reception were very courteous and helpful. The hotel doesn't have a pool but it didn't matter with the beach directly across the road. You leave the hotel and you are in the middle of Waikiki.There is a tour desk in the hotel and they are very helpful with any queries about tours and destinations. There is also access to two computers near reception which we found very helpful to keep in touch with family back home.If you are looking for a hotel in the best location at Waikiki beach that is clean,comfortable and great views at a very resonable price then this is the one.Definately recommended.

I spent a week here with my wife in July to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The rooms are cozy for two crowded for four. Step out on the balcony and enjoy the view, absolutely breathtaking. The staff are polite,helpful and prompt! The value is great. See you next year"

After reading Tripadvisor reviews, we stayed here a week with our two grand daughters (8 and 10). We had booked a city view, and upgrading was not possible when we checked in. The city view, however, was fabulous, and equally exciting since we come from a small Montana city with no high rise buildings. After reading comments on noise, however, I chose the top floor. That meant that the wind was always blowing really hard on the balcony, so it was probably not the best choiice, tho we loved the view from up there!  The room was very quiet and although small, it was arranged efficiently. We had no problems keeping it comfortable. Even the bathroom was totally fine for the 4 of us. We did take some rope to run a line for hanging damp swimsuits on. This worked well since the bathroom had little space for hanging anything but the wettest items. Beds were great - we all slept soundly every night. The staff was awesome, from office personnel to cleaning crew. We felt truly welcome and didn't hesitate to go to them with questions. After we stored our luggage for awhile when checking out, I suddenly realized that I'd accidently packed an important asthma inhaler. They instantly tracked that bag down in a room full of luggage. And of course the location is amazing. Even when going to the beach wasn't on the schedule for the day, we could still run over for a quick 15 minute swim. Morning surf lessons were right there. Half our meals - including breakfasts - turned into picnics on "our" beach. The Circle was just perfect for us with an incredible price that was too good to refuse, and I hope to go back again someday.

We had seen this hotel many times from the outside, when we had stayed elsewhere. This time, we gave it a go. From the moment we stepped up to register to check out, we really felt like "family". Every employee made us feel totally welcome and no question was to trivial. The room was on the smaller side, but very well laid out and quite comfortable. The beds......best sleep I have had in many years. If this hotel had a swimming pool(mot missed at all)it would be well worth at least 3.5 stars. Will positively be going back again.

My wife and I stayed here for 1 night at the end of our trip to Hawaii. The location is amazing; merely steps to the beach. The room was clean but a little on the small side. it is an interesting building in the shape of a cylinder so all the rooms have curved walls. The staff were quite helpful and friendly and had no problem letting us stay in the room an extra hour as we were waiting for a shuttle bus to take us to the airport. If you want to be practically right on the beach then this is a good place to stay. if you want to save a fair bit of money and have a 5 minute walk to the beach then i would recommend staying at the Miramar (we stayed there for 4 nights at the start of our trip for considerably cheaper.)
Small clean rooms. Very well located. Friendly staff. We enjoyed our 10 days here. Don't hesitate to book at this hotel.

I had read that the rooms were small, but there were three of us in the room and it was fine. The room is an L shape with a dressing and wardrobe section. We had a room with a partial ocean view and this was amazing. It was wonderful to sit there on the balcony in the morning and evening. We found the staff to be really helpful and they gave us great discount books and passes for the children to get free meals in various restaurants. They are in the process of furbishing their own restaurant which will open soon.They lend out beach towels and beach toys too.We only stayed here 2 nights for the beach experience, but would definately go back. We got a great internet offer on the room that made it the the bargain on the beach.Th

The hotel was not too big and the location was perfect just across the street from the beach. We had a room with ocean front view and it was perfect to wake up in the morning, looking out on the ocean. It's a quite bussy area with a lot of traffic, but with the balcony door closed in the nights it was not a problem. The room was always clean after we came home from the beach. The only negative is that the room had to beds and not one big kingsize bed. They are to small for a couple to have a good night sleepWe would love to stay here again if we are going back to Hawaii.

4 day stop here and great. This older hotel designed after a chinese lantern caught my eye on a visit two years ago. We just had to give it a spin as we come to Hawaii about every 18 months. It is right smack dab inthe middle of Waikiki and for the most part ocean front (across the street). Clean and friendly.... good staff. Clean older rooms. If you stay here at this prime location, get nothing less than a ocean front room at a fraction of what you would pay at any other hotel in Waikiki. We made it work with an 11 and 14 year old and the swimming in the man made swim bay across the street was superb. Don't go to CheeseBurger in paradise for a "meatloaf burger". Go to Dukes and pay a dollar less for the same thing for 100% angus and on the beach to boot. Dave the Aerospace Quality Engineer from Portland :-)

Absolutely loved the Circle hotel. We booked 2 rooms, 1 Oceanfront and 1 Oceanview as we had my mother in law, husband, myself and 2 year old twins. We gave my MIL the Oceanfront as she got up early and watched the surfers and waves whilst we equally enjoyed the views from the Oceanview. We had 2 little camping beds for the kids and they both fitted in the little desk alcove and we placed our bags on the spare double bed. We had no issues with the room size or even bathroom. We visited the Big Island for a few days inbetween our trip to Waikiki so we were able to store 2 bags that we didn't require for those days. For us, being able to walk straight across the road and onto the beach was very convenient. We were recommended this hotel by a friend and since then, have recommended this hotel to everyone we have spoken to. We looked at staying in a 4.5 star hotel but for price, location and convenience, we will be staying here again. We were there whilst the renovations were happening and even though our twins were still having day naps, we were not interrupted with the noise. It will be great to go back and visit again when it has all been completed.Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Location just perfect, right in middle of things. View of ocean and beach was spectacular. Room was small but satisfactory - as advertised. Room was clean, staff was friendly and helpful. Excellent value for price paid. Wish they would offer wi-fi in future - but that was available at the McDonalds next door.
Loved it so much.. Walked on the beach everyday.. Ate atop the hotel at their rooftop cafe. What a relaxing expierence,,

Just returned from Oahu and stayed 5 nts at the Aston Waikiki Circle. This little classic was just renovated so it's fresh and right across the street from the beach in the heart of Waikiki. The rooms are small, but that was fine w/ us. For a budget price we were there between all the big price tag hotels. Beds were comfortable and hotel staff very friendly and helpful. We had an ocean view room which I would recommend, or an ocean front. Watch the surfers and sights from your balcony. Lots of reasonably priced places to eat, McDonalds below w/ island plate breakfasts (spam, eggs and rice) and crepes across the side street. We liked Lulus down 2 blks and upstairs for a reasonable meal and a drink , have a lychee Martina and watch the sun set.. You can do Waikiki on a budget, it's not that difficult. Take the $18.99 Circle Tour (28.00 w/ fees) a bargain that gives you a good overview of the whole island. We saw 12 sea turltes at one of stop. Also enjoyed the Hawaiin plantation Village. It's a bit of an effort to find, but worth it. About 7-8 miles, so take a E bus 2 blks up from the hotel on the main street.(forget the name). a 50 acre park that has preserved individual houses from each immigrant group that came to the plantations to work (Chinese, Portuguese, Japanese, etc.) Includes tour and short film. The Food Pantry also located up on the main street has a variety of cheap eats, order a steak at the counter, sushi , sandwich or a Leonard's bakery supplied "Malasadas" (yummy Portuguese fried donuts filled w/ custard, Guava and coconut) .Aloha and enjoy!.

While the Waikiki Circle won't win any awards, it rates highly in my book for a couple of reasons. The staff are all super-nice and the view from the oceanfront rooms is amazing! You're looking right across at Waikiki Beach, to the left is Diamond Head and you're watching the parade of people walking down Kaulakaua Avenue. If you can look past the small room and tiny bathroom you'll feel like you're in a five star hotel with that incredible view! It doesn't cost much more for oceanfront...spend the extra $20 a night. It's worth it!

We love this little hotel. We are booked again for September. I believe it has 101 rooms. It is right across the street from the beach, with no hotels on that side of the street. It is "bare bones"--no pool, no restaurant, but newly remodeled clean rooms. There is coffee in the lobby every morning and a McDonald's just a few doors away with free wi-fi. The staff is pleasant and efficient. They keep a box in front with toys that people leave behind, and we've always been able to get a couple of beach chairs. There are boogie boards, sometime even snorkel equipment. It is a handy location, not far from the bus stops. The price is right.

We now live in Waikki, but when tourists for over 15 years we stayed in the Circle Hotel in Waikiki.It is directly across from the beach on Kalakaua Ave. and has a selection of rooms with city view and ocean view. and each room has a lanai overlooking all the activity on the street and beach. We look forward to having guests in our condo, we turn the condo over to them and head to the Circle for a few days. Although rather expensive, only a few blocks away is the Food Pantry on Kuhio Ave. where all your food needs can be met. When we first stayed there 30 years ago it was about $20. a night, that has changed a bit.Wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

This was our 2nd stay at the Circle. We were very happy with the remodel, so much so that we requested the mattress information. We slept like logs! The Circle staff is as always warm, friendly and helpful. Our oceanfront room, 804, was perfect for watching the parade on July 3rd (and everyday actually). The A/C works beautifully and we had no problem with street noise. Being next door to the 24-Hour MacDonalds was perfect for early rising, great coffee and breakfast plate of spam, rice and egg. This place is a real gem.

I absolutely loved this little hotel. It's perfect if you're mainly in Waikiki to go beach bumming then this hotel is for you. The hotel was clean, quiet, comfortable beds and the bathroom seemed newly renovated and clean. We had the "city view" which is generally just a view of the other hotels adjacent to Waikiki beach. But if you intend to stay outdoors most of the time, then this should not be an issue. It's very convenient since you just have to cross the road to get to the beach. ABC stores are on either side.Only downside is the parking is quite tiny, and quite expensive. But we never did have an issue of not finding a parking spot even when coming in late. Also trying to get in and out of parking is a hassle since the Waikiki sidewalk is always bustling with people. it's close to several bars, so no need to drink and drive. :-)They also allowed us a late check out with no extra charge. Reception people and security were very accomodating...Over all a great experience! :-)

This is a great little hotel in the heart of Waikiki. As mentioned by someone else, the outside can be deceiving, it looks like a tired 60's hotel. However take time to appreciate the indoor/outdoor lobby and make sure you pay the small amount for an upgrade to an ocean view (or partial view) room. The view is amazing! The rooms are newly renovated and lovely. Admittedly, it would be a tight fit for 4 people, but perfect for a couple. The bathroom is small, but really clean and perfectly adequate. There is room for a couple of good sized suitcases, as well as a desk. There are a couple of little quibbles, paying $10 for internet access, and that not wifi, is not really good enough these days. If you have a room on the McDonalds' side of the hotel you might be able to link up to their free wifi! We out here in the travelling world really expect this! A coffee maker or extending the coffee offer in the lobby would also be appreciated also. We would be happy to stay there again!

Under construction during our stay with tile removal (very loud and disruptive). Water turned off during the day (no showers after beach time). No hot water in the evening - and after 4 calls to the front desk, them admitting that the hotel manager "had gone to the movies and wasn't answering the phone so the plumber hadn't been called". No amenities (to include no coffee in the room). Rooms are TINY and bathroom is little more than a shoebox. This hotel stay (at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel) was definately the worst I have ever encountered. The Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel down the street is the polar opposite and I highly recommend.

We have stayed at the Waikiki Circle before, so we knew basically what to expect. Having said that the rooms have been restored and are lovely and cozy. From the open air lobby to our room, everything was clean and nice looking. Every employee at the Circle was friendly and helpful, especially Guy at the front desk. We have only been home for two weeks and we are already planning our trip back!
Rooms are on the small side, but when you are right by the beach who cares. Friendly staff. Clean. Recommend.

we stayed at the Waikiki Circle for 3 nights, and then another night after flying back from Maui. Check-in process was smooth and easy and the staff super friendly. We were given the keys to our room, even though we were checking in at 11am (and after a 10 hour overnight flight from Sydney, this impressed us hugely!) The room was as it appears on the website, 2 x double beds, small, but totally functional bathroom that looked recently upgraded, and the most AMAZING view of Waikiki beach! We booked an Oceanfront room, and our room on the 13th floor did not disappoint! Other reviews have criticised the amount of space in the room, but we found it totally manageable. There is a little study/desk area where we kept our bags, and with a perfect location, we didnt spend much time in our room anyway! When we did, we found the room perfectly fine for our needs... The flatscreen TV had enough channels to keep us amused, the balcony (lanai) was great for enjoying an evening drink, or our morning cup of tea (or just admiring the view!)The ABC Shop right under the hotel was fantastic, we'd buy our breakfast there each day and either sit on our balcony or take it across to the beach. Highly recommended for couples or friends, not sure how the room configuration or size would work with kids though.

We stayed 2 nights in mid-June and were not disappointed. Newly renovated and well done for moderate/budget older hotel building. Location right across street was the large swimming lagoon on Waikiki Beach and Duke K statue. Restaurants nearby including McDonalds, Starbucks etc. If you are looking for clean place to sleep while enjoying the beach and sights, this is a great option. We had partial ocean view, 11th floor. 2 adults, rooms are pie shaped because the building is round, but enough room for 2. It would be very small for 4 people. We enjoyed it and always love staying off the beaten track, in something less standard and more local or interesting, authentic. There is paid parking but if we did not rent car. Bus stops out front and around corner and will take you everywhere. Or you can walk everywhere in Waikiki from here.Would recommend to my family and friends!

When we first arrived we were checked in immediately and on the beach within 5 minutes! Our room was right off the elevator on the 5th floor. Prime location for viewing waikiki beach across the street. One whole side of our room was a huge sliding door to our lanai. We could lay in bed and view the ocean. We enjoyed watching the 4th of July parade, people watching, and watching the surfers from our lanai. It's a busy street but not too noisy considering how busy it is. We all slept well on comfortable beds. My husband and I went with our teenagers, 18 and 14, and we were all comfortable although it was small. My recommendation would be to put away all our clothes and stow the empty suitcases in your closet. There is also storage shelves in the closet for clothes. This will provide you with adequate floor space to move around. The bathroom and shower were small but workable for us. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only minus I would say is that we could hear the wind blow through the halls, and it rattled our door a bit as there are small open spots in the door frame. Once I knew what it was it didn't bother us a bit. We also could hear people's voices echo in the hall when they were on their way to their rooms, but we could not hear anything room to room, nor hear anyone above us. You can book great trips through the travel center right in the building. We enjoyed parasailing, swimming with the dolphins and sea turtles catamaran trip, circle island tour (nearly every popular site), and Germaine's Luau (Georgie was a riot!)....lots to see and do on foot and through the tours. You don't even need a rental car. The hotel has computers in the lobby with free check in for your flights, you do pay 50 cents per page to print out your passes however (by credit card), but very convenient. They called our cab for us and we had a ride within 10 minutes of calling. I highly recommend staying here at the Aston Waikiki Circle! I cried when we had to leave, the view and our stay was that beautiful.

My mom and I stayed at this hotel for a week. We upgraded to the ocean view room, which is a great idea. This hotel sits across the street from the ocean and you can see the Duke's statue from the lanais. It's very convenient. On the minus side, this hotel is older and the rooms are very small. It's a basic room and the bed was not that comfortable (too soft for my taste). But the staff was very freindly. If you need a beach chair or mat or beach toys, they have a box outside in the parking lot where you can leave anything you purchase for the next guest, or you can borrow anything left behind by previous guests. This was great as we were able to borrow beach mats, chairs, etc. several times. They had free coffee in the lobby in the mornings (none in the rooms). If you are interested in an inexpensive hotel on the beach and don't need any frills, then this is a great location and a good value. Older, but well-managed.

Check-in was quick and painless, and upon riding the elevator up, I was immediately impressed by the view from my balcony on the 12th floor overlooking Waikiki Beach! While I agree with other reviewers that the room is fairly small and the bathroom borderline tiny, as a solo traveler, I was not bothered by this as most of my time was spent away from the hotel exploring the island. When I was in the room, I was able to gaze upon the beautiful sunsets on Waikiki without being among throngs of people on Kalakaua Ave below. I don't think you'll find a better oceanfront value on Waikiki. The room was clean and my only complaint is that the bottom of the shower curtain was a bit mildewy (I'm sure it's hard to prevent that with the overall size of the shower and lack of ventilation), but overall, the housekeeping service was great. I especially appreciated the late 2pm check-out at no additional cost since my flight wasn't until later in the evening. Hotel is within walking distance of the Honolulu Zoo, Waikiki Aquarium, International Marketplace, and anything on Kalakaua Ave. Bus stop is conveniently only one block away on Kuhio Ave. The only thing that will make this hotel even better is the opening of Eggs 'n Things in the Fall.... I will definitely return to this hotel in the future!

I recently stayed at the Waikik Circle Hotel whilst on "stress" leave.Although I am a Travel Agent in Australia who has been in the Industry for 40ys my report is not sponsored in any way. I paid the full rack rate.I have booked many clients at this hotel - all giving good reports and returning guests. Firstly if you are looking for the best location across the road from the largest swimming lagoon in Waikiki this is it. The hotel although listed as a budget property should not in any way put you off from giving it a go. Don't judge a book by it's cover this really is the best value for the best location in WaikikiAll rooms have been recently upgrades, they are light and airy with two large queen side beds, flat screen T.V fridge along with a safe at an additonal minimum fee. The ocean front and ocean view rooms simply are stunning with lower graded rooms providing sea views with exception of the city view room which is same quality/facilities but very limited view so if on a tight budget and the view not important then this also for you. I would however pay a little more for the view over the beach and ocean.The shower although not large is fully tiles with good water flow and plenty of hot water with all modern features. Fresh good quality towels provided daily with beach towels on request.There is tea and coffee provided each morning.The staff both front office and house maids extremely polite and friendly.Overall this is a must try hotel and if considering and you know you are not booking a "Sheraton" then I am sure you will not be disappointed. This is true value for money for those who want location, cleanliness,friendliness without all the expensive frills.

We decided to stay at the Aston Waikiki Circle because of the good reviews. We were NOT disappointed!! It is in the middle of EVERYTHING!! The beach is right across the street. The rooms are small but remodeled and very clean. The hotel employees are very friendly and helpful. They are opening an Eggs and Things restaurant on the property soon. They have the BEST pancakes in the world! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definately stay there again.

Newly renovated and awesome. Love the color theme. Rooms where very clean. Yes, they are small but for just 2 best friends, sleeping in separate beds it was perfect. Ooh the shower is tiny!! We had a city view and the winds get pretty strong back there, but you don't have the afternoon heat beating your sliding glass door either. We felt very safe anytime of day or night. Just a quick walk across the street to the beach!Free towels to use at the beach AND boogie boards and floating rings. We didn't have a car but noticed towards the end of the week there was a sign on the front desk stating that parking was full and to ask about another lot to use.McDonalds just 2 stores over, must have the spam and eggs and rice breakfast! Only bummer was that Eggs & Things wasn't open yet! :)

We stayed here in April, 2011, for 4 nights. It's a boutique hotel, the rooms are very small but adequate for two people. We didn't get an 'ocean front' room and wished we had for about $30 more per night (we paid $140 per night). Our room had a lovely view, but when you're in Waikiki, the ocean is what you're there for and it is so beautiful, the more you see, the better. Plus with an ocean front view you would get more of a panoramic view which would include Diamond Head. What we really liked about this place was that it was literally right across the street from the beach, with nothing to obstruct your view. They offer a small fridge in the room, no microwave. You can request a 'hot pot' to boil water upon availablility, which we did and it was nice to be able to make a cup of tea in the room. They also offer coffee in the morning in the lobby, but it goes fast. If they offered free internet it would be a perfect deal. They charge $10 per day.
Stayed for 2 weeks with no problems. If you don't need room service, a swimming pool, or a large room, stay here.

This was my second time staying here and wll defnitely return. Thre are not many amenities but for the price you can't beat the location. The front desk staff are quite fiendly and helpful. Make sure to request at least an oceanview room - the view is amazing. I've had an ocean front (1st choice) and an ocean view. The rooms are small but very clean. You get a free newspaper each morning and free kona coffee in the lobby. Will definitely be back to stay here.

I was hoping since the renovations would be complete that some of the reviews would be moot. Our room was fine, but as stated in other reviews and as seen in photos, the rooms are extremely small. It served our purposes fine for two people. The room had definitely been remodeled. Painted. New clean linens. The bathroom appeared to have been completely remodeled. The shower is extremely small. I was concerned because I am claustrophobic. It was fine. My only complaint is that for women shaving your legs is literally impossible. I'm 5'9 and there's just no room. The location is awesome. The view is beautiful. Now, the cons. Upon arrival, first impressions mean everything and though the rooms have been remodeled the exterior looks completely run down. The air conditioners on the outside facade are all rusted. The entrance needs to be completely repainted. It's worn and just looks old. There is a very, very tiny grassy area in front with some trees and growth. It isn't taken care of at all. As small as it is, about one day of hard work and it could look awesome and inviting. The hallways are extremely warm. And finally, the balcony and balcony furniture is just horrible. The balcony rails are rusting and loose. The furniture looks like it's been out there since about 1975. We might consider staying here again, but I would look at different properties first. Hopefully they'll get the exterior renovated and bring this hotel up to the standards I believe it can achieve.

My family of four, husband, 3 year old and 7 month old stayed here and it was a great experience. Walking distance to the beach, International marketplace, zoo and aquarium. The rooms were clean and though the shower was small, it still fit me with the kids in it! Who needs a pool when the beach is right in front. Excellent place to stay at. We spent our money more on food and shopping so why pay for an expensive room you will only sleep in? Will be back in a couple of years time, so see you soon. Mahalo!

Hotel on the main front drag in Waikiki, facing the beach. The rooms are a good size, simple and clean, with an underground garage at a reasonable daily rate. There's no restaurant -- but then there doesn't need to be, given the location.

Yes I've been here before (3 times) and yes my husband and I love it. Why? Fabulous location, great staff, clean rooms and don't get me started on the view from the lanai. I found this hotel years ago and felt like I had discovered gold. It is in the best spot in Waikiki with the most fantastic views. My best tip is that you pay the extra for an "Oceanfront" room and ask for one on the higher levels to keep away from the traffic/street noise. The hotel is a no frills hotel but is extremely clean, the staff are very accommodating, it has just been renovated (and looks great) and there are free towels and beach lilo's for all guests. There is no pool on the grounds but I can guarantee there is a big one across the road (with millions of litres of water). I've seen the reviewers complain about the bathroom being small. If that's your only gripe, the hotel is doing well. I don't sleep in a bathroom so as long as it's clean, I'm not sharing with randoms and there's hot water, it's perfect. I just hope the Aston keeps those great room rates - no need to increase them anytime soon. Look I've been here heaps of times, take my word for it. Would you rather spend your money on a room in a "chain" hotel with a fancy lobby and pool or spend your money at Waikele Factory Outlet on yourself? It's a no brainer ......

We stayed for 4 days in April 2011 and would highly recommend the Circle!! Rooms may be small but they are clean, nicely decorated and have everything you need within a 5 minute walk! We didn't go to Hawaii to sit in a hotel room, we asked our travel agent to find us somewhere clean, safe and close to everything without spending a fortune. She booked the Aston Circle and it exceeded our expectations!! Would stay there again in a minute!

Reasonable price for a priceless experience! You are at the hub of the ACTION:swimming,people watching,sunset,shopping,accessibility to public transportation,and a sound sleep.that's all we need. No frills!

We were late getting to the hotel. A simple call from the airport assured us that everything was fine and our room would be ready when we arrived. We arrived around 8pm and were welcomed by Jan. She had the paperwork ready and within 5 minutes we were relaxing in our room. The room (& bathroom) were clean as was the beautiful balcony. If you are going to stay here pay the extra to get an Ocean Front room the view is well worth the price. As soon as you book your room call the hotel and request a room on the highest floor available. Although you can hear other rooms in the hall way once you are in your room the only thing you hear is the ocean (when you have the balcony open.) The beach is right across the street and the view of the ocean, surfers, moonlight, and beach are all breath taking regardless of the time of day. The hotel is centrally located. You only have to walk a couple of blocks in any direction to find restraunts, convenience stores, shopping, and anything else your stay may require. The first day you are there I suggest you grab a map and walk around Waikiki to get your bearings. Eggs & Things is opening up in front of the hotel. McDonald's is on the corner and an ABC Convenience Store is next door. One block towards Diamond Head is a Burger King and a little further is a Subway if you want fast food. Our favorite affordable places to eat were Denny's (they have the $2,4,6,8 menu) on Kuhio near the international marketplace (ask for Tina in the mornings) & the China Buffet on Ala Moana in front of the Ramada (7.99 breakfast, 9.99 lunch, & 15.99 dinner.) We ate at Atlantis Seafood & Steaks for our wedding dinner. The food was good but the steaks were cooked one level less than ordered. I ordered Well Done and recieved Medium Well and my husband ordered his medium well and recieved medium rare. The Mahi Mahi was delicious. It was under $60 for two entrees, 2 iced teas, and 1 dessert. Keep your eyes open for the specials and only order the specials. Restraunts & attractions lure you in with the specials but keep asking you if you want extras. If you go with the extras your bill tends to double or triple. Watch out for the street vendors. They people with the parrots will come up to you and put the birds on you and take a picture of it with your camera then charge you $10 or more for the experience after you have already done it. The gold, silver, & newspaper people will stay frozen in place. If you put a dollar in their can they come to life and show their gratitude with interactive poses. If you want excellent deals on t-shirts, dresses, sarongs, baggage, flip flops, and souvenirs then visit the Aloha Stadium Swap Meet/Flea Market on Saturday or Sunday from 6am-3pm. You can take the #42 bus out there but if you buy a suitcase bigger than carry-on you will have to pay a shuttle to take you back to your destination. Take the #65 bus to the Byodo-In Temple. There is a 1/4 mile walk from where the bus lets you off to the Temple and admittance is $3/person. It is a wonderuflly peaceful experience and there are many great views of the mountains both on your way there and back and at the temple grounds itself.Dillingham airfield is the place to go for skydiving, glider riding, and airplane rides. Skydive Hawaii does not go up as high as Pacific Skydiving. Mr. Bill of Honolulu Soars is the man to talk to for the glider rides. He has wonderful background information about the area. Ask for Flight man Dwight to take you for your glider ride. He is ex-military and knows his stuff about the island.Stay away from the thrift stores like Savers, Goodwill and Salvation Army Thrift. You can buy most everything new for the same price they charge.Take the free Hilo Hattie Trolley. One of the driver's is Aunt Frannie! She is an amazing guide filled with helpful information. Ask her about the free peanut butter & jelly sandwhiches!Learn to snorkel or at least get a pair of goggles and put your face in the water and look at the underwater life. Even on Waikiki beach there are many fish and other sea life who love to show off for visitors. If you are going to get married there do it at either sunrise or sunset on Magic Island in Ala Moana Park. It is amazing.You won't spend much time in your room. When you are, the balcony will be your favorite place!

If you do not need a pool, restaurant or fancy rooms, this is the place for you. Rooms a little small but clean. Personel wonderful and helpful. Location is great. It is right across fom the beach, near diamond head, and near the international market. On kuhio lots of "hole in the wall," cheap, tasty places to eat. I would highly recommend especially if you are on a budget.

The Aston circle is in an unbeatable location within blocks of some of the best shopping on the island and right across from public beach front property that includes snorkeling, surfing and great people watching.The rooms are clean but INCREDIBLY tiny. I’m talking claustrophobia inducing tiny. They each include a little lanai which is about ½ the size of the room, a refrigerator, TV, etc. It was really tough for 3 of us to get comfortable in the room as you can’t pass another person without that person having to move out of the way. Like I said, TEENY.Also, even with the blackout curtains the room stays well lit due to the cracks between and under doors and curtains. Also, since the rooms are (you guessed it) teeny, you can hear everyone in the halls and waiting for the elevators, and occasionally people in other rooms as well. You can pay to use the computers downstairs, but it’s expensive and kind of slow loading. Beach towels are available at no charge at the front desk. Also - they charge you for parking, ut didn't mention it at check in.All in all, I’d stay here if I were on a budget but would really opt for a nicer room at a different hotel if I could afford to do so!

We stayed in the Circle Hotel for 6 nights in April/May 2011 and we thought we would be prepared for small rooms and a non-luxury hotel. The location of the hotel is very good and the rooms have recently been remodeled, but they are very very small, especially the bathroom was tiny. The insulation of the balcony sliding door was terrible and therefore we woke up to a lot of street noise in the morning. The ocean view from the rooms is very nice though and the rooms are very clean. The hotel doesn't have a lobby or any common areas. It definitely feels more like a hostel than a hotel. The staff was nice but not very helpful, except with bus schedules and some directions. You have to pay for internet, parking is 12 USD +tax per night.As a conclusion I can say that we enjoyed the location, but we didn't really enjoy the hotel. The price was very competitive though, what might compensate a lot of the negative aspects. if you don't mind staying 2-4 blocks away from the beach, then you should rather go for the Best Western or one of the Aqua hotels.

This is an awesome no frills hotel. It does not have a real lobby. It has an outdoor lobby and that it is just fine, becuase you won't care since the beach is so close. You must get the ocean view room or at least partial ocean view room to get the real experience of this hotel. The views are really great. If you get a city view, well..... then you are just paying for staying right on the beach, and that is good too. I highly recomend it. The only con is the noise from the busy street and people partying and playing on the beach. (Yes, you are that close, especialy if you get an ocean veiw room).

The room is small, the showers are smaller, but the fact is... your RIGHT on Waikiki Beach. You can wake up to the sound of the ocean and watch the sunset from your deck. Let's face it, most people go to Hawaii for the beach, not the hotel room. The price is reasonable for the location (compared to the other hotels that brag oceanview) and you are close to the International Market and loads of other restaurants, shopping and activities.Servicing of the rooms can happen anywhere between 11:00 and 2:00, so be prepared to come back to your room not being cleaned at some times during the day.I'm not the type of person that really cares too much about the elegance of the room, I don't plan on staying in it for more than sleeping anyways. There is no restaurant or pool, but again, the ocean is no more than twenty feet from the entrance and there are restaurants all over the place.Tip: If the power goes off and you find yourself stuck in the elevator (happened to a family during our trip; freak weather), wait about ten minutes for the emergency backup power to come on. Before then, you can try all you want to open the door, but won't succeed. (Family found that out when the fire department finally showed up and effortlessly opened the door. The father swore that he tried everything to open the door. Poor guy.)

The Waikiki Circle Hotel is our Home away from Home when we are visiting Waikiki. We love the staff especially Jan, Chip and Pett! Aston and their amazing staff provide an A+ experience here at the Waikiki Circle Hotel. Can't wait to visit the islands again and stay at our favorite hotel. Mahalo Nui Loa!!!

I'm just finishing my stay here at the Aston Waikiki Circle Hotel. I've been very pleased with it. It's right opposite the beach where all the action is. We stayed in a room with partial ocean views, and it's well worth the cheaper price. We got quite a lot of ocean in our view and could sit out on our balcony watching the surfers or the people on the beach. The room itself was quite nice. It's all just been renovated, so it's not run down or anything. Our beds seemed to be on a slight angle but we still slept fine. There was a fridge and a safe in the room and toiletries were provided. The only thing I didn't like was that the bathroom door had a blue bubbly glass panel down the middle and you can kind of see shadows and stuff. I don't like any kind of glass in bathroom doors as I'm a very private person, but I guess some people wouldnt mind. The people at the front desk were very helpful when we had questions and we took advantage of the beach towels you can borrow. There is internet and a printer in the lobby, but its not free. If I come back to Waikiki I will definately stay here again. You can't beat the great price for the location!

Aston Waikiki Circle was amazing. Friendly staff, clean rooms, across the beach from the center of Waikiki beach, and walking distance from dining areas and stores. They have free beach towels in the front desk that you check in/out each time you get one, they have body boards, life savers, and surf boards that can be borrowed on a first come first serve basis, free coffee from 0645 to 0900 am, $12 nightly parking, $2.50 safe fee (inside the room), computer rentals in the lobby, and they charge for wi-fi (not sure how much). We got complimentary newspaper everyday and housekeeping kept our room spot-free everyday. The room came with a flat screen tv, 2 double beds, a nightstand, a study table, a fridge, a safe, and a closet. We had a patio that overlooks the ocean and other hotels in the area. The shower area and bathroom are very very very small, and the hotel itself is old, but who goes to Hawaii to stay in. I totally recommend this hotel, it is way worth than what you pay for.

This hotel is in a prime location in Waikiki. It is close to everything that you could possibly want to do while visiting Waikiki. The rooms were pretty small but the view more than made up for it! The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. My biggest and only complaint is that the shower is soooo small. Other than that I would highly recommend this hotel!
